TEXT:
Vivimos inmersos en la cultura de la ducha diaria.

Nos ba√±amos d√≠a s√≠ y d√≠a tambi√©n e invertimos una media de 11 minutos en esta actividad. Muchos ya no concebimos la idea de llegar al trabajo sin antes despejarnos bajo el reparador chorro de agua caliente. Lo hemos convertido en algo as√≠ como una necesidad b√°sica. Y no decimos que est√© mal hacerlo, el problema es que muchas veces no lo hacemos como deber√≠amos. Un mal uso de la ducha puede provocar multitud de problemas cut√°neos.

1. Nos ba√±amos demasiado

La piel es el √≥rgano m√°s extenso de nuestro cuerpo y el primer mecanismo que tenemos para defendernos de los agentes externos. "Si estamos continuamente rasurando, lavando o haciendo correr agua por ella estamos quitando nuestras defensas", explica la doctora Mar√≠a Sainz, jefa del servicio de Medicina Preventiva del Hospital Cl√≠nico San Carlos de Madrid y FUNDADEPS. Piensa que el ser humano es el √∫nico mam√≠fero que realiza esta tarea para reprimir su olor corporal.

2. Usamos demasiado del jab√≥n

Pasar por debajo del chorro de agua a diario no es tan pernicioso como lo es el uso continuado de gel, "especialmente si tenemos una piel sensible y vemos que nuestro cuerpo no lo tolera bien", nos explica el doctor Ram√≥n Grimalt, especialista en dermatolog√≠a y miembro de la Asociaci√≥n Espa√±ola de Dermatolog√≠a y Venereolog√≠a (AEDV).

Este especialista insiste en la necesidad de recurrir el sentido com√∫n para limitar su uso, mientras que otros hablan de emplearlo dos o tres d√≠as a la semana. "A no ser que hagas deporte o tengas un exceso de sudoraci√≥n", se√±ala la doctora Sainz que insiste en que no hay que tomarse esta recomendaci√≥n como una norma para toda la poblaci√≥n sino como una orientaci√≥n. Porque no es lo mismo ser chico que chica. Tampoco es lo mismo hacer deporte a diario que llevar una vida no tan activa. Ni vivir en un clima c√°lido o en uno fr√≠o. "Para el grueso de la poblaci√≥n se recomienda usar jab√≥n s√≥lo por la zona de mayor sudoraci√≥n y que en el resto del cuerpo que corra el agua y listo", a√±ade Sainz.

No seguir estos pasos y abusar del uso de geles no neutros significar√≠a que estar√≠amos atacando constantemente el manto lip√≠dico que recubre nuestro cuerpo destruyendo su pH, que se encarga de defendernos de agentes externos como bacterias, virus, √°caros y dem√°s microorganismos. Esto podr√≠a llegar a causarnos problemas mayores como dermatitis at√≥pica, que afecta a un 10% de la poblaci√≥n; infecciones como pitriasis alba (manchas blanquecinas o falta de pigmentaci√≥n en la espalda y extremidades superiores) o alergias. "No es que no haya que lavarse todos los d√≠as, hay que hacerlo con un gel no abrasivo o hacerlo por parroquias como se suele decir", explica Fernando P√©rez Escanilla, responsable del √Årea de Salud P√∫blica de la Sociedad Espa√±ola de M√©dicos Generales y de Familia (SEMG).

3. El agua suele estar demasiado caliente

Si bien no deber√≠amos usar gel todos los d√≠as, especialmente en el caso de ni√±os o ancianos, tampoco podemos ducharnos a altas temperaturas. As√≠ lo expresa la Academia Espa√±ola de Dermatolog√≠a y Venereolog√≠a (AEDV) en su lista de consejos para cuidar el pH de la piel: "No te duches con agua demasiado caliente porque podr√≠an desintegrarse algunas mol√©culas del manto √°cido y esto propiciar√≠a una excesiva resequedad".

4. Abusamos de la esponja

En su lista de consejos, la AEDV se√±ala que no debemos enjabonarnos m√°s de una vez y que habr√≠a que "limitar el uso de esponjas con fibras demasiado √°speras" si queremos que el nivel alcalino del 'manto' se mantenga equilibrado entre los 5.5 y los 5.9 grados de acidez.

El dermat√≥logo Ra√∫l Gonz√°lez recomienda emplear esponjas solo "una o dos veces a la semana" y secarlas con la luz del sol despu√©s de usarlas "para evitar la colonizaci√≥n con mohos" que pueden causar foliculitis, hongos u otras infecciones peores.

En cuanto al uso de guantes y estropajos no deber√≠a hacerse m√°s de un d√≠a a la semana porque resultan traum√°ticos para la piel. "Las cremas exfoliantes pueden utilizarse cuando no hay lesiones inflamatorias y no se est√° ingiriendo vitamina A (piel m√°s sensible). Su aplicaci√≥n debe ser muy espaciada, preferentemente una vez al mes", asegura este especialista.

5. No nos lavamos bien el pelo

Del mismo modo que si queremos cuidar nuestra piel no deber√≠amos lavarnos con jab√≥n todos los d√≠as, si queremos cuidar nuestro cuero cabelludo tampoco podemos lavarnos el pelo a diario. El cuidado del cabello tambi√©n es importante y para ello la AEDV aconseja emplear "un champ√∫ con pH 5.5, usar lociones e hidratantes y cepillarse a diario con un cepillo de cerdas suaves".

Lo curioso es que muchos eligen bien el champ√∫ pero luego no saben c√≥mo aplicarlo, especialmente las personas con pelo largo. "Debe realizarse en sentido vertical y no acumularlo en la parte alta de la cabeza. Esto puede crear un enredo permanente imposible de solucionar como no sea con el corte, es lo que se denomina cabello en nido de p√°jaro", explican en el documento de cosm√©tica capilar de la AEDV. Posteriormente hay que "enjuagarse muy bien con agua abundante, si se desea puede aplicarse un acondicionador, peinar con un peine de p√∫as anchas que ayude a desenredar, y posteriormente secar". Terminado este proceso, la doctora Mar√≠a Sainz insiste en que embadurnar el cuero cabelludo con colonia, una pr√°ctica muy frecuente en los adolescentes, es peligroso por su alto contenido de alcohol: "Se ha comprobado que esto acelera la aparici√≥n de la calvicie en gente con predisposici√≥n a tenerla por la abundante presencia de alcohol".

6. Tampoco elegimos bien la toalla

Toda ducha debe terminar con un secado pero para ello no valdr√≠a cualquier toalla. Muchas veces las elegimos por est√©tica, porque quedan bien con los azulejos del ba√±o, y no nos preocupamos de si son o no adecuadas para nuestra piel. Una toalla rugosa o demasiado √°spera puede irritar las pieles sensibles e incluso resecarlas. Lo aconsejable es que sea suave de algod√≥n absorbente. Para usarla hay que hacerlo mediante ligeros toques que eliminen el exceso de humedad y no frotando.
TITLE: Seguro t√∫ tambi√©n te has estado ba√±ado mal toda la vida

SUMMARY:
Und Sie erkl√§ren Sie mir nicht ‚Äì da Facebook ja mit seinen Kunden nicht spricht und auf Anfragen nicht antwortet.
Facebook ist die Schweigemauer des Internets.
So sehr ich Facebook als Medium sch√§tze ‚Äì so unheimlich ist mir dieses Schweigen.
Ihr Sprecher sagte nun zum Abonnenten-Schwund und dem Zensur-Vorwurf: "Facebook ist eine neutrale Plattform, die f√ºr Offenheit und das Recht auf Meinungsfreiheit steht.
Der Fachmann klagt: "Ein gro√ües Problem bei solchen Ph√§nomenen ist die Intransparenz von Facebook.
TEXT:
Sehr geehrte Facebook-Manager, ich komme mir vor wie in einem Roman von Kafka | Dani Cardona / Reuters

Sehr geehrte Facebook-Manager,

ich komme mir vor wie in einem Roman von Kafka. Seit September geschehen mit meinem Facebook-Account seltsame Dinge. Ich kann sie mir nicht erkl√§ren.

Und Sie erkl√§ren Sie mir nicht ‚Äì da Facebook ja mit seinen Kunden nicht spricht und auf Anfragen nicht antwortet.

Facebook ist die Schweigemauer des Internets. Bis vor zwei Monaten hatte ich neben meinen 5000 Freunden auf Facebook rund 16.500 Abonnenten. Die Zahl der Follower war immer gewachsen.

Ich nutze Facebook nicht f√ºr den privaten Austausch, sondern als Medium ‚Äì f√ºr meine journalistische Arbeit. Hauptthema: Russland und die Ukraine. Mit viel Kritik an Putin.

Seit zwei Monaten leidet meine Seite an massivem Abonnenten-Schwund. T√§glich gehen Dutzende Abonnenten verloren. Fast 2000 in zwei Monaten. Tr√∂pfchenweise, fast gleichm√§√üig.

Gestern Nacht etwa waren es noch 14.531. Jetzt, w√§hrend ich diese Zeilen schreibe, sind es nur noch 14.499.

Wenn Sie diesen Brief lesen, werden es schon wieder weniger sein. Dass die Abonnenten wie auf Absprache in fast gleichen Zeitabst√§nden abspringen, scheint wenig realit√§tsnah.

Es muss also irgendeine andere Erkl√§rung geben.

Auch Erdogan-Kritiker erleben einen Schwund an Abonennten

Ich habe mich damit abgefunden, weil ich wei√ü: Fragen an Facebook zu stellen ist sinnlos.

Jetzt stie√ü ich auf einen Artikel, und traute meinen Augen nicht.

Kritiker des t√ºrkischen Diktator Erdogan erleben im Moment genau das gleiche wie ich: Einen unerkl√§rlichen, massiven Schwund von Abonnenten. Tausende Follower springen innerhalb weniger Wochen ab. Auch Freunde sind pl√∂tzlich "entfreundet‚Äú.

Bei den verschwundenen Unterst√ºtzern handelte es sich offenbar auch nicht um Fake-Profile ‚Äì was eine Erkl√§rung gewesen w√§re. "Ich wurde t√§glich von mehreren Personen kontaktiert, die mir sagten, dass sie nicht mehr mit mir befreundet seien oder meine Beitr√§ge nicht mehr abonniert h√§tten, obwohl sie mich nicht gel√∂scht haben", zitiert das Nachrichtenportal "Watson.ch" Kerem Schamberger, einen der Betroffenen.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Google und Facebook sollen islamfeindliche Werbung im US-Wahlkampf unterst√ºtzt haben

Schamberger ist wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter am Institut f√ºr Kommunikationswissenschaft und Medienforschung an der Ludwig-Maximilians-Universit√§t in M√ºnchen. Und unerm√ºdlicher Kritiker von Erdogan.

Schamberger wirft Ihnen, sehr geehrte Facebook-Manager, vor, dass Sie ihn als T√ºrkei-kritische Stimme zensieren und seine Reichweite bewusst drosseln.

Ich hoffe, er irrt sich.

Euer Schweigen ist mir unheimlich

Aber ich w√ºrde dazu gerne mehr erfahren von Ihnen.



Mehrere Male hat Schamberger seine gesamten Facebook-Daten angefordert. Doch obwohl diese normalerweise innerhalb weniger Stunden von Ihnen bereitgestellt werden, erhielt er keine Antwort.

Nach Recherchen von "watson.ch" handelt es sich bei dem Entfreundungs-Ph√§nomen nicht um Einzelf√§lle. Mehrere T√ºrkei-kritische Profile sind demnach betroffen.

Ein Sprecher von Ihnen, sehr geehrte Facebook-Manager, wies die Vorw√ºrfe zur√ºck. Es ist schon mal sch√∂n, dass ein Sprecher √ºberhaupt etwas dazu sagt ‚Äì auf Anfrage von Journalisten. Denn bei stinknormalen Kunden neigt Facebook dazu, auf Anfragen gar nicht erst zu antworten.

So sehr ich Facebook als Medium sch√§tze ‚Äì so unheimlich ist mir dieses Schweigen.

Da Sie nicht antworten, habe ich l√§ngst aufgeh√∂rt, Fragen an Sie zu stellen. Etwa, warum Putin-Kritiker oder Islam-Kritiker oft aus unerfindlichen Gr√ºnden von Ihnen gesperrt werden, w√§hrend etwa Aufrufe zur Vernichtung Israels regelm√§√üig nicht gel√∂scht werden ‚Äì von Sperrungen ganz zu schweigen.

Werden einfach "Gesch√§ftskunden‚Äú bevorzugt?

Ihr Sprecher sagte nun zum Abonnenten-Schwund und dem Zensur-Vorwurf: "Facebook ist eine neutrale Plattform, die f√ºr Offenheit und das Recht auf Meinungsfreiheit steht. Nichts liegt uns ferner, als Herrn Schamberger oder andere zu zensieren."

Ich will Ihrem Sprecher gerne glauben.

F√ºr seine Aussage spricht auch, dass es auf meiner russischsprachigen Seite keinerlei Verlust von Abonnenten gibt. Im Gegenteil ‚Äì ihre Zahl w√§chst best√§ndig weiter, liegt jetzt bei knapp 13.500. Diese Seite ist aber im Gegensatz zu meiner "pers√∂nlichen‚Äú deutschen offiziell eine "kommerzielle‚Äú.

Das macht das Ph√§nomen noch merkw√ºrdiger. Werden einfach "Gesch√§ftskunden‚Äú bevorzugt? Oder nur auf deutschsprachigen Seiten Abonnements gestrichen? Fragen √ºber Fragen.

Und keine Antworten. Denn eine triftige Erkl√§rung f√ºr das Ph√§nomen kann Ihr Sprecher nicht bieten.

Die Probleme Ihres Konzerns sind die Probleme unserer Gesellschaft

Auch Markus Reuter von "netzpolitik.org" hat keine Erkl√§rung f√ºr das mysteri√∂se Verschwinden der Follower, wie "Watson" schreibt.

Der Fachmann klagt: "Ein gro√ües Problem bei solchen Ph√§nomenen ist die Intransparenz von Facebook. Angesichts dieser ist unklar, ob einfach nur der Algorithmus verr√ºcktspielt oder ob es sich um gezielte Ma√ünahmen gegen kurdische Personen und Organisationen handelt, wie einige Nutzer und Betroffene auf Facebook vermuten."

F√ºr die Betroffenen, so Reuter zu "Watson", bleibe bislang nur die Erkenntnis, dass sie um ihre Reichweite gebracht werden und nicht wissen, warum: "So etwas ist bei einer so marktdominanten Plattform √§u√üerst unbefriedigend, denn f√ºr viele Menschen ist Facebook die wichtigste M√∂glichkeit, √ñffentlichkeit herzustellen."

Daher meine Bitte an Sie, sehr geehrte Facebook-Manager: Sie machen ein gro√üartiges Produkt, das ich gerne nutze. Aber Sie m√ºssen der Verantwortung, die Ihnen aus diesem Erfolg erw√§chst, endlich gerecht werden.

Als ich im Juni an einer Konferenz zum Thema "Desinformation" an der Stanford-University war, sagte ein alter Professor: Die IT-Firmen "haben Technologien geschaffen, die es m√∂glich machen, mit Katzenbildern Geld zu verdienen. Und jetzt stellt sich heraus, dass diese Technologien gef√§hrlich sind f√ºr unsere Demokratie.‚Äú

Daher sind Ihre Probleme nicht nur die eines gro√üen Konzerns ‚Äì sondern unserer Gesellschaft.

Starten Sie Ihre eigene Glasnost

Umso wichtiger ist es, dass Sie hinter Ihrer Schweigemauer heraustreten und dem Dialog mit Ihren Kunden nicht mehr ausweichen.

Einen echten Dialog ‚Äì nicht den Potemkinschen Dialog mit Ihren Werbeanzeigen, die einem jetzt √ºberall entgegen prallen. Ob BMW oder Rossmann, Apple oder Aeroflot: Die meisten Unternehmen antworten zumindest auf Kundenanfragen.

Das sollten Sie doch auch k√∂nnen.

Deshalb: Starten Sie Ihre eigene Glasnost. Ihre Kunden werden es Ihnen danken.
TITLE: Sehr geehrte Facebook-Manager, was ihr gerade macht, ist unheimlich

SUMMARY:
Cuando llegan los Oscares una de las grandes quejas de todo el mundo aqu√≠ en M√©xico es que no se han estrenado las pel√≠culas.
Porque solo son elegibles para ser nominadas las pel√≠culas que se hayan estrenado en el 2017.
Entonces nosotros en M√©xico vemos estas pel√≠culas en diciembre, y sobre todo en enero y febrero.
Dunkerque es at√≠pica por su fecha de estreno, pero es una pel√≠cula tan grande que es imposible olvidarla.
O sea, que s√≠ es posible ver la mayor√≠a de las pel√≠culas antes de los Oscares.
TEXT:
Cuando llegan los Oscares una de las grandes quejas de todo el mundo aqu√≠ en M√©xico es que no se han estrenado las pel√≠culas. Y por tanto, a la hora de ver la ceremonia, pues como que no hay forma de opinar con fundamento si te parece bien o si te parece mal qui√©n va ganando.

A continuaci√≥n, presentaremos un calendario si quieren llegar a la noche del Oscar, en marzo 4 de 2018 como unos campeones y opinar con la seguridad con la que opinan del f√∫tbol.

¬øPor qu√© se estrenan la mayor√≠a de las pel√≠culas oscareables a fin de a√±o en Estados Unidos? Porque solo son elegibles para ser nominadas las pel√≠culas que se hayan estrenado en el 2017. Y como los votantes tienen memorias cortas, los estudios prefieren atiborrar de pel√≠culas adultas el fin de a√±o para que est√©n frescas en la mente de los miembros de la Academia. Entonces nosotros en M√©xico vemos estas pel√≠culas en diciembre, y sobre todo en enero y febrero. Empecemos:

En este caso, la favorita para ganar el Oscar ya se estren√≥ en verano y es Dunkerque, de Christopher Nolan. Un logro tit√°nico, un tema √©pico y serio, una pel√≠cula de un tama√±o que ya no es com√∫n y un director estrella hacen la tormenta perfecta. Si no la han visto, v√©anla. En Estados Unidos Warner la reestrenar√° en cine, que es d√≥nde se debe de ver. Ojal√° hagan lo mismo en M√©xico. Dunkerque es at√≠pica por su fecha de estreno, pero es una pel√≠cula tan grande que es imposible olvidarla.

La √∫nica piedra en el camino de Dunkerque para Mejor Pel√≠cula puede ser Los archivos del Pent√°gono, de Steven Spielberg, que relata la publicaci√≥n que hizo el Washington Post de documentos clave que ayudaron a exponer el desastre de la Guerra de Vietnam; aunque la pel√≠cula se estrena hasta el 25 de diciembre en Estados Unidos, las reacciones iniciales de la gente que la ha visto son de aplauso, y con un elenco encabezado por Meryl Streep como la due√±a del Post, Katherine Graham y de Tom Hanks, como el editor Ben Bradlee, promete ser un ca√±onazo, especialmente en este momento pol√≠tico en que la libertad de la prensa parece amenazada diariamente. En M√©xico se estrena el 2 de febrero.

Uncover the truth. Steven Spielberg's #ThePost arrives in theaters this Christmas. Una publicaci√≥n compartida de The Post (@thepostmovie) el 23 de Nov de 2017 a la(s) 6:06 PST

¬øQu√© hay de las dem√°s pel√≠culas? Empecemos por una cercana al coraz√≥n de los mexicanos, por el hecho de que la dirige Guillermo del Toro: The Shape of Water. Una historia de amor tipo La Bella y la Bestia entre una mujer muda y una criatura acu√°tica, la pel√≠cula le mereci√≥ a del Toro el Le√≥n de Oro en Venecia y sus mejores cr√≠ticas desde El laberinto del fauno. El entusiasmo es palpable, aunque llega a ocurrir en ocasiones que una pel√≠cula que impact√≥ en festivales a veces pierde fuerza en su estreno comercial. Dudo que sea el caso, y una nominaci√≥n para Sally Hawkins como Mejor Actriz parece segura y la pel√≠cula ser√° fuerte contendiente para ser nominada a Mejor Pel√≠cula y del Toro al Mejor Director. Del Toro nunca ha sido nominado para Mejor Director y el hecho de que el ramo de los directores es m√°s sofisticado augura bien para el mexicano en las nominaciones. La pel√≠cula se estrena en M√©xico el 12 de enero.

Para Mejor Actor el que m√°s suena es Gary Oldman en El instante m√°s oscuro, que vendr√≠a a ser un complemento o segunda parte no oficial de Dunkerque, ya que trata sobre el primer mes como Primer Ministro de Winston Churchill precisamente cuando tuvo que decidir si negociar la paz con Hitler o ser la √∫nica naci√≥n europea que seguir√≠a combatiendo la amenaza nazi. Oldman es un actor muy respetado que adem√°s ha tenido exposici√≥n en blockbusters como el Comisionado Gordon en la trilog√≠a de Batman y como Sirius Black en la saga de Harry Potter.

Su actuaci√≥n como Churchill viene sonando desde mediados de a√±o ya que el actor hace una transformaci√≥n prodigiosa como el robusto, irascible y heroico Primer Ministro. Es nominado seguro y el candidato a vencer. El instante m√°s oscuro tambi√©n podr√≠a ser contendiente a Mejor Pel√≠cula. Se estrena el 19 de enero.

De igual manera, como en la pol√≠tica, empiezan las campa√±as de desprestigio entre las pel√≠culas.

La que empez√≥ como una improbable contendiente y que cada vez parece m√°s s√≥lida es una pel√≠cula que trat√≥ el tema de la tensi√≥n racial en Estados Unidos, que gan√≥ m√°s de 250 millones de d√≥lares, dirigida por un afroamericano, Jordan Peele, y con un protagonista negro, Daniel Kaluuya, Se trata de la pel√≠cula de terror Get Out, ya estrenada en M√©xico bajo el t√≠tulo de Huye. En mi opini√≥n es un excelente thriller, pero sobrevalorado y que no es como para ser nominado a Mejor Pel√≠cula. Pero el momento pol√≠tico de tensiones raciales ayuda y el nominar la pel√≠cula manda un buen mensaje, adem√°s de que es admirable que se hizo por solo 5 millones de d√≥lares. A estas alturas causar√≠a gran decepci√≥n que la Academia no la reconociera de alguna forma. Vale la pena verla. Ya est√° disponible en DVD/Blu Ray y en iTunes.

Siguiendo con el tema pol√≠tico, para el segmento anti Trump est√° 3 carteles fuera de Ebbing Missouri, en que una madre de clase trabajadora arma una lucha feroz por presionar a la polic√≠a de un peque√±o pueblo gringo de que reactiven la investigaci√≥n sobre el asesinato y violaci√≥n de su hija. Y quien adem√°s se tiene que enfrentar a unos trogloditas rednecks creando una confrontaci√≥n que escala a la cat√°strofe. Frances McDormand, que gan√≥ un Oscar por Fargo, tiene asegurada nominaci√≥n a Mejor Actriz y la pel√≠cula es contendiente. Se estrena el 26 de enero

Una apuesta todav√≠a m√°s segura es Call Me by Your Name del director Luca Guadagnino y que cuenta la historia de amor gay entre un adolescente y un maestro que llega a su casa (el gal√°n Armie Hammer, de El agente de Cipol). Cabe aclarar que el adolescente es de edad legal en Italia donde ocurre la historia, aunque esto ha causado ligera controversia. Juzgada como una historia de amor exquisita, la nominaci√≥n parece un hecho, pero la Academia a veces falla con los temas LGBT, como lo demuestra el hecho inconcebible de que hace un par de a√±os Carol no fue nominada a Mejor Pel√≠cula. Se estrena el 2 de febrero.

Come out and dance with us. #NationalComingOutDay #CMBYN Una publicaci√≥n compartida de Call Me By Your Name (@cmbynfilm) el 11 de Oct de 2017 a la(s) 8:31 PDT

Una carta fuerte que podr√≠a ocupar el lugar de cine independiente que en el pasado ocuparon Beasts of the Southern Wild y Moonlight es The Florida Project, que exhibe la marginalidad de unos ni√±os que viven en un motel en la Florida m√°s pobre a la sombra de Disney World. Nuevamente la pel√≠cula ha tenido excelentes cr√≠ticas y el director Sean Baker ya sorprendi√≥ con la divertida y muy fresca Tangerine hace un par de a√±os. Willem Dafoe ser√° nominado seguro a Mejor Actor y es el contendiente a vencer en la premiaci√≥n. Se estrena en M√©xico el 2 de marzo.

Daniel Day Lewis se re√∫ne con su director de Petr√≥leo sangriento, Paul Thomas Anderson, para El hilo invisible; considerando que Day Lewis ha ganado 3 Oscares de Mejor Actor y que ha dicho que se retira despu√©s de esta pel√≠cula, una nominaci√≥n a Mejor Actor parece probable. Se estrena en M√©xico el 2 de marzo de 2018. Otra contendiente a Mejor Actriz ser√° Saoirse Ronan por su aclamada actuaci√≥n en la muy bien recibida Lady Bird, de la directora Greta Gerwig. Ser√≠a la tercera nominaci√≥n para la joven Saoirse despu√©s de ser nominada por Atonement y Brooklyn.

Otras que vale la pena ver porque pueden sorprender con alguna nominaci√≥n son Extraordinario, con Julia Roberts y Owen Wilson, que se estrena el 15 de diciembre ; Detroit, de la directora de Zona de miedo, Kathryn Bigelow, el 15 de diciembre. El gran showman, con Hugh Jackman, el 28 de diciembre , que se puede colar a Mejor Actor por esta pel√≠cula y por Logan; La apuesta maestra, con Jessica Chastain e Idris Elba, que se estrena el 4 de enero, y La batalla de los sexos, con Emma Stone y Steve Carell.

Does she have the nerve? #EmmaStone & #SteveCarell star in #BattleoftheSexes üéæ NOW PLAYING in select theaters & everywhere Friday! Get tickets via the link in bio. Una publicaci√≥n compartida de #BattleoftheSexes (@battleofthesexesmovie) el 25 de Sep de 2017 a la(s) 11:09 PDT

Y como un ejemplo de una pel√≠cula que tuvo un fuerte impacto en festivales pero que se diluy√≥ en su estreno en Estados Unidos, El seductor, de Sof√≠a Coppola. Ella gan√≥ el premio de Mejor Director en Cannes, pero la pel√≠cula gener√≥ poco entusiasmo en su estreno comercial y muchos cr√≠ticos la encontraron demasiado superficial. Y no olvidemos Mother, con Jennifer Lawrence y Javier Bardem, la pel√≠cula m√°s controversial de a√±o; a diferencia de la pel√≠cula de Coppola, la de Darren Aronofsky s√≠ tiene sus fans muy intensos, y aunque es dif√≠cil podr√≠a sorprender con nominaci√≥n a Mejor Actriz o Mejor Director. Ya veremos.

O sea, que s√≠ es posible ver la mayor√≠a de las pel√≠culas antes de los Oscares. Este es el panorama en este momento. En un mes pueden cambiar muchas cosas porque se anuncian los Premios de los Cr√≠ticos y las nominaciones a los Golden Globes, que afectan las opiniones de los votantes. De igual manera, como en la pol√≠tica, empiezan las campa√±as de desprestigio entre las pel√≠culas, y ahora con las denuncias diarias de acoso sexual alguien podr√≠a caer, y si no preg√∫ntele a Kevin Spacey, cuyo papel ya filmado para Todo el dinero del mundo fue cortado y vuelto a hacer con Christopher Plummer en un lapso de semanas para lograr la fecha de estreno de diciembre.

Los miembros de la Academia comienzan a votar el 5 de enero, las votaciones se cierran el 12 y se anuncian el 23 de enero. As√≠, comencemos a disfrutar de una de las mejores temporadas de cine del a√±o.

*Este contenido representa la opini√≥n del autor y no necesariamente la de HuffPost M√©xico.
TITLE: Qu√© pel√≠culas ver para prepararte para los Oscares

SUMMARY:
There's no magic solution to the smog problem in the Indian capital as it's caused by a variety of factors, United Nations Environment head Erik Solheim has said, adding: "The key here is providing clear, decisive leadership on the issue."
"Delhi's smog problem is caused by a variety of factors.
"We need action on transport for two reasons.
"But we really need to see more innovation and change in the air transport and shipping sectors."
For Solheim, the solution to reduce greenhouse gas emissions lies in steering electricity sector transformation towards green technology.
TEXT:
There's no magic solution to the smog problem in the Indian capital as it's caused by a variety of factors, United Nations Environment head Erik Solheim has said, adding: "The key here is providing clear, decisive leadership on the issue."

It's the same in New Delhi, Manchester, London, Beijing or Nairobi. Citizens and politicians have to breathe the same air. It's possible to build a strong consensus for action to opt for low-carbon solutions.

"Delhi's smog problem is caused by a variety of factors. These range from agricultural burning, the burning of waste, transport, construction and power generation, among others," Solheim told IANS in an online interview from Nairobi, which is hosting the UN Environment Assembly next week.

He said the priority is really to establish a scientific basis for action, using air quality monitoring technology to identify the precise sources of pollution.

"Policymakers can then use that data to prioritise areas of action and plan future change. The key here is providing clear, decisive leadership on the issue. Given the public health concerns, anyone taking firm action can be sure of winning public support," he observed.

Ahead of the third session of the UN Environment Assembly, where world leaders are gathering for the largest global meeting on pollution, an optimistic Solheim said there's a need for action on transport to curb emissions.

Transport accounts for nearly 18 per cent of all emissions worldwide, and over 90 per cent of the sector is still dependent on carbon-intensive fossil fuels.

"We need action on transport for two reasons. The transport sector, be it on land, in the air or at sea, is a major contributor to emissions and a driver of climate change. It's also a big cause of pollution, with an immediate detrimental impact on the health of hundreds of millions of people," Solheim said.

"We have started to see a shift to low-carbon solutions, but this needs to speed up. I'm convinced that the days are numbered for the internal combustion engine, with many nations now committing themselves to a time-bound phase-out of petrol and diesel vehicles," he said.

"But we really need to see more innovation and change in the air transport and shipping sectors."

The UN Environment Assembly, with 193 nations as its members, aims to deliver commitments to end the pollution of air, land, waterways and oceans and to safely manage chemicals and waste.

According to Solheim, what's happening in many cities around the world is criminal, and people deserve far better.

"Living in a city should not mean being condemned to poor health and an early death. On the positive side, both policymakers and citizens are increasingly aware of the issue, and especially the costs to health, to productivity and to the environment.

"It's possible to build a strong consensus for action. The benefit here is that action on tackling poor air quality in cities is also a big part of the action we need to take on climate change," he said.

On stepping up action to fight oceanic pollution, he said: "Beach clean-up initiatives are fantastic because they are a very useful tool to highlight the sheer scale of the problem and they help galvanise public support for change.

"But ultimately, we have to stop plastics getting into the oceans in the first place. For this we need stronger political leadership on the issue. Better waste management, incentives for recycling and producers taking more responsibility for where their products end up."

Solheim, an admirer of Indian lawyer Afroz Shah's commitment and passion for clean seas, says his model of cleaning beaches can be replicated for the rest of the world.

For Solheim, the solution to reduce greenhouse gas emissions lies in steering electricity sector transformation towards green technology.

China and India are both undergoing extraordinary change, and the shift to renewables in both the countries has been one of the most promising trends of recent years.

"I'm convinced that both nations will emerge as global energy leaders if they continue on this path," said Solheim, who recently tried out one of the bicycles delivered by Mobike that will be available for delegates to move around during the UN Environment Assembly.

He believes the bike aims to provide affordable and clean transport solutions for the cities.
TITLE: There's No Magic Solution To Delhi's Smog Problem, Says United Nations Environment Head

SUMMARY:
Children who worry about our world today need to know about the "long game in life."
Understanding that life really is a long game is one way to help them cope with their fears and anxieties.
Positive thinking is one key way to deal with the long game of life effectively.
A resilient child accepts that change in life is inevitable, is able to problem solve and understands the value of empathy ‚Äî all necessary elements in a successful long game of life.
Today, almost 20 years later, his long game is doing what he can to make the world a better place.
TEXT:
There was a "before this time" in history and there will be an after. Children who worry about our world today need to know about the "long game in life."

We have all been in stressful situations that seemed endless, only to discover they weren't. We moved past those particular markers and on to our future.Keep Calm and Carry On became the benchmark for positive thinking in the face of adversity many years ago. Those particular hostilities ended and life did indeed carry on. So successful were the simple but truthful few words that they have remained a catchphrase for optimism to this day, more than 70 years later. It is a timeless sentiment that works effectively as a family motto too.

Children deal in such an immediacy in their lives and emotionally can run to extremes in their outlook. Understanding that life really is a long game is one way to help them cope with their fears and anxieties.

How do you teach that to children who are caught up in worry?

To begin, they need to understand we are psychologically hard-wired to fret.

As Marcia Reynolds writes, "Our brains are always on the alert to keep you from being harmed... therefore, the brain can skew our thoughts toward pessimism and worrying about the worst that can happen. Shifting to optimism and possibilities takes conscious effort for most people."

The capacity to be resilient is an indispensable aspect for living a full and productive life.

You can help your child veer away from pessimism to optimism. Begin by using examples in your own life, using teachable moments to recount the many times you have worried about something and eventually ended up where you would have been, worry or not. As parents, how we deal with worry sets an example for our children.

Shifting to an optimistic mindset is a choice to exercise our own personal power. Positive thinking is one key way to deal with the long game of life effectively. Research has shown that children who learn to think positively are less likely to become depressed.

Positive thinking fosters resilience in the face of adversity. The capacity to be resilient is an indispensable aspect for living a full and productive life. A resilient child accepts that change in life is inevitable, is able to problem solve and understands the value of empathy ‚Äî all necessary elements in a successful long game of life. Parents can help develop resiliency with a positive home environment, consistency, boundaries and reasonable expectations.

It is a time of year where giving is a focus, with the emphasis on consumerism. Rather than unlimited attention on that list for Santa, encourage your child to also participate in philanthropic efforts, shifting that focus from "I want" to "they need." Fostering empathy can begin at a very young age. This provides an opportunity to educate your child about the disparities in life. Thinking outside their own gift boxes and helping others in some way is an investment in their future and their place in society. The long game has an added purpose.

Altruism is one very wide avenue on the road to optimism. Every child, no matter what their age, can be involved in some humanitarian effort.

There are food drives, holiday fund drives, snowsuit collections and many other local initiatives at this time of year that all seek contributions for those in need. Invariably, these programs have children who benefit from those donations. A volunteer connection to their community by children for children is a powerful educational tool.

By age eight, children have acquired the capacity to think outside their own little world and understand a broader view of life. As a result, some children create their own philanthropic projects. Ryan Hreljac was six years old in 1998 when he first learned about water shortages in Uganda and decided to build a well for one Ugandan community. Today, almost 20 years later, his long game is doing what he can to make the world a better place.

It is not an easy world today, but it is the world we live in. Acceptance of that reality is also part of coping with worry. Volunteerism, in any capacity, helps your child see the world with a wider lens.

Fostering their resiliency and nurturing their empathy will have a positive impact on your child's life. These social-emotional skills are the cornerstones of a healthy future.

As Shel Silverstein wrote, "Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me. Anything can happen, child, anything can be."

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: How To Help Your Kids Think About Life As A Long Game

SUMMARY:
‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017AR Rahman at the IFFI Red Carpet, when asked about the Padmavati row, "Sorry."
‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017As of today, the Kerala High Court passed a decision, asking IFFI to screen Sexy Durga, overruling the Ministry's decision.
When asked about freedom of expression being under threat, he said, "No, I don't want to say anything.
‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017Actor Shahid Kapoor, who features in a key role in Padmavati, spoke at length about the controversy.
‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017He went on to say, "Due process is being followed.
TEXT:
The controversy-ridden International Film Federation of India (IFFI) was officially declared open Monday evening, in the presence of key members of the Information and Broadcasting Ministry, Bollywood, and other film personalities.

A glittering ceremony took place at the Shyam Prasad Stadium in Taleigao, about 20 minutes from the state capital, Panjim, which also functions as the main venue for the 9-day-long extravaganza.

Hundreds of local Goans, tourists, journalists, and sundry festival guests descended into the stadium where Shah Rukh Khan was the chief guest, while actors Radhika Apte and Rajkummar Rao compered the event.

Khan spoke about dissent at the opening ceremony. "Sometimes, we dance along with the film. At other times, we get angry, disturbed or agitated. That exactly is the magic of storytelling, a magic which has the power to touch all our senses and in doing so, actually binding us together. The essence of storytelling is incomplete, if there is no story listener. And I believe that storytellers and story listeners are, or at least should be, like a family."

Back at the red-carpet, the question on the minds of the assembled press was one: isn't it a bit ironical to celebrate cinema in a glitzy ceremony when actors and filmmakers are being blatantly issued death threats, when the ministry organising the festival has dropped 3 important films, despite being selected by the jury, and when there's a general culture of fear that's taken over the creative industry, thanks to fringe groups almost having a free pass in holding filmmakers at ransom?

The condemnation, or rather the lack of it, from the artistic community was more telling than any comment probably could.

A conspiracy of silence, monosyllabic responses, and reluctant one-line remarks, monopolised the red-carpet.

Musicians walked away mid-way, producers absolved themselves by distancing their role in the controversy, and actors maintained a diplomatic stand even as Smriti Irani, Minister of Information & Broadcasting (I&B), sniggered inside the auditorium, at one point saying, 'Rajkummar, I would like the whole country to know that you made fun of Irani ‚Äî a minister ‚Äî which shows what a tolerant government we are."

Rao had made a joke, drawing connection to Smriti's last name and Irani filmmaker, Majid Majidi, whose film, Beyond the Clouds opened the festival.

HuffPost India was at the red-carpet and we asked every person who walked the red-carpet about the current climate of fear and governmental over-reach, stifling of freedom of expression, and about the ongoing Padmavati row, where the makers had to postpone the film's release after multiple threats from the Karni Sena (the makers have called it a 'voluntary' decision)

When asked about the Padmavati row, producer Boney Kapoor on IFFI red carpet said, "Padmavati is, well, not my film." Great way to show solidarity. ‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017

AR Rahman at the IFFI Red Carpet, when asked about the Padmavati row, "Sorry." Walks away. "i will let you know..." well done, Mr Rahman. ‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017

Ashwini Iyer Tiwari, the director of two critically-acclaimed films, Bareily ki Barfi and Nil Battey Sanata, chose not to respond to the question on Sexy Durga and Nude being dropped. Tiwari is also part of the steering committee of IFFI 2017.

Ashwini Iyer Tiwari, director of Barely ki Barfi, and who is part of IFFI's steering committee, on S Durga and Nude being dropped: "I don't want to say anything on that." ‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017

As of today, the Kerala High Court passed a decision, asking IFFI to screen Sexy Durga, overruling the Ministry's decision.

Despite repeated pleas, producer and former Disney head honcho, Sidharth Roy Kapoor, walked away, choosing not to respond to the media.

Dangal director, Nitesh Tiwari, also walked past.

Rajkummar Rao, who appeared on the red carpet after the ceremony was over, did not take any questions from the media.

Vishal Bhardwaj, who was present at the ceremony as he's written the dialogues for the opening film, Beyond the Clouds, didn't respond to questions about the Ministry arbitrarily dropping Sanal Kumar Sasidharan's Sexy Durga and Ravi Jadhav's Nude. When asked about freedom of expression being under threat, he said, "No, I don't want to say anything. I am here to attend the film festival."

Talking about the Padmavati row, Bhardwaj said:

"I stand with Mr Bhansali." Vishal Bhardwaj on Padmavati row. ‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017

Actor Shahid Kapoor, who features in a key role in Padmavati, spoke at length about the controversy.

He said, "I don't think there is anything in the film that is unacceptable or not in good taste. Eventually, Padmavati will come out in full force. Our Constitution says that you are innocent until proven guilty. Same should be extended to Padmavati, it should not be considered guilty even before people judge it."

When this reporter asked if the systematic attack on Padmavati could have been possible without the complicity or the tacit support of the government, Shahid said, "I can't answer all your questions. If we do not get the certificate, then I would feel very demotivated. But we're in the process of procuring it right now."

Majid Majidi, the Oscar-winning filmmaker of Children of Heaven, who has made films in times of great unrest in Iran, said:

Majod Majidi, a filmmaker who has made films in a very trying environment, on the current environment of censorship: "It is happening all over the world. An independent voice shouldn't be choked." ‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017

"Even if a government tries to suppress a voice and contain it, artists will always find an outlet to put their work out," Majid Majidi on the rising censorship in India. ‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017

Prasoon Joshi, the current chief of the Censor Board:

When asked what's the point if celebrating cinema at a film fest when the idea of cinema is in itself under threat, Prasoon Joshi said, "there are many people who don't get to watch international films, fest is for them, as for Padmavati, we need to stop being angsty." ‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017

He went on to say, "Due process is being followed. Talks are going on. We need to sit and reach a consensus which all parties agree upon." ‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017

Criticising the way actors of Padmavati have been threatened, Nana Patekar said, "Their language has been inappropriate, and I hope nothing like this happens. See, everybody takes creative liberties when it comes to making a film. People can get offended by it or not, but it is my responsibility as a filmmaker that I don't hurt anybody's sentiments. But here, commenting on the film, or objecting to the story without watching the film is totally wrong."

The strongest comment came perhaps from upcoming actor, Ishaaan Khatter (Beyond the Clouds), who said:

Young actor Ishaan Khattar perhaps had the 'bravest' comment. "I don't believe art should be suppressed (in the manner it has)". On S Durga and Nude being dropped from IFFI, a fest where his film, Beyond the Clouds, is premiering. ‚Äî Ankur Pathak (@aktalkies) November 20, 2017

He then proceeded to walk in for the ceremony, saying, "Right now, I want to focus on my film which is opening the festival."

Also see on HuffPost:
TITLE: IFFI 2017: We Asked Celebrities On The Red Carpet About Threat To Artistic Freedom, Most Did Not Respond

SUMMARY:
In a partnership with Stanford University School of Medicine, the study uses the heart rate sensor on the Apple Watch to collect heart rate data and in turn better understand the condition of an irregular heart beat.
Millions of people now have a pretty accurate heart rate sensor on their wrists in the form of an Apple Watch.
Using the data anonymously collected by the heart rate sensor, researchers at Stanford are hoping to not only better understand irregular heart rates but even potentially reach a stage where gadgets like the Apple Watch can predict if they‚Äôll lead to something more serious.
The study is currently only available in the US and includes a dedicated app that once installed will not only send data anonymously to Stanford but will also notify the participant if it detects an irregular heart beat.
Once notified they‚Äôll also get a free video consultation with one of the study‚Äôs medical professionals through the app.
TEXT:
In a partnership with Stanford University School of Medicine, the study uses the heart rate sensor on the Apple Watch to collect heart rate data and in turn better understand the condition of an irregular heart beat.

One such example of this is AFib, a condition that affects potentially tens of millions of people and can lead to blood clots or even heart failure.

The problem is that for many, the symptoms needed to diagnose it go completely unnoticed.

This is where Apple comes in. Millions of people now have a pretty accurate heart rate sensor on their wrists in the form of an Apple Watch.

Using the data anonymously collected by the heart rate sensor, researchers at Stanford are hoping to not only better understand irregular heart rates but even potentially reach a stage where gadgets like the Apple Watch can predict if they‚Äôll lead to something more serious.

The study is currently only available in the US and includes a dedicated app that once installed will not only send data anonymously to Stanford but will also notify the participant if it detects an irregular heart beat.

Once notified they‚Äôll also get a free video consultation with one of the study‚Äôs medical professionals through the app.
TITLE: Apple And Stanford University Launch Heart Study On Apple Watch

SUMMARY:
Si el presidente boliviano Evo Morales logra ser reelegido en las siguientes elecciones, llegar√≠a a cumplir 19 a√±os como mandatario.
Se entiende que la Constituci√≥n de un pa√≠s es la norma jur√≠dica "suprema" que rige la organizaci√≥n de un Estado y no est√° abierta a interpretaciones.
Si el presidente boliviano Evo Morales logra ser reelegido en las siguientes elecciones, llegar√≠a a cumplir 19 a√±os como mandatario, con una serie de cuestionamientos sobre la manera en la cual pretende quedarse en el poder a nombre de los bolivianos.
Es complejo observar la situaci√≥n de mi pa√≠s a la distancia y tratar de hacer algo al respecto que no se quede √∫nicamente en protestas en redes sociales y en una queja con mis compatriotas.
Y de recordar que a√∫n existe la democracia y una Constituci√≥n pol√≠tica que debe ser respetada y no manipulada al antojo de un sector.
TEXT:
Si el presidente boliviano Evo Morales logra ser reelegido en las siguientes elecciones, llegar√≠a a cumplir 19 a√±os como mandatario.

Muchos se preguntan qu√© pasa con la situaci√≥n en Bolivia y si la poblaci√≥n est√° a favor o en contra del gobierno del presidente Evo Morales y su pol√≠tica, ya que este pasado martes 28 de noviembre el Tribunal Constitucional Plurinacional emiti√≥ un fallo por el cual quedan inaplicables cuatro art√≠culos de la constituci√≥n, lo que permite que Morales pueda ser candidato presidencial nuevamente y de manera indefinida.

Senadores y diputados del Movimiento al Socialismo (MAS) ‚Äîel partido del presidente Evo Morales‚Äî presentaron una Acci√≥n de Inconstitucionalidad Abstracta en el mes de septiembre, asegurando que estos art√≠culos limitaban el derecho pol√≠tico de las personas al poner un l√≠mite a la cantidad de veces que alguien puede aspirar a un cargo p√∫blico, ampar√°ndose de la Convenci√≥n Americana de Derechos Humanos. Sobre esta decisi√≥n el propio Secretario General de la Organizaci√≥n de Estados Americanos, Luis Almagro, asegur√≥ que el Pacto de San Jos√© no tiene como fin perpetuarse en el poder.

Las manifestaciones y protestas no se han hecho esperar en Bolivia, desde que se conoci√≥ el fallo del Tribunal Constitucional del pasado martes en la tarde, desde ex mandatarios, analistas pol√≠ticos, hasta estudiantes han salido a las calles.

El problema de no respetar la Constituci√≥n Pol√≠tica del Estado en repetidas ocasiones est√° en la posibilidad de "perpetuarse" en el poder, por si no fueran suficientes once a√±os, con el pretexto de continuar con el llamado proceso de cambio y hablar a nombre de "pueblo".

Los magistrados que habilitaron al presidente y vicepresidente a ser candidatos a una nueva elecci√≥n est√°n en sus √∫ltimos d√≠as de funciones en el cargo, pues este domingo 3 de diciembre en Bolivia se llevar√° adelante la elecci√≥n de autoridades del √ìrgano Judicial y del Tribunal Constitucional Plurinacional.

Un d√≠a despu√©s de conocer esta determinaci√≥n el presidente Evo Morales asegur√≥ que el pueblo boliviano quiere la continuidad de su gobierno para seguir con crecimiento econ√≥mico, que este fallo aplica tambi√©n para las autoridades de la oposici√≥n y que sus rivales pol√≠ticos deber√≠an estar prepar√°ndose para las elecciones en lugar de criticarlo. Evidentemente evadi√≥ el cuestionamiento sobre la vulnerabilidad de la Constituci√≥n Pol√≠tica del Estado al ponerla por debajo de la Convenci√≥n Americana de los Derechos Humanos. Se entiende que la Constituci√≥n de un pa√≠s es la norma jur√≠dica "suprema" que rige la organizaci√≥n de un Estado y no est√° abierta a interpretaciones.

Si el presidente boliviano Evo Morales logra ser reelegido en las siguientes elecciones, llegar√≠a a cumplir 19 a√±os como mandatario, con una serie de cuestionamientos sobre la manera en la cual pretende quedarse en el poder a nombre de los bolivianos.

Al parecer esta decisi√≥n del gobierno boliviano sirvi√≥ de apoyo para el presidente Venezolano Nicol√°s Maduro, pues el vicepresidente de aquel pa√≠s, Tareck El Aissami, habl√≥ sobre la intenci√≥n de postularse a una elecci√≥n presidencial en el a√±o 2018, como si la democracia a√∫n existiera en Venezuela.

Es complejo observar la situaci√≥n de mi pa√≠s a la distancia y tratar de hacer algo al respecto que no se quede √∫nicamente en protestas en redes sociales y en una queja con mis compatriotas. Explicar en M√©xico la realidad boliviana es un intento de hacer escuchar la voz de varios que al parecer no pertenecen al "pueblo" del que tanto habla Evo Morales. Y de recordar que a√∫n existe la democracia y una Constituci√≥n pol√≠tica que debe ser respetada y no manipulada al antojo de un sector.

*Este contenido representa la opini√≥n del autor y no necesariamente la de HuffPost M√©xico.
TITLE: La inconstitucionalidad de la Constituci√≥n: una preocupante historia en Bolivia

SUMMARY:
This winter the capital is home to more winter pop-ups than ever before, with fairy lights, festive music and mulled wine in abundance.
The Winter Forest at Broadgate, Liverpool StreetWinter ForestMade up of majestic pine trees, Broadgate‚Äôs pop-up forest brings an unexpected slice of Nordic countryside to central London.
Boxpark, CroydonBoxparkCrystal Palace FC turned on the Christmas lights at Boxpark Croydon on the 21 November, kicking off a season of festive pop-ups at the venue.
Queen of Hoxton, ShoreditchQueen Of HoxtonIf you‚Äôre starting to get bored of alpine-themed winter pop-ups, head to Queen of Hoxton‚Äôs ‚ÄòMoroccan Medina‚Äô this winter.
Winterland, FulhamWinterlandWinterland is something of a festive Mecca, with igloos, curling, street food and Christmas trees galore.
TEXT:
If you love Christmas more than Buddy the Elf, let London be your playground. This winter the capital is home to more winter pop-ups than ever before, with fairy lights, festive music and mulled wine in abundance. There‚Äôs something to suit everyone with ice-skating, Christmassy cinema screenings and dinner in an igloo being just a few of the activities on offer. Excited? Check out our round-up of some of the best venues below. 1. Coppa Club, Tower Bridge

Coppa Club/Allan Stone

Coppa Club‚Äôs popular igloos are back, bringing a little slice of Lapland to the restaurant‚Äôs Thames-side terrace. This year they‚Äôve been revamped with timber frames and Perspex sliding doors, and are all fully furnished with heating, blankets and speakers. A wide selection of dishes are available to enjoy inside the igloos, from the succulent Coppa Club burger to the sustainably caught hake. Or to really get in the festive spirit, head down between now and 31 December to try the set Christmas menu featuring roast turkey, lamb, duck or sea bream. Sadly, open reservations for the igloos sold out within four hours of this year‚Äôs website going live, so you‚Äôll have to chance your luck and head down on the day, where several walk-in tables have been left open on a first come, first served basis. Open: Now until the end of February 2018.

Address: Coppa Club, 3 Three Quays Walk, Lower Thames Street, EC3R 6AH.

More info: coppaclub.co.uk/towerbridge.



2. The Winter Forest at Broadgate, Liverpool Street

Winter Forest

Made up of majestic pine trees, Broadgate‚Äôs pop-up forest brings an unexpected slice of Nordic countryside to central London. Walk through the trees surrounded by twinkling reactive lights and biodegradable snow, or visit the neighbouring Winter Forest Market, where you‚Äôll find food, gifts and more. Finish your visit in the bar and grill for mulled wine and Prosecco under the stars. Top tip: This small pop-up is great if you‚Äôre looking for an alternative venue to catch up with mates after work, but probably isn‚Äôt big enough for a whole day out. Open: Now until 12 January 2018.

Address: Exchange Square, Broadgate, Liverpool Street, EC2M 7QH.

More info and booking: thewinterforest.broadgate.co.uk. 3. Boxpark, Croydon

Boxpark

Crystal Palace FC turned on the Christmas lights at Boxpark Croydon on the 21 November, kicking off a season of festive pop-ups at the venue. On Sunday 3 December, Columbia Creative will bring their floral magic to Croydon with a wreath-making masterclass while on Sunday 10 December, Croydon Philharmonic Choir will provide the space with a festive soundtrack. Friday 15 December hails the arrival of Christmas Jumper Day, where ¬£1 of every purchase made by someone wearing a Christmas jumper will be donated to Save The Children. And finally, from Monday 18 December until Wednesday 20 December there will be free screenings of a selection of classic Christmas movie favourites, including ‚ÄòMiracle on 34th Street‚Äô and ‚ÄòJingle All The Way‚Äô. Open: Now until 20 December.

Address: Boxpark Croydon, 99 George Street, Croydon, CR0 1LD.

More info: boxpark.co.uk/croydon/. 4. Skylight, Wapping

Skylight

Like many London rooftops, Skylight has transformed the top floors of an urban carpark for fun and frolics. But unlike its competitors, Skylight has the only rooftop ice skating rink in the capital. Themed around an urban apr√®skate bar, the east London venue also plays host to delicious seasonal drinks, fondue and street food from YIRO, cutting edge DJs, ice hockey shooting, indoor and outdoor heated areas, and some of the best views in the city. Top tip: head up to Skylight late in the afternoon so you catch the sunset. The views of The Shard and London skyline are pretty spectacular - especially with a delicious cocktail or mulled wine in hand. Open: Now until 14 January

Address: Tobacco Dock, Pennington St. Car Park entrance, Wapping, E1W 2SF.

More info and booking: skylightlondon.com. 5. Queen of Hoxton, Shoreditch

Queen Of Hoxton

If you‚Äôre starting to get bored of alpine-themed winter pop-ups, head to Queen of Hoxton‚Äôs ‚ÄòMoroccan Medina‚Äô this winter. The d√©cor, inspired by the Majorelle Gardens in Marrakesh, comes complete with giant cacti set against dusty cobalt blue walls, with canopies of fairy lights and cast iron fire pits. Keep warm inside the rooftop‚Äôs wigwam-turned-Moroccan-feasting-hall, or find a spot by the bar under the stars. Visitors can feast on a menu of Middle Eastern delights - from lamb and apricot tagine to a ‚Äòrainbow vegan mezze board‚Äô - or get a Henna tattoo while taking in the heady scents of spices and shisha pipes. The venue will play host to a series of events throughout the winter, including a Moroccan shoe-making workshop (18 Nov and 3 Feb) and a rooftop hip-hop and meditation class (20 January). Open: Now until end of March 2018.

Address: 1 Curtain Road, London, EC2A 3JX.

More info and tickets: queenofhoxton.com/rooftop/winter.

6. Winterland, Fulham

Winterland

Winterland is something of a festive Mecca, with igloos, curling, street food and Christmas trees galore. And better yet, it‚Äôs Bring Your Own Booze (BYOB) on Thursdays, Fridays and Sundays making it a relatively cheap evening out. The amount of alcohol you‚Äôre permitted to bring into the venue per person is restricted to one bottle of wine (75cl)/Prosecco/Champagne, or six cans of beer, or half a bottle (35cl) of spirits. On Saturdays you can purchase drinks at your pleasure from one of the two alcoholic bars, including glorious hot cocktails. Open: Now until 22 December

Address: Winterland, Wandsworth Bridge Road, London, SW6 2TY.

More info and booking: winterlandlondon.com. 7. Christmas at Kew 2017, Kew Gardens

Kew

With over one million twinkling lights used throughout its festive displays, you won‚Äôt be left disappointed by Christmas at Kew. The gardens have been taken over by an array of awe-inspiring light and sound installations during the festive season, including an ultraviolet walkway of continuously moving bubbles and a ‚Äòweeping tree‚Äô covered in glittering lights. Visitors can also marvel at the ‚Äòsledge tree‚Äô (an 11m-high structure constructed from over 360 wooden sledges) and the ‚Äòsinging trees‚Äô (six large trees wrapped in dazzling coloured lights accompanied by familiar Christmas tunes). Finish off the evening with the ‚Äòpalm house grand finale‚Äô - an impressive display of laser beams, streams of light and kaleidoscopic projections, accompanied by Christmas music classics with the iconic greenhouse as a backdrop. Open: Now until 1 January 2018.

Address: Kew Gardens, Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, Richmond, TW9 3AE.

More info and booking: kew.org. 8. Winterville, Clapham Common

Winterville

With a long list of activities on offer, Winterville has something to suit all ages and interests. Active sorts can skate on Clapham Common‚Äôs first ever ice rink, play crazy golf on the UV-powered Plonk Golf course or ride the Big Wheel. For a more chilled affair, enjoy street food from Street Feast, watch screenings of Christmas classics in Backyard Cinema‚Äôs ‚Äòwinter night garden‚Äô or grab some last-minute gifts from the alternative Christmas market. Top tip: If you‚Äôre looking for a pop-up that‚Äôs child-friendly, Winterville is our pick. Little ones will love the entirely free Kids Quarter, where they‚Äôll be taught circus skills, make twinkly Christmas decorations and get glitter tattoos from Santa‚Äôs elves. Open: Now until 1 January.

Address: Clapham Common, Windmill Drive, SW4 9DE.

More info: winterville.co.uk.



9. Sipsmith‚Äôs Winter Warming Terrace at Charlotte‚Äôs W5, Ealing

Charlottes W5
TITLE: Best Winter Pop-Ups In London 2017, From Cosy Igloos To Rooftop Ice Rinks

SUMMARY:
The holiday season is full of giving and receiving, but there are some young people who won't be so lucky this Christmas.
One Small Act of Kindness is desperate for children's toys, as is The Angel Network, Charity Begins At Home, and the amazing Hotel Hope orphanage in Johannesburg.
HospitalsGo to your nearest paediatric unit and see what they need ‚Äì‚Äì there are so many children who who could do with the help.
Another is the South African Bikers' annual toy run and the Game Toy Story drive.
If you know of any other children's charities in need of festive-season donations, let us know at news@huffpostsa.com ‚Äì‚Äì we would love to help you promote your cause!
TEXT:
The holiday season is full of giving and receiving, but there are some young people who won't be so lucky this Christmas. If you have some spare goodies lying around that you'd like to donate to the less fortunate, here's a guide to finding worthy recipients:

Facebook

There are tons of groups on the lookout for donations, so just try searching in your Facebook browser for somewhere close to you. One Small Act of Kindness is desperate for children's toys, as is The Angel Network, Charity Begins At Home, and the amazing Hotel Hope orphanage in Johannesburg.

Hospitals

Go to your nearest paediatric unit and see what they need ‚Äì‚Äì there are so many children who who could do with the help. While you're at it, check out the Nelson Mandela Children's Hospital, and see if you can help in any way, and also consider the amazing work being done by CHOC Childhood Cancer Foundation.

Welfare groups

Head to your nearest Child Welfare organisation. Some Googling will help you find branches around the country that could do with a little love and support, as well as Childline.

Toy Runs

There are always a bunch of campaigns that run this time of year. Toys For Joy is one of them. Another is the South African Bikers' annual toy run and the Game Toy Story drive.

If you know of any other children's charities in need of festive-season donations, let us know at news@huffpostsa.com ‚Äì‚Äì we would love to help you promote your cause!
TITLE: Here's Where To Donate Your Old Toys This Holiday Season

TEXT:
FRANCOIS NASCIMBENI via Getty Images

POLITIQUE - "Entre eux, c'est la guerre". Voici comment le Journal du Dimanche titre ce 3 d√©cembre un article consacr√© aux relations entre deux ministres pourtant cens√©s coop√©rer: St√©phane Travert (Agriculture et Alimentation) et Nicolas Hulot (Transition √©cologique). Dans un article puis une interview, l'hebdomadaire d√©taille ainsi la d√©gradation de leurs rapports, li√©s √† des "incidents de fronti√®res".

En clair, les deux hommes ont l'impression que l'autre empi√®te en permanence sur son terrain, √† l'image des r√©cents dossiers du glyphosate ou des √©tats g√©n√©raux de l'alimentation, imagin√©s par Hulot, mais finalement pr√©sid√©s par Travert. Et un sujet illustre particuli√®rement bien ces dissensions: le repas v√©g√©tarien par semaine voulu par le militant √©cologiste dans les cantines.

Des personnalit√©s oppos√©es

Une mesure visiblement loin de trouver gr√¢ce aux yeux du ministre de l'Alimentation. "Libert√© et responsabilit√© plut√¥t que contrainte", r√©pond-il au JDD dans une interview. "Ce qui importe, c'est que nos enfants aient une alimentation saine, diversifi√©e et √©quilibr√©e." Pourtant, dans l'article consacr√© √† la brouille entre les deux hommes, l'hebdomadaire dominical est bien plus direct, assurant que St√©phane Travert parle "d'√©cologie punitive" quand il est interrog√© sur cette question.

Si les diff√©rends entre les deux hommes viendraient √©galement de leurs personnalit√©s diam√©tralement oppos√©es entre "l'affectif col√©rique" et "l'armoire normande", pour reprendre les mots d'un conseiller de Travert cit√© par le JDD, ce dernier n'envisage pourtant pas une seconde de d√©missionner. "Dans ce minist√®re, il faut savoir affronter des temp√™tes, les pieds bien plant√©s dans la terre. Je n'ai pas d'√©tats d'√¢me."

Des objectifs chiffr√©s √† l'horizon 2022

St√©phane Travert pr√©cise dont sa feuille de route pour les mois √† venir, et affirme notamment suivre les ambitions du pr√©sident de la R√©publique Emmanuel Macron concernant le glyphosate. En clair, si les √âtats membres de l'UE ont renouvel√© la licence de l'herbicide pour 5 ans, la France cherche √† s'en passer d'ici trois ans. "C'est la feuille de route du pr√©sident, je n'en ai pas d'autres."

L'ancien cadre socialiste √©voque √©galement la grande politique de l'Alimentation engag√©e par Emmanuel Macron, et y ajoute quelques pr√©cisions. Ainsi, la France inscrira dans la loi son engagement qu'il y ait 50% de bio et de produits locaux dans la restauration collective d'ici √† 2022, et visera √† ce que la moiti√© des ≈ìufs coquille consomm√©s dans le pays proviennent "d'√©levages alternatifs √† la cage".

St√©phane pr√©cise aussi qu'il compte venir en aide aux agriculteurs en modifiant la mani√®re dont sont √©tablis les prix. "Ils le seront d√©sormais √† partir des co√ªts de production", assure St√©phane Travert. Et d'affirmer qu'il n'est "aux mains de personne" et surtout pas de la FNSEA. "Pour bagage, je n'ai que mes convictions. Et pour boussole, l'int√©r√™t g√©n√©ral."

TEXT:
Ivanka Trump, daughter of U.S. President Donald Trump, speaks during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit (GES) in Hyderabad, India November 28, 2017. REUTERS/Cathal McNaughton

U.S. President Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump kicked off a global business summit in southern India on Tuesday calling for better opportunities for women entrepreneurs battling heavy odds around the world.

Ivanka, also an informal adviser to her father, received a warm welcome in India's high-tech hub of Hyderabad with all the trappings of a state guest.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi joined her in the opening of the U.S.-backed Global Entrepreneurship Summit which New Delhi is hoping will further boost political and economic ties with the United States under the Trump administration.

Ivanka, wearing a bright green floral dress, said fuelling the growth of women-led businesses and closing the gender entrepreneurship gap could help expand global GDP by 2 percent.

"Women still face steep obstacles to starting, owning and growing their businesses. We must ensure women entrepreneurs have access to capital, access to networks and mentors," Ivanka said to loud cheers from a packed audience in a heavily-guarded conference centre.

In developing countries, 70 percent of women-owned smaller businesses were being denied access to capital, she said, leading to a near $300 billion annual credit deficit for them.

GES is an event conceived by former U.S. President Barack Obama. It has previously been held in countries such as the United States and Turkey, but this year's edition is the first under the Trump administration.

The theme of the conference this year is "Women First, Prosperity for All". More than half the participants at the summit are women, and all-female delegations are representing countries such as Afghanistan, Israel and Saudi Arabia.

Ivanka, who ran an eponymous clothing and jewellery business before becoming an adviser in the White House, has made women's issues one of her main policy areas.

She cited a Harvard Business Review report that found that in the United States investors ask men questions about their potential for gains, whereas they ask women questions about their potential for loss.

Billboards with pictures of Ivanka dotted many parts of Hyderabad which is also home to major U.S. firms such as Microsoft. In recent days, authorities took beggars off city streets in a clean-up drive before the meeting, media said.

More than 10,000 police officials were deployed in the city and sniffer dogs as well as "spotters", or men trained to detect any suspicious activity or people, were on stand by, a police officer said.

On the sidelines, Ivanka held talks with Modi, as well as Indian foreign minister Sushma Swaraj. Later she toured the conference centre with Modi and met a few entrepreneurs, before watching traditional Indian dance performances in the inaugural session.

"This event not only connects the Silicon Valley with Hyderabad but also show-cases the close ties between the United States of America and India. It underlines our shared commitment towards encouraging entrepreneurship and innovation," Modi said.

India has become a major market for the United States, with two-way trade of about $115 billion last year. They aim to raise that to $500 billion by 2022. Military and strategic ties are also improving as China's influence rises in Asia and beyond.

"The Trump administration sees India as a strategic partner and wants to engage with India more. When you look at sending of Ivanka Trump, it is sending a very strong signal," said Mukesh Aghi, president of the US-India Strategic Partnership Forum.
TITLE: Must Ensure Women Entrepreneurs Have Access To Capital, Says Ivanka Trump

BLOG VOICESPop Culture's Appropriation From The House Ball Community Runs DeepMichael Roberson Maasai Milan explains how pop culture music and television have appropriated from the house ball community without ever referencing them as inspiration.
This has created challenges for identity, inclusion and opportunity for members of that community.
Roberson is a New York City-based public health practitioner, educator, activist, and founder of House of Blahnik, Maasai and Garcon.
He was in Toronto as part of the Black Love Matters unconference, a course offered by York University that explores black love, identity, community, and structural and other forms of racism and discrimination faced by black Canadians.
Read more here: http://huffp.st/OryGeqb
TEXT:
BLOG VOICES

Pop Culture's Appropriation From The House Ball Community Runs Deep

Michael Roberson Maasai Milan explains how pop culture music and television have appropriated from the house ball community without ever referencing them as inspiration. This has created challenges for identity, inclusion and opportunity for members of that community. Roberson is a New York City-based public health practitioner, educator, activist, and founder of House of Blahnik, Maasai and Garcon. He was in Toronto as part of the Black Love Matters unconference, a course offered by York University that explores black love, identity, community, and structural and other forms of racism and discrimination faced by black Canadians. Read more here: http://huffp.st/OryGeqb
TITLE: Pop Culture's Appropriation From The House Ball Community Runs Deep

TEXT:
Brauchen wir auch eine Obergrenze f√ºr Klimafl√ºchtlinge? Bei den gescheiterten Jamaika-Sondierungen hat es ja insbesondere bei den Themen Klima und Migration immer wieder heftig gekracht. W√§hrend die Gr√ºnen sich bei anderen Parteien f√ºr Verpflichtungen zu (deutlich) mehr Klimaschutz durchsetzen wollten, beharrte vor allem die CSU auf der "Obergrenze" und einer strikten Regelung beim Thema Familiennachzug. Sozialwissenschaftler, Migrationsforscher und wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter am Deutschen Institut f√ºr Entwicklungspolitik (DIE)

Wer Fl√ºchtlinge gegen Arbeitslose ausspielt, hat das Problem nicht verstanden St√§ndig h√∂re ich denselben Satz: Die Fl√ºchtlinge bek√§men viel mehr Geld vom Staat als die Deutschen. St√§ndig gefolgt von dem Lamento: Das sei doch unfair. Fast jedes Mal brauche ich nur eine einzige Nachfrage zu stellen, um das Schimpfen als grundlos zu entlarven. Gr√ºndungsmitglied von aufRECHT e.V, Hartz-IV-Empf√§nger

Ich habe 2 Monate in einem s√§chsischen Dorf gewohnt ‚Äì jetzt verstehe ich, was Deutschland zerrei√üt Als ich meinen Freunden und Kollegen in M√ºnchen erz√§hlt habe, dass ich f√ºr zwei Monate nach Sachsen ziehen werde, habe ich eigentlich immer die gleichen Reaktionen bekommen: "Oh, du Armer, da will doch niemand hin" oder "Na viel Spa√ü, da oben wirst du dich ordentlich langweilen", um nur ein paar wenige Kommentare zu nennen. Autor im Video-Team

Die Digitalisierung ist eine gro√üe Chance f√ºr uns K√ºnstler Ich wuchs in einer l√§ndlichen Gegend im S√ºden der Vereinigten Staaten auf. Dort wird Kunst kulturell anders bewertet als in den gro√üen St√§dten. In der Region, aus der ich stamme, waren K√ºnstler √ºberwiegend Au√üenseiter. K√ºnstler und Dozent an der Yale University

Es wird Zeit, dass wir die T√ºrkei aus der Nato werfen Die T√ºrkei hat s√§mtliche westlichen Werte l√§ngst abgelegt und entwickelt sich mehr und mehr zu einem islamischen Gottesstaat. Erdogan kann noch so oft behaupten, er w√ºrde eine Demokratie anf√ºhren, aber es ist klar, dass sich das Land unter seiner F√ºhrung in ein autorit√§res Regime verwandelt hat, dass mit den westlichen Demokratien nichts mehr gemeinsam hat. Senior Fellow, NYU's Center for Global Affairs

Kartoffelsalat, Weihnachten und Monopoly - Wie mich meine deutsche Oma beeinflusst hat Ich habe ein Geheimnis. Nur meine engsten Freunde wissen davon. Seit Kindesbeinen verfolgt es mich und weder das voranschreitende Alter noch die parallel dazu gewonnene Erfahrung konnten seinen Einfluss auf mein Leben mindern. Twentysomething mit Migrationshintergrund aus K√∂ln

"Ich lasse nicht zu, dass du so √ºber Muslime redest" - Warum ich so stolz auf meinen kleinen Jungen bin "Muslime sind das Problem", meinte ein Schulkamerad meines Sohnes. Ich wei√ü nicht, wie eine Gruppe F√ºnftkl√§ssler darauf kam, im Sportunterricht √ºber Terrorismus zu diskutieren. Ich wei√ü nur, dass mein Sohn den Jungen unterbrochen hat, aufgestanden ist und zu ihm sagte: "Ich bin in einem Raum voller Muslime gesessen und ich habe mich vollkommen sicher gef√ºhlt." Stellvertretende Vorsitzende bei einem Gremium, das sich f√ºr Minderheiten einsetzt

"Meine Kollegen haben die Schnauze voll": Immer mehr Pfleger verlassen Deutschland Im Jahr 2016 gab es nach Angaben des Statistischen Bundesamts 2,9 Millionen pflegebed√ºrftige Menschen in Deutschland. Experten sch√§tzen, dass es im Jahr 2030 3,5 Millionen sein werden. Bis dahin werden rund eine halbe Million Stellen in der Alten-, Kinder- und Krankenpflege unbesetzt sein - und das zum Leid der Patienten. Pflegeberater

Ich beobachtete, wie ein Schwarzer in der U-Bahn beleidigt wurde - und habe versagt Es gibt Momente im Leben, wo das eigene Selbstbild pl√∂tzlich v√∂llig in Frage gestellt wird. Momente, wo fast alles, woran man geglaubt hat, sich als falsch erweist. So einen Moment hatte ich vor Kurzem in der U-Bahn. Head of Blogs & Community, HuffPost Deutschland

Ich coache Fl√ºchtlinge und m√∂chte mit Missverst√§ndnissen zwischen ihnen und Deutschen aufr√§umen Ich sehe so oft junge Fl√ºchtlinge mit ihren Briefen vom Amt in der Hand dastehen. Sie haben nicht verstanden, was darin steht. Aber sie sch√§men sich, es zu sagen. Perspektivcoach f√ºr Gefl√ºchtete bei Interkular

SUMMARY:
At least three people were dead and nine left injured after thirteen coaches of the Vasco Da Gama-Patna express jumped the rails near Manikpur railway station in Uttar Pradesh today.
"Of those injured, two were serious and admitted to district hospital, Chitrakoot.
The Patna-bound Vasco Da Gama Express (12741) derailed at 4:18 am, soon after leaving platform number 2 of the Manikpur railway station in Chitrakoot district, about 250 km from Lucknow, he said.
"The injured have been rushed to the hospital and officials have left for the spot.
He further said that soon after the accident, a medical train reached the spot and by 5:20 am, an accident relief train was dispatched for the spot.
TEXT:
At least three people were dead and nine left injured after thirteen coaches of the Vasco Da Gama-Patna express jumped the rails near Manikpur railway station in Uttar Pradesh today.

Confirming the casualties, Chitrakoot SP Pratap Gopendra Singh said a father-son duo from Bettiah district of Bihar died on the spot while the third person died at a hospital.

"Of those injured, two were serious and admitted to district hospital, Chitrakoot. Seven with minor injuries are being treated at Manikpur," Singh said.

The Patna-bound Vasco Da Gama Express (12741) derailed at 4:18 am, soon after leaving platform number 2 of the Manikpur railway station in Chitrakoot district, about 250 km from Lucknow, he said.

According to ADG (Law and Order), Anand Kumar, prima facie it appears that fractured railway track is the cause of accident as per local assessment.

Providing a breakup of the derailed coaches, North Central Railway PRO Amit Malviya said, the coaches which jumped off the rails were coaches numbered S3-S11, two general coaches and two extra coaches.

"The injured have been rushed to the hospital and officials have left for the spot. Relief operations are underway," North Central Railway PRO Amit Malviya said.

He further said that soon after the accident, a medical train reached the spot and by 5:20 am, an accident relief train was dispatched for the spot.

The divisional railway manager (DRM), Allahabad has already reached the spot while the General Manager, NCR is on his way, he said.

In the aftermath of the derailment, movement of trains was disrupted on the Patna-Allahabad route.

The train derailment in Chitrakoot comes less than 12 hours after a bolero had collided with a passenger train near Lucknow killing four and injuring two.

The Railway Ministry has announced a compensation of Rs 5 lakh for the kin of those dead and Rs 1 lakh for those with grievous injuries.
TITLE: Vasco Da Gama-Patna Express Jumps Rails In UP; 3 Dead, 9 Injured

The fan, known only by her Twitter handle @chojuroh, tweeted co-creator Dan Harmon simply asking: ‚ÄúDo you have advice for dealing with depression.‚ÄùIn response, Dan wrote a series of supportive messages, advising the woman to ‚Äúadmit and accept that it‚Äôs happening‚Äù.

TEXT:
When a ‚ÄòRick and Morty‚Äô fan asked the show‚Äôs co-creator for advice on coping with depression, the internet was overwhelmed by the response she received.

The fan, known only by her Twitter handle @chojuroh, tweeted co-creator Dan Harmon simply asking: ‚ÄúDo you have advice for dealing with depression.‚Äù

In response, Dan wrote a series of supportive messages, advising the woman to ‚Äúadmit and accept that it‚Äôs happening‚Äù.

He also advised her to remember that ‚Äúfeelings are real, but they aren‚Äôt reality‚Äù and that she doesn‚Äôt have to ‚Äúdeal with it alone‚Äù.
TITLE: 'Rick And Morty' Co-Creator Dan Harmon Gives Fan Heartfelt Advice For Coping With Depression
