How It Works





You are an independent user. By submitting content to us, you do so as an independent content creator using the HuffPost as a forum for distributing your own individually created content. You are not an employee or a worker of HuffPost. You agree that you are not entitled to, and don't expect any wages, compensation, or remuneration of any kind for the content that you submit. You also agree that you are not eligible for any employee benefit plans or programs. You warrant you have obtained and payed for all necessary third-party clearances, approvals, permissions and licenses and everything else you need to create and submit your content to us and for it to be published and used as permitted hereunder. You cannot hold yourself out as our agent or representative or attempt to bind us to any obligations.

What do I get out of this? HuffPost provides a forum with a large, diverse audience for you to share your views and express your unique opinions and ideas. You may, subject to your compliance with these terms, use your post to promote any of your other works and to build a fan base and readership within the HuffPost community and inform readers of your own social networking outlets, such as your Twitter or Facebook feeds.

Post if and when you want. As an independent creator, you have complete control. You agree that you are not under the direction or control of HuffPost and have complete discretion over the manner and means by which you submit content for HuffPost. You can stop posting at any time. If you decide to post, you decide when, where and how often you write and submit it. You can write or provide content for anyone else you want at any time. Subject to these terms, you can write about anything you want. HuffPost does not select or approve your topics. And please remember: You must not identify yourself as a representative of HuffPost or any of its affiliates, including, without limitation, if you attend or cover events, even if you submit content to us on the event or a topic from the event.

Submit proper posts. You warrant and represent to us that any blog posts, photos, videos, and any other content you submit (1) is your original content or is properly licensed content that you have the express right and permission to license to us, (2) does not and will not infringe or violate any law, rule or regulation or the rights or intellectual property rights of any person or entity (or encourage anyone else to do so), and is and will remain ethical, legal and proper, (3) is not and will not be objectionable, inaccurate or inflammatory; and (4) is not and will not be obscene, defamatory, threatening, pornographic, harassing, hateful, racially or ethnically offensive, (5) is not and will not be an advertisement, marketing communication or solicitation of business or contributions; and/or (6) is not and will not be otherwise against the interests of HuffPost, its affiliates, including, without limitation, Oath (UK) Limited and Oath Inc. and/or our users as a whole. We have the right (but not the obligation) to remove any or all of your content that fails to comply with the foregoing, or for any other reason, without notice to you.

Disclosure: In an effort to be as transparent with readers as possible, HuffPost contributors must disclose to us in advance any actual or potential conflicts of interest related to the issue they are writing about. If you receive payment or income from a company, organization, group, or individual with a financial stake in the issue you are weighing in on, that information must be disclosed by you in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.

Correct your errors. If your post contains a factual error, you must correct or retract it within 24 hours after notice. If you make substantive changes (including error corrections) after your post has been published, you must note this at the bottom of your post. This includes matters of fact, but not changes to spelling, grammar or style or minor editorial corrections. However, in the interest of transparency, you must note to readers that an earlier version of the post had an error that was since corrected. Note: if a correction/retraction is due to a legal complaint of defamation, then the correction/retraction must be posted in as prominent a location as the defamatory content.

No guarantees. The HuffPost Contributor Program provides a forum for your ideas and expression, but is made available to you "as is" without guarantee of any results based upon the publication of your post, is subject to changes and could temporarily or permanently be suspended without notice to you, and without guarantee that it will operate free of errors, viruses, bugs or service breakdowns. We do not guarantee that your participation will fulfill any requirements you expect from the program.

You own your submissions, but we can still use them. You own the copyright to your submitted content and you can post it anywhere else you wish. However, by submitting any content to HuffPost (including text, videos, photographs or audio materials), you grant HuffPost a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free, irrevocable, perpetual, sub-licensable license to exercise all rights under copyright law with respect to all and/or any part of such content, which HuffPost may use, copy, store, syndicate, publish and/or distribute (along with your name and identifying features) on their websites and other properties and those of their affiliates and business partners (including translating, dubbing, or subtitling your submissions for international audiences), as well as for marketing and promotional purposes, online or offline, in any medium and mode of delivery now known or in the future devised.

We may be required to provide information about you. You agree that if HuffPost and/or any of its affiliates, including, without limitation, the Huffington Post.com, Oath (UK) Limited and Oath Inc., may be legally required to disclose information held about you (including, without limitation, your IP address and location, name and user name), and may do so, without notice to you.

Complaints and Inquiries/Choice of law. If you violate any of the Contributor Program terms, or we receive an inquiry or complaint about your content, you agree that you are responsible, and you agree to indemnify and hold harmless HuffPost and its affiliates, for all resulting claims and liabilities. This agreement is governed by the laws of England and Wales, and if we have a dispute about it, or about any content that you submit to us, the dispute will be resolved only in the courts of England and Wales. We may provide you notices about the HuffPost Contributor Program and these terms by e-mail.
TITLE: Contributor - Terms of Use and User Agreement

SUMMARY:
This communications data is the subject of last years‚Äô Investigatory Powers Act.
The Act, and its previous iterations, became known as the Snoopers‚Äô Charter because of the sweeping powers it gave the Government to store and access everybody‚Äôs communications data.
They have agreed to two safeguards that I‚Äôve spent three years fighting for: a new independent body (the Office for Communications Data Authorisations) will be set up to authorise requests to access communications data and a new ‚Äòserious crime‚Äô threshold for use of the data will be introduced.
The Snoopers‚Äô Charter was an example of that.
Advances in technology made things possible but the legislation didn‚Äôt ensure what was possible was used appropriately and with adequate safeguards.
TEXT:
In George Orwell‚Äôs 1984, Winston Smith, a nonconformist working at the Ministry of Truth, commits the worst of thought-crimes against the Big Brother state. He buys a diary and expresses his private thoughts in it. These days, diaries aren‚Äôt necessary: we have a web of ‚Äòcommunications data‚Äô which can reveal who you have spoken to and when, what you have searched on the internet, your use of social media, essentially enough personal data to work out almost everything about you.

This communications data is the subject of last years‚Äô Investigatory Powers Act. The Act, and its previous iterations, became known as the Snoopers‚Äô Charter because of the sweeping powers it gave the Government to store and access everybody‚Äôs communications data. In part because of the revelations of Edward Snowden, it soon became apparent that the powers in the act were being used without meaningful restraint or scrutiny for things that would have been unimaginable when it was first passed. Many parts of Government could access intimate data without any kind of authorisation or sufficient justification, and citizen‚Äôs whose data was accessed were not notified and therefore had no ability to challenge the access or seek redress.

I‚Äôm proud to have played a part in mobilising opposition to this within Westminster. In November 2013 Reprieve helped me organise a public meeting with German MP Hans Christian Stroebele, who‚Äôd just visited Snowden in Moscow, to talk about the broader implications of the revelations, including the ‚Äòwar on terror‚Äô. In December, I asked a leading public and telecoms QC Jemima Stratford her view on the adequacy of the legislation. Her advice - which I shared with all MPs ‚Äì was clear: the existing regime was out of date and had significant gaps, rendering huge swaths of GCHQ‚Äôs surveillance work illegal.

In response to these concerns and other legal challenges the Government rushed through ‚Äòemergency‚Äô surveillance legislation just before the summer recess 2014 which rubber stamped everything Snowden had disclosed.

It was against this background that, represented by Liberty, I launched a legal challenge to this new legislation that fails to protect people‚Äôs fundamental rights or respect the rule of law. The Government fought the challenge but luckily the UK High Court and then the European Court of Justice agreed with me, that parts of the legislation was illegal and must be changed.

Yesterday, three years after I initially submitted my claim and just a week before it returns once more to the Court of Appeal, the Government finally conceded the principle that amendments to the IPA will be needed. They have agreed to two safeguards that I‚Äôve spent three years fighting for: a new independent body (the Office for Communications Data Authorisations) will be set up to authorise requests to access communications data and a new ‚Äòserious crime‚Äô threshold for use of the data will be introduced. They aren‚Äôt perfect ‚Äì and I won‚Äôt stop fighting for the lot ‚Äì but this marks a significant shift in law and practice.

For many years I‚Äôve been struck by and determined to explore the broadest implications of technological advance on people and society: hacking, fake news, investigatory powers, the future of work. Technology raises huge and difficult questions in each of these areas ‚Äì questions that Westminster sometimes tends to avoid. The Snoopers‚Äô Charter was an example of that. Advances in technology made things possible but the legislation didn‚Äôt ensure what was possible was used appropriately and with adequate safeguards.

I‚Äôm glad that the announcement yesterday went some way to addressing that.
TITLE: Amendments To The Snoopers' Charter Are A Good Step But There Is Still More To Be Done

Der Leipziger Jura-Professor Thomas Rauscher, der bei Twitter f√ºr ein "wei√ües Europa" warb und den Islam als "kriegerisch" bezeichnete, hatte im November eine Welle der Emp√∂rung losgetreten.
Und √§u√üert sich weiter zu seiner politischen Einstellung: Zur AfD habe er eine kritische Position.
Er teile die "Ansichten der AfD in Sachen Euro und ich teile die Ansichten in puncto Migrationspolitik", sei in anderen Fragen aber n√§her an CDU und FDP.

TEXT:
Der umstrittene Leipziger Professor Rauscher hat in einem Interview N√§he zur AfD zugegeben

Er wolle sich nicht zensieren lassen, erkl√§rte Rauscher

Im Video oben: So allt√§glich ist das Thema Rassismus in Deutschland

Es fing mit ein paar Tweets an und wurde ein Streit √ºber Meinungsfreiheit im akademischen Raum.

Der Leipziger Jura-Professor Thomas Rauscher, der bei Twitter f√ºr ein "wei√ües Europa" warb und den Islam als "kriegerisch" bezeichnete, hatte im November eine Welle der Emp√∂rung losgetreten. Ausgefochten ist der Konflikt auch mehrere Wochen sp√§ter noch nicht.

Nach mehreren Protestaktionen linker Studenten wandte sich Rauscher nun in einem Interview mit dem MDR erneut an die √ñffentlichkeit. Er erkl√§rte: "Ich habe nicht vor, mich selber zu zensieren." An seiner Universit√§t werde intern seine Entlassung eingeleitet. Er wolle jedoch weiter seine Meinung vertreten.

"Erdr√ºckende Stimmung an der Universit√§t"

Rauscher spricht von einer "erdr√ºckenden" Stimmung innerhalb der Fakult√§t. Und √§u√üert sich weiter zu seiner politischen Einstellung: Zur AfD habe er eine kritische Position. Er teile die "Ansichten der AfD in Sachen Euro und ich teile die Ansichten in puncto Migrationspolitik", sei in anderen Fragen aber n√§her an CDU und FDP.

Der Professor kann die Aufregung √ºber seine rassistischen Tweets nicht verstehen. Er habe sich lediglich zur Frage √§u√üern wollen, "ob wir die Europa in gro√üer Zahl drohende Migrationswelle aus Nahost, aus Afrika, auch aus Teilen Asiens, hier sozusagen entgegennehmen m√ºssen, weil es eine koloniale Schuld zu begleichen g√§be" ‚Äì und diese verneint.

Rauscher gibt offen zu, das Konzept des Ethnopluralismus gutzuhei√üen. Also eine Vermischung von Menschen unterschiedlicher Kulturen in einer Gesellschaft abzulehnen. "Ich habe gro√ües Interesse daran, dass diese Kulturen (...) in ihrem Wesenskern erhalten bleiben", sagte der Akademiker dem MDR.

Studierende der Uni Leipzig protestieren gegen Rauscher

Rauscher war an der Universit√§t nach Bekanntwerden seiner Tweets ein harscher Gegenwind entgegengeschlagen.

Studierende der Universit√§t Leipzig protestieren auf dem Campus der Universit√§t in Leipzig (Sachsen) gegen Rassismus, Sexismus, Islamophobie und Homophobie. Einige Studierende st√∂rten eine Vorlesung des Professors, der seinen Twitter-Account nach der ersten Emp√∂rungswelle l√∂schte.

Dennoch berichtet Rauscher auch von positiven R√ºckmeldungen. "Ich habe in all meinen Vorlesungen von zahlreichen Studenten Zuspruch bekommen. Auch per E-Mail. In den Veranstaltungen ist da keinerlei Nachteil zu sp√ºren", erkl√§rte der Jura-Professor.

(best)
TITLE: Leipziger Skandal-Professor √§u√üert sich zu rassistischen Tweets: "Ich teile die Ansichten der AfD"

Die Bundesregierung plant eine zus√§tzliche Pr√§mie f√ºr abgelehnte Asylbewerber, wenn sie in ihre Heimat zur√ºckkehrenZu den bisherigen 3000 Euro kann eine Familie mit einem Kind noch einmal 3000 Euro an Wohnungshilfen erhaltenDie wichtigsten Infos des Textes seht ihr zusammengefasst auch im Video obenDie Bundesregierung will die freiwillige R√ºckreise f√ºr abgelehnte Asylbewerber in ihre Heimat attraktiver machen.
Februar kann laut Bundesinnenministerium eine zus√§tzliche "Reintegrationsunterst√ºtzung" von bis zu 3000 Euro beantragt werden.
Familien k√∂nnten Sachleistungen zum Beispiel f√ºr Miete, Bau- und Renovierungsarbeiten oder die Grundausstattung f√ºr K√ºche oder Bad im Wert von bis zu 3000 Euro bekommen, Einzelpersonen im Wert von bis zu 1000 Euro.
Damit werde das im Februar gestartete R√ºckkehrprogramm "Starthilfe plus" f√ºr drei Monate um einen Wohnkostenzuschuss (Dein Land, Deine Zukunft, Jetzt) erweitert.

TEXT:
Die Bundesregierung plant eine zus√§tzliche Pr√§mie f√ºr abgelehnte Asylbewerber, wenn sie in ihre Heimat zur√ºckkehren

Zu den bisherigen 3000 Euro kann eine Familie mit einem Kind noch einmal 3000 Euro an Wohnungshilfen erhalten

Die wichtigsten Infos des Textes seht ihr zusammengefasst auch im Video oben

Die Bundesregierung will die freiwillige R√ºckreise f√ºr abgelehnte Asylbewerber in ihre Heimat attraktiver machen. Bis zum 28. Februar kann laut Bundesinnenministerium eine zus√§tzliche "Reintegrationsunterst√ºtzung" von bis zu 3000 Euro beantragt werden.

Familien k√∂nnten Sachleistungen zum Beispiel f√ºr Miete, Bau- und Renovierungsarbeiten oder die Grundausstattung f√ºr K√ºche oder Bad im Wert von bis zu 3000 Euro bekommen, Einzelpersonen im Wert von bis zu 1000 Euro.

Damit werde das im Februar gestartete R√ºckkehrprogramm "Starthilfe plus" f√ºr drei Monate um einen Wohnkostenzuschuss (Dein Land, Deine Zukunft, Jetzt) erweitert. Zuerst hatte die "Bild am Sonntag" √ºber die Programmerweiterung berichtet.

Bislang erhalten Fl√ºchtlinge √ºber zw√∂lf Jahren, die sich bereits vor Abschluss des Asylverfahrens f√ºr eine R√ºckreise entscheiden und den Asylantrag zur√ºcknehmen, 1200 Euro, Kinder 600 Euro. Eine Familie mit einem Kind konnte also 3000 Euro erhalten, bei Inanspruchnahme des neuen Programms nun das Doppelte, also insgesamt 6000 Euro.

De Maizi√®re appelliert an Ausreisepflichtige

Bundesinnenminister Thomas de Maizi√®re (CDU) appellierte in der "Bild am Sonntag" an die Ausreisepflichtigen, von dem Angebot Gebrauch zu machen:"Wenn Sie sich bis Ende Februar f√ºr eine freiwillige R√ºckkehr entscheiden, k√∂nnen Sie neben einer Starthilfe erstmals eine Wohnkostenhilfe f√ºr die ersten zw√∂lf Monate in Ihrem Herkunftsland erhalten."

Die bisherige R√ºckkehrf√∂rderung haben laut "Bild am Sonntag" zwischen Februar und Oktober 2017 nur 8639 Menschen in Anspruch genommen.

Der Zeitung zufolge leben 115.000 abgelehnte Asylbewerber in Deutschland. 80.000 von ihnen w√ºrden derzeit noch geduldet, 35.000 Ausreiseentscheidungen wurden laut Innenministerium von Januar bis September rechtsg√ºltig. Abgeschoben worden seien im gleichen Zeitraum 19.520 Menschen.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Studie zeigt, was Fl√ºchtlinge √ºber ihr Leben in Deutschland denken
TITLE: Bis zu 3000 Euro: Bundesregierung plant neue Ausreise-Pr√§mie f√ºr abgelehnte Asylbewerber

SUMMARY:
Meghan Markle is continuing to boost Canadian fashion labels as she tours the U.K. with new fianc√© Prince Harry.
Prince Harry and Meghan Markle attend the Terrance Higgins Trust World AIDS Day charity fair at Nottingham Contemporary on Dec. 1, 2017 in Nottingham, England.
Meghan Markle wears a Mackage coat on Dec. 1"I woke up this morning with tons of instant messages on my phone," Thibault said.
Meghan Markle wears a Mackage jacket at the Invictus Games opening ceremony.
Prince Harry and Meghan Markle at Kensington Palace after it was announced they were engaged.
TEXT:
Meghan Markle is continuing to boost Canadian fashion labels as she tours the U.K. with new fianc√© Prince Harry.

At a charity event in Nottingham for World AIDS Day on Friday, Markle wore a long navy double-breasted wool coat by Montreal-based outerwear label Mackage.

There were only four of the $790 Elodie jackets left in the company's online store early Friday and they sold out within minutes of photos of the Nottingham event appearing online, said Mackage's communications director Hugo Thibault.

Prince Harry and Meghan Markle attend the Terrance Higgins Trust World AIDS Day charity fair at Nottingham Contemporary on Dec. 1, 2017 in Nottingham, England.

"Our website traffic exploded," Thibault said. "We had a 500 per cent increase today... mostly all in Europe, because North America (was) just waking up."

Markle has been a supporter of Mackage for years, attending the brand's fashion show in Toronto seven or eight years ago, Thibault said. The company knew she owned several of their pieces but had no heads-up that she planned on wearing the jacket Friday.

Meghan Markle wears a Mackage coat on Dec. 1

"I woke up this morning with tons of instant messages on my phone," Thibault said. "Oh my god, oh my god, she's wearing our jacket again!"

In September, Markle wore a Bordeaux-coloured Mackage leather jacket to the opening ceremony of the Invictus Games. That colour sold out within 24 hours, Thibault said, and other colours followed quickly.

Meghan Markle wears a Mackage jacket at the Invictus Games opening ceremony.

The actress, who is from Los Angeles, has lived part-time in Toronto since 2011.

In her time here, she's supported many Canadian designers at a variety of price points, including luxury designers like Jason Wu and Erdem, high-end brands like Sentaler and Smythe, and mid-range retail brand Aritzia. In 2016, she partnered with the more affordable retail chain Reitmans for an advertising campaign and a "capsule collection."

On Monday, at a photo op to announce her engagement to Prince Harry, Markle wore a white wool wrap coat by Toronto brand Line the Label, which quickly sold out and was renamed the "Meghan."

Prince Harry and Meghan Markle at Kensington Palace after it was announced they were engaged.

Thibault said other celebrities have worn Mackage but no one has made quite the same impact that Markle is having now.

"Everybody looks at what she's wearing all the time," he said. "The Meghan effect is much stronger than everything we've seen before."

Maija Kappler, The Canadian Press

Keep Up With The Royals

Get our weekly email round-up of all things Royal.



Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Meghan Markle Wears Canadian Coat At First Engagement With Prince Harry

SUMMARY:
Je suis ouvrier dans une usine de tri de d√©chets industriels et m√©nagers dans la zone industrielle d√©primante d'une petite ville de province.
Une usine qui marche bien et qui fait du chiffre.
Vincent, Fran√ßois, Paul et les autresDans cette exp√©rience √©prouvante, les relations entre coll√®gues prennent une place centrale au quotidien.
Les complicit√©s aident √† tenir et √† pers√©v√©rer dans les moments de d√©couragement.
Peu de conflits finalement, hormis dans les relations avec les diff√©rents chefs, et il y en a un paquet !
TEXT:
Il y a un an et demi, apr√®s avoir encha√Æn√© les d√©ceptions et les √©checs professionnels, je me retrouve l√†, √† 6h du matin, tenue bleue de l'usine exig√©e et gilet jaune. Je suis ouvrier dans une usine de tri de d√©chets industriels et m√©nagers dans la zone industrielle d√©primante d'une petite ville de province. Une usine qui marche bien et qui fait du chiffre. Un fleuron, un moteur de la r√©gion, en somme. J'√©tais pourtant √† deux doigts de devenir journaliste...

Les temps modernes

Les temps changent mais pas tant que √ßa. Me voici dans un nouveau monde o√π il n'y a pas de temps √† perdre. Apr√®s cinq minutes, me voil√† d√©j√† √† la cha√Æne, dans une cabine, √† devoir trier du bois (en r√©alit√©, distinguer le bois du "faux bois") qui passe √† grande vitesse sur le tapis devant moi. Mes coll√®gues m'expliquent rapidement comment proc√©der mais je me sens perdu.

S'en suit un apprentissage sur le terrain, avec les indications des coll√®gues comme seule boussole. Le chef d'√©quipe ne joue pas le chaperon, √† moi de me d√©brouiller et d'√©viter les blessures. Pourtant, mon corps va souffrir pendant ces mois difficiles: sciatique, allergies, membres endoloris et √©corchures multiples. L'usine et son travail de sape.

Vos micro-ondes, vos cafeti√®res, vos ordinateurs, vos frigos, tout ce que vous avez balanc√© passe par l√†, entre mes mains, sur ce tapis qui ne s'arr√™te jamais. Il y tra√Æne parfois quelques souris, voire des chats morts... entre autres.

Nous trions le plastique, la ferraille, les piles, les c√¢bles, les cartouches d'encre, je pourrais continuer longtemps comme √ßa. La liste est presque infinie.

Lentement, tous les gestes deviennent habitude et l'impression de vivre dans un film se dissipe tout doucement.

Les quelques rendez-vous avec la conseill√®re d'insertion semblent √™tre des sketches tant elle n'a rien √† proposer r√©ellement. Le passage du permis de conduire, passer d'autres permis pour devenir cariste...

Somme toute, tous les moments hors de la cha√Æne sont autant de plaisir de pouvoir enfin respirer quelques minutes.

Quoi qu'il en soit, les r√™ves semblent lointains.

Si ce n'est pas Germinal, on s'en rapproche par moment. De la crasse des doigts jusqu'aux √©paules, le visage parsem√©s de t√¢ches de je ne sais quoi. Les jours de froid, l'usine est un cong√©lateur ( je suis tr√®s frileux ), les jours de chaleur il fait parfois jusqu'√† 40¬∞, les mouvements sont lents et deviennent une √©preuve. Il n'est rien d'enviable dans tout ceci et il faut bien √™tre oblig√© de travailler ici pour le faire. Ce n'est pas un destin.

Prendre des notes chaque jour en rentrant me permet de me projeter et de trouver un peu de sens √† ce que je fais. Heureusement.

Vincent, Fran√ßois, Paul et les autres

Dans cette exp√©rience √©prouvante, les relations entre coll√®gues prennent une place centrale au quotidien. Les complicit√©s aident √† tenir et √† pers√©v√©rer dans les moments de d√©couragement. La gal√®re rapproche, c'est √©vident.

Peu de conflits finalement, hormis dans les relations avec les diff√©rents chefs, et il y en a un paquet ! Mais l'un d'entre eux l'emporte haut la main: froid et cassant au possible, s'exprimant avec maladresse au mieux, avec d√©dain le plus souvent. Le genre de mec qui essaye, d√®s que possible, de te mettre dans des situations d√©licates. Une fois, on me fait changer de poste, je m'ex√©cute sagement; celui-ci me voit travailler pendant deux, peut-√™tre trois heures, avant de venir me dire que tout ce que je faisais √©tait nul et non avenu. Peut-√™tre √©tait-il simplement maladroit...

Les manques de reconnaissance ou m√™me d'encouragements m'ont souvent d√©√ßu, voire choqu√©. Malgr√© le "label" d'entreprise d'insertion, produire reste, d'apr√®s moi, le seul projet r√©el. Le turnover est incessant car les contrats durent quatre mois ( renouvelables potentiellement quatre fois ). Ceci explique peut-√™tre cela.

Mes anciens coll√®gues m'ont facilit√© la t√¢che pour l'√©criture de ce livre en me donnant du grain √† moudre chaque jour gr√¢ce √† leurs anecdotes ou histoires personnelles tant√¥t dr√¥les, tant√¥t d√©chirantes. Le panel de personnalit√©s est tr√®s large ( contrairement √† ce qu'on pourrait en penser de prime abord ); les parcours professionnels sont plut√¥t vari√©s, de l'ancien commercial, au chef d'entreprise, du b√ªcheron √† l'ancien animateur pour enfants.

Les discussions √† la pause sont parfois lunaires, certains jours j'ai pri√© pour √™tre ailleurs. Litt√©ralement ailleurs.

Je garde quelques connexions avec certains de mes anciens coll√®gues, encore aujourd'hui.

Le premier jour du reste de ta vie

C'est ainsi que j'ai v√©cu le premier jour post-usine. Libre. Tout redevenait possible. Une renaissance. Un souffle nouveau.

Finis les bruits, les bruits des v√©hicules, ceux de la ferraille qui tape sur encore plus de ferraille et qui r√©sonnent dans la t√™te pour la journ√©e enti√®re. Fini d'ingurgiter des tonnes de poussi√®re apr√®s le balayage du soir, en bas des cabines de tri. Fini le mal partout, le port des radiateurs, les chaussures de travail, les casques anti-bruits, les odeurs improbables, les levers √† 4h35, les couchers √† 22h. Tout √ßa est bien fini.

Et il fallait que j'en parle. Pour moi et aussi pour les autres, ceux qui y travaillent toujours et √† qui personne ne donne la parole, ceux qui se casseront le dos et la sant√© des mois, des ann√©es encore.

Je ne suis pas un porte-parole, mais un ancien acteur et spectateur d'une vie d'un autre √¢ge mais toujours existante. Au mieux, un porte-voix.

Fran√ßois Hasl√© - Ordures - De presque journaliste √† vraiment ouvrier - Auto√©dition

√Ä voir √©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: J'ai √©t√© ouvrier dans une usine de tri de d√©chets, voici ce qu'il s'y passe vraiment

Il ministro dello Sviluppo Economico Carlo Calenda replica al governatore affermando come abbia "dichiarato tutto e il contrario di tutto".

TEXT:
"Rinnovo" a Michele Emiliano "l'offerta di riaprire immediatamente il tavolo di Taranto per avviare un dialogo costruttivo ritirando contestualmente il ricorso contro il DPCM ambientale". Il ministro dello Sviluppo Economico Carlo Calenda replica al governatore affermando come abbia "dichiarato tutto e il contrario di tutto".

Scrive in una nota il ministro: "Siamo ormai abituati ai ricorsi di Emiliano, su vaccini, Buona scuola, Tap e anche precedenti su Ilva per fortuna tutti regolarmente perduti. In questo caso per√≤ il rischio √® che l'investitore, constatata l'ostilit√† delle Istituzioni locali, scappi a prescindere dal l'esito del ricorso lasciando sulle spalle del governo, e non certo di Emiliano che sino ad ora nulla di concreto ha fatto a questo proposito, il destino di 20.000 persone e i costi delle bonifiche. Rinnovo pertanto ad Emiliano l'offerta di riaprire immediatamente il tavolo di Taranto per avviare un dialogo costruttivo ritirando contestualmente il ricorso contro il Dpcm ambientale".

"Il piano industriale ed il piano ambientale dell'Ilva", ricostruisce il ministro, "sono stati presentati al governatore della Puglia e a quello della Liguria insieme a molti sindaci - ma non a quello di Taranto che non si √® presentato all'ultimo minuto pur avendo richiesto l'incontro - da Mittal nell'ambito del tavolo istituzionale tenutosi al ministero dello Sviluppo Economico lo scorso 16 novembre. Nello stesso tavolo", prosegue Calenda, "si era deciso di convocare due incontri separati per Taranto e per Genova per approfondire le tematiche ambientali e industriali. All'uscita dalla riunione Emiliano dichiarava alla stampa la sua soddisfazione per la convocazione del tavolo Taranto salvo qualche giorno dopo presentare ricorso al Tar contro il Dpcm ambientale. Da quel momento Emiliano ha dichiarato tutto e il contrario di tutto: che il ricorso era uno come un altro, che in caso di accoglimento della sospensiva l'Ilva non rischia la chiusura, che il ricorso serve a conoscere carte segrete quali il piano industriale etc. Si tratta", conclude la nota, "di affermazioni non rispondenti al vero".
TITLE: Calenda tende la mano a Emiliano sull'Ilva

SUMMARY:
To make this holiday tradition more accessible to kids facing similar struggles, the 29-year-old now provides "sensory friendly" visits with Santa.
KFM Making A Difference Kerry Magro offers sensory friendly visits with Santa, in which he dresses as the man in red.
Magro, a motivational speaker, author and activist, will be Santa again at an autism and sensory friendly event in Jersey City on Dec. 9 and 10.
Only eight kids with sensory challenges are allowed per time slot.
He was nonverbal until he was 2-and-a-half years old and struggled with sensory challenges.
TEXT:
For many kids, waiting in line to visit Santa Claus is a cherished annual gig. But when Kerry Magro was a child, meeting jolly old Saint Nick wasn't that easy. "Growing up with autism, I had challenges in meeting Santa in public places because I dealt with a lot of sensory challenges, so giant malls were never really an option for me," he told HuffPost. The blaring music, the sparkling decorations, the crowds of people could all be too much to handle. To make this holiday tradition more accessible to kids facing similar struggles, the 29-year-old now provides "sensory friendly" visits with Santa. And who better to play the man in red than Magro himself?

KFM Making A Difference Kerry Magro offers sensory friendly visits with Santa, in which he dresses as the man in red.

Magro, a motivational speaker, author and activist, will be Santa again at an autism and sensory friendly event in Jersey City on Dec. 9 and 10. Since starting this tradition three years ago with his nonprofit, KFM Making a Difference, Magro said he has welcomed some 500 children with various challenges, including autism and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder. Parents sign their kids up for 30-minute slots so the children won't feel rushed or overwhelmed, Magro explained. The usual loud Christmas music and bright lights are turned down. Only eight kids with sensory challenges are allowed per time slot. They can participate in arts and crafts, and take home a photo with Santa. An occupational therapist, a speech therapist and a physical therapist ‚Äï possibly dressed as Santa's elves ‚Äï are also on site.

KFM Making A Difference Since starting the event three years ago, Magro and his team have welcomed kids with autism, ADHD and other challenges.

As for "Santa," he lets the kids take their time and pays attention to their different levels of development. "We don't want them to feel rushed. We don't want them to feel overloaded," Magro told HuffPost. "We just want to make it a labor of love." Magro describes his own childhood as "a time when a lot of people just really had no idea what autism was." He was nonverbal until he was 2-and-a-half years old and struggled with sensory challenges. It took his parents 18 months to obtain a formal diagnosis. Thanks to "a lot of therapy," Magro said, he grew up to be someone who now advocates for others with autism and, through his nonprofit, gives scholarships to students with autism to pursue higher education.
TITLE: Man With Autism Offers Sensory Friendly Santa Visits So No Kid Misses Out

SUMMARY:
Akhil Bhartiya Shakti Samaj launched a signature campaign against the release of the upcoming Bollywood movie ' Padmavati' in Kolkata.
For Muslims in Gujarat, the Congress's silence is especially grating because it comes on the heels of an election campaign in which they have been completely sidelined by the Congress.
In this backdrop, there are Muslims in Gujarat who see the Congress's silence over Padmavati not just as a electoral strategy to appease the Rajputs, but the beginning of a slide towards Hindutva.
"What Rahul Gandhi did to GST is what he should have done to the movie Padmavati."
What Rahul Gandhi did to GST is what he should have done to the movie Padmavati.
TEXT:
Akhil Bhartiya Shakti Samaj launched a signature campaign against the release of the upcoming Bollywood movie ' Padmavati' in Kolkata.

A series of events last week, leading up to the postponement of a period drama about a Rajput queen, has polarized opinion and shifted the focus of prime time news from pressing matters such as an ongoing farmers' agitation in the heart of the national capital, to a raging discussion on Hindu pride.

In a recent conversation with HuffPost India, Hanif Lakdawala, a doctor based in Ahmedabad, recalled the events with shock and disbelief, particularly the threats of violence made against Sanjay Leela Bhansali and Deepika Padukone, the director and lead actress of the film Padmavati ‚Äî based on an epic poem by Malik Muhammad Jayasi.

"How can people saying that they are going to chop off someone's nose and head over a movie. Still, no one is coming forward to defend free speech or even to condemn such hateful statements. What is going on in this country?" he said.

The 66-year-old activist, who has devoted four decades of his life to improving public health in urban slums, added, "I'm aghast."

Lakdawala was referring to the all-around tacit approval of the threats issued by Karni Sena, a fringe group of Rajputs leading the protest against Bhansali's movie about the 13-14th century queen.

Even though Padmavati may or may not have existed in real life, detractors have said that the Rajput community will not tolerate a film that even hints at a romance between their brave queen and the Muslim ruler Alauddin Khilji.

For Lakdawala, it came as no surprise to see the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party taking a stand against free speech, with some of its leaders even backing the threats made by the Karni Sena. But it is the Congress Party's silence on the controversy that has rattled many Muslims, who see it as further evidence of the Grand Old Party adhering to BJP's core tenet of giving primacy to the Hindus and appeasing the majority.

For Muslims in Gujarat, the Congress's silence is especially grating because it comes on the heels of an election campaign in which they have been completely sidelined by the Congress. The Congress, meanwhile, seems to have taken for granted that most Muslims, who constitute 10 percent of Gujarat's population, will vote for them as opposed to the Hindu nationalist BJP.

Long time observers of the Gujarat state election cannot recall the last time that a Congress leader had visited so many temples as Rahul Gandhi has in the past few weeks, without making it to a single dargah.

In this backdrop, there are Muslims in Gujarat who see the Congress's silence over Padmavati not just as a electoral strategy to appease the Rajputs, but the beginning of a slide towards Hindutva.

As Lakdawala puts it, "I think it is part of the larger Hindutva issue, not just an issue of Rajput sentiments," he said. "If there was no election tomorrow and no votes to worry about, I still don't think they would speak out."

The doctor continued, "There is a deep sense of helplessness in the Muslim community, rich and poor. We don't have any say in forming the government. We don't have a say if someone is threatening to cut off someone's nose in our country. We have no voice anymore."

There is a deep sense of helplessness in the Muslim community, rich and poor.

Congress and Hindutva

While the BJP has always accused the Congress of appeasing the minority for votes, political analysts believe that the Congress has practiced "soft Hindutva" since the eighties.

In 1985, then Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi nullified the landmark judgement that granted alimony to a Muslim wife from Indore named Shah Bano, just to appease orthodox Muslims who opposed the Supreme Court's interference in their personal laws.

To restore the balance, a few months later, Rajiv Gandhi ordered the lock on the Babri Masjid to be removed, giving Hindus access to the birthplace of Lord Rama. But long time observers of the Gujarat elections say they have never seen anything like the current campaign.

In the 2007 state election, in a move that backfired, Sonia Gandhi used the term "maut ka saudagar" to describe Narendra Modi, who was chief minister of Gujarat at the time. In 2017, the Congress has not mentioned the religious violence that consumed Gujarat in 2002, claiming over 1000 lives, mostly Muslims.

Speaking on the Congress campaign, Ghanshyam Shah, a leading political analyst in Gujarat, said, "They are not even mentioning minorities. It is scary for Muslims. It is scary for all of us. The liberal space is shrinking. There is all kinds of anti-Muslim propaganda in the social media here. Even civil society can't do anything."

They are not even mentioning minorities. It is scary for Muslims. It is scary for all of us.

Like Lakdawala, the former Jawaharlal Nehru University professor believes that Congress's silence over Padmavati went beyond the election. "I believe that that Congress has lost its capacity to speak on issues like free speech."

For Mujahid Nafees, a 35-year-old Muslim man from Ahmedabad, the Congress is playing a "dangerous game" in not condemning the agitation against Padmavati. "Today, they are quiet about Padmavati. What will it be tomorrow? What's the limit of looking the other way," he said.

Nafees, who runs an advocacy group called the Minority Coordination Committee, continued, "Right now, the Congress believes that Muslims will always vote for them. Eventually, Muslims will just have to stop voting and that just hurts the democratic system that we live in. It is dangerous."

Eventually, Muslims will just have stop voting and that just hurts the democratic system that we live in.

The old guard

There are political analysts who believe that Congress is already gaining on the BJP by focusing on issues like poor governance, the problems around the Goods & Services Tax (GST) and demonetisation-related suffering, while steering clear of anything that could be construed as appeasing the minority.

On the other hand, some social scientists like Nadeem Hasnain, a leading anthropologist from Lucknow University, believe that Congress leaders are making a mistake simply because they will never be able to beat the BJP at Hinduvta.

"They can never say the things that BJP says. They can never do the things that BJP does. They have to take a strong secular stand otherwise they will lose out on their core supporters," he said.

They can never say the things that BJP says. They can never do the things that BJP does.

Meanwhile, there is a tussle inside the Congress. Those at the grassroots believe that the party is still not going far enough to curry favour with the Hindus. Others believe a line has already been crossed.

Ammar Rizvi, a Congress leader in Uttar Pradesh for five decades, said that he felt "sorry" about the current Congress campaign in Gujarat. In a conversation with HuffPost India, he said, "It hurts the sentiments of those who have been with Congress for so long. Congress has never changed its stand on secularism, socialism and the fight against communalism."

And while Rizvi believes that the movie Padmavati should be screened for leaders from the Rajput community before it is released, the 78-year-old leader called on his party to condemn the violent threats made the Karni Sena. "Even if the Congress has not any raised objection, I would like to do it. I would like the leaders of the Congress to courageously and boldly condemn those who threaten criminal action," he said.

I would like the leaders of the Congress to courageously and boldly condemn those who threaten criminal action,

Rahul Gandhi an "Atheist"

Interestingly, even though Rahul Gandhi is the face of the Congress's campaign in Gujarat, there are few who doubt his secular credentials.

Nafees, for instance, firmly believes that Gandhi is an "atheist."

Shiv Visvanathan, a leading political analyst and professor at the Jindal Global Law School, said that Gandhi is one of the last few leaders who believed in the "secular" brand even though it was regarded as dirty word by most politicians.

Instead of resorting to a quick fix like majority appeasement, Visvanathan said that Gandhi would have to learn to talk about subjects like Padmavati, explaining its nuances and preventing the debate from degenerating into "Rajputs versus movie makers."

"Right now, the Karni Sena has better debaters than the Congress. Rahul Gandhi needs to learn to talk about religion instead of coming across as cryptically illiterate," he said. "What Rahul Gandhi did to GST is what he should have done to the movie Padmavati."

What Rahul Gandhi did to GST is what he should have done to the movie Padmavati.

Also on HuffPost India:
TITLE: Why Congress's Silence On 'Padmavati' Is Terrifying A Section Of Muslims In Gujarat

Progressivement "drogu√©" √† la propagande djihadiste, jusqu'√† √™tre le destinataire d'une vid√©o pr√©sageant l'attentat de Saint-Etienne-du-Rouvray, il a √©t√© condamn√© vendredi 1er d√©cembre √† cinq ans de prison.
"Y a aucune diff√©rence entre la coca√Øne et les vid√©os de Daech: √† chaque fois on veut savoir ce qui va se passer".
"Drogu√©" √† la violence des images, il commence "√† avoir le m√™me discours".
"Je culpabilise", assure-t-il aujourd'hui, "si j'avais d√©nonc√© cette vid√©o √† la police, peut-√™tre que le pr√™tre serait encore en vie".
Une connaissance de 19 ans, jug√©e √† ses c√¥t√©s pour des vell√©it√©s de d√©part, a √©t√© condamn√©e √† cinq ans d'emprisonnement dont six mois avec sursis, et arr√™t√©e √† l'audience.
TEXT:
TERRORISME - Dans une autre vie, Omar, 20 ans, cr√©ait des sketches sur YouTube. Progressivement "drogu√©" √† la propagande djihadiste, jusqu'√† √™tre le destinataire d'une vid√©o pr√©sageant l'attentat de Saint-Etienne-du-Rouvray, il a √©t√© condamn√© vendredi 1er d√©cembre √† cinq ans de prison.

"On va dire que c'√©tait une radicalisation cin√©matographique", dit cet Alg√©rien, jeans r√¢p√© et cheveux fris√©s, jug√© devant le tribunal correctionnel pour association de malfaiteurs √† vis√©e terroriste.

√Ä l'origine du personnage de "Mamadou Segpa"

Ce jeune sans histoires, qui vivait avec sa m√®re √† Mantes-la-Ville dans les Yvelines, √©tait dissip√© au lyc√©e mais passionn√© de vid√©o. Les milliers de vues des sketches humoristiques qu'il diffusait sur YouTube, "Mamadou Segpa", lui rapportaient un peu d'argent. Au fil des √©pisodes, "Mamadou" allait "au kebab", "√† l'√©cole"...

Il s'√©tait mis un jour √† regarder des vid√©os de l'organisation √âtat islamique, "par curiosit√©", affirme-t-il, pour les besoins d'un √©pisode intitul√© "Mamadou Segpa rejoint Daech". Et d'expliquer: "A force, j'√©tais fascin√© par Daech", "par ce genre de grosse production hollywoodienne", assure-t-il dans le box des pr√©venus. "Y a aucune diff√©rence entre la coca√Øne et les vid√©os de Daech: √† chaque fois on veut savoir ce qui va se passer".

"Drogu√©" √† la violence des images, il commence "√† avoir le m√™me discours". La justice lui reproche des vell√©it√©s de d√©part en Syrie, des √©changes r√©p√©t√©s au sein de la "djihadosph√®re" sur Internet et le t√©l√©chargement de fichiers par dizaines: images d'attentats, conseils sur les techniques de dissimulation...

Des contacts nou√©s sur Internet

Il s'√©tait abonn√© "d√©but 2015" √† plusieurs cha√Ænes en lien avec le jihad sur la messagerie crypt√©e Telegram et, "en juillet 2016", √† celle du propagandiste Rachid Kassim, avec lequel il entretenait des conversations nourries. Le 23 juillet 2016, celui-ci lui avait adress√© une vid√©o dans laquelle un homme annon√ßait une "attaque d√©vastatrice" et pr√™tait all√©geance √† l'EI, lui demandant de la diffuser.

Le 24, la police avait d√©barqu√© chez lui pour une perquisition administrative, et saisi cette vid√©o. "J'√©tais choqu√© par ces propos mais j'y croyais pas trop", assure le pr√©venu. Par "peur", dit-il, il n'en avait pas parl√© √† la police. Il avait √©t√© interpell√© le 25 juillet 2016. Le 26, pendant sa garde √† vue, les jihadistes Abdel Malik Petitjean et Adel Kermiche √©gorgeaient le p√®re Jacques Hamel dans son √©glise de Saint-Etienne-du-Rouvray (Seine-Maritime).

Des vell√©it√©s de d√©part en Syrie

"Une polici√®re de la DGSI me parle d'une prise d'otage dans une √©glise", se souvient le pr√©venu, "elle me dit: "J'esp√®re que c'est pas la personne qui est sur cette vid√©o"". Et quand les enqu√™teurs ont identifi√© formellement Abdel Malik Petitjean, la polici√®re "m'a fait un signe de la t√™te".

"Je culpabilise", assure-t-il aujourd'hui, "si j'avais d√©nonc√© cette vid√©o √† la police, peut-√™tre que le pr√™tre serait encore en vie". Il estime ne pas avoir √©t√© radicalis√© "religieusement", mais reconna√Æt avoir √©t√© sensible aux arguments religieux avec lesquels l'EI l√©gitimait sa violence.

Attir√© par le mirage d'une vie confortable en Syrie, il avait projet√© avant son interpellation de s'y installer pour y faire des montages vid√©o. Le 1er d√©cembre au soir, il a √©t√© condamn√© √† cinq ans d'emprisonnement assortis d'un suivi socio-judiciaire de cinq ans. En d√©pit de faits "d'une gravit√© √©vidente" -"vouloir partir en Syrie apr√®s les attentats de 2015 et 2016"- le tribunal s'est dit "confiant" s'agissant de sa "prise de conscience".

Le procureur avait demand√© sept ans, assortis d'une p√©riode de s√ªret√© des deux tiers. Son avocate, Marie Dos√©, a salu√© une d√©cision "√©quilibr√©e, qui prend en compte sa personnalit√© et le travail effectu√© seul en d√©tention". Une connaissance de 19 ans, jug√©e √† ses c√¥t√©s pour des vell√©it√©s de d√©part, a √©t√© condamn√©e √† cinq ans d'emprisonnement dont six mois avec sursis, et arr√™t√©e √† l'audience.

√Ä voir √©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Le YouTubeur derri√®re "Mamadou Segpa" condamn√© √† 5 ans de prison pour des contacts avec Daech

TEXT:
Former President Barack Obama sent his well wishes Monday afternoon to Prince Harry and Meghan Markle on their engagement.

‚ÄúMichelle and I ... wish you a lifetime of joy and happiness together,‚Äù he tweeted.

Michelle and I are delighted to congratulate Prince Harry and Meghan Markle on their engagement. We wish you a lifetime of joy and happiness together. ‚Äî Barack Obama (@BarackObama) November 27, 2017

Prince Harry‚Äôs father announced Monday that the 33-year-old British royal and the 36-year-old American actress, who had been dating since 2016, got engaged earlier this month.

Obama‚Äôs sweet tweet to the happy couple immediately took off, with Twitter users asking him to ‚Äúcome back‚Äù and exclamations of ‚Äúwe miss you!‚Äù but also with many saying they couldn‚Äôt wait to see the stylish Obamas ‚Äúpull up to this wedding.‚Äù

Prince Harry and the ex-president have been seen out together since Obama left the White House and they seem pretty chummy, so we‚Äôre sincerely hoping that an invite for the former POTUS and FLOTUS ends up in the mail.

Samir Hussein via Getty Images Former President Barack Obama and Prince Harry watch wheelchair basketball at the Invictus Games in Toronto on Sept. 29, 2017.

Some Twitter users even wondered whether Michelle Obama was the friend who introduced the prince to Markle.

HANG ON IS MICHELLE OBAMA THE FRIEND WHO HOOKED THEM UP?!?!!?! https://t.co/meksoQ28rT ‚Äî Frank Lloyd Write üóΩ (@emarvelous) November 27, 2017

The newly engaged couple revealed in a BBC interview that they were introduced by a mutual friend, but declined to reveal who that mysterious friend was. Perhaps we‚Äôll find out in the future.
TITLE: Barack Obama Congratulates Prince Harry And Meghan Markle On Engagement

SUMMARY:
Slavery in Libya has gone beyond auctioning humans and some "slave masters" are using them for organ trade, a legal practitioner has told GhanaWeb, an online news and video site.
Lawyer Bobby Banson said he had seen videos, where at least one person caught up in the slavery alleged that body parts of his colleagues were harvested and sold abroad.
The lawyer appealed to the African Union to set up an ad-hoc court to get to the bottom of this crime.
He said Ghanaians who returned from Libya had been recounting harrowing incidents they encountered in Libya.
Meanwhile, UN secretary-general Ant√≥nio Guterres who condemned the "appalling acts" ordered that the slave trade be investigated by competent authorities to bring the perpetrators to justice.
TEXT:
Slavery in Libya has gone beyond auctioning humans and some "slave masters" are using them for organ trade, a legal practitioner has told GhanaWeb, an online news and video site.

Lawyer Bobby Banson said he had seen videos, where at least one person caught up in the slavery alleged that body parts of his colleagues were harvested and sold abroad.

"...The truth is that they are not sold to go and work, but their human parts are harvested... kidney, liver are in high demand in these areas," he was quoted as saying.

He said this was because organs of a dead person could not be harvested.

"They are put on some drugs and their parts are harvested and resold. So that is actually what is happening, and that is a crime against humanity," Banson told TV3's New Day on Saturday.

The lawyer appealed to the African Union to set up an ad-hoc court to get to the bottom of this crime.

Banson was also reportedly worried about Ghanaians in Libya.

He said Ghanaians who returned from Libya had been recounting harrowing incidents they encountered in Libya.

A total of 127 Ghanaians including children arrived in Ghana on Wednesday from Libya, where they had been put under detention for various offences, the report stated.

Meanwhile, UN secretary-general Ant√≥nio Guterres who condemned the "appalling acts" ordered that the slave trade be investigated by competent authorities to bring the perpetrators to justice.
TITLE: Lawyer: Slaves In Libya Are Used For Organ Trade

TEXT:
FRANCE - Une rencontre au sommet. Non, il ne s'agit pas d'un G8 ou d'une visite diplomatique. Ce samedi 2 d√©cembre, l'ancien pr√©sident des √âtats-Unis, Barack Obama, foulera pour la premi√®re fois le sol fran√ßais depuis son d√©part de la Maison-Blanche. Et ce sera gr√¢ce √† l'influence et au travail d'une nouvelle fondation aux allures de start-up: Les Napoleons.

Comment ce club d'√©v√®nementiel qui se pr√©sente comme un r√©seau social, n√© il y a moins de quatre ans, a-t-il r√©ussi, apr√®s Fran√ßois Hollande, √† se payer Obama? Les r√©ponses sont dans notre vid√©o en t√™te d'article.

Vous n'aurez pas d'informations sur le montant du ch√®que sign√© pour cette rencontre, qui aura lieu dans le magnifique auditorium de la Maison de la Radio. Ni plus de d√©tails sur le r√¥le qu'a jou√© dans la n√©gociation finale, St√©phane Richard, le PDG d'Orange et l'influent parrain des Napoleons. Pour les fondateurs, Mondher Abdennhader et Olivier Moulierac, qui se sont tous les deux rencontr√©s chez Euro RSCG avant l'√®re Havas, "patience et pers√©v√©rance ont permis cette rencontre" qu'ils pr√©paraient depuis trois ans, alors que Barack Obama √©tait encore pr√©sident des √âtats-Unis. Depuis qu'il a quitt√© la Maison-Blanche, l'ex-pr√©sident qui a cr√©√© sa fondation aurait mis l'accent sur l'innovation et la culture, deux valeurs intrins√®quement li√©es pour les p√®res des Napoleons qui en ont fait leur banni√®re.

Les 400.000 euros avanc√©s par Le Canard Enchain√© pour solder la rencontre, sont "des chiffres erron√©s" selon eux et les modalit√©s du contrat strictement r√©gies par une clause de confidentialit√©. "Et c'est une clause qui s'applique √† tous nos speakers, il n'y a pas de r√©gime sp√©cial pour cette journ√©e du 2 d√©cembre", pr√©cisent-ils.

Quant √† la relation entre Richard et Obama, on apprendra qu'ils se sont d√©j√† rencontr√©s deux ou trois fois dans le pass√©, "mais c'est tout".

Apr√®s Obama, les Napoleons, qui entament par cette journ√©e introductive sur le th√®me de la peur, leur session d'hiver qui se tiendra au Val d'Is√®re, ne comptent pas s'arr√™ter l√†. "Il y a encore plein de personnalit√©s influentes, comme Mark Zuckerberg ou encore le pape. Et aussi, bien s√ªr des personnes moins connues qui sont tout aussi inspirantes. On n'a pas de souci √† se faire de ce c√¥t√©-l√†", annonce Olivier Moulierac.

TITLE: Barack Obama √† Paris: comment Les Napoleons ont r√©ussi √† obtenir sa premi√®re conf√©rence en France

SUMMARY:
A few members of the cast and crew of Kundan Shah's classic satire, Jaane Bhi Do Yaaron, were present at an event to commemorate the memory of the late filmmaker.
I don't think it's possible for us to make a Jaane Bhi Do Yaaraon in the current climate.
But I don't think we can make something like that now, the current times are scary."
He further added, "Such is the situation now that if Kundan was alive and we had decided that we will make another Jaane Bhi Do Yaaron, then our legs would have been broken.
The Kerala High Court later passed an order overruling the Ministry's decision, asking IFFI to screen the film.
TEXT:
A few members of the cast and crew of Kundan Shah's classic satire, Jaane Bhi Do Yaaron, were present at an event to commemorate the memory of the late filmmaker.

Among those who were present included writer-actor Satish Kaushik, filmmaker Sudhir Mishra (who was an Assistant Director on the film), Neena Gupta, and the film's dialogue writer, Ranjit Kapoor.

What started as an event where the crew shared anecdotes from the making of the film turned into a conversation about the timelessness and relevance of the dark satire in the current environment where artistic freedom faces imminent threat.

Kapoor addressed the elephant in the room and said, "We live in pretty difficult times. I don't think it's possible for us to make a Jaane Bhi Do Yaaraon in the current climate. We took on the then Chief Minister of Maharashtra, who hated the press. There was a famous quote of his which said, 'All the press should be thrown in the Bay of Bengal.' The film is as relevant today as it was back then. Maybe even more. But I don't think we can make something like that now, the current times are scary."

He further added, "Such is the situation now that if Kundan was alive and we had decided that we will make another Jaane Bhi Do Yaaron, then our legs would have been broken. I feel more fear even now. The fear is more underlined that in the time when our film was made. At that time we used feel that there is freedom of expression. I do not see it now. There are lot of incidents which I am witnessing today, which convinces me that the world we live in is more dangerous, than the one which existed at the time of Jaane Bhi..."

A biting social commentary, every frame of Jaane Bhi Do Yaaron is a critique of the establishment, with references to the then Chief Minister of Maharashtra, A R Antulay, who was convicted of corruption by the Bombay High Court and had to resign from his post.

When this writer asked about the current times where freedom of expression is increasingly under threat to Sudhir Mishra, he said he isn't 'scared' to make the films he wants to, while Kapoor said if not through cinema, he'll use theatre and other outlets of expression to register dissent.

The International Film Festival of India, which concludes on November 28, has been under serious criticism after the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting arbitrarily dropped two films, S Durga and Nude, from the selection. The Kerala High Court later passed an order overruling the Ministry's decision, asking IFFI to screen the film.

Also see on HuffPost:
TITLE: IFFI 2017: They'd Break Our Legs If We Think Of Making 'Jaane Bhi Do Yaaron' Today, Says Film's Writer

SUMMARY:
It was a wild moose chase like no other.
Residents of Markham City in Ontario, Canada got an unexpected visit from a moose on Friday.
The lost and frightened moose ran through the highly populated and residential areas of the city trying to find its way back home.
The moose was first sighted at 7am on Friday and as news spread about their unusual visitor, Markham residents were shocked by its tour of the city.
The moose is now believed to have managed to relocate itself to the safety of its wild habitat.
TEXT:
It was a wild moose chase like no other.

Residents of Markham City in Ontario, Canada got an unexpected visit from a moose on Friday.

The lost and frightened moose ran through the highly populated and residential areas of the city trying to find its way back home. The moose took itself on quite an adventure, running through backyards, across main roads and through car parks.

The moose was first sighted at 7am on Friday and as news spread about their unusual visitor, Markham residents were shocked by its tour of the city.

"It's very strange. We have had deer around here and foxes, but not a moose. It's pretty amazing," one resident told CTV.

Wildlife experts and police had a big job on their hands trying to detain the moose to keep both the animal and the city's people safe. Initially, police attempted to find the 360-kilogram moose, tranquilise it and move it to a more northern location in the state, but eventually the creature found its own way into a wooded area just outside of the city.

The moose is now believed to have managed to relocate itself to the safety of its wild habitat.
TITLE: 'Moose On The Loose' Runs Wild Through Canadian City

SUMMARY:
The Home Office told Satbir Singh, 30, on Friday it was wrong to deny his Indian wife Gitanjali, 31, a visa, after Singh wrote a widely read blog about his pain and anger about their initial refusal three days earlier.
‚ÄúMy wife is coming home because you gave me a platform to tell the world what is being done to people,‚Äù he told HuffPost.
They shouldn‚Äôt have to.‚ÄùSatbir Singh Satbir and Gitanjali Singh on their wedding day in London in 2014It has been a whirlwind week for the couple.

They moved to America where Satbir Singh pursued a scholarship to study Gitanjali Singh worked for the Clinton Health Access Initiative.
TEXT:
A man whose wife was rejected for a visa to live in Britain in error has called it ‚Äúoutrageous‚Äù that it took the publicity he drummed up, including by writing a HuffPost UK blog, to reverse the decision. The Home Office told Satbir Singh, 30, on Friday it was wrong to deny his Indian wife Gitanjali, 31, a visa, after Singh wrote a widely read blog about his pain and anger about their initial refusal three days earlier. ‚ÄúMy wife is coming home because you gave me a platform to tell the world what is being done to people,‚Äù he told HuffPost. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm incredibly grateful... but this isn‚Äôt how government is supposed to work.‚Äù Singh added: ‚ÄúI find it outrageous this is how errors are brought to their attention. Most people can‚Äôt do this. Most people can‚Äôt write something for HuffPost and bring pressure to bear. They shouldn‚Äôt have to.‚Äù

Satbir Singh Satbir and Gitanjali Singh on their wedding day in London in 2014

It has been a whirlwind week for the couple. Singh learned on Monday the Home Office had reached a decision. He was so sure she would be coming to London he ordered a ‚ÄúWelcome Home‚Äù banner off Amazon. On Tuesday, he received the rejection. He said it left him ‚Äúin shock‚Äù. He was sure it was a mistake in processing their 1,103-page application and defining his income to assess whether he earned the ¬£18,600 Britons must if they want to bring a spouse from outside the European Economic Area (EEA). On Wednesday, he picked up the keys to the Kilburn flat they were due to rent together. ‚ÄúAs a husband, I am broken,‚Äù he wrote that day in his blog.

I find it outrageous this is how errors are brought to their attention. Satbir Singh

‚ÄúThe [Home Office] has overlooked or misplaced key documents and declared that we have failed to submit them. ‚ÄúThey have applied the incorrect sections of the law and declared that we fail to satisfy them, and all this with almost complete impunity. Four different lawyers have confirmed that the Home Office has made a mistake.‚Äù Their lawyer had told them an appeal could take up to a year. The lawyer had been due to respond to the Home Office on Monday, Singh said. But on Friday, two days after his blog was published, Singh said he received an automated email acknowledging the mistake and apologising. The Home Office does not comment on individual cases but confirmed it had reversed its original decision. The couple met studying at SOAS in London in 2010 and were married in 2014.

They moved to America where Satbir Singh pursued a scholarship to study Gitanjali Singh worked for the Clinton Health Access Initiative. But her visa forced her to leave Washington for Delhi in September 2016, the last time the couple lived together. ‚ÄúIt is a year that has seen us forced to live on opposite sides of the world, in different time zones and climates, each of us stealing moments at odd hours to be there on the phone when the other one woke up or went to sleep,‚Äù Satbir Singh wrote in his blog. He returned to Britain in January and worked freelance as a human rights consultant until September, when he became chief executive of the Joint Council for the Welfare of Immigrants, which campaigns against the visa rules. The transition from self-employment complicated their visa application, which requires evidence of six months‚Äô earnings. She had stayed in her job, working remotely, and the visa application included the fact this work would continue when she came to Britain. But, in such cases, the spouse‚Äôs income does not count if they are working abroad.
TITLE: Home Office Admits It Was Wrong To Reject Visa For British Man's Wife After HuffPost Blog

Es ist eine √ºberraschende Wende im Fall des Potsdamer BombenalarmsStatt um einen m√∂glichen versuchten Anschlag auf den Weihnachtsmarkt oder eine Apotheke geht es um einen Erpressungsversuch gegen DHLDie Polizei warnt Privatpersonen und Unternehmen, auff√§llige Pakete nicht zu √∂ffnenMitten im wichtigen Weihnachtsgesch√§ft wird der Paketdienst DHL erpresst.

TEXT:
Es ist eine √ºberraschende Wende im Fall des Potsdamer Bombenalarms

Statt um einen m√∂glichen versuchten Anschlag auf den Weihnachtsmarkt oder eine Apotheke geht es um einen Erpressungsversuch gegen DHL

Die Polizei warnt Privatpersonen und Unternehmen, auff√§llige Pakete nicht zu √∂ffnen

Mitten im wichtigen Weihnachtsgesch√§ft wird der Paketdienst DHL erpresst.

Das am Freitag an eine Apotheke am Potsdamer Weihnachtsmarkt gesendete gef√§hrliche Paket stehe in diesem Zusammenhang, sagte Brandenburg Innenminister Karl-Heinz Schr√∂ter (SPD) am Sonntag in Potsdam.

Schr√∂ter sprach von einer "Briefbombe". Der oder die T√§ter verlangten eine Millionensumme. Eine √§hnliche Lieferung sei bereits Anfang November in Frankfurt (Oder) bei einem Online-H√§ndler aufgetaucht.

Zischen beim Aufmachen des Pakets

Der oder die T√§ter n√§hmen schwerste Verletzungen der Adressaten oder sogar deren T√∂tung billigend in Kauf, warnte Schr√∂ter. Es scheine sich nach bisherigen Erkenntnissen um regional agierende T√§ter aus Berlin oder Brandenburg zu handeln.

Weitere Einzelheiten dazu wurden aus ermittlungstaktischen Gr√ºnden zun√§chst nicht genannt.

Polizeipr√§sident Hans-J√ºrgen M√∂rke sagte, der Apotheker habe beim Aufmachen ein Zischen geh√∂rt. Zuerst hatte es dagegen gehei√üen, das Paket habe vermutlich √ºber keinen Z√ºnder verf√ºgt. Inzwischen sei der Sprengsatz aber noch mal analysiert worden, sagte M√∂rke.

Die Sicherheitsbeh√∂rden halten weitere Sendungen f√ºr m√∂glich oder sogar wahrscheinlich, wie M√∂rke weiter erkl√§rte.

Der Potsdamer Sendung habe eine Nachricht beigelegen. Diese sei als sogenannter QR-Code im Internet verschl√ºsselt, aber eindeutig rekonstruiert worden, sagte Polizeipr√§sident Hans-J√ºrgen M√∂rke.

"Auff√§llige Pakete nicht √∂ffnen"

Betroffen seien bislang vor allem kleine Unternehmen.

Auch die Sendung an Privatpersonen sei aber nicht auszuschlie√üen, hie√ü es. "Wer ein auff√§lliges Paket zugestellt bekommt, nicht √∂ffnen, denn das k√∂nnte die Ausl√∂sung bewirken", warnte Innenminister Schr√∂ter.

Hinweise seien zum Beispiel unbekannte Absender, Rechtschreibfehler oder auch aus dem Paket ragende Dr√§hte, erkl√§rte die Polizei, die auch eine Telefonhotline schaltete.

Ermittlungen wegen versuchter schwerer r√§uberischer Erpressung

Ermittelt werde wegen versuchter Herbeif√ºhrung einer Sprengstoffexplosion und versuchter schwerer r√§uberischer Erpressung, sagte der Leitende Potsdamer Oberstaatsanwalt Heinrich Junker.

Anfang November wurde den Ermittlern zufolge bereits ein √§hnliches Paket an einen Online-H√§ndler in Frankfurt (Oder) gesendet. Dieses sei beim √ñffnen in Brand geraten, sagte Polizeichef M√∂rke.

Dadurch verbrannte das Erpresserschreiben. In der Potsdamer Sendung sei aber auf die erste Tat Bezug genommen worden. Sie war am Donnerstagmorgen an einer Paketstation in der Landeshauptstadt abgegeben worden.

Paket enthielt N√§gel, Schrauben und Polenb√∂ller

Die Pakete enthielten nach bisherigen Ermittlungen unter anderem N√§gel, Schrauben und sogenannte Polenb√∂ller. So werden umgangssprachlich Feuerwerksk√∂rper bezeichnet, die wegen Sicherheitsm√§ngeln in Deutschland illegal sind.

Die Tat sei besonders verwerflich, meinte Minister Schr√∂ter. Mit an Sicherheit grenzender Wahrscheinlichkeit habe die Zustellung der "Briefbombe" aber nicht dem Weihnachtsmarkt gegolten, sagte er.

Erinnerungen an den Fall "Dagobert"

Die Erpressung erinnert laut Schr√∂ter an den Fall "Dagobert". Der Kaufhauserpresser hatte vor allem Anfang der 1990er Jahre ein Katz-und-Maus-Spiel mit der Polizei betrieben, bevor er gefasst wurde. "Ich hoffe, wir sind schneller erfolgreich", sagte Schr√∂ter.

Der Fall "Dagobert" gilt als einer der aufwendigsten Erpressungsf√§lle in der deutschen Kriminalgeschichte.

F√ºr die Potsdamer Fahndung setzte die Polizei eine Ermittlungsgruppe ¬´Luise¬ª ein - benannt nach der Apotheke, an die das Paket geschickt worden war. In der Gruppe arbeiten rund 25 Kriminalisten.
TITLE: DHL wird erpresst:

SUMMARY:
Seitdem hat sich die Euphorie um das Thema wieder gelegt: √úber die Digitalisierung redet heute kaum jemand mehr.
Wir brauchen hier eine Figur, die dem Land hilft, das Thema zu verstehen, die aber gleichzeitig auch die Kraft hat, das Thema wirklich zu treiben.
Wir m√ºssen diese Investitionen mit aller Kraft anschieben und dabei die Fehler vermeiden, die wir z.B.
Die Digitalisierung wird unsere Gesellschaft mehr fordern als die Hartz-Reformen, der bislang gr√∂√üte Umbau unserer Sozialsysteme.
Denn wenn wir es nicht tun, werden es andere tun.
TEXT:
Digitalisierung war eines der Schlagw√∂rter im Wahlkampf. Es stand in gro√üen Lettern auf Plakaten und wurde von den Spitzenkandidaten in gro√üe Hallen gerufen.

Seitdem hat sich die Euphorie um das Thema wieder gelegt: √úber die Digitalisierung redet heute kaum jemand mehr. In den Sondierungsverhandungen spielte es keine nennenswerte Rolle.



Doch damit wollen wir uns nicht zufrieden geben. In einer mehrteiligen Serie spricht die HuffPost mit Experten, Tech-Pionieren und Politikern, um der Frage nachzugehen, was auf dem Weg in die Zukunft passieren muss.

Wie Deutschland das gelingen kann, dar√ºber haben wir mit Stefan Schaible, Deutschland-Chef der Unternehmensberatung Roland Berger, gesprochen. Er erkl√§rt auch, wo sich die Zukunft der digitalen Wirtschaft wirklich entscheidet - es ist nicht (nur) die USA - und warum Deutschland endlich einen Digitalminister braucht.

Herr Schaible, Sie reisen beruflich oft nach China. Welches Gef√ºhl hatten Sie, als Sie letztes Mal wieder in Frankfurt gelandet waren?

Schaible: Ich war fasziniert und besorgt zugleich. Fasziniert wegen des Innovationswillens der Chinesen in allen Bereichen der Digitalisierung, das sp√ºrt man auch in unserem chinesischen B√ºro, unserem weltweit zweitgr√∂√üten. Besorgt, weil die Entscheider dort sehr genau Deutschlands St√§rken analysieren - und in genau diesen Feldern angreifen.

Welche sind das?

Bei vernetzten Fabriken, und - wenn wir uns weiter anstrengen - bei neuen Antriebstechnologien f√ºr Autos und bei K√ºnstlicher Intelligenz (KI), ist Deutschland weltweit vorn mit dabei. Allerdings strebt China an, bis 2030 allein im Bereich KI Produkte im Herstellungswert von 150 Milliarden Dollar in den Markt zu geben, und weltweit agierende, digitale Player aufbauen. Dass China das kann, zeigen zum Beispiel die chinesischen Milliardenunternehmen Tencent, ein soziales Netzwerk, und der Amazon-Konkurrent Alibaba.

Wenn es um die digitale Wirtschaft geht, schauen die meisten eher in die USA‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ dabei √ºbersehen sie, wo einige der gr√∂√üten digitalen Player der Zukunft entstehen. China hat die Digitalisierung als wichtigstes Zukunftsfeld erkannt - und treibt das Thema nun mit aller Macht voran.

Die Sache mit der Macht ist in Deutschland nun allerdings anders organisiert.

Wir m√ºssen trotzdem schneller sein, sonst findet das Wachstum der Zukunft anderswo statt. Aktuell hat Deutschland noch eine Chance, in der digitalen Wirtschaft von Morgen mitzuspielen. Und wir k√∂nnen doch nicht akzeptieren, dass westliche Demokratien in Verbindung mit der Marktwirtschaft das unterlegene System sind.

In den Jamaika-Sondierungen ging es vor allem um Fl√ºchtlingsthemen ‚Äì wie sich Deutschland global wettbewerbsf√§hig in der Digitalisierung aufstellt, schien eher von untergeordnetem Interesse‚Ä¶..

Bei allen k√ºnftigen Regierungsbildungen sollte die die Idee eines Digitalministers auf dem Tisch liegen. Meiner Meinung nach eine echte Chance‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ f√ºr einen Gr√º√üonkel.

Das kann passieren, wenn sich eine Koalition nur auf einen Staatsminister einigen kann. Ein m√§chtiger Digitalminister im Kabinett hingegen h√§tte die Chance, einen Turnaround im Digitalbereich zu organisieren. Einzige Bedingung: Er m√ºsste tats√§chlich einige Interventionsrechte √§hnlich wie der Finanzminister haben.

Sie wissen selbst, dass es dazu in Deutschland eher nicht kommen wird.

Warten wir es ab. Wenn eine neue Regierung das Thema ernst nimmt, wird es nicht anders gehen. Ein Digitalminister br√§uchte zum Beispiel ein Veto-Recht bei allen Fragen der Digitalisierung. Vom Netzausbau bis hin zur digitalen Industriepolitik.

Wer w√§re Ihr Wunschkandidat?

Wir brauchen hier eine Figur, die dem Land hilft, das Thema zu verstehen, die aber gleichzeitig auch die Kraft hat, das Thema wirklich zu treiben. Denn wir m√ºssen einfach verstehen, dass wir viel zu sehr von den Ideen und Innovationen der Vergangenheit leben.

Was w√ºrde der Digitalminister oder die Ministerin als erstes anpacken?

Das wei√ü ich nicht. Ich kann Ihnen aber sagen, was ich machen w√ºrde. Zun√§chst m√ºssten wir digitale Felder identifizieren, in denen Deutschland f√ºhrend sein soll, so, wie es die Chinesen gerade tun. F√ºr diese Felder m√ºssten wir dann klare Ziele definieren. Wir k√∂nnten uns zum Beispiel vornehmen, globale Milliardenplayer in den Sektoren Industrie 4.0 und K√ºnstliche Intelligenz aufzubauen. Grundlage daf√ºr sind Milliarden-schwere Fonds f√ºr Startups und Wachstumsunternehmen. Es ist doch absurd, dass deutsche Forscher f√ºhrend sind bei K√ºnstlicher Intelligenz, dass aber Unternehmen aus den USA und China damit das meiste Geld verdienen. Grund daf√ºr ist auch das fehlende Geld in Deutschland.

Leider keine ganz neue Erkenntnis.

Umso wichtiger, dass ein Digitalminister das Thema angeht. Ein weiterer Faktor ist, dass der deutsche Mittelstand in Teilen noch zu z√∂gerlich ist bei Investitionen in digitale Gesch√§ftsbereiche.

Wie kann das ein Digitalminister √§ndern?

Er k√∂nnte helfen, zus√§tzliche Mittel f√ºr Investitionen zu organisieren, √ºber die KfW zum Beispiel. Die hat eine hohe Akzeptanz beim Mittelstand. Angesichts des weltweiten Milliarden-Wettrennens gro√üer Investoren brauchen wir zus√§tzliche Mittel von 50 Milliarden Euro, die in den n√§chsten f√ºnf Jahren in digitale Investitionen in der deutschen Wirtschaft flie√üen.

Viele Unternehmen w√ºrden schon dann mehr investieren, wenn Forschung und Entwicklung st√§rker steuerlich beg√ºnstigt w√ºrden.

Richtig. Deshalb k√∂nnten Ausgaben f√ºr Forschung und Entwicklung (F&E) voll von der Steuerschuld abgezogen werden, das w√ºrde einen neuen Investitionsboom ausl√∂sen. Wir m√ºssen diese Investitionen mit aller Kraft anschieben und dabei die Fehler vermeiden, die wir z.B. bei W√§rmed√§mmung und Erneuerbaren Energien gemacht haben.

Google, Amazon, Facebook, Apple sind uneinholbar. In welchen Feldern kann die deutsche Digitalwirtschaft in ein paar Jahren zur Elite geh√∂ren?

F√ºr die vernetzte Industrie ist Deutschland gut positioniert - ebenso im Bereich K√ºnstliche Intelligenz und vernetzte Mobilit√§t. Diese Felder haben durchaus auch das Potenzial die f√ºhrende Rolle von US-Playern wie Google, Facebook oder Amazon in Frage zu stellen. Doch in diese Felder investieren Fonds und Regierungen in aller Welt Milliarden. Letztlich hat Europa hier nur gemeinsam eine Chance.

Die da w√§re?

Wir brauchen zum Beispiel einen digitalen Binnenmarkt, mit gleichen Datenschutz-Regeln in allen L√§ndern. Bislang hat praktisch jedes EU-Land eigene Gesetze.

Kann die Digitalisierung Europa am Ende wom√∂glich ein St√ºck enger zusammenbringen?

Vielleicht. Aktuell sorgt ja das Thema Digitalisierung - neben der Angst vor der Zuwanderung - f√ºr gro√üe √Ñngste in der Mittelschicht. Gerade deshalb m√ºssen wir den Menschen mit konkreten Projekten und Ideen zeigen, dass die Digitalisierung eine positive Entwicklung ist. Das ist der einzige Weg gegen die diffuse Angst.

Mit positiven Projekten?

Ich wei√ü, es wird schwierig, die positiven Auswirkungen f√ºr jeden Einzelnen zu zeigen. Aber wir m√ºssen es versuchen. Die Digitalisierung wird unsere Gesellschaft mehr fordern als die Hartz-Reformen, der bislang gr√∂√üte Umbau unserer Sozialsysteme.

Warum?

Weil es alle Bereiche unserer Gesellschaft ver√§ndern wird. Wie wir arbeiten, lernen und wie unsere Wirtschaft wachsen wird. Neben allen Chancen d√ºrfen wir nicht vergessen, diesen Wandel zu erkl√§ren.

F√ºr viele steht die Angst vor Arbeitslosigkeit im Mittelpunkt.

Ja. Aber ich glaube die Angst ist unbegr√ºndet. Es entstehen viele neue Chancen und Jobs - auch f√ºr √§ltere Generationen. Wir m√ºssen allerdings auch sicherstellen, dass wir den Menschen helfen, deren Arbeitsumfelder sich am st√§rksten ver√§ndern. Letztlich aber brauchen wir eine revolution√§re Ver√§nderung.

Ein gro√ües Wort.

Aber nur dann haben wir eine Chance. Wir m√ºssen damit beginnen, unsere Wirtschaft und letztlich unser Leben zu digitalisieren. Denn wenn wir es nicht tun, werden es andere tun. Ein erster gro√üer Schritt w√§re zum Beispiel die Digitalisierung der gesamten Verwaltung.

Bislang scheitern wir allerdings noch an einer digitalen Gesundheitskarte.

Leider ja. Aber wollen Sie so schnell aufgeben? Es w√§re es eine riesige Chance: Denn das w√ºrde gigantische Investitionen erfordern, die wiederum Unternehmen gro√ü machen w√ºrden, die dann wichtiger Teil des digitalen √ñkosystems werden: Experten f√ºr Datenbanken, Cyber-Sicherheit, Algorithmen, die Akten organisieren k√∂nnen: Alles Technologien, f√ºr die ich gro√üe Chancen sehe in den n√§chsten Jahren.

(jg)
TITLE: Roland-Berger-Chef Schaible: "Digitalisierung wird unsere Gesellschaft mehr fordern als die Hartz-Reformen"

During BTS' much-awaited appearance on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show," which aired Monday, band member RM, formerly known as Rap Monster, revealed that he learned English the best way ever ‚Äï by watching TV show "Friends."
The BTS leader told host Ellen DeGeneres that his mother had bought him DVDs of all the "Friends" seasons.
He watched them first with Korean subtitles before switching to English ones.
"When I was 15 or 14, it was quite like a syndrome for all the Korean parents to make their kids watch 'Friends,'" RM said.

TEXT:
During BTS' much-awaited appearance on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show," which aired Monday, band member RM, formerly known as Rap Monster, revealed that he learned English the best way ever ‚Äï by watching TV show "Friends."

The BTS leader told host Ellen DeGeneres that his mother had bought him DVDs of all the "Friends" seasons. He watched them first with Korean subtitles before switching to English ones. And eventually, RM didn't need subtitles at all.

"When I was 15 or 14, it was quite like a syndrome for all the Korean parents to make their kids watch 'Friends,'" RM said. "I thought I was a victim at that time, but now I'm the lucky one."

DeGeneres even ended up gifting the group, who performed their song "Mic Drop," a bunch of "Friends" swag.
TITLE: K-Pop Band BTS Lead Learnt English By Watching 'Friends'
