TEXT:
Cabezas de jaguar, chivos y otros animales cuidan con la mirada el taller de Don Gorgonio Castro, que forma parte de la tercera generaci√≥n de artesanos que hacen m√°scaras de madera en el municipio de Suchitl√°n, en Colima.

La tradici√≥n de dar vida a animales fant√°sticos a partir de madera fue instaurada por el abuelo de Don Gorgonio, quien al practicar el arte de la danza prehisp√°nica carg√≥ sus ense√±anzas de magia y misticismo.

Las m√°scaras, que a decir de Gorgonio tienen mayor popularidad para las festividades de Semana Santa y Navidad, son representaciones de animales regionales como linces, perros, ocelotes, chivos, burros, coyotes y zorros, y tienen que ver con algunas de las creencias de la cosmovisi√≥n prehisp√°nica.

As√≠, explic√≥, "hay un orden dentro de la danza, hay unos que significan inteligencia, sabidur√≠a, fuerza, uni√≥n, y as√≠ sucesivamente".

Con la tranquilidad de quienes aman cada parte de su trabajo, el artesano explic√≥ que a√∫n cuando existen trabajos especiales que requieren de un mayor tiempo para nacer de entre la madera, la elaboraci√≥n de una m√°scara de tama√±o regular se puede llevar hasta una semana y la venta de las mismas es en el taller de Gorgonio, aunque tambi√©n ha llegado a exponer su trabajo en otras exposiciones de Colima.

El artesano, explic√≥ que no se ha animado a buscar exponer su trabajo fuera del Estado debido a que considera necesario encontrar el punto exacto de la madurez de su obra, "todav√≠a√¨ no he llegado", coment√≥, aunque las m√°scaras que viven en la pared de su taller opinen lo contrario.

Gorgonio comenz√≥ con la talla de madera desde los siete a√±os de edad y record√≥ que inici√≥ con una especie de ritual en el que su padre, que fue quien le entren√≥ para este trabajo, le hac√≠a √©nfasis en la observaci√≥n de la naturaleza y los determinados momentos de un d√≠a para luego mirar la madera y dejar guiar su imaginaci√≥n para as√≠ encontrar la figura que vive dentro del tronco.

Record√≥ que en su aprendizaje, su padre le hac√≠a mirar los trozos de madera y le preguntaba: ¬øy t√∫ qu√© ves m√°s all√° de tus ojos?, el pap√° de Gorgonio consideraba que las m√°scaras ya viv√≠an en los trozos de madera, "nada m√°s hay que quitar la madera que les sobra", explic√≥.

"Mi pap√° dec√≠a que las m√°scaras no las hacemos nosotros, que ya estaban dentro, solamente le quitamos lo que le sobra, mi pap√° dec√≠a que las m√°scaras ya hab√≠an sido creadas, solo hab√≠a que encontrarles la forma".

El taller del artesano se encuentra a un costado de su casa, ah√≠, la luz natural, el aire fresco y un mont√≥n de ara√±as que cuelgan de las copas de los √°rboles frutales acompa√±an el trabajo cotidiano de Gorgonio, quien ya prepara a la cuarta generaci√≥n que seguir√° con la tradici√≥n de la talla de madera.

El artesano utiliza la misma t√©cnica de ense√±anza que aprendi√≥ de su padre quien a su vez fue ense√±ado por su abuelo y que consiste en la entrega de un trozo de madera para "sacar la m√°scara" y as√≠ determinar las habilidades del aprendiz, en su familia, no todos son mascareros, s√≥lo practican este modo de vida √®l y su hermano, y pr√≥ximamente, ser√° el hijo de Gorgonio quien contin√∫e con la tradici√≥n.

Gorgonio ahora ense√±a a su hijo, primero a la observaci√≥n de los fen√≥menos naturales para as√≠ conectarse con su mascarero interno; es decir, explic√≥, la elaboraci√≥n de estas piezas no solo tiene una finalidad decorativa, sino espiritual.

"Primero hay que ver la madera, tienes que ver m√°s all√° de tus ojos para as√≠ sacar el modelo del animal que va a nacer del tronco", en ese sentido, detall√≥ que primero se hace la talla de la madera para dar la forma del animal a representar; luego, se resana y se lija para darle una mayor suavidad y posteriormente se le pasan al menos tres capas de pintura.
TITLE: El artesano Don Gorgonio y su obsesi√≥n por las m√°scaras de animales

SUMMARY:
The 82-year-old Tibetan spiritual leader met with Obama at a New Delhi hotel on Friday morning.
The Dalai Lama sat down with his ‚Äúold trusted friend,‚Äù former U.S. President Barack Obama , to discuss promoting peace in a world ‚Äútorn by strife and violence.‚ÄùHis Holiness the Dalai Lama meeting with former US President Barack Obama in New Delhi, India on December 1, 2017.
(Photo by Tenzin Taklha) pic.twitter.com/zGECQLJLcF‚ÄúIt was very good,‚Äù said the Dalai Lama of the meeting, according to a report by the Central Tibetan Administration (CTA), the official organ of the Dalai Lama‚Äôs government in exile.
We should fulfil our aspiration for world peace.

TEXT:
The 82-year-old Tibetan spiritual leader met with Obama at a New Delhi hotel on Friday morning. He later shared a photograph on Twitter showing the two men in mid-discussion.

The Dalai Lama sat down with his ‚Äúold trusted friend,‚Äù former U.S. President Barack Obama , to discuss promoting peace in a world ‚Äútorn by strife and violence.‚Äù

His Holiness the Dalai Lama meeting with former US President Barack Obama in New Delhi, India on December 1, 2017. (Photo by Tenzin Taklha) pic.twitter.com/zGECQLJLcF

‚ÄúIt was very good,‚Äù said the Dalai Lama of the meeting, according to a report by the Central Tibetan Administration (CTA), the official organ of the Dalai Lama‚Äôs government in exile. ‚ÄúI think we are really two old trusted friend[s]. I mentioned to him that now time has come for us to promote the sense of oneness among seven billion human beings. It is sad to see there are so much differences among people.‚Äù

As CNN noted, the meeting marked the sixth time the Dalai Lama and Obama, both Nobel Peace Prize laureates, have met in person. They last met at the White House in June 2016 when Obama was still president.

Kasur Tempa Tsering, a representative for the Dalai Lama, said the two men ‚Äúdwelled on various topics pertaining to promoting peace in today‚Äôs world torn by strife and violence‚Äù during their 45-minute meeting.

‚ÄúTo Obama, His Holiness said, ‚ÄôYou are not only a former US president but you are a Nobel laureate, you are young and you can do a lot. We should fulfil our aspiration for world peace. Maybe my generation will not see the results, but your generation will definitely see the results,‚Äù Tsering said.

The meeting comes about two months after the Dalai Lama expressed concern about the U.S. becoming more ‚Äúselfish‚Äù and ‚Äúnationalist‚Äù under President Donald Trump.

‚ÄúThe present president, in the very beginning he mentioned ‚ÄòAmerica first.‚Äô That sounded in my ear not very nice,‚Äù he said at a conference in October, according to the Washington Post.
TITLE: Dalai Lama Meets 'Old Trusted Friend' Barack Obama In India To Discuss World Peace

SUMMARY:
Triple J has announced it will no longer celebrate its annual Hottest 100 on Australia Day, moving the countdown one day later to January 27 after a public campaign to change the date.
As the public broadcaster representing all Australians, triple j and the ABC doesn't take a view in the discussions," Triple J said in a statement.
"However, in recent years the Hottest 100 has become a symbol in the debate about Australia Day.
Triple J shared results from two surveys it had conducted, to find attitudes among listeners to keeping or changing the date of the Hottest 100.
Original, has been one of the loudest voices calling for Triple J to reconsider holding the Hottest 100 on Australia Day, and changing the date of Australia Day itself altogether.
TEXT:
Triple J has announced it will no longer celebrate its annual Hottest 100 on Australia Day, moving the countdown one day later to January 27 after a public campaign to change the date.

The national youth radio station has counted down listeners' top 100 favourite songs of the previous on January 26 since 1998, bringing it in line with the national public holiday.

However, in recent years Triple J has been under pressure from Indigenous groups and musicians to not hold the celebration on Australia Day, as debate continues as to whether the national holiday should be moved to a date less antagonistic to Australia's first people.

On Monday, Triple J announced how the Hottest 100 would be run in 2018, saying that the countdown would happen on the fourth weekend of January each year instead of the strict January 26 date.

triple j's Hottest 100 is moving to a new date and here's whyhttps://t.co/BwE9JvOlic pic.twitter.com/r3KGnNKPXK November 27, 2017

"It's fair to say there's been increasing debate around 26 January and there are a lot of perspectives on what it means to different Australians. As the public broadcaster representing all Australians, triple j and the ABC doesn't take a view in the discussions," Triple J said in a statement.

"However, in recent years the Hottest 100 has become a symbol in the debate about Australia Day. The Hottest 100 wasn't created as an Australia Day celebration. It was created to celebrate your favourite songs of the past year. It should be an event that everyone can enjoy together ‚Äì for both the musicians whose songs make it in and for everyone listening in Australia and around the world. This is really important to us."

Triple J had resisted calls to move the date in 2016, but said the timing was under review.

"We want the Hottest 100 to be an inclusive and respectful event for all Australians, including all the incredible Indigenous artists making great Australian music, and the listeners from all cultural backgrounds who love it," the station said last year.

Triple J shared results from two surveys it had conducted, to find attitudes among listeners to keeping or changing the date of the Hottest 100. Nearly 65,000 fans responded to one survey, with 60 percent saying they supported moving the date, while another smaller survey of 759 people found 55 percent supported a change while 22 percent "don't care either way", while just 24 percent disapproved of a date change.

"Ultimately, our research and your feedback shows that most of you are behind a move for the Hottest 100. For those that don't want the date to move, we have heard you," Triple J wrote.

"We've listened closely to how all of you felt about the Hottest 100 and responded with what's the right choice, right now, that reflects the variety of complicated views. And it's a move backed up by more than those survey results."

Indigenous rapper Briggs, as part of his award-winning duo A.B. Original, has been one of the loudest voices calling for Triple J to reconsider holding the Hottest 100 on Australia Day, and changing the date of Australia Day itself altogether. In a popular 'Like A Version' cover of Paul Kelly's hit 'Dumb Things', he even predicted "the date's changing". On Monday, he marked the news quickly:

Key dates for Hottest 100, 2018:
TITLE: Triple J Won't Do The Hottest 100 On Australia Day, Moving It To New Date

Spero che questo vostro viaggio motivi a pensare che la sinistra √® viva, ricca, plurale.
Spero che possiate trovare le parole giuste, e assieme alle parole il tono, lo stile, per ricostruire in quella parte della sinistra la coscienza di sentirsi accolti dentro una comunit√† nuova.
Con alcuni di voi, direi molti, ci conosciamo da anni.
Diversi ‚Äì non tutti, ma diversi tra voi ‚Äì hanno militato nel Pd.

TEXT:
Cari Compagni che vi riunite domani a Roma per dar vita a "Una nuova proposta", vorrei dirvi nel modo pi√π sincero una cosa semplice. Spero che questo vostro viaggio motivi a pensare che la sinistra √® viva, ricca, plurale. Spero che possiate trovare le parole giuste, e assieme alle parole il tono, lo stile, per ricostruire in quella parte della sinistra la coscienza di sentirsi accolti dentro una comunit√† nuova.

Con alcuni di voi, direi molti, ci conosciamo da anni. Penso di sapere quale passione sorregga le scelte che state compiendo. Diversi ‚Äì non tutti, ma diversi tra voi ‚Äì hanno militato nel Pd. Quel partito lo hanno pensato, voluto, costruito, sino per√≤ a maturare la convinzione che si trattasse di un progetto incompiuto. E allora hanno fatto quel passo deciso verso l'uscita. Nei loro confronti ‚Äì verso ciascuno di loro ‚Äì ho avuto e avr√≤ sempre rispetto e considerazione.

Io quella decisione non l'ho condivisa, per i tempi, le forme, alcune delle ragioni di fondo. Non da ora vedo i limiti che hanno segnato la mia parte, ma assieme vivo la realt√† di donne e uomini che continuano a riversare in quel partito la loro sincerit√† e speranza di una sinistra vincente. Insomma vedo le cose buone, importanti, che in questi anni si sono fatte e penso che non si debba rimuovere ci√≤ che la forza pi√π grande esprime e rappresenta nella coscienza di milioni di persone per bene, progressiste, di sinistra.

Allo stesso tempo non mi nascondo la durezza di una rottura che ci accompagner√† nei mesi della pi√π difficile campagna elettorale degli ultimi anni. La considero una prova faticosa e non posso arrendermi all'idea che mentre la destra ‚Äì quella vera, pensante, di nuovo a volte violenta ‚Äì incalza, questa nostra met√† del campo marci divisa. E allora credo conteranno molto i modi che segneranno il percorso davanti a noi. La capacit√† delle classi dirigenti, vecchie e nuove, di lavorare per ricostruire il perimetro largo di un'alleanza che pu√≤ e deve riscoprire il senso profondo della sua unit√†.

Ma il primo piccolo passo per immaginare che qualcosa di simile domani possa compiersi √® mirare lo sguardo sul buono che per la sua parte ciascuno coltiva e pensare che sar√† un bene per tutti ‚Äì per voi che mollate gli ormeggi e anche per quanti hanno scelto di stare o rimanere altrove ‚Äì dicevo, sar√† un bene per tutti se la sinistra rafforzer√† s√© stessa, rinnover√† i suoi principi e li collocher√† nella storia del dopo.

Che sia una buona giornata.
TITLE: Ultimo appello ai compagni della sinistra

SUMMARY:
Quelle le√ßon que la d√©cision europ√©enne d'autoriser le pesticide glyphosate pour cinq ans suppl√©mentaires!
"L'Europe qui prot√®ge" ne prot√®ge ni la sant√© des paysans, ni celle des consommateurs, ni la qualit√© des cours d'eau et des sols.
Le glyphosate est "probablement canc√©rig√®ne" selon le centre de recherche sur le cancer de l'Organisation mondiale de la sant√©... mais il est autoris√© par l'UE!
C'est la Commission europ√©enne, et elle seule, qui a l'initiative des lois, r√®glements et autorisations comme celle sur le glyphosate.
Comme apr√®s le martyr de la Gr√®ce sur le plan financier et mon√©taire, personne ne pourra dire qu'il ne savait pas √† quoi s'attendre.
TEXT:
Quelle le√ßon que la d√©cision europ√©enne d'autoriser le pesticide glyphosate pour cinq ans suppl√©mentaires! C'est une p√©dagogie de masse sur ce qu'est l'Union europ√©enne, ses r√®gles et ses rapports de forces. Et donc sur la n√©cessit√© de rompre avec cela si l'on veut assumer les devoirs humains qui se pr√©sentent √† nous en mati√®re √©cologique, sociale et d√©mocratique.

Cette d√©cision a un m√©rite. Elle l√®ve toute ambigu√Øt√©, s'il en restait une, sur le but r√©el de l'Union europ√©enne et de ceux qui la dirigent, √† la Commission comme parmi les gouvernements nationaux. "L'Europe qui prot√®ge" ne prot√®ge ni la sant√© des paysans, ni celle des consommateurs, ni la qualit√© des cours d'eau et des sols. Le glyphosate est "probablement canc√©rig√®ne" selon le centre de recherche sur le cancer de l'Organisation mondiale de la sant√©... mais il est autoris√© par l'UE! "L'Europe qui prot√®ge" prot√®ge en fait seulement les profits de Monsanto. Et par-l√† m√™me ceux du g√©ant allemand de la chimie Bayer qui rach√®te le chimiste am√©ricain pour former le num√©ro un mondial.

Au passage, les citoyens europ√©ens d√©couvrent ce que peu savent. Dans l'UE, le Parlement europ√©en n'est pas un vrai parlement. Il n'a pas le pouvoir d'imposer son point de vue. C'est la Commission europ√©enne, et elle seule, qui a l'initiative des lois, r√®glements et autorisations comme celle sur le glyphosate. C'est toujours √† partir d'une proposition de la Commission que le d√©bat a lieu. Dans le cas du glyphosate elle avait m√™me le pouvoir de trancher en dernier recours s'il n'y avait pas eu de majorit√© des Etats pour soutenir l'autorisation du glyphosate pour cinq ans. Et tout cela, m√™me si le Parlement europ√©en a vot√© une demande de renouvellement pour cinq ans assortie d'une interdiction au-del√†. La Commission n'en a pas tenu compte, comme elle en a le droit. Et elle a donc propos√©, et obtenu des Etats, une autorisation pour cinq ans assortie de rien du tout, avec la possibilit√© de proposer une nouvelle autorisation dans cinq ans!

Cet √©pisode est aussi une p√©dagogie du rapport de forces √† destination de tous ceux qui les ignorent de bonne foi, ou les nient par na√Øvet√© ou par aveuglement. L'Allemagne d'Angela Merkel, repr√©sent√©e par le ministre de l'agriculture membre du m√™me parti que la chanceli√®re, a chang√© de position au moment d√©cisif. Jusqu'ici elle s'abstenait. Mais √† l'heure de sauver les profits de Monsanto et demain Bayer, elle a vot√© pour la r√©autorisation du glyphosate. Entendre certains d√©put√©s europ√©ens EELV avouer qu'ils "ne s'attendaient pas √† ce que l'Allemagne change de position" est stup√©fiant. Les lecteurs du livre Le Hareng de Bismarck de Jean-Luc M√©lenchon savent eux combien le gouvernement allemand fait passer les int√©r√™ts de ses grandes firmes industrielles avant toute consid√©ration morale, sanitaire ou √©cologique. Car ce n'est pas la premi√®re fois que le gouvernement allemand agit ainsi. Il l'a d√©j√† fait encore r√©cemment sur les perturbateurs endocriniens ou la r√©glementation anti-pollution automobile. Si les lobbies gagnent √† Bruxelles, c'est aussi parce qu'ils y ont de solides appuis politiques √† la Commission mais aussi nationaux.

La d√©cision montre aussi l'absence totale d'influence d'Emmanuel Macron en Europe. A vouloir jouer le bon √©l√®ve de l'int√©gration europ√©enne et sans jamais pr√©voir de "plan B" au cas o√π les positions fran√ßaises ne l'emporteraient pas, il ne fait peur √† personne. Et il se laisse donc marcher sur les pieds avec le sourire. Le cocorico pouss√© au sujet des travailleurs d√©tach√©s il y a un mois avait d√©j√† mis la puce √† l'oreille. Macron n'avait en r√©alit√© rien obtenu pour n'avoir rien demand√© de d√©cisif. L√†, c'est une d√©faite avec en prime l'abandon en rase campagne par le pr√©tendu partenaire du "couple franco-allemand". Que d'illusions dissip√©es!

Il faut dire que le gouvernement fran√ßais n'avait aucune chance de convaincre. Sans rapport de force car sans plan B, sans position unique du gouvernement fran√ßais et sans exemple montr√© en France, on se demande bien comment M. Hulot esp√©rait convaincre les Allemands et la Commission. Le gouvernement Macron-Philippe n'a pas montr√© par ses mesures nationales sa volont√© de transformation agricole: l'autorisation d'un nouvel insecticide tueur d'abeille ou l'arr√™t des aides au maintien des exploitations agricoles bios donnent clairement le sentiment inverse. Le ministre de l'Agriculture fran√ßais s'est d'ailleurs r√©joui de la d√©cision europ√©enne preuve du double-jeu de M. Macron. Un peu de s√©rieux et de coh√©rence n'aurait pas pu nuire dans la discussion europ√©enne.

Que faire d√©sormais? D√©sob√©ir. M. Macron affirme sur twitter vouloir interdire l'usage du glyphosate en France dans trois ans. Mais d√©j√† son Premier ministre laisse entendre que cette d√©cision √©l√©mentaire et d√©j√† tardive ne serait en fait prise que si les autres pays europ√©ens s'engagent aussi sur l'interdiction. Monsieur Philippe est-il au courant qu'ils viennent majoritairement de voter l'inverse? Mais si le Premier ministre freine des quatre fers, c'est qu'interdire l'usage du glyphosate par les agriculteurs fran√ßais ne suffira pas. Pour √©viter toute concurrence d√©loyale et prot√©ger les consommateurs, il faudrait aussi interdire l'importation de produits cultiv√©s avec du glyphosate! Interdire ceux qui par exemple du Canada: il faudrait donc par exemple refuser l'accord CETA de libre-√©change avec le Canada que le gouvernement vient justement de laisser entrer en vigueur avant m√™me le vote de l'Assembl√©e nationale ou du peuple fran√ßais. Mais aussi interdire ceux cultiv√©s dans les autres pays de l'Union europ√©enne et donc rompre la libert√© de circulation des produits dans le "march√© unique". Le protectionnisme √©cologique est n√©cessaire, mais il ne peut se faire avec une passoire qui laisserait entrer les produits glyphosat√©s d'Allemagne ou de Pologne.

Voila comment un pesticide interroge l'ensemble de la politique europ√©enne du gouvernement et met √† nue la r√©alit√© de l'Union europ√©enne : Mme Merkel et la Commission du c√¥t√© de Monsanto, M. Macron sans influence, le Parlement europ√©en et les citoyens sans pouvoir, l'impossibilit√© d'interdire l'importation de produits au glyphosate en France sans rompre avec les r√®gles europ√©ennes. C'est assez terrible pour l'agriculture et les consommateurs. Mais c'est une p√©dagogie assez claire pour comprendre les positions de la France insoumise sur l'Union europ√©enne, la sortie des trait√©s et la n√©cessit√© d'une strat√©gie de rapport de force qui int√®gre un plan B si les choses tournent mal. Comme apr√®s le martyr de la Gr√®ce sur le plan financier et mon√©taire, personne ne pourra dire qu'il ne savait pas √† quoi s'attendre.

Matthias Taevel est l'auteur de Le Cauchemar europ√©en, comment s'en sortir ! (Editions Bruno Leprince)

HARC√àLEMENT - Il y a quelques mois, Eliza Hatch marchait dans la rue, √† Londres, quand un homme l'a d√©pass√©e en lui demandant de "sourire". Ces mots ont pouss√© cette photographe de 23 ans √† cr√©er un projet poignant sur le harc√®lement sexuel, judicieusement intitul√© Cheer Up Luv ("Un p'tit sourire, ma belle").

Cette s√©rie de photos montre des dizaines de femmes dans les diff√©rents endroits o√π elles se sont fait siffler ou harceler sexuellement. Chacune raconte son exp√©rience; beaucoup de ces agressions se sont produites dans des lieux publics: un trottoir, au coin de la rue, un banc...

Eliza Hatch raconte au HuffPost am√©ricain qu'apr√®s avoir entendu cet inconnu lui r√©clamer "un p'tit sourire", elle s'est sentie tr√®s en col√®re. "Cette phrase, que j'entends r√©guli√®rement, a fini par m'√©nerver √† tel point que j'ai eu besoin de faire quelque chose", confie-t-elle. "Cela m'a pouss√©e √† aborder le sujet du harc√®lement avec mes amies. Nous avons fini par √©changer sur nos exp√©riences pendant plus d'une heure, en parlant du harc√®lement sexuel comme si c'√©tait la chose la plus banale qui soit."

A post shared by Cheer Up Luv üå∏ (@cheerupluv) on Aug 2, 2017 at 1:58pm PDT

"Je me rendais au travail. Comme j'avais quelques minutes d'avance, je me suis install√©e sur un banc pas loin. Un type √©tait assis quelques bancs plus loin. Il s'est approch√©, il a sorti sa bite, et il a commenc√© √† se masturber en me regardant droit dans les yeux." - Krupa

La photographe explique avoir √©t√© incit√©e √† commencer ce projet apr√®s que ses amis de sexe masculin ont exprim√© leur "incr√©dulit√© et leur horreur" en apprenant qu'elle et ses amies √©taient si fr√©quemment victimes de harc√®lement sexuel. "Je me suis rendu compte que le probl√®me n'√©tait pas seulement le harc√®lement, mais aussi la prise de conscience de cette r√©alit√©", d√©clare-t-elle.

Elle ajoute que ses photos ont √©t√© tr√®s bien accueillies, et qu'un nombre incroyable de femmes de tous √¢ges, de toutes morphologies et de toutes origines veulent poser pour le projet. "Pour ces femmes, comme pour moi, √ßa a √©t√© une v√©ritable th√©rapie. La r√©action de mes mod√®les a √©t√© extr√™mement positive, car √ßa leur a permis de se r√©approprier ce qui leur √©tait arriv√©, et de transformer une situation dont elles avaient √©t√© les victimes en une situation o√π elles reprennent le pouvoir."

Elle esp√®re que cette s√©rie aidera les femmes √† faire entendre leur voix dans les discussions sur le harc√®lement de rue. "Ce projet est d√©di√© aux femmes qui y ont particip√©, et √† celles qui ont des exp√©riences √† partager sur le sujet", pr√©cise-t-elle. "Je veux donner une voix aux femmes et continuer √† sensibiliser l'opinion sur un probl√®me dont on parlait tr√®s peu jusqu'√† pr√©sent."

J'ai refus√© et j'ai essay√© de contourner la voiture, mais il a red√©marr√© pour me barrer le passage. J'ai essay√© de passer derri√®re mais il m'en a encore emp√™ch√©e. Il y avait des tas de si√®ges libres et il choisissait quand m√™me de rester debout devant moi. Tr√®s vite je n'ai plus eu qu'une seule id√©e: descendre √† la station suivante. "On sortait de bo√Æte avec des amies et ma copine, et on a d√©cid√© de prendre le bus pour aller ailleurs. Pendant qu'on l'attendait, un homme m'a abord√©e pour me draguer. "J'avais 15 ans. Je rentrais de l'√©cole √† pied comme tous les jours, en uniforme. Ce jour-l√†, un homme n'a pas arr√™t√© de m'envoyer des baisers depuis sa camionnette. J'ai d√©cid√© de l'ignorer parce que √ßa me r√©pugnait, mais il a continu√© √† m'en envoyer et √† faire des remarques d√©plac√©es. J'ai continu√© mon chemin et puis je me suis retourn√©e, et j'ai vu qu'il s'√©tait arr√™t√©. Il avait gar√© la camionnette, ouvert les porti√®res et se dirigeait droit sur moi. A mesure que nous avancions l'un vers l'autre, j'ai remarqu√© qu'il me fixait avec intensit√©, en d√©taillant mes jambes, ma robe d'√©t√©, mon d√©collet√©. Les douze d√©partements avaient √©t√© plac√©s le 1er d√©cembre en fin d'apr√®s-midi en vigilance orange neige et verglas en raison du "premier √©pisode neigeux remarquable de la saison".

TEXT:
METEO - Sept d√©partements demeurent en vigilance neige et verglas ce samedi 2 d√©cembre en fin de journ√©e et jusqu'√† samedi apr√®s-midi, en raison du "premier √©pisode neigeux remarquable de la saison", a annonc√© M√©t√©o France.

La vigilance orange concerne: les Alpes-de-Haute-Provence, les Alpes-Maritimes, les Bouches-du-Rh√¥ne, le Var, la Haute-Garonne, l'Ari√®ge et les Hautes-Pyr√©n√©es. La Haute-Corse a √©t√© de son c√¥t√© plac√©e en alerte orange pour pluie et inondations.

Sept d√©partements en vigilance orange neige et verglas

La fin de l'√©v√©nement pour les huit d√©partements est pr√©vue dimanche 3 d√©cembre √† 6h00 selon M√©t√©o-France. L'alerte neige et verglas a en revanche d√©j√† √©t√© lev√©e pour le Cantal, la Corr√®ze, la Creuse, la Haute-Loire, le Puy-de-D√¥me.

Les douze d√©partements avaient √©t√© plac√©s le 1er d√©cembre en fin d'apr√®s-midi en vigilance orange neige et verglas en raison du "premier √©pisode neigeux remarquable de la saison". Il continue de neiger sur l'ensemble des Alpes-de-Haute-Provence, avec localement des hauteurs relev√©es de 10 √† 15 cm.

De la neige en montagne

Dans l'int√©rieur des Alpes-Maritimes il neige au-dessus de 300 m avec une couche atteignant 15 cm, alors qu'il pleut sur la c√¥te. Dans l'int√©rieur varois, dans les plaines int√©rieures ainsi que sur le nord, il neige assez fort. Cette neige qui va encore tomber dans les prochaines heures, tient au sol avec par endroits de 5 √† 10 cm. Les neiges ont gagn√© √©galement une grande partie est des Bouches du Rh√¥ne.

Sur les Pyr√©n√©es, les averses de neige qui vont faiblir jusqu'en fin de matin√©e apporteront 4 √† 8 centim√®tres de neige au dessus de 500 m. En montagne, il devrait tomber 10 √† 20 cm sur l'ouest de la cha√Æne, 20 √† 30 cm sur l'est, selon les pr√©visionnistes.

Il va √©galement neiger en plaine dans le sud-ouest, on devrait trouver des traces de neige vers 150 m√®tres (Toulouse), et de 1 √† 3 centim√®tres √† 250 m√®tres.

Des pluies de plus en plus fortes en Haute-Corse

Sur le Mercantour et notamment les cr√™tes frontali√®res, les chutes de neige se prolongent tout samedi et les cumuls pourront atteindre 20 √† 40 cm. Sur une grande partie des Alpes-de-Haute-Provence: 5 √† 10 cm, localement jusqu'√† 20 cm de neige sont attendus. Dans les Bouches-du-Rh√¥ne, √† l'est d'une ligne Aix/Marseille : 2 √† 10 cm sont attendus. Quelques centim√®tres sont possibles sur les agglom√©rations d'Aix-en-Provence et de Marseille.

Enfin, en Haute-Corse, les pluies actuellement mod√©r√©es vont s'intensifier au cours des prochaines heures. Elles seront alors assez fortes sur les reliefs et les versants est des massifs. Sur les massifs, les cumuls attendus d'ici √† dimanche matin atteindront 150 √† 200 mm, 60 √† 100 mm sur la plaine littorale. Au-dessus de 1000 m, ces pr√©cipitations prendront la forme de neiges continues assez fortes.

Doch bis heute gibt es daf√ºr keine Hinweise

Malinka spricht jetzt dar√ºber, wie die Vorw√ºrfe sein Leben zerst√∂rten

Sergej Malinka ist heute 32 Jahre alt. Der Russe wird bald zum ersten Mal Vater, er f√ºhrt ein geregeltes Leben in Portugal. Doch das war nicht immer so.

2007 hatte die Polizei ihn beschuldigt, etwas mit dem Verschwinden des britischen M√§dchens Madeleine McCann zutun zu haben. Ab diesem Zeitpunkt nahm sein Leben eine dramatische Wende.

Malinka jobbte damals in einem Restaurant, war gerade mit seinen Eltern nach Portugal gezogen. Am Abend des 3. Mai, der Tag an dem Maddie McCann verschwand, gingen ihre Eltern Gerry und Kate McCann in das Restaurant "Ocean Club" essen - jenes Lokal, in dem Malinka arbeitete.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: R√§tselhafter zweiter Fall: Maddie McCann ist nicht das einzige Kind, das an der Algarve verschwunden ist

Sp√§ter am Abend war das dreij√§hrige M√§dchen verschwunden. Und Malinka r√ºckte ins Visier der Ermittler. Verd√§chtig machte ihn in den Augen der Polizei, dass er noch in der Nacht des Verschwindens von Maddie eine Stunde mit einem portugiesischen Gesch√§ftsmann telefonierte. Worum es in dem Telefonat ging, ist nicht bekannt. Dennoch wurde Malinka mehrmals verh√∂rt.

Auch seine Computer wurden untersucht. Hinweise auf ein Verbrechen fand die Polizei nicht. Schon bald galt er nicht mehr als ein Verd√§chtiger im Fall Maddie McCann.

"Ich habe alle verloren"

Doch da hatte die Abw√§rtsspirale schon Fahrt aufgenommen, die Medien waren auf ihn aufmerksam geworden.

Mit schlimmen Folgen f√ºr sein Privatleben.

Heute, 10 Jahre sp√§ter, spricht Malinka offen √ºber das, was ihm nach den Anschuldigungen passierte. Die Ereignisse verarbeitete er in seinem Buch "Kollateral-Schaden", das 2018 auf den Markt kommen soll.

"Ich wurde zu falschen Behauptungen und Anschuldigungen bez√ºglich ihres Verschwindens gezwungen. Ich habe alle verloren - Jobs, Freunde, Hoffnung", sagt Malinka √ºber die belastende Zeit, wie die britische Nachrichtenseite "Express" berichtet.

Auf sein Auto sei ein Brandanschlag ver√ºbt, auf den Gehsteig daneben das portugiesische Wort "Fala" gespr√ºht worden - auf deutsch bedeutet es "Sprich". In manchen Momenten habe er am "Rande der Verzweiflung" gestanden. "Ich war 22 Jahre alt, ein junger Mann, der alleine in einem fremden Land war", zitiert der "Express" Malinka.

Malinka habe irgendwann sogar um sein Leben gef√ºrchtet und sei f√ºr einige Zeit aus der Gegend weggezogen.

Nun, Jahre sp√§ter, will er wieder ein normales Leben f√ºhren: "Jetzt versuche ich, mir mein Leben aus den Tr√ºmmern dieses Ereignisses neu aufzubauen. Zehn Jahre sp√§ter werde ich zum ersten Mal Vater. Meine Familie ist mein Leben. Ich werde es nicht l√§nger zulassen, dass die L√ºgen anderer unsere Zukunft vergiften."



(ll)
TITLE: Einem Mann wurde vorgeworfen, Maddie McCann entf√ºhrt zu haben - jetzt bricht er sein Schweigen

SUMMARY:
The 2017 Word of the Year is complicit, says Dictionary.com.
"Lookups for the word complicit increased by nearly 300 percent in searches in 2017 as compared to 2016," Liz McMillan, CEO of Dictionary.com, said in a press release.
Dictionary.com cites many newsworthy 2017 moments that facilitated the use of complicit, including times when people called out the powerful for misdeeds and for silence in the face of wrongdoing.
Searches for the word complicit spiked during political happenings, Hollywood scandals and natural disasters, Dictionary.com said.
The year's first surge for the word was on March 12, after a "Saturday Night Live" sketch featuring Scarlett Johansson as Ivanka Trump in a perfume ad for a fictional scent called "Complicit."
TEXT:
The 2017 Word of the Year is complicit, says Dictionary.com.

Complicit, defined as "choosing to be involved in an illegal or questionable act, especially with others," was the annual pick of a word "indicative of larger trends that resonated throughout the year," the company said. The choice was made by the online dictionary's in-house experts ‚Äï lexicographers, the marketing and product teams, and the CEO.

"Lookups for the word complicit increased by nearly 300 percent in searches in 2017 as compared to 2016," Liz McMillan, CEO of Dictionary.com, said in a press release. "We continue to see a direct correlation between trending word lookups and current events, and we find it encouraging that our users are dedicated to understanding the language and words that pop up in the biggest news stories of the year."

Dictionary.com cites many newsworthy 2017 moments that facilitated the use of complicit, including times when people called out the powerful for misdeeds and for silence in the face of wrongdoing.

Searches for the word complicit spiked during political happenings, Hollywood scandals and natural disasters, Dictionary.com said. The year's first surge for the word was on March 12, after a "Saturday Night Live" sketch featuring Scarlett Johansson as Ivanka Trump in a perfume ad for a fictional scent called "Complicit." The satirical tagline for the fake beauty product was: "The fragrance for the woman who could stop all this, but won't."
TITLE: 'Complicit' Is The Word Of The Year, According To Dictionary.com

TEXT:
Star Wars has permeated practically every facet of our culture.

So what could possibly be next? A touring burlesque show complete with custom built costumes, movie props and a chorus line of dancing stormtroopers?

Check your local entertainment guide people, it's coming to a theatre near you.

From droid building workshops to heavy metal tribute bands - even a lightsaber academy that teaches special need kids valuable life skills.

SUBSCRIBE AND FOLLOW Get top stories and blog posts emailed to me each day. Newsletters may offer personalized content or advertisements. Learn more Newsletter Please enter a valid email address Thank you for signing up! You should receive an email to confirm your subscription shortly. There was a problem processing your signup; please try again later Facebook

Twitter

YouTube

Pinterest

Snapchat

Instagram

CLOSE

With Star Wars mania in hyperdrive, there's no letting up for the Empire Strips Back -- the Star Wars burlesque parody that is the brainchild of Sydney based creative director Russall S. Beattie.

"Our shows aren't gratuitous," Beattie told HuffPost Australia.

"Our audience is probably 50 percent female and we have age groups from 18 to 70."

Beattie designed the show for the small stage, but the public appetite for dominatrix Darth Vaders and gyrating Jedis saw the show expanding to larger venues.

And how do they get away with it?

Australia's parody laws provide the necessary safeguard against any objections Disney might have on copyright grounds.

"We are parody show, we have no affiliation with Disney whatsoever," Beattie said.

"You just have to respect the people who you are parodying. You can laugh along with them, not at them."

This respect for the source material is evident in the painstaking attention to detail put into the production.

To build the expanded show, Beattie assembled a team which included people who worked on the original Star Wars films.

For six months they designed and built all the costumes and props, bringing the iconic movie imagery to life.

"That's the biggest kick I got out of it, taking these things from my childhood that only existed in the scope of film, and making it work in real life," he said.

The Empire Strips Back is touring Australia now and a U.S. tour is being planned.

Check their website for dates.
TITLE: The Empire Strips Back: A Star Wars Burlesque Parody

SUMMARY:
Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and Prime Minister Justin Trudeau talk at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Aug. 31, 2016.
OTTAWA ‚Äî As Prime Minister Justin Trudeau prepares to travel to China next week, officials say Canada is still contemplating the challenges associated with pursuing a free trade deal between the two countries.
The prime minister leaves Saturday for his four-day trip ‚Äî a return visit that at least one analyst says is shaping up to be a very "ordinary" excursion.
China is anxious to start formal free trade talks after several rounds of exploratory discussions, but Canada is still assessing its position, officials say.
In announcing the trip earlier this week, Trudeau's office made no mention of free trade, and government officials have said no decision has been made on whether to pursue such negotiations.
TEXT:
Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and Prime Minister Justin Trudeau talk at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Aug. 31, 2016.

OTTAWA ‚Äî As Prime Minister Justin Trudeau prepares to travel to China next week, officials say Canada is still contemplating the challenges associated with pursuing a free trade deal between the two countries.

The prime minister leaves Saturday for his four-day trip ‚Äî a return visit that at least one analyst says is shaping up to be a very "ordinary" excursion.

"There are a number of considerations still to be had. The government is weighing the challenges and opportunities," a government official who briefed journalists on Friday said when asked about the possibility of Trudeau launching trade talks in Beijing.

Watch: Stephen Poloz weighs in on trade with China

The officials, speaking on condition of anonymity in accordance with the terms of Friday's briefing, say the focus of the trip will be deepening economic ties and attracting more Chinese investment to Canada.

Trudeau will meet Monday with Chinese Premier Xi Jingang and will also have meetings with senior Canadian and Chinese executives.

China is anxious to start formal free trade talks after several rounds of exploratory discussions, but Canada is still assessing its position, officials say.

The government recently released the results of consultations with more than 600 businesses, academics and civil society groups.

Some of those surveyed said a pact with China could kill Canadian jobs, including in manufacturing, and reduce the ability to compete against lax labour standards, lower environmental requirements and Chinese state subsidies.

"The trip has to be understood as an ordinary trip in extraordinary times," said Paul Evans of the Institute of Asian Research at the University of British Columbia.

Earlier:

Trudeau Visits China Trudeau Visits China



1 of 13 Share this slide:





Evans said Canada is likely biding its time amid the ongoing renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement, which reached an impasse earlier this fall when the United States tabled a series of proposals that Canada and Mexico deemed untenable.

"Canada will try and tread water for a little time longer," while the Chinese will be "increasingly frustrated on this," Evans said.

In announcing the trip earlier this week, Trudeau's office made no mention of free trade, and government officials have said no decision has been made on whether to pursue such negotiations.

"A strong relationship with China is essential to creating jobs, strengthening the middle class, and growing the Canadian economy," Trudeau said in statement.

"I look forward to meeting again with China's leaders to strengthen our relationship and set the stage for even greater trade and investment co-operation."

Canada intends to continue frank dialogue with China on topics like human rights and good governance, the statement said.
TITLE: Trudeau Not Planning To Start Up Free Trade Talks During China Trip

SUMMARY:
The Home Office told Satbir Singh, 30, on Friday it was wrong to deny his Indian wife Gitanjali, 31, a visa, after Singh wrote a widely read blog about his pain and anger about their initial refusal three days earlier.
‚ÄúMy wife is coming home because you gave me a platform to tell the world what is being done to people,‚Äù he told HuffPost.
They shouldn‚Äôt have to.‚ÄùSatbir Singh Satbir and Gitanjali Singh on their wedding day in London in 2014It has been a whirlwind week for the couple.
Satbir Singh‚ÄúThe [Home Office] has overlooked or misplaced key documents and declared that we have failed to submit them.
They moved to America where Satbir Singh pursued a scholarship to study Gitanjali Singh worked for the Clinton Health Access Initiative.
TEXT:
A man whose wife was rejected for a visa to live in Britain in error has called it ‚Äúoutrageous‚Äù that it took the publicity he drummed up, including by writing a HuffPost UK blog, to reverse the decision. The Home Office told Satbir Singh, 30, on Friday it was wrong to deny his Indian wife Gitanjali, 31, a visa, after Singh wrote a widely read blog about his pain and anger about their initial refusal three days earlier. ‚ÄúMy wife is coming home because you gave me a platform to tell the world what is being done to people,‚Äù he told HuffPost. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm incredibly grateful... but this isn‚Äôt how government is supposed to work.‚Äù Singh added: ‚ÄúI find it outrageous this is how errors are brought to their attention. Most people can‚Äôt do this. Most people can‚Äôt write something for HuffPost and bring pressure to bear. They shouldn‚Äôt have to.‚Äù

Satbir Singh Satbir and Gitanjali Singh on their wedding day in London in 2014

It has been a whirlwind week for the couple. Singh learned on Monday the Home Office had reached a decision. He was so sure she would be coming to London he ordered a ‚ÄúWelcome Home‚Äù banner off Amazon. On Tuesday, he received the rejection. He said it left him ‚Äúin shock‚Äù. He was sure it was a mistake in processing their 1,103-page application and defining his income to assess whether he earned the ¬£18,600 Britons must if they want to bring a spouse from outside the European Economic Area (EEA). On Wednesday, he picked up the keys to the Kilburn flat they were due to rent together. ‚ÄúAs a husband, I am broken,‚Äù he wrote that day in his blog.

I find it outrageous this is how errors are brought to their attention. Satbir Singh

‚ÄúThe [Home Office] has overlooked or misplaced key documents and declared that we have failed to submit them. ‚ÄúThey have applied the incorrect sections of the law and declared that we fail to satisfy them, and all this with almost complete impunity. Four different lawyers have confirmed that the Home Office has made a mistake.‚Äù Their lawyer had told them an appeal could take up to a year. The lawyer had been due to respond to the Home Office on Monday, Singh said. But on Friday, two days after his blog was published, Singh said he received an automated email acknowledging the mistake and apologising. The Home Office does not comment on individual cases but confirmed it had reversed its original decision. The couple met studying at SOAS in London in 2010 and were married in 2014.

They moved to America where Satbir Singh pursued a scholarship to study Gitanjali Singh worked for the Clinton Health Access Initiative. But her visa forced her to leave Washington for Delhi in September 2016, the last time the couple lived together. ‚ÄúIt is a year that has seen us forced to live on opposite sides of the world, in different time zones and climates, each of us stealing moments at odd hours to be there on the phone when the other one woke up or went to sleep,‚Äù Satbir Singh wrote in his blog. He returned to Britain in January and worked freelance as a human rights consultant until September, when he became chief executive of the Joint Council for the Welfare of Immigrants, which campaigns against the visa rules. The transition from self-employment complicated their visa application, which requires evidence of six months‚Äô earnings. She had stayed in her job, working remotely, and the visa application included the fact this work would continue when she came to Britain. But, in such cases, the spouse‚Äôs income does not count if they are working abroad.
TITLE: Home Office Admits It Was Wrong To Reject Visa For British Man's Wife After HuffPost Blog

SUMMARY:
Labor senator Sam Dastyari warned Chinese Communist Party-linked political donor Huang Xiangmo last year that his phone was likely tapped by government agencies, including the US government.
Before the two spoke, Mr Dastyari gave Mr Huang counter-surveillance advice, saying they should leave their phones inside and go outside to speak.
SHAREShare on Facebook SHAREShare on Twitter TWEETLink Senator Sam Dastyari warned Huang Xiangmo his phone might be tapped.
Photo: Ryan StuartThose same media reports also detailed dealings between Mr Dastyari and Mr Huang.
Mr Dastyari responded: "I reject any assertion that I did anything other than put to Mr Huang gossip being spread by journalists."
TEXT:
Labor senator Sam Dastyari warned Chinese Communist Party-linked political donor Huang Xiangmo last year that his phone was likely tapped by government agencies, including the US government.

Before the two spoke, Mr Dastyari gave Mr Huang counter-surveillance advice, saying they should leave their phones inside and go outside to speak.

The face-to-face meeting between the pair in the grounds of Mr Huang's Mosman mansion in Sydney last October came several weeks after Mr Dastyari quit the frontbench over his dealings with Mr Huang.

It also occurred after ASIO briefed senior political figures, including from the Australian Labor Party, that Mr Huang was of interest to the agency over his opaque links to the Chinese government.

SHARE

Share on Facebook SHARE

Share on Twitter TWEET

Link Senator Sam Dastyari warned Huang Xiangmo his phone might be tapped. Photo: Ryan Stuart

Security agencies have the capacity to use mobile phones as surveillance devices without a user's knowledge.

A Canberra source with knowledge of the meeting said on background that Mr Dastyari blamed the US government for the scandal that earlier enveloped him and Mr Huang and said he was the subject of surveillance, including by the US government.

Advertisement

Details of the phone tap warning and other dealings involving the pair have been collected by national security officials, Fairfax Media has confirmed, and the revelations are likely to spark debate about sweeping reforms proposed by the Turnbull government to counter foreign interference in Australia.

Attorney-General George Brandis said the revelation raised questions about Mr Dastyari's loyalty.

SHARE

Share on Facebook SHARE

Share on Twitter TWEET

Link Huang Xiangmo's Mosman mansion on Sydney's north shore. Photo: HuwLambert.com

"This comes at a time when members and senators are under intense scrutiny over whether they hold dual citizenship. Of the 226 Australians elected at the 2016 federal election, the person whose allegiance to Australia is most in question is Sam Dastyari," Mr Brandis said.

The Mosman meeting occurred more than a month after media reports in early September last year that ASIO's top spy, Duncan Lewis, had warned Labor "that some of their donors had strong links to the Chinese Government".

SHARE

Share on Facebook SHARE

Share on Twitter TWEET

Link Political donor Huang Xiangmo. Photo: Ryan Stuart

Those same media reports also detailed dealings between Mr Dastyari and Mr Huang. Among them were that Mr Huang had paid a $5000 legal bill for Mr Dastyari, and that Mr Huang had told a Chinese Communist Party newspaper that "political demands and political donations" should be linked.

Also among the revelations that damaged Mr Dastyari were comments he reportedly made at a press conference with Mr Huang that contradicted Labor policy on the South China Sea, and echoed Beijing's policy position.

SHARE

Share on Facebook SHARE

Share on Twitter TWEET

Link Mr Huang's Mosman house, scene of his October meeting with Senator Dastyari. Photo: HuwLambert.com

These events led to Mr Dastyari's resignation from the Labor frontbench on September 7 last year.

Two Labor sources have also confirmed that, shortly after these events, Opposition Leader Bill Shorten warned Mr Dastyari through a "back channel" that ASIO had concerns about Mr Huang. Mr Shorten's office declined to answer questions about if or when this occurred, although a source with first-hand knowledge of the ASIO warning relayed to Mr Dastyari said it was generic and did not contain any classified information known to Mr Shorten.

SHARE

Share on Facebook SHARE

Share on Twitter TWEET

Link Huang Xiangmo with Opposition Leader Bill Shorten in 2013. Photo: James Brickwood

On Monday, Fairfax Media asked Mr Dastyari why he had told Mr Huang his phone was tapped, and why he advised him to move outside his house and not to speak near his phone.

Mr Dastyari responded: "I reject any assertion that I did anything other than put to Mr Huang gossip being spread by journalists."

SHARE

Share on Facebook SHARE

Share on Twitter TWEET

Link Huang Xiangmo with former prime minister Kevin Rudd. Photo: Supplied

Fairfax Media also asked Mr Dastyari why he met Mr Huang in person, rather than calling him, and why he thought a face-to-face meeting was appropriate weeks after the extensive public reporting about ASIO's concerns regarding Chinese Communist Party-connected donors.

Mr Dastyari said: "After the events of last year, I spoke to Mr Huang to tell him that I did not think it was appropriate that we have future contact. I thought it was a matter of common courtesy to say this face to face."

SHARE

Share on Facebook SHARE

Share on Twitter TWEET

Link Huang Xiangmo and Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull. Photo: Fairfax Media

Mr Dastyari has since begun his public rehabilitation, and was promoted to deputy senate whip in February.

Mr Dastyari said on Monday: "I have never received a security agency briefing, or received any classified information about any matter, ever. I've never passed on any protected information ‚Äì I've never been in possession of any."

SHARE

Share on Facebook SHARE

Share on Twitter TWEET

Link Huang Xiangmo with Foreign Minister Julie Bishop. Photo: Supplied

His statement did not address what fellow Labor officials had told him about Mr Huang.

Mr Huang, a billionaire property developer, has close ties to the Chinese consulate in Sydney and, until the weekend, headed a Sydney organisation aligned with the Chinese Communist Party's political lobbying and propaganda agency, the United Front Work Department.

On Saturday, Mr Huang stepped down as chairman of the Australian Council for the Promotion of the Peaceful Reunification of China (ACPPRC), and was lauded as a "banner" and likened to a patriotic flag who had made "heroic achievements" in the past year.

On September 14, 2016, weeks prior to the Mosman meeting, US ambassador John Berry said the US was concerned about Chinese government involvement in Australian politics, in remarks reported in connection to Mr Dastyari's dealings with Mr Huang.

On September 28, also prior to the meeting, Mr Huang dispatched members of the ACPPRC for a meeting in Beijing with a senior Chinese government official, who directed the members to "make allies to obtain international support" and contribute to the "great revitalisation of the Chinese nation".

ASIO began an assessment of Mr Huang's citizenship application in early 2016. The application remains blocked by ASIO and, earlier this year, national security officials interviewed Mr Huang at a secure Sydney CBD location.

Fairfax Media and Four Corners have previously revealed that after the citizenship request first stalled in early 2016, Mr Huang asked Mr Dastyari to intervene on his behalf. Mr Dastyari or his office called immigration officials four times in the first six months of 2016, but the senator has described this contact as routine.

The Turnbull government is planning to introduce news laws this year to counter foreign interference from Beijing and other nations and require agents or official advocates of foreign governments to register under a foreign agents registration act. The latter reform may concern ex-senior Liberal and Labor figures who work for companies or institutions controlled or directed by Beijing or its proxies.

A former intelligence officer told Fairfax Media that the instruction to Mr Huang to talk not within the vicinity of his phone amounts to counter-surveillance advice. Mr Dastyari is a security-conscious member of federal parliament who, along with many colleagues, uses encrypted applications to communicate.
TITLE: Labor senator Sam Dastyari warned wealthy Chinese donor Huang Xiangmo his phone was bugged

SUMMARY:
A senior official on President Donald Trump‚Äôs transition team suggested that Russia had ‚Äúthrown‚Äù the U.S. presidential election in Trump‚Äôs favor in a December 2016 email thread leaked to the New York Times and published Saturday.
The emails contradict White House lawyer Ty Cobb‚Äôs claims that Michael Flynn, Trump‚Äôs former national security adviser, acted independently when he reached out to Russian officials during Trump‚Äôs transition to presidency.
‚ÄúIf there is a tit-for-tat escalation Trump will have difficulty improving relations with Russia, which has just thrown the U.S.A. election to him,‚Äù McFarland wrote, according to the Times.
As we said in the story, it‚Äôs no clear that she is saying she believed that election had been thrown.
Trump has called for friendlier relations with Russia and continuously denies claims that his election campaign colluded with Russia during last year‚Äôs presidential election.
TEXT:
A senior official on President Donald Trump‚Äôs transition team suggested that Russia had ‚Äúthrown‚Äù the U.S. presidential election in Trump‚Äôs favor in a December 2016 email thread leaked to the New York Times and published Saturday.

The emails contradict White House lawyer Ty Cobb‚Äôs claims that Michael Flynn, Trump‚Äôs former national security adviser, acted independently when he reached out to Russian officials during Trump‚Äôs transition to presidency.

Hours after the Obama administration imposed sanctions against Russia for its meddling in the 2016 presidential election, Trump‚Äôs former Deputy National Security Adviser KT McFarland suggested that the transition team would need to strengthen its relationship with Russia, according to email exchanges obtained by or described by unnamed sources to the Times.

The sanctions, McFarland noted in the email, appeared to be the outgoing administration‚Äôs attempt to discredit Trump‚Äôs victory in the election and would make it more difficult for the incoming president to improve the U.S.‚Äôs relationship with Russia.

‚ÄúIf there is a tit-for-tat escalation Trump will have difficulty improving relations with Russia, which has just thrown the U.S.A. election to him,‚Äù McFarland wrote, according to the Times.

‚ÄúIf there is a tit-for-tat escalation Trump will have difficulty improving relations with Russia, which has just thrown the U.S.A. election to him.‚Äù An excerpt from McFarland's email, according to the Times.

As Times reporter Michael S. Schmidt noted in the story and later on Twitter, it‚Äôs not clear if McFarland believed that Russia threw the election in Trump‚Äôs favor, but a White House lawyer told the paper on Friday that she was only saying Democrats were trying to make it appear that way.

.@McFaul See attached. As we said in the story, it‚Äôs no clear that she is saying she believed that election had been thrown. And WH lawyer in story said she was referring to how Dems portrayed it. pic.twitter.com/cjXNpCKIJO ‚Äî Michael S. Schmidt (@nytmike) December 2, 2017

The leaked emails show how Trump‚Äôs transition team worked to ease relations with Russia after former President Barack Obama attempted to punish the country for reportedly interfering in the U.S. election.

These efforts would include Flynn reaching out to Russian ambassador Sergey I. Kislyak to discuss the sanctions hours after they were placed, McFarland wrote in an email, according to the Times. Flynn later resigned from his post in February following revelations that he lied about his conversations with the Russian ambassador.

On Friday, Flynn pleaded guilty to lying to the FBI about his contacts with the Russian government, including his conversation with Kislyak about the sanctions. After news of Flynn‚Äôs guilty plea spread, Trump tweeted that he had to fire Flynn because he knew Flynn lied to Vice President Michael Pence and the FBI.

I had to fire General Flynn because he lied to the Vice President and the FBI. He has pled guilty to those lies. It is a shame because his actions during the transition were lawful. There was nothing to hide! ‚Äî Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) December 2, 2017

On the same day Flynn pleaded guilty, the Associated Press identified McFarland as the unnamed senior official in court papers who is said to have talked to Flynn about what he would say to Russian officials during a discussion on the Obama administration‚Äôs sanctions.

Trump has called for friendlier relations with Russia and continuously denies claims that his election campaign colluded with Russia during last year‚Äôs presidential election.

Cobbs responded to Flynn‚Äôs guilty plea by saying it implicates no one other than Flynn himself.
TITLE: Senior Trump Transition Official Suggested Russia 'Threw' Election In Leaked Email: Report

SUMMARY:
"The problem is, what happens at the Christmas party definitely doesn‚Äôt stay at the Christmas party."
The work Christmas party is notorious for people getting a little too excited and letting more than their hair down.
The problem is, what happens at the Christmas party definitely doesn't stay at the Christmas party.
So, as you head off to your work Christmas party this year, plan to have fun but to also keep it tidy.
Vomiting at the Christmas party, especially where people can see you, is likely to be a problem for your reputation.
TEXT:
"The problem is, what happens at the Christmas party definitely doesn‚Äôt stay at the Christmas party."

The work Christmas party is notorious for people getting a little too excited and letting more than their hair down. While some of things people get up to are hilarious others are dumb, or just downright dangerous. The problem is, what happens at the Christmas party definitely doesn't stay at the Christmas party. Your antics will follow you back to work and no doubt impact your reputation, if not career.

So, as you head off to your work Christmas party this year, plan to have fun but to also keep it tidy. No doubt your HR department will have plenty to do in the new year without you adding to their load.

Eight things people have done that I highly recommend you avoid are listed below. No prizes for guessing, excessive alcohol consumption was involved in most.

What not to do at your work Christmas party:

1. Fall over.

Of course, we all have accidents but if you fall over while drinking, it's not a good look. This one can be especially problematic if you're in sight of someone in a position to influence your career. Even staggering a little can draw unwanted attention to your intoxicated state.

2. Throw up.

Vomiting at the Christmas party, especially where people can see you, is likely to be a problem for your reputation. Expect to be highly unpopular come Monday if you struggled to hold down your alcohol and dinner. Eat before you drink and pace yourself.

3. Break things.

Overly boisterous behaviour at the Christmas party usually ends in tears. Broken bones, bruised egos and damaged property too easily happen when people let things get out of hand. Climbing on things is usually where the trouble starts.

Unless you're there for an organised team-building event and are asked to, climbing on tables, chairs, photocopiers and any other object not made for standing on, is probably not a good idea. If you've been drinking it's definitely not.

4. Reveal too much.

An accidental undies 'reveal' due to an expertly executed pirouette on the dance floor may be okay, but ending up with your dress above your head because you're drunk and have fallen over definitely isn't. Think carefully about the culture of your organisation and tone of the event before choosing what you'll wear. Some outfits are best left for a nightclub.

5. Get naked.

No, the nudie run definitely isn't a good Christmas party idea. Neither is having sex in the bathroom or skinny dipping in the ocean. No matter how amorous or free-spirited things become, keep your clothes on.

6. Steal grog.

Accept when the party is over, that it's over. Apart from it being against the law, it's really not okay to take without asking. Especially when you have already been given so much. This one happens a lot. The bar is closed, the crowd is being moved along and someone decides it's a good idea to stock up on beverage supplies.

7. Get 'agro'.

No one likes the person who gets aggressive and spoils everyone's fun. If you tend to get angry when you drink, then don't drink. It really is that simple. If you have a gripe with another member of team, choose to stay away from them if you can't keep things civil. Picking a fight at work is never okay and that extends to when you're at a work function.

8. Lecture the boss.

It really does make me laugh how often people choose to give their manager or CEO constructive feedback while at the Christmas party. Of course being open to feedback is important but most people aren't that open to hearing it when you're slurring your words or being overly opinionated.

Contemplate the reaction of the CEO I know who was told by a member of his team: "You really could be a much nicer guy, then people would want to work for you".

Let's face it. Work Christmas parties wouldn't be anywhere near as much fun if people didn't let go just a little. The last thing we want is for everyone to be all serious and 'buttoned up'. It's definitely a time to relax and have fun, just remember it's a work event so a modicum of decorum is in order.
TITLE: What Not To Do At Your Work Christmas Party

L'obbligo per le tv di rispettare quote di investimenti e di programmazione di opere italiane, varr√† anche per lo streaming: "Anche Netflix o altre piattaforme come Amazon Prime avranno gli stessi obblighi, compatibilmente a una programmazione senza fasce orarie".
Lo dice - a La Stampa - il ministro Dario Franceschini che anticipa: "Netflix avr√† quote di programmazione e obblighi di investimento come le tv tradizionali" e "stiamo pensando a meccanismi per assicurare la visibilit√† di serie e film italiani".

TEXT:
L'obbligo per le tv di rispettare quote di investimenti e di programmazione di opere italiane, varr√† anche per lo streaming: "Anche Netflix o altre piattaforme come Amazon Prime avranno gli stessi obblighi, compatibilmente a una programmazione senza fasce orarie". Lo dice - a La Stampa - il ministro Dario Franceschini che anticipa: "Netflix avr√† quote di programmazione e obblighi di investimento come le tv tradizionali" e "stiamo pensando a meccanismi per assicurare la visibilit√† di serie e film italiani".

Franceschi parla anche della novit√† per le librerie, con il tax credit inserito nella manovra: "√® una compensazione per tutti i tipi di imposta, non solo sul reddito, ma anche Imu, Irap, Iva, contributi previdenziali dei dipendenti e del titolare se √® senza dipendenti. Una vera detassazione: fino a 20 mila euro per le librerie indipendenti e 10 mila per quelle delle grandi catene". "E' un intervento - sottolinea - che aiuter√† i piccoli librai che eroicamente resistono. La piccola libreria √® un bene che va tutelato dallo Stato, perch√© √® insieme identit√† e bellezza immateriale". Spera di aiutare "i nostri centri storici a non perdere la loro identit√† come purtroppo √® avvenuto in questi anni di boom turistico e di incontrollata liberalizzazione delle licenze", "cominciamo dalle librerie, ma non √® escluso che in futuro si possano salvaguardare in questo modo anche altri negozi storici".
TITLE: Dario Franceschini: "Obbligheremo Netflix a dare pi√π visibilit√† a serie e film italiani"

SUMMARY:
Before Meghan Markle‚Äôs starring role on ‚ÄúSuits,‚Äù the 36-year-old actress appeared on a variety of different shows ‚Äï including ‚Äú Deal or No Deal ,‚Äù where she had a recurring role.
I went from working in the U.S. Embassy in Argentina to ending up on Deal,‚Äù she told Esquire.
Definitely working on Deal or No Deal was a learning experience, and it helped me to understand what I would rather be doing.‚ÄùThe actress told Esquire that she didn‚Äôt think she ever had the winning case.
Besides appearing on ‚ÄúDeal or No Deal,‚Äù Markle also made guest appearances on ‚ÄúGeneral Hospital,‚Äù ‚ÄúCSI: Miami,‚Äù ‚ÄúFringe,‚Äù and ‚ÄúCastle‚Äù over the years.
If you want to catch Markle on reruns of ‚ÄúDeal or No Deal,‚Äù tune into the Game Show Network weekdays at 11 a.m. Eastern until Dec. 22.
TEXT:
Markle displays case No. 11 in the clip below. Mandel references her by name at one point:

The soon-to-be member of the British royal family was a briefcase model on Howie Mandel‚Äôs game show from 2006 to 2007 . A clip of Markle on the show began circulating shortly after news of her engagement to Prince Harry was announced on Monday.

Before Meghan Markle‚Äôs starring role on ‚ÄúSuits,‚Äù the 36-year-old actress appeared on a variety of different shows ‚Äï including ‚Äú Deal or No Deal ,‚Äù where she had a recurring role.

Markle spoke about appearing on the show in a 2013 interview with Esquire, saying she did the job out of necessity.

‚ÄúI would put that in the category of things I was doing while I was auditioning to try to make ends meet. I went from working in the U.S. Embassy in Argentina to ending up on Deal,‚Äù she told Esquire. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs run the gamut. Definitely working on Deal or No Deal was a learning experience, and it helped me to understand what I would rather be doing.‚Äù

The actress told Esquire that she didn‚Äôt think she ever had the winning case.

‚ÄúI would end up standing up there forever in these terribly uncomfortable and inexpensive five-inch heels just waiting for someone to pick my number so I could go and sit down,‚Äù she said.

Besides appearing on ‚ÄúDeal or No Deal,‚Äù Markle also made guest appearances on ‚ÄúGeneral Hospital,‚Äù ‚ÄúCSI: Miami,‚Äù ‚ÄúFringe,‚Äù and ‚ÄúCastle‚Äù over the years.

But don‚Äôt count on seeing her star in any shows after her ‚ÄúSuits‚Äù exit. The actress recently announced she‚Äôs going to leave acting to focus on her royal duties.

If you want to catch Markle on reruns of ‚ÄúDeal or No Deal,‚Äù tune into the Game Show Network weekdays at 11 a.m. Eastern until Dec. 22.
TITLE: Meghan Markle Used To Be A 'Deal Or No Deal' Briefcase Model

SUMMARY:
ABBOTSFORD, B.C.
‚Äî A nine-year-old girl who was hit by a bus in Abbotsford, B.C., has died of her injuries.
Abbotsford police say emergency services were called just after 8 a.m. Friday to treat the girl, who was transported to hospital with critical injuries.
Police say she was hit by the bus while in a crosswalk.
Judy Bird of Abbotsford police says it's too early to say how fast the bus was travelling.
TEXT:
ABBOTSFORD, B.C. ‚Äî A nine-year-old girl who was hit by a bus in Abbotsford, B.C., has died of her injuries.

Abbotsford police say emergency services were called just after 8 a.m. Friday to treat the girl, who was transported to hospital with critical injuries.

She died shortly after arriving at hospital.

Police say she was hit by the bus while in a crosswalk.

Several departments were investigating the death including the major crime unit and B.C. Commercial Vehicle Safety.

'Extremely saddened'

B.C. Transit president Manuel Achadinha says in a statement he is "extremely saddened" to hear of the girl's death and the agency's thoughts are with her family, the driver and others who witnessed the event.

Sgt. Judy Bird of Abbotsford police says it's too early to say how fast the bus was travelling.

"At that time of morning, it was still quite dark, as well as our weather conditions were very rainy, so there was some visibility issues. But at this time we are at the very preliminary stages of investigation."

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: 9-Year-Old Dies After Being Hit By A Bus While In A Crosswalk

SUMMARY:
Note Saying 'Padmavati Ka Virodh' Found Near Body Of Man Found Hanging In Jaipur's Nahargarh FortNEW DLEHI -- The body of a 40-year-old man was found hanging from the outer walls of Nahargarh Fort here on Friday morning, with the message "Padmavati' ka virodh" - in protest against the film Padmavati.
Activists of the Karni Sena, a Rajput community, besides other groups have been protesting against the movie, claiming the film "distorts" historical facts.
It is not acceptable," an activist of the Karni Sena said.
Activists of the Karni Sena earlier this month vandalised a theatre in Kota, Rajasthan, over reports that it was showing a trailer of Padmavati.
A Karni Sena leader threatened actress Deepika Padukone, who plays the lead in the movie, with physical harm.
TEXT:
Note Saying 'Padmavati Ka Virodh' Found Near Body Of Man Found Hanging In Jaipur's Nahargarh FortNEW DLEHI -- The body of a 40-year-old man was found hanging from the outer walls of Nahargarh Fort here on Friday morning, with the message "Padmavati' ka virodh" - in protest against the film Padmavati.

ANI reported that the man was identified as Chetan Saini:

Body found hanging at Nahargarh Fort in #Jaipur is of 40 year old local Chetan Saini ‚Äî ANI (@ANI) November 24, 2017

The message, written on the stones near the fort wall adjacent to the body, read, "Hum putle nahin jalate....latkate hain" (we don't burn effigies, we hang them).

"It is early to comment on it as the matter is under investigation. The identity of the man, around 40-years-old, is yet to be ascertained," Satyendra Singh, DCP Jaipur (North), told IANS.

Sanjay Leela Bhansali's Padmavati has been mired in controversies since its shooting started. Activists of the Karni Sena, a Rajput community, besides other groups have been protesting against the movie, claiming the film "distorts" historical facts.

"They are trying to defame queen Padmavati by distorting historical facts. It is not acceptable," an activist of the Karni Sena said.

Activists of the Karni Sena earlier this month vandalised a theatre in Kota, Rajasthan, over reports that it was showing a trailer of Padmavati. A Karni Sena leader threatened actress Deepika Padukone, who plays the lead in the movie, with physical harm.

The release of the movie, earlier scheduled for December 1, has been deferred.
TITLE: Note Saying 'Padmavati Ka Virodh' Found Near Body Of Man Found Hanging In Jaipur's Nahargarh Fort

Un principio ribadito dal tribunale di Torino, che ha ordinato a un agente assicurativo di versare all'ex consorte 94.508 euro pi√π interessi e spese processuali.
E' la legge del 1970 a stabilire che il coniuge - se non √® convolato a nuove nozze - ha diritto a una percentuale del trattamento di fine rapporto.
Lui cominci√≤ a lavorare per l'agenzia di Rivoli (Torino) di una compagnia assicuratrice nel 1990 e smise nel settembre del 2014.
L'uomo ha tentato di spiegare che di Tfr non si poteva parlare in quanto non era un dipendente.
TEXT:
hands of wife and husband signing divorce documents or premarital agreement

Alla moglie divorziata spetta una quota del Tfr del marito. Anche se l'uomo ha ricevuto l'indennit√† dieci anni dopo lo scioglimento del matrimonio. Un principio ribadito dal tribunale di Torino, che ha ordinato a un agente assicurativo di versare all'ex consorte 94.508 euro pi√π interessi e spese processuali.

Di per s√© non √® una novit√†. E' la legge del 1970 a stabilire che il coniuge - se non √® convolato a nuove nozze - ha diritto a una percentuale del trattamento di fine rapporto. A stupire, nel caso esaminato dai giudici subalpini, sono due aspetti. Il primo √® il tempo trascorso dalla proclamazione del divorzio: un decennio. Il secondo √® legato al cosiddetto "onere della prova": l'agente assicurativo, come si legge nella sentenza, non ha saputo (o non ha potuto) dimostrare che in realt√† quei 393 mila euro liquidati dalla compagnia non erano un Tfr, ma una sorta di buonuscita. Se fosse stato cos√¨, quei 94 mila euro sarebbero rimasti nelle sue tasche perch√© la Cassazione, nel 2016, ha affermato che non tutti i denari percepiti da un coniuge devono essere assoggettati al prelievo. Sfuggono, per esempio, i ricavi originati da un'attivit√† di "natura imprenditoriale" esercitata "mediante una complessa e articolata struttura organizzata con vasta dotazione di mezzi e personale".

I due contendenti si sposarono nel 1976 e divorziarono nel 2004. Lui cominci√≤ a lavorare per l'agenzia di Rivoli (Torino) di una compagnia assicuratrice nel 1990 e smise nel settembre del 2014. Il 13 febbraio 2015 gli arrivarono i quasi 400 mila euro e lei (che era titolare di assegno divorzile e nel frattempo non si era risposata) chiese la sua parte.

L'uomo ha tentato di spiegare che di Tfr non si poteva parlare in quanto non era un dipendente. Tanto √® vero che si avvaleva di sub agenti e di altro personale. Ma la difesa della donna ha contrattaccato con dei documenti: l'ufficio aveva degli orari di apertura indicati dalla compagnia, gli agenti avevano l'obbligo dell'esclusiva e non si assumevano rischi, la gestione dei sinistri era eterodiretta. "Elementi - hanno spiegato gli avvocati - che fanno propendere per la natura subordinata del rapporto di lavoro". I giudici della settima sezione civile (presieduta da Cesare Castellani) hanno dato ragione alla donna: "Gravava sul convenuto - scrivono - l'onere di provare la natura imprenditoriale della sua attivit√† di agente". Poi hanno fatto i calcoli: hanno preso in esame solo i quattordici anni (dal 1990 al 2004) di coincidenza piena fra matrimonio e rapporto di lavoro, hanno fatto la proporzione e hanno concluso per 94 mila euro. Il 40% del totale. Esattamente la somma richiesta dall'ex moglie.

Ora toccher√† agli avvocati delle parti capire se, in caso di appello, la sentenza resister√† ai nuovi orientamenti della Cassazione nel 2017 in materia di assegno di divorzio, e ai disegni di riforma della legge che sono in preparazione alla Camera.
TITLE: All'ex moglie il 40% del Tfr, anche 10 anni dopo il divorzio

Twitter culp√≥ a un "empleado deshonesto" que durante su √∫ltimo d√≠a en el trabajo elimin√≥ la cuenta de The Donald.
Trump jura que Twitter fue clave para que llegara a la Casa BlancaAhora, el hombre responsable que hizo temporalmente imposible que Trump tuitera, revel√≥ su identidad y explic√≥ sus acciones en una entrevista exclusiva con TechCrunch.
