Zuletzt hatte sich die Krise um das Atomprogramm des kommunistischen Regimes wieder zugespitzt, als Nordkorea erneut eine Rakete in Richtung Japan abfeuerte.
Im Vorfeld des Man√∂vers steigen deswegen die Spannungen zwischen den USA und Nordkorea.
Bei einer Konferenz im US-Bundesstaat in Kalifornien sagte der Trump-Berater, die Wahrscheinlichkeit eines Krieges zwischen den USA und Nordkorea erh√∂he sich jeden Tag.
Zwar gebe es nicht-milit√§rische Wege, um die Krise mit Nordkorea zu l√∂sen.
Auch Deutschland hatte daraufhin seine diplomatischen Beziehungen zu Nordkorea eingeschr√§nkt.
TEXT:
Am Montag beginnt ein gemeinsames Milit√§rman√∂ver von S√ºdkorea und den USA

Zuvor nehmen die Spannungen zwischen Washington und Pj√∂ngjang wieder zu

Es soll das gr√∂√üte gemeinsame Luftwaffen-Man√∂ver der USA und S√ºdkorea auf der koreanischen Halbinsel werden.

Am Montag wollen die beiden B√ºndnispartner zusammen eine Milit√§r√ºbung abhalten. F√ºnf Tage lang.

Zuletzt hatte sich die Krise um das Atomprogramm des kommunistischen Regimes wieder zugespitzt, als Nordkorea erneut eine Rakete in Richtung Japan abfeuerte. Laut Angaben des s√ºdkoreanischen Verteidigungsministeriums h√§tte die Hwasong-15-Rakete sogar Washington treffen k√∂nnen.

Nun stehen also 12.000 US-Soldaten bereit, in den n√§chsten Tagen den Ernstfall zu √ºben. F√ºr Pj√∂ngjang und Diktator Kim Jong-un ist das selbstverst√§ndlich eine Provokation.

Im Vorfeld des Man√∂vers steigen deswegen die Spannungen zwischen den USA und Nordkorea. Und die Eskalation der Worte in diesem Konflikt beginnt einmal mehr von Neuem.

Nordkorea: "Trump bettelt um einen Atomkrieg"

Am Samstag wetterte das nordkoreanische Au√üenministerium, Donald Trump "bettelt um einen Atomkrieg".

Der US-Pr√§sident veranstalte ein "extrem gef√§hrliches Gl√ºcksspiel auf der koreanischen Halbinsel", hie√ü es in einer schriftlichen Mitteilung des Ministeriums, aus der unter anderem der US-Sender CNN zitierte. Darin wird Trump auch als "nuklearer D√§mon" und "St√∂rer des Weltfriedens" bezeichnet.

Am Sonntag kritisierte die Zeitung "Rodong Sinmun", die von der in Nordkorea herrschenden Partei herausgegeben wird, in einem Kommentar: Das Milit√§rman√∂ver der USA und S√ºdkorea sei eine "gef√§hrliche Provokation" und bringe die Region an den Rand eines Krieges.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Journalisten haben mit dem Koch der Kim-Familie gesprochen: So war der Diktator als Kind

"Die Wahrscheinlichkeit eines Krieges steigt t√§glich"

Bereits am Samstag wetzte auch der Nationale Sicherheitsberater, HR McMaster, rhetorisch das Messer. Bei einer Konferenz im US-Bundesstaat in Kalifornien sagte der Trump-Berater, die Wahrscheinlichkeit eines Krieges zwischen den USA und Nordkorea erh√∂he sich jeden Tag.

"Das bedeutet, dass wir uns in einem Wettrennen befinden. In einem Wettrennen, dieses Problem zu l√∂sen", sagte McMaster laut dem US-Sender CNN.

Zwar gebe es nicht-milit√§rische Wege, um die Krise mit Nordkorea zu l√∂sen. Aber der nordkoreanische Machthaber Kim Jong-un "kommt n√§her und n√§her" an Atomwaffen heran, sagte McMaster: "Es bleibt nicht viel Zeit."

Auch Deutschland zieht Konsequenzen

Der neuerliche nordkoreanische Raketentest am Mittwoch war international scharf kritisiert worden. Das diplomatisch isolierte Land hatte damit zum wiederholten Mal gegen UN-Resolutionen versto√üen.

Die F√ºhrung in Pj√∂ngjang erkl√§rte danach, das Land sei jetzt in der Lage, das gesamte Festland der USA mit Atomsprengk√∂pfen angreifen zu k√∂nnen.

Auch Deutschland hatte daraufhin seine diplomatischen Beziehungen zu Nordkorea eingeschr√§nkt. Au√üenminister Sigmar Gabriel k√ºndigte am Donnerstag bei einem Besuch in Washington den Abzug eines deutschen Diplomaten - aber nicht des Botschafters - aus der nordkoreanischen Hauptstadt Pj√∂ngjang an.

Mit Material der dpa.
TITLE: "Wahrscheinlichkeit eines Krieges steigt t√§glich": Nordkorea-Krise versch√§rft sich vor US-Milit√§rman√∂ver

SUMMARY:
TPG via Getty ImagesThe Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald was published in 1925, before its author was even thirty years old.
In the book, Fitzgerald more or less predicts the Stock Market Crash of 1929.
Now, in our own time, we see a similar sense of moral unease about the way people are making money, the way the American Dream is being realized.
Either way, critics tend to say that ‚ÄãThe Great Gatsby is the Great American Novel of the 20th Century ‚Äî I would proffer that it is looking pretty prescient of the 21st Century as well.
And in ‚ÄãGatsby it is Nick Carraway, also the narrator, who is transformed through his encounter with Jay.
TEXT:
TPG via Getty Images

The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald was published in 1925, before its author was even thirty years old. In the book, Fitzgerald more or less predicts the Stock Market Crash of 1929. After a summer of wild parties and booze-soaked soir√©es, a drunken Daisy runs down Myrtle killing her in the road, and on that night Gatsby‚Äôs dream dies too. Fitzgerald once said of the 1920s that he was pretty sure ‚Äúliving wasn‚Äôt the reckless, careless business these people thought.‚Äù He knew something was fundamentally wrong with the moral fabric of society and he predicted that it was only a matter of time before the whole ‚Äúbonanza‚Äù came tumbling down. And it did. ‚ÄúAs if reluctant to die outmoded in its bed, the decade leapt to a spectacular death in October 1929.‚Äù The morning after Daisy kills Myrtle, her long-suffering husband Wilson‚Äã ‚Äãkills‚Äã ‚ÄãGatsby‚Äã ‚Äãas‚Äã ‚Äãhe‚Äã ‚Äãfinishes‚Äã ‚Äãtaking‚Äã ‚Äãa‚Äã ‚Äãswim‚Äã ‚Äãin‚Äã ‚Äãhis‚Äã ‚Äãspectacular‚Äã ‚Äãpool. Now, in our own time, we see a similar sense of moral unease about the way people are making money, the way the American Dream is being realized. That was true when we made the film a few years ago ‚Äãand I think it is still true now, maybe even more so. Certainly, the bankers, the politicians, and the real-estate moguls, the very same ones who would have attended Gatsby‚Äôs glittering parties almost a century ago, are still the ones running the show. Maybe they never stopped. Either way, critics tend to say that ‚ÄãThe Great Gatsby is the Great American Novel of the 20th Century ‚Äî I would proffer that it is looking pretty prescient of the 21st Century as well. You certainly could not get a better reflection of the period we are in currently, for my money, than Nick Carraway‚Äôs observation the first time he attends one of Gatsby‚Äôs‚Äã ‚Äãparties:‚Äã ‚Äã‚ÄúIt‚Äôs‚Äã ‚Äãlike‚Äã ‚Äãan‚Äã ‚Äãamusement‚Äã ‚Äãpark.‚Äù When I was a very young boy, growing up in a small town in Australia, my father ran the local cinema, down the road. Naturally, I saw a lot of movies. But from the moment I saw ‚ÄãButch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid‚Äã, I knew what I wanted to be. I wanted to be Robert Redford. To a kid like me, a dreamer growing up in the middle of nowhere, he was the coolest. And so I guess it makes sense that I can still remember when, a few years later, I went to see his 1974 version of ‚ÄãThe Great Gatsby‚Äã, full of excitement; after all, this was ‚Äúthe new Redford film.‚Äù I remember, when the final credits rolled, that I sat there in the dark thinking ‚Äúwow, that was really, really beautiful, but I don‚Äôt ‚Äòquite get it‚Äô‚Äù ‚Äî to be honest, I left the cinema with no clear idea of who this Gatsby character was. Had he killed a man, or hadn‚Äôt he? He sure looked great in his pink suit and flashy yellow sports car, but was I even supposed to like him? A few years after that, in high school, I read the book, as do most kids. But, like most kids, that didn‚Äôt help at all. Probably, it made things worse. As time passed, Redford, of course, stayed cool as hell in films like ‚ÄãAll the President‚Äôs Men‚Äã, ‚ÄãThree Days of the Condor‚Äã, ‚ÄãThe Natural ‚Äî the list goes on and on and on ‚Äî and I started to gravitate more and more towards theater and the many other creative aspects of my life. For a long time, I confess, I gave no further thought to the perennially‚Äã ‚Äãmysterious‚Äã ‚ÄãJay‚Äã ‚ÄãGatsby. Whenever I finish any long project I like to go off on what I call ‚Äúa debriefing adventure‚Äù ‚Äî to rest and to get my ‚Äúimaginator‚Äù running again. In 2001, I‚Äôd just finished ‚ÄãMoulin Rouge and I decided that this time I would take the Trans Siberian Express across Russia, from Beijing through Manchuria and Irkutsk and on to Moscow. Alone. I suppose I thought this would be romantic. A first-class cabin was reserved and off I went. And, well, my cabin was a sardine tin, with a rackety air conditioner and an old babushka handing me a hose and yelling ‚ÄúThis! You go! Now! Shower!‚Äù I quickly realized that this was not going to be the great poetic experience I‚Äôd‚Äã ‚Äãhad‚Äã ‚Äãin‚Äã ‚Äãmind‚Äã ‚Äã‚Äî‚Äã ‚Äãit‚Äã ‚Äãwas‚Äã ‚Äãgoing‚Äã ‚Äãto‚Äã ‚Äãbe‚Äã ‚Äãmore‚Äã ‚Äãlike‚Äã ‚ÄãCrime‚Äã ‚Äãand‚Äã ‚ÄãPunishment‚Äã.

Sunset Boulevard via Getty Images American actor Robert Redford on the set of The Great Gatsby based on the novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald, and directed by British Jack Clayton

Luckily, I‚Äôd packed a generous supply of Australian red wine, plus a few audiobooks on this new contraption called the ‚ÄòiPod.‚Äô One of those books just so happened to be The Great Gatsby. A few hours into the trip and already feeling sorry for myself, I succumbed to temptation, uncorked the wine, put in my headphones, poured, and, as I lay back and began to listen ‚Äî ‚ÄúIn my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I‚Äôve been turning over in my mind ever since‚Äù ‚Äî watching the birch trees rush by through the darkening window ‚Äî ‚Äú‚ÄòWhenever you feel like criticizing any one,‚Äô he told me, ‚Äòjust remember that all the people in this world haven‚Äôt had the advantages that you‚Äôve had‚Äô‚Äù ‚Äî feeling the rhythm of the train, the power of Fitzgerald‚Äôs storytelling, his incredible poetry, suddenly I found myself hearing and understanding Jay Gatsby for the first time. I spent the whole next day waiting for night to fall so I could have the same experience all over again. And when I finally did get to those immortal finishing words ‚Äî ‚ÄúTomorrow we will run faster, stretch out our arms farther... And one fine morning ‚Äî So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Äî There I was, alone, racing across the plains of Siberia and, suddenly, I was gripped with an overwhelming‚Äã ‚Äãpassion‚Äã ‚Äãto‚Äã ‚Äãmake‚Äã ‚Äãa‚Äã ‚Äãmovie‚Äã ‚Äãof‚Äã ‚Äãthe‚Äã ‚ÄãGreat‚Äã ‚ÄãAmerican‚Äã ‚ÄãNovel. SUBSCRIBE AND FOLLOW Get top stories and blog posts emailed to me each day. Newsletters may offer personalized content or advertisements. Learn more Newsletter Please enter a valid email address Please accept our terms of service and privacy policy By checking this box, I accept the Huffington Post South Africa Terms of Service and Privacy Policy Thank you for signing up! You should receive an email to confirm your subscription shortly. There was a problem processing your signup; please try again later Twitter

Facebook

Instagram For my wife Catherine Martin and me, part of our creative joy is immersing ourselves in and living the life of whatever project we‚Äôre doing. Once we are committed, we take all our creative collaborators into that world with us. For Moulin Rouge we moved to Paris and steeped ourselves in the world of the ‚Äãfin de si√®cle and the Montmartre of the 1890s. For Gatsby, we followed in Fitzgerald‚Äôs footsteps, arriving in New York City by ocean liner, as Fitzgerald once had, to glimpse that ‚ÄúIncalculable city ‚Ä¶ built on a wish‚Ä¶ a miracle of foamy light suspended by the stars‚Ä¶ this was the greatest nation and there was gala in the air!‚Äù Soon, there wasn‚Äôt an inch of Long Island that we hadn‚Äôt covered. Or a fingerbowl of champagne we hadn‚Äôt drunk. And on the way back into Manhattan, yes, we too put the top down and absolutely: ‚ÄúThe city seen from the Queensboro Bridge is always the city seen for the first time, in its first wild promise of all the mystery and the beauty in the world.‚Äù With our team, we went on to read all of Fitzgerald‚Äôs love letters and short stories, and we met with the leading scholars, and were very fortunate to have their help, especially the wonderful Anne Margaret Daniel and James L. West III, who edited ‚ÄãTrimalchio‚Äã, the early galley version of ‚ÄãThe Great Gatsby‚Äã, as well as Don C. Skemer, the curator of rare books at the Princeton Library. We even had the good fortune of spending one warm summer afternoon amid the campus ivy, thumbing through the original handwritten manuscript of the book that you now hold in your hands. Of course, we couldn‚Äôt help but also experiment with F. Scott and Zelda‚Äôs infamous passion for alcohol‚Ä¶ Did I mention that? Maybe we went a bit far with that one‚Ä¶ To quote him: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs perfect, two‚Äôs too much, and three is never enough.‚Äù Sadly, we were never arrested for dancing in the fountain outside the Plaza Hotel, but writing this reminds me‚Ä¶ Jokes aside, I can say honestly that I feel like I did come‚Äã ‚Äãto‚Äã ‚Äãknow‚Äã ‚ÄãF.‚Äã ‚ÄãScott. One thing I learned, and this was a major signpost for both me and my cowriter and longtime collaborator Craig Pearce, as we worked on the screenplay, is that Fitzgerald was a great fan of Joseph Conrad‚Äôs work, especially ‚ÄãHeart of Darkness (1899). Francis Coppola‚Äôs ‚ÄãApocalypse Now‚Äã, which is a retelling of that book, is one of my all-time favorite films; and, like the book, the film is built on the Orphean myth of an innocent who journeys into an underworld, a place of lost souls, encountering an iconic, demonic figure. In ‚ÄãApocalypse Now this is Marlon Brando‚Äôs Walt Kurtz. What is interesting about these characters is that while they at first appear to be the main characters, they don‚Äôt actually transform or evolve at all as the story progresses, as we might expect of a protagonist. Instead, Kurtz dies the same man he was on the day Willard finds him, with ‚Äòthe horror‚Äô on his lips. Gatsby, another of these characters, we realized, dies the same ‚Äúelegant roughneck‚Äù that he was on the night Nick first meets him at one of his parties, with ‚ÄúDaisy‚Äù on his lips. In ‚ÄãApocalypse Now it is Willard, the narrator, who is transformed, through his encounter with Kurtz. And in ‚ÄãGatsby it is Nick Carraway, also the narrator, who is transformed through his encounter with Jay. While the novel is named for Mr. Gatsby, the truth, we realized, is‚Äã ‚Äãthat‚Äã ‚Äãthis‚Äã ‚Äãis‚Äã ‚ÄãNick‚Äôs‚Äã ‚Äãstory. Fitzgerald is very deft at this: Nick is actually writing his own book, within Fitzgerald‚Äôs book, about the strange, slightly ominous neighbour he just so happens to have moved in next door to. In the early pages, he tells us about ‚ÄúGatsby, the man who gives his name to this book.‚Äù In Chapter 3, he reflects, ‚ÄúReading over what I have written so far‚Ä¶‚Äù In other words, Nick is using the process of writing to chart the course of his changing feelings for Gatsby. At the outset he confides to the reader that Gatsby ‚Äúrepresented everything for which I have an unaffected scorn,‚Äù but by the end, the last thing he calls out to Gatsby before he dies is: ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre a rotten crowd‚Ä¶. You‚Äôre worth the whole damn bunch put together.‚Äù It is Nick who is transformed‚Äã ‚Äãby‚Äã ‚Äãhis‚Äã ‚Äãjourney‚Äã ‚Äãinto‚Äã ‚Äãand‚Äã ‚Äãthen‚Äã ‚Äãout‚Äã ‚Äãof‚Äã ‚Äãdisillusionment.

Bettmann via Getty Images
TITLE: Why The Great Gatsby Remains The Best Reflection Of The American Dream

SUMMARY:
Le th√®me en sera ‚Äìcomme l'indique le titre‚Äì le silence.
Ou ‚Äìpour le dire √† la fa√ßon bouddhiste‚Äì pour que ces pens√©es, m√™me effervescentes, soient pleinement vues et accept√©es.
Pratique 1: le silence des yeux Pendant 5 √† 10 minutes, baissez le regard et posez le devant vous, sur le sol, dans un angle de 45 degr√©.
R√©sultat: Vous vous recentrez.
Le secret pour le d√©passer est tout simplement de l'accepter.
TEXT:
Cette petite chronique ayant √©t√© √©crite en √©coutant le ronron de Lala ( chat zen s'il en est ), je vous invite √† prendre une graaaaande respiration et √† vous d√©tendre avant de lire les lignes qui suivent...

Le th√®me en sera ‚Äìcomme l'indique le titre‚Äì le silence. Le silence sous toutes ses formes, dans tous les coins, de la terre jusqu'au ciel et de la cave au grenier. Mais surtout le silence, au quotidien. Car c'est l√†, au c≈ìur de nos jours sans fin, que le brouhaha semble recouvrir nos vies, aussi d√©sagr√©able et incongrue qu'une couverture en laine dans un sauna. Beurk!

Pourtant, quand on y regarde de plus pr√®s, l'environnement n'est pas toujours si sonore. Et, m√™me au c≈ìur des villes, quand le m√©tro s'arr√™te, il est possible de go√ªter quelques grammes de silence suspendu.

La question qui nous animera ici, sera donc la suivante: mais d'o√π vient tout ce bruit? Ce charivari, ce vacarme, ce tintamarre? Pour y r√©pondre, nous avons install√© quelques cobayes consentants et non r√©mun√©r√©s en posture de m√©ditation, en plein Paris, avec la consigne suivantes: ouvrez vos esgourdes, √©coutez les sons du monde... et faites un compte-rendu. (Notez que cette petite exp√©rience s'est d√©roul√©e de fa√ßon tout √† fait √©thique: aucun √™tre humain n'a √©t√© maltrait√© pour tourner ces sc√®nes... sauf ce cadre d'une agence bancaire bien connue pour lequel ces 30 minutes de m√©ditation, immobile, sans t√©l√©phone avait tout de la torture). Donc, √† l'issue du zazen (la m√©ditation zen), les participants ont soulign√© deux choses:

Il y a beaucoup moins de bruit en ville qu'on peut l'imaginer Par contre, dans la t√™te, c'est un vrai cirque! Des pens√©es qui d√©filent √† toute berzingue, sans aucune coh√©rence et sans s'arr√™ter!

Ce qui nous am√®nera ‚Äì enfin ;-) - au vrai th√®me de l'article √† savoir: comment retrouver le silence int√©rieur. Comment faire pour que cette machine √† laver de pens√©es, lanc√©e en mode essorage dans notre petite caboche, passe enfin en mode "laine". Ou ‚Äìpour le dire √† la fa√ßon bouddhiste‚Äì pour que ces pens√©es, m√™me effervescentes, soient pleinement vues et accept√©es. Ommm...

Vaste programme! Heureusement, une m√©thode s'offre √† nous qui permet d'apprivoiser ce silence pas √† pas: la cure de silence. En voici la prescription, soigneusement √©tablie apr√®s des ann√©es de tests, exp√©riences, apprentissages au laboratoire de la vie.

La posologie

La cure de silence consiste √† vous retirer du monde pendant une p√©riode: un week-end serait id√©al mais une matin√©e, voire quelques heures, peuvent suffire. Pendant ce temps-l√†, vous allez prendre conscience de vos actes et pens√©es au moyen de diverses m√©thodes. Cette prise de conscience a pour but de vous reconnecter au moment pr√©sent, √† la chose que vous √™tes entrain de faire en ce moment ( comme de lire cet article ), √† l'endroit o√π vous vous trouvez ( l√†, tout de suite ) etc. Ce faisant, corps et pens√©es en unit√©, votre perception de la vie change.

Voici par exemple quelques "exercices" √† faire pendant votre cure.

Pratique 1: le silence des yeux Pendant 5 √† 10 minutes, baissez le regard et posez le devant vous, sur le sol, dans un angle de 45 degr√©. Laissez les paupi√®res s'apaiser, les muscles oculaires, les joues √©galement... Gardez les yeux entrouverts pour maintenir une pleine Pr√©sence, une pleine conscience de ce que vous √™tes entrain de faire. R√©sultat probable: reconnexion au corps, les pens√©es s'apaisent, l'esprit dirig√© dans une direction apprend √† se re-concentrer

Pratique 2: le silence des oreilles Dans une posture dynamique, assis ou debout, reprenez conscience de l'univers sonore dans lequel vous baignez. Ecoutez les sons proches ou lointains, les diff√©rentes tonalit√©s, tout ce qui vous entoure. Et soudain cette question: les sons que vous entendez sont-ils √† l'int√©rieur ou √† l'ext√©rieur? R√©sultat: Vous vous recentrez. Vous touchez √† nouveau un certain sens de la pr√©sence, de la conscience d'√™tre vivant, ici et maintenant. ... ou pas. Dans ce cas essayez la pratique qui va suivre... Pour essayer l'exercice en vid√©o c'est ICI.

Pratique 3: le silence du corps Notre corps est souvent travers√© d'√©motions. Celles-ci sont le plus souvent inconscientes mais laissent des traces sur notre "√©tat d'√™tre". Pour favoriser la circulation naturelle des √©motions, et les inviter √† vraiment traverser sans s'arr√™ter, rien de mieux que de ressentir √† nouveau la respiration. La retrouver, l'inviter √† la table de la vie. R√©sultat: avoir une respiration consciente est le premier pas vers l'apaisement. A force de s'y connecter, la respiration va d'elle-m√™me s'installer au niveau de l'abdomen, et diffuser sa force. A faire souvent, en toutes circonstances.

Pr√©cautions d'emploi

Il va sans dire que cette cure n'est pas concevable sans le silence des mots. Les portables et autres outils num√©riques seront en mode avion ( sans avoir oubli√© de pr√©venir votre entourage ) et vous devrez r√©sister au plaisir de commenter votre exp√©rience en temps r√©el sur Twitter. Off. Silence. D√©connect√© du monde... pour une dur√©e de votre choix.

Egalement recommand√©s, quelques ouvrages inspirants autour de vous pour semer des graines de sagesse dans votre conscience.

Effets secondaires

Pour pourrez dans un premier temps ressentir un vide, un manque ou toute autre √©motion pas tr√®s agr√©able. C'est un passage. Celui d'une vie hyperactive vers un moment de calme. Le secret pour le d√©passer est tout simplement de l'accepter. Le manque est d'abord une sensation physique, impermanente, √©ph√©m√®re, qui disparaitra d√®s qu'elle aura √©t√© accueillie.

Mais une fois ce manque travers√©, une grande sensation de libert√© pourra vous envahir: la libert√© d'un silence et d'une solitude consentie, quand vous voulez, pour une vie authentique.

Pour aller plus loin

Si ces quelques lignes vous ont inspir√©s, vous trouverez de nombreux exercices , explications, exemples et anecdotes dans le livre "Ma cure de silence "( Editions First ‚Äì 2017 ).

Egalement vid√©os et MP3 √† t√©l√©charger gratuitement sur le blog www.dailyzen.fr

Kankyo Tannier - Ma cure de silence - Editions First

TEXT:
PEOPLE - "Toi, faire de la t√©l√©, c'est ton boulot. Pas moi." Face √† Thierry Ardisson sur le plateau de "Salut Les Terriens" sur C8, Florent Pagny n'en d√©mord pas: il peut se passer de la t√©l√©vision. Quelques jours plus t√¥t, le chanteur avait d√©j√† menac√© d'"arr√™ter la promotion" de son nouvel album face aux journalistes qui l'interrogeaient sur son exil fiscal. Le 2 d√©cembre, il est revenu plus en d√©tail sur sa d√©claration (voir la vid√©o en t√™te d'article).

"Moi, on ne me parle jamais de ma musique", a-t-il ainsi expliqu√©, en √©num√©rant "le pognon, le fisc, le p√©tard..." comme autant de sujets qui seraient abord√©s par les journalistes, en lieu et place de ses chansons. Celui qui est √©galement coach dans l'√©mission "The Voice" sur TF1 avait en effet √©t√© en septembre au c≈ìur d'une pol√©mique, apr√®s avoir annonc√© qu'il s'installait au Portugal pour des raisons fiscales.

"Moi je suis bavard, je raconte tout" s'est-il d√©fendu, avant de mettre en cause un "effet pervers" √† ses confidences. Celui qui chantait en 2003 Ma libert√© de penser a donc pr√©venu les fans: l'√©mission de Thierry Ardisson √©tait peut-√™tre "l'une de mes derni√®res t√©l√©s".

TEXT:
Sergej Malinka wurde 2007 vorgeworfen, etwas mit dem Verschwinden des britischen M√§dchens Madeleine McCann zutun zu haben

Doch bis heute gibt es daf√ºr keine Hinweise

Malinka spricht jetzt dar√ºber, wie die Vorw√ºrfe sein Leben zerst√∂rten

Sergej Malinka ist heute 32 Jahre alt. Der Russe wird bald zum ersten Mal Vater, er f√ºhrt ein geregeltes Leben in Portugal. Doch das war nicht immer so.

2007 hatte die Polizei ihn beschuldigt, etwas mit dem Verschwinden des britischen M√§dchens Madeleine McCann zutun zu haben. Ab diesem Zeitpunkt nahm sein Leben eine dramatische Wende.

Malinka jobbte damals in einem Restaurant, war gerade mit seinen Eltern nach Portugal gezogen. Am Abend des 3. Mai, der Tag an dem Maddie McCann verschwand, gingen ihre Eltern Gerry und Kate McCann in das Restaurant "Ocean Club" essen - jenes Lokal, in dem Malinka arbeitete.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: R√§tselhafter zweiter Fall: Maddie McCann ist nicht das einzige Kind, das an der Algarve verschwunden ist

Sp√§ter am Abend war das dreij√§hrige M√§dchen verschwunden. Und Malinka r√ºckte ins Visier der Ermittler. Verd√§chtig machte ihn in den Augen der Polizei, dass er noch in der Nacht des Verschwindens von Maddie eine Stunde mit einem portugiesischen Gesch√§ftsmann telefonierte. Worum es in dem Telefonat ging, ist nicht bekannt. Dennoch wurde Malinka mehrmals verh√∂rt.

Auch seine Computer wurden untersucht. Hinweise auf ein Verbrechen fand die Polizei nicht. Schon bald galt er nicht mehr als ein Verd√§chtiger im Fall Maddie McCann.

"Ich habe alle verloren"

Doch da hatte die Abw√§rtsspirale schon Fahrt aufgenommen, die Medien waren auf ihn aufmerksam geworden.

Mit schlimmen Folgen f√ºr sein Privatleben.

Heute, 10 Jahre sp√§ter, spricht Malinka offen √ºber das, was ihm nach den Anschuldigungen passierte. Die Ereignisse verarbeitete er in seinem Buch "Kollateral-Schaden", das 2018 auf den Markt kommen soll.

"Ich wurde zu falschen Behauptungen und Anschuldigungen bez√ºglich ihres Verschwindens gezwungen. Ich habe alle verloren - Jobs, Freunde, Hoffnung", sagt Malinka √ºber die belastende Zeit, wie die britische Nachrichtenseite "Express" berichtet.

Auf sein Auto sei ein Brandanschlag ver√ºbt, auf den Gehsteig daneben das portugiesische Wort "Fala" gespr√ºht worden - auf deutsch bedeutet es "Sprich". In manchen Momenten habe er am "Rande der Verzweiflung" gestanden. "Ich war 22 Jahre alt, ein junger Mann, der alleine in einem fremden Land war", zitiert der "Express" Malinka.

Malinka habe irgendwann sogar um sein Leben gef√ºrchtet und sei f√ºr einige Zeit aus der Gegend weggezogen.

Nun, Jahre sp√§ter, will er wieder ein normales Leben f√ºhren: "Jetzt versuche ich, mir mein Leben aus den Tr√ºmmern dieses Ereignisses neu aufzubauen. Zehn Jahre sp√§ter werde ich zum ersten Mal Vater. Meine Familie ist mein Leben. Ich werde es nicht l√§nger zulassen, dass die L√ºgen anderer unsere Zukunft vergiften."



(ll)
TITLE: Einem Mann wurde vorgeworfen, Maddie McCann entf√ºhrt zu haben - jetzt bricht er sein Schweigen

SUMMARY:
In August 2004, Brown killed Johnny Mitchell Allen, 43, after he paid her for sex.
Her lawyers at her first trial argued that Brown was a victim of sex trafficking and she acted in self-defense.
According to defense version of what transpired, Allen took Brown to his house where he showed her a collection of firearms.
Fearing for her life, Brown reached into her purse and shot Allen in the back of the head.
In 2011, Brown's case gained some national attention after filmmaker Dan Birman's documentary, "Me Facing Life: The Cyntoia Brown Story," aired on PBS.
TEXT:
Cyntoia Brown was just 16 years old she killed a Tennessee real estate agent who solicited her for sex, for which she was sentenced to life in prison. Though there haven't been significant changes to her case's basic details since her first trial in 2006, celebrities and advocates are turning a light on Brown's story and sex trafficking with the viral social media campaign, #FreeCyntoiaBrown.

the "justice" system is disgusting I feel angry ...when I read about this whole situation I was devastated this young woman will defenetely be in my prayers #FreeCyntoiaBrown pic.twitter.com/RejzscZkyN

After running away from home, Brown lived with her 24-year-old boyfriend who, she has said, abused her, raped her, threatened to kill her and forced her into a life of drug use and sex work.

"He would explain to me that some people were born whores, and that I was one, and I was a slut, and nobody'd want me but him, and the best thing I could do was just learn to be a good whore," Brown testified at a 2012 hearing that sought a new trial for her.

In August 2004, Brown killed Johnny Mitchell Allen, 43, after he paid her for sex. Her lawyers at her first trial argued that Brown was a victim of sex trafficking and she acted in self-defense. According to defense version of what transpired, Allen took Brown to his house where he showed her a collection of firearms. When they were in bed, Allen grabbed her between her legs and reached for something that Brown believed to be a gun. Fearing for her life, Brown reached into her purse and shot Allen in the back of the head.

Prosecutors, however, charged that Brown's motive was robbery, given that she took money and two of his guns after she shot him. Brown, according to her lawyers, took the cash and firearms because she feared returning to her pimp empty-handed.

She was tried as an adult and convicted of first-degree murder. Brown, who was diagnosed with Fetal Alcohol Syndrome disorder in 2012, is currently being held at Tennessee Prison for Women in Nashville. She'll be up for parole at age 69, The Tennessean reports.

In 2011, Brown's case gained some national attention after filmmaker Dan Birman's documentary, "Me Facing Life: The Cyntoia Brown Story," aired on PBS.

"This is a young girl who's at the tail end of three generations of violence against women," Birman told Nashville's Fox 17 earlier this month, referring to the rapes of Brown, her mother and her grandmother. "She had no chance."

Now, celebrities including Rihanna, LeBron James, Snoop Dogg, and Kim Kardashian West are advocating for Brown in an effort to win her clemency.

"Did we somehow change the definition of #JUSTICE along the way??" Rihanna wrote on Instagram on Tuesday. "Something is horribly wrong when the system enables these rapists and the victim is thrown away for life! To each of you responsible for this child's sentence I hope to God you don't have children, because this could be your daughter being punished for punishing already!"
TITLE: Celebs Rally For Cyntoia Brown, A Child Sex-Trafficking Victim Who Killed A Man

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been waiting to feel less angry, and when I‚Äôm ready, I‚Äôll say what I have to say,‚Äù Thurman said.
Uma Thurman's response when asked about the flood of sexual misconduct allegations....wow.
TEXT:
Uma Thurman had a cryptic message for her followers Thursday when she posted a Thanksgiving message to her Instagram account.

‚ÄúI said I was angry recently, and I have a few reasons, #metoo, in case you couldn‚Äôt tell by the look on my face,‚Äù Thurman wrote ‚Äï alluding to her response, earlier this month, to the sexual assault and harassment allegations leveled at disgraced Hollywood film producer Harvey Weinstein.

‚ÄúI feel it‚Äôs important to take your time, be fair, be exact, so... Happy Thanksgiving Everyone!‚Äù she added. ‚Äú(Except you Harvey, and all your wicked conspirators - I‚Äôm glad it‚Äôs going slowly - you don‚Äôt deserve a bullet) - stay tuned.‚Äù

A post shared by Uma Thurman (@ithurman) on Nov 23, 2017 at 12:58pm PST

In bombshell reports in The New York Times and The New Yorker, multiple women have come forward to accuse Weinstein of rape, sexual assault and harassment, describing a pattern spanning decades. Weinstein has been banned from many of the Hollywood institutions he used to lead, including his eponymous production company.

Los Angeles and New York police have opened probes into his prior behavior, and some of Weinstein‚Äôs accusers have joined a class-action lawsuit claiming the producer‚Äôs company helped cover up his alleged crimes. The fallout from the accusations has also led women to come forward with sexual misconduct allegations against other powerful men, in industries including entertainment, media, politics and sports.

Earlier this month, Thurman‚Äôs response to the Weinstein allegations went viral after she told an ‚ÄúAccess Hollywood‚Äù reporter that she didn‚Äôt have a ‚Äútidy soundbite‚Äù to share at the time.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been waiting to feel less angry, and when I‚Äôm ready, I‚Äôll say what I have to say,‚Äù Thurman said.

Uma Thurman's response when asked about the flood of sexual misconduct allegations....wow. pic.twitter.com/Sw5Br1GwFg ‚Äî Yashar Ali üêò (@yashar) November 4, 2017
TITLE: Uma Thurman Issues Ominous #MeToo Warning To Harvey Weinstein

SUMMARY:
Qui il corteo parte da piazza della Repubblica, diretto a piazza del Popolo, dove √® allestito il palco per l'intervento conclusivo di Camusso.
"Siamo grati ai lavoratori di Amazon perch√© hanno squarciato il velo sulle vere condizioni di lavoro di quel luogo.
Non ci crediamo che il proprietario dell'Ikea non possa creare un turno che concili tempi di lavoro e famiglia".
A Torino, secondo il programma della Cgil, il corteo sfila da Porta Susa a piazza San Carlo; a Bari da piazza Massari a piazza Prefettura; a Palermo da piazza Croci a piazza G. Verdi; a Cagliari da viale Regina Elena a piazza Garibaldi.
Tra le rivendicazioni al centro della mobilitazione, "bloccare l'innalzamento illimitato dei requisiti per andare in pensione, garantire un lavoro dignitoso e un futuro previdenziale ai giovani, riconoscere il lavoro di cura".
TEXT:
Al via la mobilitazione nazionale della Cgil, accompagnata dallo slogan 'Pensioni, i conti non tornano!'. Cinque le manifestazioni organizzate dalla confederazione dopo l'esito del confronto con il governo sulla previdenza, considerato "insufficiente": a Roma, Torino, Bari, Palermo e Cagliari. In piazza nella capitale c'√® la segretaria generale Susanna Camusso. Qui il corteo parte da piazza della Repubblica, diretto a piazza del Popolo, dove √® allestito il palco per l'intervento conclusivo di Camusso.

Oggi quella sulle pensioni "√® una prima mobilitazione. Sia chiaro. Non ci fermeremo, continueremo. La mobilitazione generale non √® lontana nel tempo". "Il vento sta cambiando", ha detto la leader Cgil. "Non √® vero che non ci sono le condizioni per dare risposte positive" e alle aziende dico "smettetela di pensare che si possano prendere i lavoratori uno per uno, discutete con i rappresentanti sindacali. Il vento che sta cambiando ci dice che nonostante quelli che pronosticavano la fine del sindacato, il sindacato continua a essere nei luoghi di lavoro. E di sindacato c'√® bisogno".

Quanto alla rottura del fronte sindacale sulla questione pensioni, Camusso ha detto: "bisogner√† ricostruire i fili" dell'unit√† sindacale, rotta con Cisl e Uil sulla vertenza pensioni. "A Cisl e Uil dico che occorre definire insieme delle regole comuni nel rapporto con i lavoratori" e nelle discussioni sulle vertenze perch√© "quando si √® divisi si √® pi√π deboli". E questa divisione "non √® compresa dai lavoratori".

Camusso ha poi ringraziato i lavoratori di Amazon e Ikea. "Siamo grati ai lavoratori di Amazon perch√© hanno squarciato il velo sulle vere condizioni di lavoro di quel luogo. Le persone pi√π ricche al mondo sono 8 uomini bianchi e tra questi c'√® il proprietario di Amazon, l'azienda che si arricchisce sfruttando i propri lavoratori. E vogliamo abbracciare Marica e i lavoratori dell'Ikea. Non ci crediamo che il proprietario dell'Ikea non possa creare un turno che concili tempi di lavoro e famiglia".

A Torino, secondo il programma della Cgil, il corteo sfila da Porta Susa a piazza San Carlo; a Bari da piazza Massari a piazza Prefettura; a Palermo da piazza Croci a piazza G. Verdi; a Cagliari da viale Regina Elena a piazza Garibaldi.

Tra le rivendicazioni al centro della mobilitazione, "bloccare l'innalzamento illimitato dei requisiti per andare in pensione, garantire un lavoro dignitoso e un futuro previdenziale ai giovani, riconoscere il lavoro di cura". Oltre alle motivazioni sulla previdenza, il sindacato di corso d'Italia chiede anche di "cambiare la legge di bilancio per sostenere lo sviluppo e l'occupazione, estendere gli ammortizzatori sociali, garantire a tutti il diritto alla salute, rinnovare i contratti pubblici".
TITLE: Cgil in piazza sulle pensioni. Camusso: "Mobilitazione generale non lontana. Ricostruire i fili con Cisl e Uil"

SUMMARY:
Noch bei der Landtagswahl 2013 triumphierte die CSU mit fast 48 Prozent.
Nicht mal Schwarz-Gelb h√§tte eine MehrheitW√§ren an diesem Sonntag Landtagswahlen w√ºrden noch 37 Prozent der Befragten der CSU ihre Stimme geben.
Nur noch 17 Prozent aller Befragten w√§ren daf√ºr, dass die CSU Bayern weiterhin allein regiert ‚Äì unvorstellbar in einem Land, in dem CSU und Staat Jahrzehnte lang eine Art Symbiose bildeten.
Da die CSU aktuell bei 37 Prozent steht, reicht es weder f√ºr ein B√ºndnis mit den Liberalen noch mit den Freien W√§hlern.
Wegen des immer gr√∂√üer werdenden Parteiensystems werde die CSU "in zehn Jahren Kerzen in Alt√∂tting stiften, wenn sie 40 oder 42 Prozent bekommt".
TEXT:
Der Dauerstreit in der CSU schadet der Partei massiv

Die absolute Mehrheit scheint kaum mehr zu retten zu sein ‚Äì egal, wer k√ºnftig die Partei f√ºhren wird

Wir erkl√§ren die wahrscheinlichsten Szenarien im Streit um die Parteif√ºhrung

Es ist noch nicht lange her, da blickten die beiden anderen Volksparteien ein ums andere Mal neidvoll in den S√ºden der Republik auf den bayerischen L√∂wen.

W√§hrend CDU und SPD anderenorts immer √∂fter nur noch zusammen eine Mehrheit erringen konnten, gl√§nzte die CSU bei Wahlen immer wieder mit einer absoluten Mehrheit.

In den vergangenen 60 Jahren mussten die Christsozialen nur vier Jahre lang ihre Macht in der Staatskanzlei mit einer anderen Partei teilen. Noch bei der Landtagswahl 2013 triumphierte die CSU mit fast 48 Prozent.

Doch nun regiert bei den Schwarzen das Chaos.

Nicht mal Schwarz-Gelb h√§tte eine Mehrheit

W√§ren an diesem Sonntag Landtagswahlen w√ºrden noch 37 Prozent der Befragten der CSU ihre Stimme geben. Das geht aus einer aktuellen GMS-Umfrage hervor. Nur noch 17 Prozent aller Befragten w√§ren daf√ºr, dass die CSU Bayern weiterhin allein regiert ‚Äì unvorstellbar in einem Land, in dem CSU und Staat Jahrzehnte lang eine Art Symbiose bildeten.

Derzeit h√§tte nicht einmal Schwarz-Gelb eine Mehrheit. Grund f√ºr das fehlende W√§hlervertrauen ist den Demoskopen zufolge die heillose Zerstrittenheit der Partei.

"Daran, dass in der Partei jemals so heftig gestritten wurde, kann ich mich nicht erinnern", sagt ein langj√§hriger CSU-Landtagsabgeordneter. Die Auseinandersetzungen um die Macht seien seit Anfang der 1950er-Jahre nicht mehr so "erbittert gef√ºhrt worden‚Äú, konstatiert auch der CSU-nahe Politologe Heinrich Oberreuter.

Weber hat m√§chtige Gegner

Und der Streit droht sich nun massiv zuzuspitzen: Am Donnerstagabend berichteten mehrere Medien, dass auch CSU-Vize Weber f√ºr das Amt des Parteivorsitzenden kandidieren wolle.

Weber hat durchaus Unterst√ºtzer. "Nat√ºrlich w√§re er der richtige", sagt ein f√ºhrender niederbayerischer CSU-Mann.

Doch CSU-Landesgruppenchef Alexander Dobrindt soll ebenso wie der aktuelle CSU-Chef und Ministerpr√§sident Horst Seehofer dagegen sein. Dobrindt wolle, dass Seehofer Parteichef bleibt, berichteten mehrere Medien. Das galt bislang als wahrscheinliche L√∂sung.

Klar ist: Bayerns Finanzminister Markus S√∂der stellt sich bei der anstehenden Abstimmung in der CSU-Landtagsfraktion an diesem Montag im Kampf um die Spitzenkandidatur zur Wahl. Das best√§tigten auch mehrere Landtagsabgeordnete sowie ein hochrangiger Christsozialer der HuffPost. S√∂der ist Franke ‚Äì und hat dort besonders viele Unterst√ºtzer.

S√∂der hat in der Fraktion die meisten Anh√§nger

Mehrere Medien wie die "S√ºddeutsche Zeitung" hatten zudem berichtet, dass Bayerns Innenminister Joachim Herrmann (der auch Franke ist) ‚Äì unterst√ºtzt vom Seehofer-Lager ‚Äì gegen ihn antreten wolle. Mehrere eher S√∂der-nahe Landtagsabgeordnete bezweifeln dies allerdings und gehen davon aus, dass nur S√∂der antreten werde.

Auch in der in der "Bayerischen Staatszeitung" wird ein f√ºhrender CSU-Mann zitiert, dass eine Kandidatur Herrmanns noch nicht fest stehe. Andere Christsoziale halten auf Anfrage eine Kandidatur Herrmanns dagegen f√ºr wahrscheinlich.

Klar ist jetzt schon: Der CSU droht in den kommenden Monaten Dauerstreit. Denn vorstellbar sind mehrere Szenarien:

Szenario 1: Sowohl S√∂der als auch Seehofer besetzen Spitzen√§mter

W√ºrde S√∂der Spitzenkandidat im Rennen um die Ministerpr√§sidentschaft und Seehofer bliebe Parteichef w√ºrde eine Dauerfehde drohen. Seehofer k√∂nnte S√∂der laufend beharken. Die beiden k√∂nnen sich bekannterma√üen nicht leiden.

Seehofer soll √ºberzeugt sein, dass es S√∂der war, der 2007 die "Bild" √ºber sein nichteheliches Kind informierte. Das berichtet die "SZ". Auch ein zweites Schmutzger√ºcht f√ºhren seine Leute demnach auf S√∂der zur√ºck. Zudem gilt: Die CSU hat mit Doppelspitzen schlechte Erfahrungen gemacht. Es g√§be dann zwei Machtzentren.

Szenario 2: Zwei Franken treten gegeneinander an

W√ºrde Herrmann Spitzenkandidat bei der Landtagswahl, k√∂nnte S√∂der wegen des Regionalproporzes keinesfalls zumindest Parteichef werden ‚Äì zwei Franken an der Spitze w√§re ein No-Go.

Doch S√∂der d√ºrfte sich eine so bittere Niederlage kaum gefallen lassen und im Wahlkampf wohl kaum ruhig halten. Seine Anh√§ngerschaft ist m√§chtig - mindestens ein Drittel der Mitglieder der Landtagsfraktion, sogar beachtliche Teile der altbayerischen Bezirksverb√§nde.

Szenario 3: S√∂der und Weber machen das Rennen

W√ºrde S√∂der zwar Spitzenkandidat im Rennen um die Ministerpr√§sidentschaft, Weber jedoch Parteichef, bliebe das generelle Problem der Doppelspitze. Zudem wurde Weber bislang dem Anti-S√∂der-Lager zugerechnet.

Szenario 4: S√∂der wird Parteichef und Spitzenkandidat

K√∂nnte S√∂der sogar beide Spitzenposten der CSU f√ºr sich einnehmen, w√ºrde dies dem noch immer einflussreichen Seehofer-Lager ganz und gar nicht schmecken. Hier droht eine Dauer-Fehde.

Klar ist: Sowohl mit Streitereien als auch mit Doppelspitzen hatte die CSU zuletzt schlimme Erfahrungen gemacht: 2008 rutschte die Partei um 17 Prozentpunkte auf ein Ergebnis von 43,4 Prozent. Die Christsozialen verloren damals die absolute Mehrheit, nachdem G√ºnther Beckstein und Erwin Huber um die Nachfolge Edmund Stoibers gerangelt hatten.

"Zun√§chst befriedet die Trennung von Parteichef und Spitzenkandidatur das Land, doch sp√§ter entstand bislang in der Regel doch wieder Streit", sagt Oberreuter. Partei- und Regierungsf√ºhrung geh√∂re in eine Hand.

GroKo f√ºr Bayern

Ein f√ºhrender Weber-naher CSU-Mann verweist dagegen auf "gute Erfahrungen", die man unter Edmund Stoiber als Ministerpr√§sident und Theo Waigel als Parteichef gemacht habe.

Doch sicher ist wohl auch: Passiert nicht noch ein Wunder und die CSU sorgt mit einer salomonischen L√∂sung f√ºr Ruhe, k√∂nnte in Bayern ein Regierungsb√ºndnis zustande kommen, das anderswo seit vielen Jahren l√§ngst Teil des politischen Alltags ist: eine gro√üe Koalition.

Da die CSU aktuell bei 37 Prozent steht, reicht es weder f√ºr ein B√ºndnis mit den Liberalen noch mit den Freien W√§hlern. Gut m√∂glich, dass ein k√ºnftiger CSU-Chef eine Koalition mit der SPD im Vergleich zu einem Dreier-B√ºndnis oder einem in Bayern wegen der Fl√ºchtlingsfrage besonders konfliktgeladenen schwarz-gr√ºnen B√ºndnis vorzieht.

Bayern n√§hert sich Deutschland an

Oberreuter prophezeit: "Absolute Mehrheiten werden f√ºr die Christsozialen k√ºnftig unwahrscheinlich." Wegen des immer gr√∂√üer werdenden Parteiensystems werde die CSU "in zehn Jahren Kerzen in Alt√∂tting stiften, wenn sie 40 oder 42 Prozent bekommt".

Klar ist: Nach sieben Jahrzehnten der politischen Abschottung, k√∂nnte das politische System in Bayern dem im Rest der Republik deutlich √§hnlicher werden.
TITLE: Die CSU versinkt im Chaos: Warum jetzt ein langer Streit droht - und eine schmerzhafte Wahlniederlage

TEXT:
While most shows deliver their voting terms and conditions rather swiftly, they‚Äôre an entirely different ballgame in the world of ‚ÄòStrictly Come Dancing‚Äô.

Every week, Claudia Winkleman introduces something, or someone, rather unexpected to deliver the rules on the phone vote and on Saturday (2 December) night, viewers got a special treat in the form of a return from Russell Grant.

When competing in the 2011 series, the astrologer delivered a number of memorable - thought not necessarily technically good‚Ä¶ - performances, and the same could be said for his musical version of the T&Cs.

Appearing in the ‚ÄòClauditorium‚Äô, Russell was dressed as the genie from ‚ÄòAladdin‚Äô and proceeded to sing the voting rules to the tune of ‚ÄòWhole New World‚Äô:
TITLE: ‚ÄòStrictly Come Dancing‚Äô: Russell Grant Makes Surprise Return For Musicals Week

SUMMARY:
Alors je ne vais pas le nier.
Cette semaine a connu des hauts et des bas.
Sortir au dernier moment un soir parce qu'on veut finalement des p√¢tes au pesto et pas √† la sauce tomate.
Cela m'a rappel√© une apr√®s-midi √† l'√©cole primaire, la fiert√© que j'avais eu √† ramener cette feuille marronn√¢tre √† la maison.
Et passer au stade sup√©rieur : faire du lobbying aupr√®s de mes proches et coll√®gues pour que le z√©ro d√©chet essaime un peu plus.
TEXT:
Il y a cinq jours, je vous ai mis au d√©fi de r√©duire vos d√©chets. Depuis cinq jours donc (bon, un peu plus, j'avais pris de l'avance!) je tente de faire de m√™me. Alors certes, devenir z√©ro d√©chet, √ßa ne se fait pas en 5 jours. La question est : vais-je poursuivre l'exp√©rience pour tenter d'atteindre cet objectif? J'ai envie de r√©pondre oui.

Alors je ne vais pas le nier. Cette semaine a connu des hauts et des bas. Les hauts c'√©taient chaque commer√ßant qui me disait : "Quelle bonne id√©e !" C'√©tait le magasin de vrac qui me donnait ses recettes. C'√©tait vos posts sur l'event facebook pour donner vos conseils.

Les bas c'√©tait le resto asiatique du coin qui a tenu √† me montrer que demander √† mettre mes nouilles dans un tupperware √ßa ne servait pas √† grand chose puisque les sauces √©taient d√©j√† dans des r√©cipients en plastique. C'√©tait cette soir√©e √† une conf√©rence o√π l'on proposait du poulet yassa avec assiettes en carton et couverts en plastiques. Je ne peux pas dire non √† de la nourriture...

Tout √ßa peut √™tre anticip√©: il faut toujours avoir un tupperware avec soi, des couverts, une serviette. Pas facile. Je ne suis pas certaine d'y arriver tous les jours ! Mais je vous promets, √† vous qui avez suivi ce d√©fi et aux tortues de mer, que je tenterai de maintenir le cap.

Tout anticiper, c'est r√©duire ses d√©penses

D'ailleurs, au bout d'une semaine, je comprends pourquoi B√©a Johnson estime que cela permet de r√©duire ses d√©penses et de gagner du temps. Pour la seule et m√™me raison: il faut toujours tout anticiper. Apporter son tupperware pour son d√©jeuner au bureau, c'est √©viter de payer 10‚Ç¨ un menu √† emporter dans le resto du coin. C'est anticiper ses courses. Faire son march√© une fois par semaine en r√©fl√©chissant √† ce que l'on veut manger, penser √† ne rien oublier dans le magasin √† vrac. Se faire plaisir - "je vais bien manger demain" - en cuisinant sa tambouille.

√Ä l'inverse, vouloir se faire plaisir sur le moment, c'est passer du temps √† se demander ce que l'on veut manger. Sortir au dernier moment un soir parce qu'on veut finalement des p√¢tes au pesto et pas √† la sauce tomate.

Avoir des produits lavables et non pas jetables c'est passer moins de temps √† faire les courses, √† se demander si l'on n'a rien oubli√©.

Je ne suis pas concern√©e mais de nombreux t√©moignages de familles indiquent que celles-ci mettent leurs enfants √† contribution. Dans la cuisine pour faire des cookies pour le go√ªter. Lors de balades pour ramasser des ch√¢taignes, des m√ªres... et autres selon les saisons. B√©a Johnson donne sa recette pour faire son papier recycl√©. Cela m'a rappel√© une apr√®s-midi √† l'√©cole primaire, la fiert√© que j'avais eu √† ramener cette feuille marronn√¢tre √† la maison.

Ne pas se priver pour autant

Aujourd'hui, je ne peux plus voir un gobelet ou un sac en plastique sans penser √† un poisson, un hippocampe, une tortue de mer.

Je reste dans une phase "de transition" comme on dit. Cette semaine, les d√©chets que j'ai jet√©s datent de mes achats de la semaine pr√©c√©dente : quelques pots de yaourts, un sachet de lentilles... Je ne souhaite pas me mettre √† la di√®te non plus. J'aime le pamplemousse au petit dej et les √©pluchures ne se compostent pas. Par ailleurs, je porte des lentilles jetables, j'aime me maquiller...

Mais j'ai pass√© suffisamment d'√©tapes pour tenter de poursuivre cette exp√©rience. Et passer au stade sup√©rieur : faire du lobbying aupr√®s de mes proches et coll√®gues pour que le z√©ro d√©chet essaime un peu plus.

√Ä voir √©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: J'ai tent√© de r√©duire mes d√©chets pendant une semaine (et j'ai surv√©cu)

SUMMARY:
A Hawaii Civil Defense Warning Device, which sounds an alert siren during natural disasters, is shown in Honolulu on Wednesday, Nov. 29, 2017.
First state to bring back sirensThere are 385 warning sirens throughout the islands.
Hawaii officials said it is the first state to bring back the Cold War-era attack warning system.
I thought if it is a nuclear missile attack, there's nothing I can do about it, so I'm just going to relax.
"I thought if it is a nuclear missile attack, there's nothing I can do about it, so I'm just going to relax."
TEXT:
A Hawaii Civil Defense Warning Device, which sounds an alert siren during natural disasters, is shown in Honolulu on Wednesday, Nov. 29, 2017.

HONOLULU ‚Äî Hawaii officials were checking if sirens intended to alert tourists and residents to a possible nuclear attack from North Korea malfunctioned or were not loud enough Friday after the first test of the warning system since the end of the Cold War was barely heard at one of the state's most popular beaches.

The sirens largely were drowned out by crashing waves and wind along Waikiki, the famous stretch of beach in the shadow of the Diamond Head volcano. Beachgoers hardly noticed the test, which sounded like a distant siren. The warning would give people 20 minutes to take shelter ahead of an imminent missile strike.

"I was out in the ocean playing around, and I heard this siren," said tourist Tom Passmore from Calgary, adding that he didn't think much of it.

"I think it's a good idea," he said of the test, "but judging by everyone's reaction around here, nobody moved."

Vern Miyagi, administrator of the Hawaii Emergency Management Agency, said early reports indicate the test went well, but officials could get complaints later. They will document any they receive and investigate if there were any glitches ‚Äî a process they carry out after every monthly test of a siren for natural disasters.

First state to bring back sirens

There are 385 warning sirens throughout the islands. How well someone hears them depends on how close they are to a device, Miyagi said.

Hawaii officials said it is the first state to bring back the Cold War-era attack warning system. The wailing siren sounded for a minute after the usual testing of the steady alert for tsunamis and other events that residents are used to hearing.

The possibility of a strike is remote but it's important to be prepared, Gov. David Ige said this week. The test will ensure the public knows what to do in case of an impending attack, he said.

The state delayed the test for a month to let people know it would be happening, Miyagi said. Hawaii turned to public service announcements on TV and radio, town hall meetings, information on agency websites and media stories.

I thought if it is a nuclear missile attack, there's nothing I can do about it, so I'm just going to relax. Thomas Hanes

Honolulu resident Mark Valdez was taking a walk in Ala Moana Beach Park, about a mile away from Waikiki, during the test. He said he's heard some information about it but that he "wouldn't know what to do" in an emergency.

Also in the park, Thomas Hanes and his wife sat in hammocks as the sirens sounded.

"We heard it quite clearly, and it was effective," he said. "I just didn't know what it was for."

The Los Angeles residents, who stopped in Hawaii on their way to Australia, had not heard anything about the test.

"I assumed it was a test," Hanes said. "I thought if it is a nuclear missile attack, there's nothing I can do about it, so I'm just going to relax."

One of the closest states to North Korea

It comes the same week North Korea fired a powerful nuclear-capable intercontinental ballistic missile it calls the Hwasong-15, leading analysts to conclude the nation has made a jump in its missile capability. The weapon would have a range of more than 8,100 miles (13,000 kilometres), easily reaching the U.S. mainland.

Hawaii is one of the closest states to North Korea, and its large military presence could make it more of a target. The island of Oahu is home to U.S. Pacific Command, the military's headquarters for the Asia-Pacific region. It also hosts dozens of Navy ships at Pearl Harbor and is a key base for the Air Force, Army and Marine Corps.

Miyagi has previously said a nuclear strike on Hawaii would result in thousands of deaths, thermal radiation, severe damage to critical infrastructure and other chaos.

It's great to alert us, I guess to say our last goodbyes, which is basically all you can do. Karen Lindsay

The tests will continue on the first business day of every month.

Karen Lindsay and Carolyn Fujioka of Honolulu kept eating their lunch in Ala Moana Beach Park during the test. They thought that if it were a real emergency, there would not be time to do much.

"It's great to alert us, I guess to say our last goodbyes, which is basically all you can do," Lindsay said. "You just hope it never comes to that."

Associated Press writer Haven Daley contributed to this report.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Hawaii Tests Nuclear Attack Siren For The First Time Since The Cold War

SUMMARY:
Less than half of Canada's population aged 25 to 54 worked a full-time job for all of 2015, census data shows.
Only 48.2 per cent of people in that prime working age group worked a full-time job for the whole year, StatCan said.
The proportion of women in that age group who worked full-time all year also declined from 46.4 per cent to 43.7 per cent over the past decade.
In October, Canada added 49,900 part-time jobs and 29,600 full-time jobs.
And despite an economy showing signs of losing steam in recent months, November represented Canada's twelfth consecutive month of job gains.
TEXT:
Less than half of Canada's population aged 25 to 54 worked a full-time job for all of 2015, census data shows.

Only 48.2 per cent of people in that prime working age group worked a full-time job for the whole year, StatCan said.

Compared to a decade earlier, men saw a greater decline in the rate than women, though women were overall less likely to hold a full-time job through the year, both then and now.

Some 56 per cent of men aged 25 to 54 worked full-time all year in 2015, down from 63.3 per cent a decade earlier ‚Äî the lowest rate since 1980, the first reference year for which comparable statistics were collected.

The proportion of women in that age group who worked full-time all year also declined from 46.4 per cent to 43.7 per cent over the past decade.

It's a sign that part-time and precarious work is on the rise in Canada, with studies pointing to it becoming the new norm over the next decade. An April survey from temp agency Randstad Canada estimated 20 to 30 per cent of jobs in Canada today are "non-traditional," meaning temp work, contract work or self-employment.

Canada's overall employment rate in May 2016 ‚Äî when the census was administered ‚Äî was 60.2 per cent, down from 62.6 per cent in May 2006.

The census data pointed to regional differences in employment rates in 2016, with Prairie provinces (Alberta, Saskatchewan, and Manitoba) boasting above-average numbers consistent with an above-average number of people moving there because of work prospects.

Immigrants also made up a larger share of Canada's work force in 2016, acounting for 23.8 per cent of the labour force, up from 21.2 per cent in 2006. In Toronto, immigrants made up half the workforce, and in Vancouver and Calgary, they represented 43.2 per cent and 32.5 per cent, respectively.

More seniors are also staying in the workforce, with one-fifth of workers over 65 staying on the job in 2016 ‚Äî twice the rate of a decade earlier.

Job growth was highest in service-producing industries, and the largest employers were in health care and social assistance.

Contrast to latest job numbers

The census numbers are a stark contrast to Friday's job numbers, which showed Canada adding 390,000 net new jobs over the past year, representing a 2.1 per cent increase in total jobs ‚Äî faster than population growth.

Full-time work has gone up by 441,000 in the past year ‚Äî representing a 3 per cent gain ‚Äî at the fastest rate in 15 years, according to TD Bank.

In October, Canada added 49,900 part-time jobs and 29,600 full-time jobs.

And despite an economy showing signs of losing steam in recent months, November represented Canada's twelfth consecutive month of job gains.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Less Than Half Of Canada's Prime-Age Workers Kept A Full-Time Job For All Of 2015

TEXT:
Sergej Malinka wurde 2007 vorgeworfen, etwas mit dem Verschwinden des britischen M√§dchens Madeleine McCann zutun zu haben

Doch bis heute gibt es daf√ºr keine Hinweise

Malinka spricht jetzt dar√ºber, wie die Vorw√ºrfe sein Leben zerst√∂rten

Sergej Malinka ist heute 32 Jahre alt. Der Russe wird bald zum ersten Mal Vater, er f√ºhrt ein geregeltes Leben in Portugal. Doch das war nicht immer so.

2007 hatte die Polizei ihn beschuldigt, etwas mit dem Verschwinden des britischen M√§dchens Madeleine McCann zutun zu haben. Ab diesem Zeitpunkt nahm sein Leben eine dramatische Wende.

Malinka jobbte damals in einem Restaurant, war gerade mit seinen Eltern nach Portugal gezogen. Am Abend des 3. Mai, der Tag an dem Maddie McCann verschwand, gingen ihre Eltern Gerry und Kate McCann in das Restaurant "Ocean Club" essen - jenes Lokal, in dem Malinka arbeitete.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: R√§tselhafter zweiter Fall: Maddie McCann ist nicht das einzige Kind, das an der Algarve verschwunden ist

Sp√§ter am Abend war das dreij√§hrige M√§dchen verschwunden. Und Malinka r√ºckte ins Visier der Ermittler. Verd√§chtig machte ihn in den Augen der Polizei, dass er noch in der Nacht des Verschwindens von Maddie eine Stunde mit einem portugiesischen Gesch√§ftsmann telefonierte. Worum es in dem Telefonat ging, ist nicht bekannt. Dennoch wurde Malinka mehrmals verh√∂rt.

Auch seine Computer wurden untersucht. Hinweise auf ein Verbrechen fand die Polizei nicht. Schon bald galt er nicht mehr als ein Verd√§chtiger im Fall Maddie McCann.

"Ich habe alle verloren"

Doch da hatte die Abw√§rtsspirale schon Fahrt aufgenommen, die Medien waren auf ihn aufmerksam geworden.

Mit schlimmen Folgen f√ºr sein Privatleben.

Heute, 10 Jahre sp√§ter, spricht Malinka offen √ºber das, was ihm nach den Anschuldigungen passierte. Die Ereignisse verarbeitete er in seinem Buch "Kollateral-Schaden", das 2018 auf den Markt kommen soll.

"Ich wurde zu falschen Behauptungen und Anschuldigungen bez√ºglich ihres Verschwindens gezwungen. Ich habe alle verloren - Jobs, Freunde, Hoffnung", sagt Malinka √ºber die belastende Zeit, wie die britische Nachrichtenseite "Express" berichtet.

Auf sein Auto sei ein Brandanschlag ver√ºbt, auf den Gehsteig daneben das portugiesische Wort "Fala" gespr√ºht worden - auf deutsch bedeutet es "Sprich". In manchen Momenten habe er am "Rande der Verzweiflung" gestanden. "Ich war 22 Jahre alt, ein junger Mann, der alleine in einem fremden Land war", zitiert der "Express" Malinka.

Malinka habe irgendwann sogar um sein Leben gef√ºrchtet und sei f√ºr einige Zeit aus der Gegend weggezogen.

Nun, Jahre sp√§ter, will er wieder ein normales Leben f√ºhren: "Jetzt versuche ich, mir mein Leben aus den Tr√ºmmern dieses Ereignisses neu aufzubauen. Zehn Jahre sp√§ter werde ich zum ersten Mal Vater. Meine Familie ist mein Leben. Ich werde es nicht l√§nger zulassen, dass die L√ºgen anderer unsere Zukunft vergiften."



(ll)
TITLE: Einem Mann wurde vorgeworfen, Maddie McCann entf√ºhrt zu haben - jetzt bricht er sein Schweigen

SUMMARY:
The news, coming on the heels of a second season released in late October that turned things totally upside down , is making fans of the show way more than halfway happy.
Netflix does not release viewership information, but according to Nielsen, 361,000 people binged all nine episodes of the second season the first day they were available.
Three days after the Season 2 release, 15.8 million viewers had watched the premiere episode.
The second season was highly promoted by the streaming service ‚Äî they even ran an ad during Super Bowl LI ‚Äî and it has been well-received by critics.
Netflix has not released a premiere date for the third season, but the Duffer brothers confirmed to Yahoo Entertainment this month that there will have to be a significant lapse in time between the end of Season 2 and the beginning of Season 3.
TEXT:
The news, coming on the heels of a second season released in late October that turned things totally upside down , is making fans of the show way more than halfway happy.

Netflix does not release viewership information, but according to Nielsen, 361,000 people binged all nine episodes of the second season the first day they were available. Three days after the Season 2 release, 15.8 million viewers had watched the premiere episode.

The second season was highly promoted by the streaming service ‚Äî they even ran an ad during Super Bowl LI ‚Äî and it has been well-received by critics.

Netflix has not released a premiere date for the third season, but the Duffer brothers confirmed to Yahoo Entertainment this month that there will have to be a significant lapse in time between the end of Season 2 and the beginning of Season 3.

‚ÄúIt will have to be somewhat of a time gap, because the kids are, I mean, they already look so much older,‚Äù Ross Duffer said. ‚ÄúNo matter what we want to do, I remember when we were originally talking about Season 2, we wanted to just start it in Christmas and just go from there, but then we realized the kids are just too old, so we had to jump forward. Even the latest trailer, we had to loop a line with [Caleb McLaughlin, who plays Lucas]. He sounds like a man now. It creeps me out. He‚Äôs going to be driving to set next year.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt seems very wrong,‚Äù Matt Duffer added. ‚ÄúThe minute I see Caleb drive up, I‚Äôm probably going to pass out.‚Äù

Until then, some fans on Reddit are having a good time fantasizing about what they‚Äôd like to see in the next season.
TITLE: ‚ÄòStranger Things‚Äô Renewed For Season 3 By Netflix

SUMMARY:
Reading praise for an advert being ‚Äúphotoshop free‚Äù, I found myself questioning, what does that mean anymore?
Fashion brand Anine Bing‚Äôs latest lingerie campaign is photoshop-free.
Though the self-love aspect is fitting for a lingerie advert, unfortunately it does not feel inspiring.
Lingerie can be seductive and sexy, and underwear models have for the majority of time been suggested to also think a certain way.
One of their campaign models was founder of skincare line, Jessica Gomes.
TEXT:
Reading praise for an advert being ‚Äúphotoshop free‚Äù, I found myself questioning, what does that mean anymore? Whenever an advertising campaign uses buzzwords like ‚Äúphotoshop-free‚Äù, I am always intrigued by what the company‚Äôs version of not altering a woman‚Äôs body looks like. Fashion brand Anine Bing‚Äôs latest lingerie campaign is photoshop-free. It features a range of women aged between 19 and 64. The founder of the LA based and Scandinavian influenced store stated in her blog: ‚ÄúThe campaign is about loving yourself, celebrating yourself, being yourself, and wearing what you want to wear for yourself!‚Äù. The campaign follows nine women who are are entrepreneurs, cancer survivors, philanthropists and mothers, and it focuses on these women being photographed in their ‚Äúnatural environment‚Äù - the selection in the diversity of women is conscious and praised. Though the self-love aspect is fitting for a lingerie advert, unfortunately it does not feel inspiring.

The message behind the campaign may have been about body positivity and loving the places we all call home, but most of Anine Bing‚Äôs models were slim and model-esque, especially in the visuals shared with Teen Vogue. This campaign is not explicitly made up of an assortment of body shapes, as would be required for it to be in the body positive arena - a term used to help women feel secure and beautiful regardless of their body shape. From size, to scarring, to body hair, being proud of your body is the core value behind this movement on social media. The Anine Bing campaign, which displays videos and photographs of women in the underwear sold, does tell stories of pregnancy and different creative leadership roles some of the women have. Props are definitely to be given to Bing and her team for viewing diversity as being about more than just casting ‚Äòethnic‚Äô models (ie. including a cancer survivor), but all of the bodies shown in the campaign still fit into Eurocentric and normative beauty standards. But for a campaign projecting variety, this seemed two dimensional; as if the clothing and accessories brand was on the ‚Äòinclusivity‚Äô bandwagon without truly committing. The campaign was made up largely of white women stylised in their ‚Äúnatural setting‚Äù - out of nine models, just two are women of colour. And although a few bumps may be shown on the models‚Äô flesh through the simple act of sitting down, this is not anything new or boundary-pushing.

Instead of having a campaign which reflected reality, the advert was shown through a lens, which may not have had any post photoshop editing, but was narrow in displaying a broad spectrum of beauty and perceptions of women. Plus - much can be achieved to portray beauty still far from the reality of many, with good natural light and rose-tinted editing. Lingerie can be seductive and sexy, and underwear models have for the majority of time been suggested to also think a certain way. Anine Bing had an opportunity to portray women in their underwear to be more interesting and well-rounded but fell into the trap of cliches. One of their campaign models was founder of skincare line, Jessica Gomes. When featured on Anine Bing‚Äôs blog, Gomes was noted to be feeling ‚Äúcheeky and naughty‚Äù in her lingerie.
TITLE: Why I'm Not Going To Applaud Your Advert Just Because It's 'Photoshop-Free'

SUMMARY:
New guidance on food labelling has been issued to tackle food waste.
Food labels will be simplified to help consumers know when their food has expired and how is best to store it: little blue fridge logos will indicate which foods need to be refrigerated, while snowflake logos will advise people where foods can be frozen.
We spoke to sustainability experts Wrap, who issued the guidance, and devised a quiz about where‚Äôs best to store food at home to keep it fresher for longer.
TEXT:
New guidance on food labelling has been issued to tackle food waste.

Food labels will be simplified to help consumers know when their food has expired and how is best to store it: little blue fridge logos will indicate which foods need to be refrigerated, while snowflake logos will advise people where foods can be frozen.

We spoke to sustainability experts Wrap, who issued the guidance, and devised a quiz about where‚Äôs best to store food at home to keep it fresher for longer.
TITLE: Quiz: Which Of These Foods Should You Keep In The Fridge?

La nouvelle s√©rie sur la vie de Sabrina Spellman s'intitulera The Chilling Adventures of Sabrina et le tournage devrait d√©buter en f√©vrier. Le titre est le m√™me qu'un livre publi√© par Archie Horror, une sous-marque d'Archie Comics.

L'histoire se passe dans les ann√©es 1960 et tourne autour de la vie de Sabrina Spellman pendant ses ann√©es d'adolescence. L'histoire d'horreur devrait causer des frissons. SUMMARY:
Bollywood actress Vidya Balan attends a promotional event for Japanese electronic company Toshiba in Mumbai April 15, 2008.
Vidya says it is not that she was not taking risks as an actor but somehow her experiments did not work until now.
"Every time I tried something new, the films didn't work.
Most of India lives in middle class, people tell me I capture little things of middle class life.
I am like, I have grown up in a middle class family.
TEXT:
Bollywood actress Vidya Balan attends a promotional event for Japanese electronic company Toshiba in Mumbai April 15, 2008. Toshiba announced Balan as their brand ambassador in India. REUTERS/Arko Datta (INDIA)

"Tumhari Sulu", an aspirational drama about a housewife, has ended Vidya Balan's dry run at the box office and the actor believes the film clicked with the audiences because its story is rooted in middle class ethos.

Vidya says it is not that she was not taking risks as an actor but somehow her experiments did not work until now.

"Every time I tried something new, the films didn't work.

It is the unfortunate truth," she says in an interview with PTI.

"When the films don't do well, it means not many people have seen it. But at the same time, whenever I have attempted to do something different, I have given my best. Thankfully, my work was appreciated always."

The film, directed by Suresh Triveni, features Vidya as a housewife, who is full of business plans and one day lands herself the job of a Radio Jockey.

The actor says the movie is a celebration of every day woman and her indomitable spirit.

"A woman is balancing everything in life. Most of the time, women are not appreciated, unless they are achievers.

You do not have to be Indra Nooyi (to be appreciated). Women should be appreciated for everything they do as they do it with commitment and dedication. This script does that."

The film has been appreciated for its witty one-liners and Vidya's chemistry with Manav Kaul, who plays her husband.

The actor credits Triveni for putting together a great story and successfully capturing the real-life emotions.

"There were some impromptu elements that we added during the shooting. I can't take the credit, I just followed what was in the script. Suresh sees humour in real life situations, in the mundanity of every life. This is one of the best scripts that I read and it just got better when we started shooting."

The national-award-winning actor says the love that is pouring in for the film is primarily because the sensibilities between her and the director matched.

"It is difficult to say where an actor's job has ended and the director's had started. If I get credit for making the character look relatable it is also to the director's credit."

The actor recently visited a theatre to gauge the audience reaction and found it heart-warming to see that people engaged with the story.

"I do think rooted stories are doing well. Most of India lives in middle class, people tell me I capture little things of middle class life. I am like, I have grown up in a middle class family. I am grateful for life, for everything," Vidya says.

The 38-year-old actor says "Tumhari Sulu" once again proves that a good story will resonate with the viewers.

"Good content always works. When a certain film resonates with the audience, they love it. Today no one type of film is working. The story has to connect with people."

Produced by T-Series and Ellipsis Entertainment, the comedy-drama released on November 17.
TITLE: Interview: 'Every Time I Tried Something New, Films Didn't Work,' Says Vidya Balan

TEXT:
La Fausse victime du Bataclan C√©dric Rey condamn√© √† six mois de prison ferme

POOL New / Reuters

JUSTICE - Un employ√© de la s√©curit√© civile de 29 ans, accus√© de s'√™tre fait passer pour une victime de l'attentat du 13 novembre 2015 au Bataclan, a √©t√© condamn√© √† six mois de prison ferme pour tentative d'escroquerie, vendredi 1er d√©cembre au tribunal correctionnel de Versailles. La procureure avait requis deux ans d'emprisonnement avec mandat d√©p√¥t.

Cet ambulancier de formation avait racont√© avec force d√©tails aux m√©dias, ce qu'il disait avoir v√©cu √† la terrasse du Bataclan ce soir-l√†. Selon son r√©cit, il buvait un verre avec deux amis quand il a vu arriver les tireurs. Une "femme enceinte" avait alors "pris les balles qui (lui) √©taient destin√©es", disait-il. Int√©gr√© dans les groupes de victimes, il s'√©tait fait un tatouage repr√©sentant une Marianne devant le Bataclan et avait √©t√© de longues semaines en arr√™t maladie. Il avait aussi rempli en janvier 2016 un dossier d'indemnisation aupr√®s du Fonds de garantie des victimes de terrorisme et d'autres infractions.

Les enqu√™teurs s'√©taient int√©ress√©s √† son cas un an apr√®s: il n'avait pas port√© plainte et des incoh√©rences avaient √©t√© relev√©es dans son r√©cit, notamment le fait qu'aucune femme enceinte n'avait perdu la vie ce soir-l√†, selon une source proche du dossier.

La t√©l√©phonie a ensuite montr√© que le jeune homme se trouvait √† une trentaine de kilom√®tres du Bataclan au moment des faits, selon la m√™me source. Ce n'est que vers minuit qu'il s'est trouv√© pr√®s de la salle de concert, o√π des t√©moins ont signal√© sa pr√©sence.

Nouvelle expertise psychiatrique

R√©sidant depuis plusieurs mois en Nouvelle-Cal√©donie, o√π il √©tait sapeur-pompier volontaire et formateur en secourisme, C√©dric Rey a expliqu√© lors d'une audience le 27 octobre √™tre rentr√© en France pour des raisons personnelles et avoir alors appris que la gendarmerie cherchait √† l'entendre.

D√©but 2016, le Fonds de garantie des victimes de terrorisme et d'autres infractions n'avait pas donn√© suite au dossier d'indemnisation du pr√©venu faute de pi√®ces suffisantes. Ce dernier est poursuivi pour tentative d'escroquerie au pr√©judice du fonds et encourt cinq ans de prison. Au moins sept personnes ont √©t√© condamn√©es depuis les attentats de Paris et Saint-Denis pour tentative d'escroquerie ou escroquerie.
TITLE: La fausse victime du Bataclan C√©dric Rey condamn√© √† six mois de prison ferme

SUMMARY:
Quale √® il motivo che spinge le persone a rivolgersi alla rete, anzich√© a medici e istituzioni deputate proprio a questo?
Ma anche quando va incontro a risposte centrate, ma non sa interpretare, n√© recepire correttamente.
E anche qualora ci riuscisse, non √® in grado di proseguire nella cura del proprio corpo se non si affida ai medici, agli specialisti, alle strutture deputate.
Come dice Burioni: "La scienza non √® democratica".
No, non lo √®. Ma non possiamo non tener conto di questi nuovi canali informativi che sono a disposizione dei pazienti.
TEXT:
"Non si deve mirare alla criminalizzazione dell'utente che cerca informazioni sulla sua salute su Internet. N√©, noi medici, dobbiamo assumere un atteggiamento di lesa maest√†". Lo spunto per una chiacchierata con il dottor Enzo Lucchini, presidente della Fondazione Irccs dell'Istituto Nazionale dei Tumori di Milano, ce lo d√† un cartello circolato in rete in cui, ironicamente ma non troppo, si legge:

"Coloro che si sono gi√† diagnosticati da soli tramite Google, ma desiderano un secondo parere, per cortesia controllino su yahoo.com". Dietro alla frase sarcastica, c'√® una verit√† piuttosto amara: "Circa l'88% (dati Censis) degli italiani cerca l'autodiagnosi digitando i sintomi su Google. Di questo 88%, il 93% sono donne", ci dice il dottor Lucchini.

Quale √® il motivo che spinge le persone a rivolgersi alla rete, anzich√© a medici e istituzioni deputate proprio a questo?

Innanzitutto la fruibilit√† dell'informazione. Il cittadino si rivolge ai motori di ricerca per soddisfare la propria curiosit√†. Atteggiamento assolutamente legittimo. Il problema √® quando si imbatte in informazioni fuorvianti. Ma anche quando va incontro a risposte centrate, ma non sa interpretare, n√© recepire correttamente. Entrambe le situazioni sono rischiose.

Si spieghi meglio.

Nella migliore delle ipotesi che possiamo considerare, l'utente che cerca informazioni sulla sua salute digitando su Internet, si imbatte in ricerche, testi, risposte precise e circostanziate. Ma il pi√π delle volte non ha gli strumenti per decodificarli. E anche qualora ci riuscisse, non √® in grado di proseguire nella cura del proprio corpo se non si affida ai medici, agli specialisti, alle strutture deputate. Questo, mi si lasci dire, √® tanto pi√π vero quando si parla di malattie come i tumori, che richiedono una diagnosi tempestiva e in cui il rischio di imbattersi in canali di cure non tradizionali √® altissimo e fatale.

E cosa succede nel caso in cui le risposte cercate siano errate o fuorvianti?

In questa seconda opzione il paziente viene deviato, a volte da veri e propri pacchetti di comunicazione che mirano alla commercializzazione di un farmaco o di una tecnica di medicina alternativa, e si allontana dal corretto percorso di cura della propria salute.

Come possiamo arginare questo processo?

I medici e le autorit√† sanitarie devono ristabilire una canale di comunicazione consapevole con i pazienti, anche per mezzo di Internet. Devono aiutarlo a capire cosa, nel mare magnum dell'informazione online, merita la sua attenzione. Per fare questo √® necessario vigilare sui contenuti diffusi in rete, ma non solo. Dobbiamo rendere gli utenti critici e dirottarli comunque verso le autorit√† sanitarie per il prosieguo della cura. Noi dell'Istituto nazionale dei tumori di Milano, per esempio, abbiamo sottoscritto il decalogo Unamsi dei giornalisti scientifici contro le fake-news e abbiamo pensato a una serie di iniziative, blog e consulenze gratuite sui social, come strumento di contrasto alle bufale sul web.

Come dice Burioni: "La scienza non √® democratica".

No, non lo √®. Ma non possiamo non tener conto di questi nuovi canali informativi che sono a disposizione dei pazienti. Perci√≤ pi√π che combattere contro il "dottor Google", dobbiamo vigilarlo e istruirlo e fare in modo che sia il pi√π attendibile possibile e che induca il paziente a rivolgersi alle strutture autorizzate e deputate alla cura.
TITLE: "Il 'Dottor Google' esiste e noi medici dobbiamo farci i conti. Ecco come"
