TEXT:
George Bowden/HuffPost UK Universal Credit has led to a surge in the numbers of people needing multiple food parcels from charity, new figures show.

Average foodbank demand in Universal Credit areas climbs 30%

Foodbanks not in Universal Credit areas see 12% increase

Hammersmith and Fulham foodbank sees sharp 94% rise On a street lined with rows of multi-million pound Edwardian houses and Mercedes, Porsches and BMWs, lies the Hammersmith and Fulham Foodbank in South West London. Housed within a church and open twice a week, the foodbank helps hundreds of people a year with emergency parcels. Despite its unlikely location, the wealthy London borough‚Äôs part in the roll out of Universal Credit has seen demand across the area‚Äôs three foodbanks soar by 94%, figures seen by HuffPost UK reveal.

George Bowden/HuffPost UK The Hammersmith and Fulham Foodbank near Parsons Green, South West London, is housed within a church and open two times a week. Demand has surged by 94% since Universal Credit hit the area last year.

Sitting at a table looking at the list of tinned and fresh goods available with her daughter and grand-daughter is Maggie Millard. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been here four times since the beginning of last month,‚Äù the 57-year-old tells HuffPost. ‚ÄúI was moved from [Employment Support Allowance] and onto Universal Credit. As soon as that happened, I just couldn‚Äôt pay the rent. I didn‚Äôt have enough.‚Äù SUBSCRIBE AND FOLLOW UK Get top stories and blog posts emailed to me each day. Newsletters may offer personalized content or advertisements. Learn more Newsletter Please enter a valid email address Thank you for signing up! You should receive an email to confirm your subscription shortly. There was a problem processing your signup; please try again later Facebook

Twitter

Instagram

Podcast

Snapchat

Google+

Pinterest CLOSE Through tears, she explains how the government‚Äôs cap in housing benefit means she does not receive enough Universal Credit to cover the full rent on her council-owned home of 20 years. ‚Ä≥I went into arrears straight away,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúNow they say I‚Äôll have to pay half the rent, but what about money for everything else?‚Äù

George Bowden/HuffPost UK Maggie Millard has been forced to use food banks since moving onto Universal Credit. She's one of dozens of claimants who have been left with no option but to repeatedly seek emergency parcels to feed themselves.

Since moving onto the new benefits regime, which has been rolled out in the borough since June 2016, Maggie has been forced to seek emergency help for basics like food and heating. She‚Äôs been attending the food bank for a month, in which time she has been directed to support from Citizens Advice, who are helping her navigate the myriad of confusing rules Universal Credit imposes. ‚ÄúPeople here have been great, so, so helpful,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúOther places make you feel like you‚Äôve crawled out from a rock.‚Äù

George Bowden/HuffPost UK Food bank manager Daphine Aikens talks to Maggie Millard about her situation on a recent weekday.

‚ÄúThere are so many more Maggies,‚Äù food bank manager Daphine Aikens says. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been brutal. Some people have been made to wait 12 weeks. People have nothing.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe had a mum with children, everything stopped when she moved to Universal Credit,‚Äù she adds. ‚ÄúShe had nothing and within two weeks she had no food. The family didn‚Äôt eat one weekend and her child was wandering the streets stealing food from bins.‚Äù

The entire service helped feed 2,364 people in the first half of 2016. The same figure after Universal Credit began, was 4,601

Aikens, who oversees three food banks across the area, revealed that the entire service helped feed 2,364 people in the first half of 2016. The same figure for 2017, after the roll out of Universal Credit began, was 4,601. An increase of around 94%. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been horrendous. The reality is we‚Äôre seeing people who have not eaten for days, who can‚Äôt pay their rent, who are starving, and they‚Äôre borrowing,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúWhereas once we‚Äôd see someone in their hour of need once or twice, we see them now multiple times. It‚Äôs so much worse.‚Äù

George Bowden/HuffPost UK The Hammersmith and Fulham foodbank near Parsons Green sits between multi-million pound homes and besides luxury super cars. Those visiting the foodbank have to walk through this street to get there.

The Hammersmith and Fulham service is part of the Trussell Trust foodbank network, which revealed on Tuesday that the average surge in demand across all its centres in Universal Credit full service areas was 30%, when compared with a year ago. Comparative analysis of foodbanks not in full Universal Credit rollout areas showed an average increase of 12%. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre seeing soaring demand at foodbanks across the UK,‚Äù Mark Ward, Interim Chief Executive at The Trussell Trust, says. ‚ÄúThe simple truth is that even with the enormous generosity of our donors and volunteers, we‚Äôre concerned foodbanks could struggle to meet demand this winter if critical changes to benefit delivery aren‚Äôt made now. ‚ÄúPeople cannot be left for weeks without any income, and when that income does come, it must keep pace with living costs ‚Äì foodbanks cannot be relied upon to pick up the pieces.‚Äù

George Bowden/HuffPost UK A sign advertising a wine shop lies on the same street as an estate agent which listed homes for sale at more than ¬£2m. Both are just yards from the Hammersmith and Fulham Foodbank.
TITLE: Universal Credit Prompts 'Horrific' Surge In Foodbank Demand

From actors sharing a laugh to them unwinding following a hard day's shoot, photographer Nemai Ghosh had a flair for capturing screen icons in candid, vulnerable moments in the most heartwarming, fascinating way possible.
As a result he was one of the leading documenters of the cinema, especially Bengali cinema, through the seventies and the eighties.
Often referred to as Academy Award winning filmmaker Satyajit Ray's 'biographer', Ghosh has captured Ray in myriad moods.
Ghosh was also a jury member at the 2007 National Film Awards, and was awarded the Padma Shri by Government of India in 2010.
Here are some photographs by Ghosh compiled by Cinemadrome:Photographs by Nemai Ghosh Photographs by Nemai Ghosh1 of 48 Share this slide:Like Us On Facebook |Follow Us On Twitter |Contact HuffPost IndiaAlso On HuffPost:
TEXT:
From actors sharing a laugh to them unwinding following a hard day's shoot, photographer Nemai Ghosh had a flair for capturing screen icons in candid, vulnerable moments in the most heartwarming, fascinating way possible. As a result he was one of the leading documenters of the cinema, especially Bengali cinema, through the seventies and the eighties.

Often referred to as Academy Award winning filmmaker Satyajit Ray's 'biographer', Ghosh has captured Ray in myriad moods. In one frame Ghosh has captured Ray in a playful conversation with a child actor - his eyes widened, his brows arched and a mischievous smile lurking around the corner of his mouth - and it almost seems like he is conversing with the child as his equal. In another, he looks pensive and focussed, giving directions to actors Soumitro Chatterjee and Sharmila Tagore.

He has exhibited his work at Cannes in 1991, at London in 1992, and several times at Kolkata and Delhi, and published a selection of his photographs in a book, titled Satyajit Ray at 70, with a preface by the late French humanist photographer Henri Cartier-Bresson.

Ghosh was also a jury member at the 2007 National Film Awards, and was awarded the Padma Shri by Government of India in 2010.

Here are some photographs by Ghosh compiled by Cinemadrome:

Photographs by Nemai Ghosh Photographs by Nemai Ghosh

SUMMARY:
We have one ask for our Rainbow Laces campaign ‚Äì wear laces.
It seems like a small act, but if you‚Äôre lesbian, gay, bi or trans and you see someone wearing rainbow laces, it means the world.
Wearing laces may be a small act, but it‚Äôs also a brave one.
Every year during Rainbow Laces we expect a slew homophobic slurs and this year was no different.
So lacing up may be a small act ‚Äì but as this week has proved, and no doubt the World Cup will prove ‚Äì it‚Äôs a brave act.
TEXT:
We have one ask for our Rainbow Laces campaign ‚Äì wear laces. It seems like a small act, but if you‚Äôre lesbian, gay, bi or trans and you see someone wearing rainbow laces, it means the world. It shows that you‚Äôre someone who understands that sport isn‚Äôt yet somewhere LGBT people feel safe, but that you‚Äôre trying to change that.

Wearing laces may be a small act, but it‚Äôs also a brave one. Anyone who laces up can expect abuse. Every year during Rainbow Laces we expect a slew homophobic slurs and this year was no different. As soon as individuals or clubs indicated their support for LGBT equality on social media, the negative responses came thick and fast.

Despite what people think, despite the claim that this abuse is ‚Äòharmless banter‚Äô, it makes the game feel unsafe for LGBT people. This is why laces are so important and why it was so great to see so many athletes, across all sports, come out in support of LGBT people.

We should be so grateful that we live in a society where people can lace up and show their support for LGBT equality. In Russia, such an act could land you in jail.

With the World Cup being hosted in Russia next year, the safety of LGBT fans is suddenly a hot topic. Russia has laws in place which create an extremely hostile environment for LGBT people. While it‚Äôs not illegal to be LGBT, it‚Äôs certainly not something that‚Äôs celebrated.

FIFA has issued advice suggesting LGBT fans shouldn‚Äôt hold hands with their partners. What that advice failed to recognise, and what discussions and debates about this will also fail to realise, is that in the UK, gay and bi men wouldn‚Äôt hold hands at a football match. They wouldn‚Äôt share a kiss while watching Saturday‚Äôs game down the pub.

Maybe they would if they were surrounded by the brilliant LGBT fan clubs who week in week out turn up at their club, proudly waving the rainbow flag, to show that yes, LGBT fans exist. But if they were on their own? Two men sharing a kiss outside the turnstiles on match day is unthinkable. It‚Äôs as unlikely as two men holding hands in Red Square, Moscow.

For those who took to Twitter to moan about ‚Äòwhy are you shoving this down our throats?‚Äô this is why. This cannot continue, this can‚Äôt be acceptable.

Without a doubt this World Cup is an amazing opportunity to highlight the situation of LGBT people around the world and to help people realise why Rainbow Laces is so needed. But we‚Äôll be approaching the World Cup with caution and we‚Äôd advise others to do the same.

We‚Äôll be talking to activists in Russia to understand how we can support them. This is absolutely crucial.

We know many LGBT fans will want to do something to help LGBT people in Russia. We know there will be a desire to take part in activism but any action has to be led by activists in Russia. This will ensure it‚Äôs safe and doesn‚Äôt put LGBT Russians at risk, and that it‚Äôs actually helpful.

We‚Äôll also be working closely with sports bodies, including the FA, to look at what steps need to be taken to ensure the safety of fans travelling to the 2018 World Cup.

Sadly, at the moment, those steps won‚Äôt be that different from what LGBT fans in the UK do at the moment. So lacing up may be a small act ‚Äì but as this week has proved, and no doubt the World Cup will prove ‚Äì it‚Äôs a brave act.

I want to thank everyone who laced up or showed their support this week. You‚Äôre helping make sport everyone‚Äôs game. You‚Äôre helping show that sport can create positive change both in the UK and internationally. You‚Äôve led the way, you‚Äôve been brave. Stick with us. Together we‚Äôll get there.
TITLE: Wearing Rainbow Laces May Be A Small Act But It's An Incredibly Brave One

TEXT:
Anastasia Reshetova ist eine der sch√∂nsten Frauen Russlands

Online wird sie allerdings st√§ndig angegriffen

Bilder ihres "Makels" seht ihr oben im Video

Dass auf Instagram gerne mal getrickst wird, ist inzwischen wohl allseits bekannt. Makellose Selfies und bestens ausgeleuchtete Avocado-Toasts: Echt ist in der perfekten Bilder-Welt kaum etwas.

Eigentlich k√∂nnte man also froh sein √ºber ein kleines bisschen Normalit√§t. Doch Model Anastasia Reshetova muss bei Instagram immer wieder Kritik f√ºr ein vermeintliches Makel einstecken. Dabei gilt sie als eine der sch√∂nsten Frauen Russlands.

Immer wieder wird sie allerdings vor allem auf eins angesprochen: ihre gro√üen F√º√üe. Wie sie darauf reagiert, seht ihr im Video oben.

Reshetova sagt: Ihre F√º√üe seien bei einer Gr√∂√üe von 1.80 Metern v√∂llig normal. Auch andere Models wie Heidi Klum oder Tyra Banks kaufen ihre Schuhe nicht kleiner als in Gr√∂√üe 43.

Reshetova befindet sich so gesehen also in bester Gesellschaft.
TITLE: Sie gilt als eine der sch√∂nsten Frauen Russlands - trotzdem wird sie im Netz wegen eines Makels angegriffen

Eisregen im S√ºden und im MittelgebirgeDies kann gerade in der Nacht f√ºr erhebliche Gl√§tte sorgen.
Besondere Vorsicht ist im Mittelgebirge geboten: Hier kann es zu Eisregen kommen, der zu gef√§hrlicher Gl√§tte f√ºhrt.

TEXT:
P√ºnktlich zum meteorologischen Winteranfang bleiben die Temperaturen auch am ersten Advent im Keller

Mehr √ºber die kommende Wetterlage erfahrt ihr oben im Video

Die Weihnachtsm√§rkte haben ge√∂ffnet und kalt genug f√ºr einen Gl√ºhwein ist es auch schon. P√ºnktlich zum meteorologischen Winteranfang am 1. Dezember bleiben die Temperaturen auch am ersten Advent niedrig. Am Sonntag kann es im Osten zun√§chst leichte Schneef√§lle geben, aus denen sp√§ter allerdings Regen wird.

Vorsicht! Eisregen im S√ºden und im Mittelgebirge

Dies kann gerade in der Nacht f√ºr erhebliche Gl√§tte sorgen. Im S√ºden geht der Schneefall etwas sp√§ter in Regen √ºber. Besondere Vorsicht ist im Mittelgebirge geboten: Hier kann es zu Eisregen kommen, der zu gef√§hrlicher Gl√§tte f√ºhrt. Autofahrer sollten mit eisglatten Fahrbahnen rechnen und auch der Zugverkehr kann von dem Eisregen beeintr√§chtigt werden.

Im Tagesverlauf wird es deutliche Temperaturunterschiede zwischen Norden und S√ºden geben. An der Nordsee kann es am Nachmittag vereinzelt sonnig mit Temperaturen bis zu acht Grad geben.

Bis zu zehn Zentimeter Neuschnee

Im S√ºden bleibt die Wolkendecke dicht und die Temperaturen liegen zwischen ein und drei Grad. Hier kann es auch zu kr√§ftigem Schneefall kommen - mit bis zu zehn Zentimeter Neuschnee.

Doch im Verlauf der n√§chsten Woche wird es auch im S√ºden wieder etwas freundlicher. Die Temperaturen k√∂nnen sogar wieder in den zweistelligen Bereich steigen. An der K√ºste muss aber mit teils kr√§ftigen B√∂en gerechnet werden. Nach der milden Phase kommt auch wieder die kalte Polarluft nach Deutschland und es wird wieder k√§lter.

SUMMARY:
For over three decades now the exclusion zone around Chernobyl has been left abandoned, following the nuclear meltdown which saw 116,000 people evacuated in 1986.
Not content with leaving this "black hole in the middle of Ukraine", a private company is now planning on installing solar panels and using it as a renewable energy zone.
According to local media, equipment is already being transported to the site and preparatory work is underway.
And the fact that Rodina Energy have already successfully completed a similar project in Bragin, Belarus.
Rodina Energy
TEXT:
For over three decades now the exclusion zone around Chernobyl has been left abandoned, following the nuclear meltdown which saw 116,000 people evacuated in 1986. Unable to use the area for livestock, farming crops or forestry, because of the potential contamination dangers, the Ukrainian authorities have been at a loss about what to do with the 1000 square miles of wasteland. Not content with leaving this "black hole in the middle of Ukraine", a private company is now planning on installing solar panels and using it as a renewable energy zone.

deurbanic via Getty Images

Just 100 metres from the decommissioned reactor four, Ukrainian engineering firm Rodina Energy Group are hoping to get approval for their project which will see an investment of 100 million Euros in the site. The panels, which it is hoped will be commissioned next month, according to Bloomberg, will have 3,762 photovoltaic modules and be 1 megawatt in size. According to local media, equipment is already being transported to the site and preparatory work is underway. This project, a collaborative effort between Rodina and German-clean-energy company Enerparc AG, is a result of an announcement made by the Ukrainian minister for ecology in July 2016, that they were planning revitalise the area. But you can see why developers might not be interested in such a risky proposition.

Pablo Bonfiglio via Getty Images

As compensation the government is offering cheap land and relatively high feed-in tariffs, with the current developers having secured a contract that will pay 15 euro cents per kilowatt-hour until 2030. That's almost 40% higher than the upper benchmark for cost of solar in other parts of Europe, a sweetener for investors according to Bloomberg. Other assurances include the recent completion of the New Safe Confinement (NSC), a high-tech shelter built to protect the remains of the reactor. And the fact that Rodina Energy have already successfully completed a similar project in Bragin, Belarus. Bragin (tagged on map) is an area just on the north eastern edge of the Polesky state radiological reserve - created to enclose the area of Belarus most affected by the radioactive fallout.

Rodina Energy
TITLE: The Site Of The World's Worst Nuclear Disaster Will Become A Hub Of Renewable Energy

Dans son budget pr√©sent√© en mars dernier, le gouvernement Couillard avait annonc√© l'octroi de 24 millions sur cinq ans pour soutenir la presse √©crite. Un montant de 12 millions $ avait √©galement √©t√© allou√© √† RecycleM√©dias pour √©ponger une partie des co√ªts li√©s √† la collective s√©lective des journaux.

La ministre de la Culture et des Communications Marie Montpetit d√©taillera, lundi matin √† Trois-Rivi√®res, comment cet argent sera d√©pens√©.

La presse √©crite devrait pouvoir miser sur deux programmes d'aide pour r√©ussir sa transformation num√©rique. Le premier visera les m√©dias communautaires et aura pour but de renforcer la vitalit√© de l'information locale et r√©gionale tout en maintenant une pluralit√© de sources d'information.

La subvention temporaire de 12 millions $ √† RecycleM√©dias sera √©galement r√©partie sur cinq ans. Le gouvernement esp√®re ainsi r√©duire la pression financi√®re sur les entreprises de presse au moment o√π leurs revenus sont en baisse et o√π les co√ªts li√©s √† la r√©cup√©ration du papier sont en hausse.

SUMMARY:
Randy Bachman closes the show during the Invictus Games in Toronto on Sept. 30, 2017.
Icon Neil Young played an invitation-only concert in his hometown of Omemee, Ont.
One of those people was musician Randy Bachman of Guess Who and Bachman Turner Overdrive fame ‚Äî who had the misfortune to lose his phone that day.
He said all he wanted was a selfie but I have 2 tix to Neil Young's show tonight so we're going to rock out.
Gotta love Randy Bachman!
TEXT:
Randy Bachman closes the show during the Invictus Games in Toronto on Sept. 30, 2017.

Icon Neil Young played an invitation-only concert in his hometown of Omemee, Ont. (population: 1,247) on Friday night. Though the show was streamed online, only an elite 225 people got to be there in person.

One of those people was musician Randy Bachman of Guess Who and Bachman Turner Overdrive fame ‚Äî who had the misfortune to lose his phone that day.

But there's an easy solution for such a problem ‚Äî just make sure you lose your phone in Canada.

Meet Barry Killen. He found my cell on the road and called a friend to safely return it. He said all he wanted was a selfie but I have 2 tix to Neil Young's show tonight so we're going to rock out. People like this make me so proud to be Canadian! Thanks, Barry! pic.twitter.com/Za8ARBFwVF December 1, 2017

According to a tweet by Bachman, someone named Barry Killen found his phone and called a friend to return it on Friday.

Bachman then revealed: "He said all he wanted was a selfie but I have 2 tix to Neil Young's show tonight so we're going to rock out. People like this make me so proud to be Canadian!"

Fans responded with praise for Killen and of course, plenty of "taking care of business jokes" too.

That's beyond cool. Well done sir #takincareofbusinessüëç ‚Äî Sean Murphy (@suburbansean) December 1, 2017

Take care of business, get taken care of. Gotta love Randy Bachman! https://t.co/M8WKwKGPd3 ‚Äî Justin Pierrot (@stormlandbrand) December 2, 2017

The acoustic concert celebrated the release of Young's new album The Visitor as well as the unveiling of an online archive of his work.

CTV said proceeds from the show would be donated to the local Scott Young Public School, named after Neil's father who was a novelist, journalist and early host of "Hockey Night In Canada."

With files from the Canadian Press

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Randy Bachman Invites Stranger To Neil Young's Exclusive Concert

In her highest-profile international event yet, the first daughter is attending the three-day Global Entrepreneurship Summit in Hyderabad, sponsored by the State Department and India, next week.

TEXT:
Secretary of State Rex Tillerson isn‚Äôt sending a top delegation to accompany Ivanka Trump to a business summit in India because he doesn‚Äôt want to promote her on the world stage, CNN reported.

In her highest-profile international event yet, the first daughter is attending the three-day Global Entrepreneurship Summit in Hyderabad, sponsored by the State Department and India, next week. A theme of the summit is female economic empowerment.

A senior State Department source told CNN that ‚Äúno one higher than the deputy assistant secretary is allowed to participate‚Äù in the India trip. Tillerson‚Äôs staff ‚Äúwon‚Äôt send someone senior because they don‚Äôt want to bolster Ivanka,‚Äù the source said.
TITLE: Report: Tillerson Snubbing Ivanka Trump's India Trip Amid Tensions

Des trains sur le point d'arriver √† Paris ont donc d√ª √™tre d√©rout√©s, certains vers la gare d'Austerlitz, d'autres vers celle de Massy, en banlieue parisienne, quand en province, le trafic √©tait longuement interrompu.

La SNCF a toutefois pr√©cis√© qu'elle pouvait, depuis la gare d'Austerlitz, assurer des liaisons √† direction de Rennes, Bordeaux et Nantes, √† raison d'un train par heure aller-retour. Cependant, selon un porte-parole de l'entreprise, la g√™ne concerne "75% du trafic TGV". √Ä noter qu'apr√®s la panne, les trains Transiliens, TER et Intercit√©s ne peuvent, eux, aller plus loin que la gare de Versailles Chantier.

SUMMARY:
Like most things in life, 'comedy' too has a dichotomy about it, especially if one were to look at the comedy scene across India.
It was the show that presented Kapil Sharma to India and Indian viewers.
Many other stand-up comedy shows ensued across various channels at that time, hoping to cash in on the new-found popularity of this genre.
However, all these stand-up comedy offerings on Indian TV were crafted to rake in the masses and therefore remained unashamedly loud, slap-stick, and partly offensive.
This alternative brand of comedy emerging out of India is in fact more aligned to 'stand-up' comedy in its purest form than the trash that is dished up each night through a multitude of comedy shows on Indian TV.
TEXT:
Like most things in life, 'comedy' too has a dichotomy about it, especially if one were to look at the comedy scene across India. Over the past few years, the growth of 'stand up' comedy in the Indian entertainment landscape has been exponential. If one were to take a closer look, the Indian stand-up comedy is a bifurcated entity, patronized by two contrasting styles that have managed to co-exist so far while catering for the classes and strata that underline the diverse Indian populace.

It all started almost a decade ago with the hugely popular TV show 'The Great Indian Laughter Challenge', a show that provided a much-needed alternative for those Indian viewers who had been left brain dead by mindless TV serials. It was the show that presented Kapil Sharma to India and Indian viewers. Many other stand-up comedy shows ensued across various channels at that time, hoping to cash in on the new-found popularity of this genre. They gave us other comedians such as Krushna, Sudesh, Rajiv, VIP, and many others, making them household names. It all culminated in Sharma climbing his way to the pinnacle of the Indian TV scene and making it his own with his hugely popular show 'Comedy Nights with Kapil' and the re-branded 'The Kapil Sharma Show' that followed.

However, all these stand-up comedy offerings on Indian TV were crafted to rake in the masses and therefore remained unashamedly loud, slap-stick, and partly offensive. They catered to a prime-time Indian audience that merely wanted to laugh out loud at the end of a hectic day. Hence, the quality of comic content for most of these shows remained extremely pedestrian, often restricted to caricatures, and mimicry.

Herein, emerged a parallel offshoot of this fast evolving Indian comedy topography that set out to woo the urban audiences who craved comedy that was intelligent, quirky, and culturally relevant. Indians in urban centers started to flock to pubs, and restaurants on Friday nights and week-ends to be tickled by a more meaningful brand of comedy than was being offered by the TV outlets. In no time, people like Amit Tandon, Zakir Khan, Vir Das, the AIB collective, Aditi Mittal and many others became hugely popular as they served a potent dose of stand-up comedy that had the urban Indians in stitches.

These new bunch of Indian stand-up comics are not everyone's cup of tea in India. Their comedy is irreverent towards the conservative social fabric of India and hence appeals to the more liberal-minded urbanites. They nudge the boundaries of political correctness in a country that is saturated to it brims with sycophancy, and in doing so (knowingly or unknowingly) are contributing in shaping up the new moral and cultural spine of Indian metros.

Lacking a main stream TV platform, this parallel stand-up comedy phenomenon out of India found an effective medium in YouTube to reach out to the global Indian diaspora. These guys are all getting increasingly popular with their audiences and their craft is on the cusp of flourishing with more and more of them notching up high profile stand-up comedy gigs both in India and overseas.

So while the Kapil Sharmas of India are lapping up the glory by playing to the masses who prefer a dumbed down version of comedy that is not prickly enough to puncture their fragile egos and value systems, there is a young breed of 'thinking' comedians who take to the microphone in half-lit venues every weekend and take the 'mickey' out of the Indian way of living while being cheered on by their audiences.

This alternative brand of comedy emerging out of India is in fact more aligned to 'stand-up' comedy in its purest form than the trash that is dished up each night through a multitude of comedy shows on Indian TV.

So I wish these stand-up comics of the parallel cadre all the very best and I cross my fingers and hope that their surge is not stalled by greedy Indian TV executives who are forever keen to bastardize a good thing and suck the life out of it.
TITLE: There Is An Alternative Brand Of Comedy Emerging Out Of India And It Must Be Encouraged

TEXT:
Australian rock group Gang of Youths were the big winners at the 2017 ARIA Awards.

The biggest night in Australian music kicked off on Tuesday night as the 2017 ARIA Awards got underway in Sydney.

Thirty years on from its inception the ARIAs still manages to boast a star-studded line-up of Australian and international stars, and this year's 31st edition of the awards night was no different.

Not only were Lorde and Harry Styles both booked in for performances, 2017 ARIA Hall of Fame inductee and Aussie favourite Daryl Braithwaite was also listed to make an appearance.

And when it comes to the nominees up for awards on the night, there really was no shortage of musical talent. You can check out the complete list, including all the winners (all in bold), below.

SUMMARY:
Below, 14 sweet little ways couples cheer each other up when the going gets tough.
I stress myself out very easily, and sometimes it just all comes crashing down on me after a bad day.
‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre having a bad day but your boyfriend knows just how to cheer you up.‚ÄùWhen you're having a bad day but your boyfriend knows just how to cheer you up.
So he sent me cute texts all day, but this one was my favorite.‚Äù‚Äï Bekah G.When you've had a bad day so your boyfriend cheers you up #luckiestgirlintheworld pic.twitter.com/zGWydVU05m ‚Äî Bekah (@Bekionist) April 13, 201613.
‚ÄúWhen I am having a bad day, my husband brings me dinner in bed.
TEXT:
The best romantic partners somehow know just how to help you turn things around after a particularly crappy day.

They understand you don‚Äôt need some grand gesture ‚Äï just a simple note, a tight hug or a favorite meal can brighten an otherwise cloudy day. Below, 14 sweet little ways couples cheer each other up when the going gets tough.

1. They bring you coffee after a sleepless night.

‚ÄúI suffer from headaches and was up all night with one. I woke up the next morning feeling a little better after seeing this coffee and note from my husband.‚Äù

‚Äï Brittanie R.

Brittanie R.

2. They put on some music for an impromptu dance in the kitchen.

‚ÄúMy hubs saw me getting frustrated, so he asked me for a kitchen dance and led me to the record player for some Jack Johnson and a little sway. Exactly what I needed.‚Äù

‚Äï Lindsey K.

3. They order food for you during an especially hectic week.

‚ÄúI was super stressed out because of school and sports. I was a captain on the cross country team and I had a lot of commitments within the team. With school I had a bunch of big labs that were due soon. I was really busy that week and the result was me not sleeping or eating much. I told her I was super stressed and she immediately ordered me dinner at Panera. I love her, she‚Äôs the best.‚Äù

4. They lie with you until you calm down and fall asleep.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôll lie in bed with me, even if it‚Äôs 8 p.m., and rub my back, tell me quietly how he hopes I have a good day tomorrow and that it will be all okay. He waits until I‚Äôm snoring away before he leaves the room.‚Äù

‚Äï Crystal N.

5. They leave little love notes around the house.

‚ÄúMy partner Gregory and I were long distance for almost two years, and it was very stressful at times. We started to leave each other little love sticky notes when we would leave early (often before 6:30 a.m.) on Mondays to drive back to our respective states to go to work. It always lifted my spirits after waking up to him being gone and knowing we wouldn‚Äôt see each other all week. The notes consist of sweet affirmations, an inside joke, a special word or a thoughtful reminder not to forget something to pack for our next trip to see each other. ‚Äù

‚Äï Kelley W.

Kelley W.

6. They give you a big hug and offer words of reassurance.

‚ÄúI work two jobs and I have two girls from a previous long-term relationship, so I‚Äôm always busy, always quickly trying to get things done. I stress myself out very easily, and sometimes it just all comes crashing down on me after a bad day. My partner Alex has so much patience with me, it‚Äôs incredible. He knows how to read me and knows that sometimes all I need is a strong hug, even if it means him holding me as I‚Äôm falling apart. All I need is his reassuring comments and his arms to make me feel like everything is okay.‚Äù

‚Äï Loyda R.

7. They rub your tired feet.

‚ÄúHe rubs a certain spot on my ankle that calms me down and makes me happy.‚Äù

‚Äï Rebecca S.

Rebecca S.

8. They hand-deliver your favorite treat.

‚ÄúMy girlfriend is an eighth grade teacher ... and she was having an awful day at school. She was super tired and, of course, her students weren‚Äôt listening to her (as eighth graders often do). So when I saw the tweet she sent during her lunch period about wanting a doughnut, I decided to act on it and try to brighten her day. She loves doughnuts (sometimes I think more than she loves me) and at the time, I was still living in Chicago. So I drove down the street to Stan‚Äôs Donuts ‚Äï one of her favorite spots ‚Äï bought a box of a dozen, and then drove over an hour in traffic to her school. The surprised look on her face when I showed up at her classroom door, her smile and the tears she shed when she realized that I showed up with doughnuts just for her were well worth it.‚Äù

‚Äï Mellow P.

9. They initiate a cuddle sesh with your pet.

‚ÄúHe brings me our dog like a cuddle delivery.‚Äù

‚Äï Christina B.

Christina B.

10. They give you a funny card to make you laugh when you don‚Äôt feel like laughing.

‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre having a bad day but your boyfriend knows just how to cheer you up.‚Äù

When you're having a bad day but your boyfriend knows just how to cheer you up. pic.twitter.com/xiLHGzbbgw ‚Äî Kathalina (@kathalinaa_) September 1, 2015

11. They decorate the house just to your liking.

‚ÄúMy fianc√© and I moved in together this summer, and I‚Äôve been winding him up, saying this year he‚Äôs going to have the cheesiest Christmas ever, as he doesn‚Äôt see the point in decorations or even giving Christmas cards! I‚Äôve been going through a particularly difficult period at work, and one dark November evening after a crappy day of awful meetings and working late, I walked into our flat to find everything in darkness, until I reached the living room. There, Connor started playing a Christmas playlist, handed me a mug of mulled wine, and straight in front of me was a Christmas tree with all the trimmings ready for me to decorate. I cried. It was so thoughtful and totally took my mind off my day.‚Äù

‚Äï Jessica M.

Jessica M.

12. They shoot you a silly text to make you smile.

‚ÄúMy boyfriend sent me this text because I was at school that day and wasn‚Äôt feeling great. I had so much stuff that I needed to get done and there were a lot of personal problems occurring at the time. So he sent me cute texts all day, but this one was my favorite.‚Äù

‚Äï Bekah G.

When you've had a bad day so your boyfriend cheers you up #luckiestgirlintheworld pic.twitter.com/zGWydVU05m ‚Äî Bekah (@Bekionist) April 13, 2016

13. They get goofy with you.

‚ÄúMy fianc√© and I always try to make each other laugh after a long, hard day. It‚Äôs the sweetest thing to me because it really works! Laughter is the best medicine.‚Äù

‚Äï Jennifer L.

Jennifer L.

14. They bring you dinner in bed.

‚ÄúWhen I am having a bad day, my husband brings me dinner in bed. There aren‚Äôt many things that a grilled cheese on a heart-shaped plate delivered by your man can‚Äôt fix.‚Äù

‚Äï Cat C.
TITLE: 14 Little Ways Couples Cheer Each Other Up After A Bad Day

Education secretary Justine Greening defended the government‚Äôs record on social mobility following Milburn‚Äôs intervention, but admitted the issue was a ‚Äúgenerational challenge‚Äù.
Education Secretary @JustineGreening announces ¬£300m of "new money" for mental health support in schools.
‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt talk about it half as much as we do, They talk about things like their children‚Äôs mental health,‚Äù she said.
TEXT:
PA Archive/PA Images

The government‚Äôs well-planned Sunday story about more investment in children‚Äôs mental health was thrown slightly off-course by the resignation of the entire board of the Social Mobility Commission. As a result, Labour‚Äôs Hillary Benn lost his place on the BBC‚Äôs Andrew Marr Show, in favour of Alan Milburn, the former Labour minister who heads the commission. He said he had ‚Äúlittle hope‚Äù the current government was capable of making the changes necessary to deliver a more equal society and that Theresa May‚Äôs leadership was not strong enough to convert ‚Äúgood words‚Äù into actions. But more of that later. The Andrew Marr Show The show had barely got underway before Nigel Farage, taking part in the weekly paper review alongside former Labour adviser Ayesha Hazarika and the Institute of Economic Affairs‚Äô Kate Andrews, launched a staunch defence of Donald Trump.

Nigel Farage says Donald Trump didn't have an "earthly clue" who Britain First were when he retweeted them https://t.co/uTuust7cYN pic.twitter.com/wiIPawHpxW ‚Äî BBC News (UK) (@BBCNews) December 3, 2017

The former Ukip leader claimed the president had no idea what he was doing when he retweeted Britain First three times this week, and therefore the planned UK state visit should still go ahead. So that‚Äôs settled, then. Oh, and Farage says he‚Äôll still be claiming his EU pension, promoting the Lib Dems to call him a ‚Äúshameless hypocrite‚Äù.

"Of course I would take it... why should my family and others suffer?" - Nigel Farage tells #Marr he would take EU pension. pic.twitter.com/egRrlLE8se ‚Äî BBC News (UK) (@BBCNews) December 3, 2017

With those pleasantries dealt with, Alan Milburn was next up to talk about his Social Mobility Commission resignation letter. He said the government‚Äôs preoccupation with Brexit means it ‚Äúdoes not have the necessary bandwidth to ensure the rhetoric of healing social division is matched with the reality‚Äù. He said he had no doubt the PM was personally supportive of social justice, but was lacking action, and that the board felt ‚Äúthere is only so long you can go on pushing water uphill‚Äù.

Alan Milburn tells #marr he has "no doubt that the PM has a personal commitment to social justice" but says she is lacking in action #marr pic.twitter.com/VPU9Aa3mlw ‚Äî The Andrew Marr Show (@MarrShow) December 3, 2017

Milburn said in order to tackle increasing economic and social divisions in UK society, those who voted Remain in the EU referendum had to think carefully about why some areas with higher poverty levels backed Leave. ‚ÄúWe must be tough on Brexit, and tough on the causes of Brexit,‚Äù the former Chief Secretary to the Treasury added, in a less-than-subtle reminder he served under Tony Blair. Jacob Rees-Mogg, who appears to now be a regular fixture on Sunday programmes, popped up to talk about the Brexit divorce bill.

"It is very important we don't hand over a great deal of money unless we have an agreement" @Jacob_Rees_Mogg on Brexit divorce bill #marr pic.twitter.com/3XMv8sWV0U ‚Äî The Andrew Marr Show (@MarrShow) December 3, 2017

Next up was deputy Irish PM Simon Coveney, who said while Ireland had been essentially given a veto over Brexit negotiations, his country had no desire to frustrate the process.

"We certainly don't want to be vetoing anything" - Irish Deputy PM says their government has no desire to delay #Brexit process #Marr https://t.co/YAHLq3ZNqR pic.twitter.com/ErdnHUggPY ‚Äî BBC News (UK) (@BBCNews) December 3, 2017

‚ÄúWe want to be able to provide the kind of certainty that businesses in the UK and Ireland are calling for,‚Äù he added. Coveney said his government was not looking for full details of future border arrangements, but wanted to be confident a solution could be found in phase two of the Brexit negotiations. ‚ÄúThat is not very much to ask,‚Äù he said. Education secretary Justine Greening defended the government‚Äôs record on social mobility following Milburn‚Äôs intervention, but admitted the issue was a ‚Äúgenerational challenge‚Äù.

Education Secretary Justine Greening defends government's record on social mobility #Marr https://t.co/3PhYRtuX1F pic.twitter.com/4sJyZoe9lY ‚Äî BBC News (UK) (@BBCNews) December 3, 2017

She also confirmed the ¬£300 million of extra spending on children and adolescent mental health care - aimed at cutting waiting times for access to treatment - was ‚Äúnew money‚Äù.

Education Secretary @JustineGreening announces ¬£300m of "new money" for mental health support in schools. #marr pic.twitter.com/0ttKlUM3BS ‚Äî The Andrew Marr Show (@MarrShow) December 3, 2017

Asked about the ongoing investigation into the conduct of First Secretary of State Damian Green, who is alleged to have used his work computer to access porn, Greening refused to comment specifically on the inquiry. But she ramped up the pressure on her cabinet colleague, saying: ‚ÄúI think it is important that we have high standards in public life.‚Äù Peston on Sunday

Health Secretary @Jeremy_Hunt confirms that even if @PhilipHammondUK didn't mention it in the Budget, @theresa_may has sanctioned ¬£300m of new spending on children's mental health services. #Peston pic.twitter.com/CNNWIwrjiX ‚Äî Peston on Sunday (@pestononsunday) December 3, 2017

Health secretary Jeremy Hunt was also out to bat on the government‚Äôs mental health announcement, but his most interesting comments came in response to questions on Brexit.

.@Jeremy_Hunt becomes the first Cabinet Minister to explain contentious government proposals for the ECJ to have a permanent role protecting the rights of EU migrants after Brexit. #Peston pic.twitter.com/sFEfVed1wg ‚Äî Peston on Sunday (@pestononsunday) December 3, 2017

In what appeared to be a stark warning to hard Brexiteers in his own party, Hunt said: ‚ÄúThe choice we face is not between this Brexit or that Brexit. If we don‚Äôt back Theresa May, we will have no Brexit.‚Äù Meanwhile, German MEP David McAllister reckons talks only have a ‚Äú50-50‚Äù chance of progressing to the next stage - when trade negotiations will be discussed in earnest - in December.

German MEP David McAllister says that the concerns of the Irish will be key in Brexit talks, but that the problems faced are the consequences of the British decision to leave the EU single market and customs union. #Peston pic.twitter.com/sYzGV9fGIB ‚Äî Peston on Sunday (@pestononsunday) December 3, 2017

But Labour‚Äôs Jess Phillips made it clear her Birmingham constituents are getting a bit bored of the subject. ‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt talk about it half as much as we do, They talk about things like their children‚Äôs mental health,‚Äù she said. And speaking of not talking, let‚Äôs definitely not mention the surprise appearance by Donald and Melania Trump.

Donald Trump (sort of) on *that* tweet to sent to Theresa May this week #Peston pic.twitter.com/f4NJ0tEkXa ‚Äî Peston on Sunday (@pestononsunday) December 3, 2017

Sunday With Paterson Shadow chancellor John McDonnell was talking ‚Äúsensible economics‚Äù while avoiding mentioning specific figures on Sky‚Äôs morning programme. He said he wanted to be known as ‚Äúthe person who brought common sense to managing the economy‚Äù, but Conservative James Cleverly claimed it would be ‚Äúordinary working people who would pay the price for a shadow chancellor who doesn‚Äôt do numbers‚Äù.

What would the cost be of lifting public sector pay cap? Shadow Chancellor @johnmcdonnellMP says "we've costed it" #Paterson pic.twitter.com/ikgSf6BXrO ‚Äî Sunday with Paterson (@RidgeOnSunday) December 3, 2017

Justine Greening, who had a busy morning, held the party line while discussing Donald Trump‚Äôs proposed state visit.

"We need to see it in the broader context of the UK/US relationship," says @JustineGreening, as she responds to whether Trump should still have UK state visit #Paterson pic.twitter.com/VXQAKMvEze ‚Äî Sunday with Paterson (@RidgeOnSunday) December 3, 2017

And returning to the issue of the Irish border, Sinn Fein‚Äôs Brexit spokesperson David Cullinane claimed ‚Äúno practical solutions‚Äù had been put forward by the UK government.

Sinn F√©in‚Äôs #Brexit spokesperson @davidcullinane says a solution to the Irish border issue has to be "tangible" adding "we've not had any practical solutions put on the table by Theresa May" #Paterson pic.twitter.com/fIyoLcO72B ‚Äî Sunday with Paterson (@RidgeOnSunday) December 3, 2017

BBC Sunday Politics Tory grandee Michael Howard defended the government‚Äôs record on social mobility, before telling the programme he had ‚Äúevery confidence‚Äù Theresa May and David Davis would secure a good Brexit deal.

There is always more to be done but I think quite a lot of progress has been made on social mobility and we shouldn't forget that" Michael Howard tells #bbcsp pic.twitter.com/PBPDxWB0aG ‚Äî BBC Daily Politics and Sunday Politics (@daily_politics) December 3, 2017

Labour‚Äôs Barry Gardiner - contrary to the apparent views of shadow home secretary Diane Abbott - reiterated his party has no plans for a second referendum. ‚ÄúIt is not part of our policy,‚Äù the shadow international trade secretary said.

Will Labour support a 2nd EU referendum? Sarah Smith quizzes @BarryGardiner #bbcsp pic.twitter.com/awNadwd9A6 ‚Äî BBC Daily Politics and Sunday Politics (@daily_politics) December 3, 2017
TITLE: Sunday Show Round-Up: Mental Health Cash, Brexit Warnings and Nigel Farage's Pension

TEXT:
Beim AfD-Parteitag in Hannover ist es zu massiven Protesten mit Ausschreitungen gekommen

Zahlreiche Demonstranten und mindestens ein AfD-Abgeordneter wurden verletzt

Beim zweiten Bundesparteitag der AfD geht es im Hannoveraner Congress Cenrum hei√ü her. Nach der Partei-Flucht der ehemaligen Bundessprecherin Frauke Petry ist der Fl√ºgel-Kampf zwischen Wirtschaftsliberalen und v√∂lkisch-nationalistischen Kadern in der AfD neu er√∂ffnet.

Doch auch vor der Halle wurde es hitzig. An Gro√üdemonstrationen beteiligten sich kirchliche Vertreter, Gewerkschafter und linke Gruppen. Mehrmals kam es zu Ausschreitungen.



Pfeffersprayeinsatz gegen Aktivisten.

Schon in den fr√ºhen Morgenstunden begann der Protest. Ab 7 Uhr sammelten sich Menschen im Hannoveraner Zooviertel. Laut Pressesprecher der Kampagne NIKA, die den Protest mitorganisierten, versammelten sich bis zu 7500 Menschen in der N√§he des Veranstaltungsortes.

Schon fr√ºh kam es zu Rangeleien, als Demonstranten versuchten, so nahe wie m√∂glich an den Eingang der Halle zu kommen. Die Polizei setzte Kn√ºppel und Pfefferspray ein.



R√§umung der Sitzblockade mit zahlreichen Verletzten

Bereits hier gab es Verletzte. Als Polizeibeamte ein Transparent der Demonstranten wegrei√üen wollten, wurden auch Pressevertreter an ihrer Arbeit gehindert. Das F√ºhrungspersonal der Polizei verbannte Reporter au√üer Sichtweite hinter Polizeifahrzeuge.



AfD Delegierter schleicht an Blockaden vorbei.

Polizeibeamte schubsten auch zwei Journalisten zu Boden. An der gleichen Blockade ‚Äì wohl an einem strategisch entscheidenden Punkt gelegen ‚Äì kam es sp√§ter zu einem Wasserwerfer Einsatz, bei 1 Grad Au√üentemperatur, sowie einer R√§umung mit zahlreichen Verletzten. An einem anderen Blockadepunkt erlitt ein Aktivist, der sich an einer Pyramide festgekettet hatte, wohl einen offenen Bruch.



Wasserwerfereinsatz bei 1 Grad gegen Sitzblockade

Doch auch AfD-Politiker berichten von Angriffen. Der Bundestagsabgeordnete Kay Gottschalk zog sich eine Verletzung am Arm zu, offenbar hatten Linke den Politiker angegriffen.

Kay Gottschalk, MdB, k√ºhlt seinen Arm. Verdacht auf Bruch. Berichtet von Angriff vor der T√ºr. Wir haben, leider, √§hnliche Konfrontationen beobachtet. #SPIEGELTV #Hannover #AfD pic.twitter.com/yuNezE2ASs ‚Äî David Walden (@walden_david) 2. Dezember 2017

Ein AfD Mitglied, das wohl am Zutritt zum Veranstaltungsort durch eine Blockade gehindert wurde, sagte der HuffPost, ihm sei ein Bein gestellt worden, er sei bespr√ºht worden und ihm w√§re ins Gesicht geschlagen und gespuckt worden.

Der saarl√§ndische Politiker gab Anzeige auf. "Das sind SA-Methoden", warf er den Aktivisten vor.

Anderen AfD-Mitgliedern gelang es dagegen, sich an den Gegenprotesten beinahe unbemerkt vorbeizuschleichen, um am Bundesparteitag der Alternative f√ºr Deutschland teilzunehmen.



Anreisende AfD Delegierte nach R√§umung der Blockaden am Eingang des HCC

Der Pressesprecher der Kampagne "Nationalismus ist keine Alternative" (NIKA), Jan Sperling, sagte:

"Wir sind eine Kampagne von jungen Menschen aus allen Bereichen. Wir sind klar antikapitalistisch und antirassistisch. Wir haben uns zusammengefunden um dem Rechtsruck und speziell der AfD etwas entgegenzusetzen."

"Die AfD hat wieder zu sp√ºren bekommen, dass man ihre rassistische Schiene nicht reibungslos laufen l√§sst", erkl√§rte Sperling der HuffPost.
TITLE: "SA-Methoden": Bei Protesten gegen den AfD-Bundesparteitag kommt es zu Ausschreitungen

Œ£Œµ ŒºŒπŒ± œÄœÅœéœÑŒ∑ ŒºŒ±œÑŒπŒ¨, Œø Œ±œÅœáŒ±ŒØŒøœÇ ŒµŒªŒªŒ∑ŒΩŒπŒ∫œåœÇ œÄŒøŒªŒπœÑŒπœÉŒºœåœÇ Œ∫Œ±Œπ Œø œÖœÄŒµœÅœÅŒµŒ±ŒªŒπœÉŒºœåœÇ Œ±œÄŒ≠œáŒøœÖŒΩ œÄŒ¨œÅŒ± œÄŒøŒªœç ŒºŒµœÑŒ±Œæœç œÑŒøœÖœÇ‚ÄïŒ∫Œ±Œπ œåœáŒπ ŒºœåŒΩŒø ŒµŒæŒ±ŒπœÑŒØŒ±œÇ œÑŒ∑œÇ ŒµŒºœÜŒ±ŒΩŒ≠œÉœÑŒ±œÑŒ∑œÇ œáœÅŒøŒΩŒøŒªŒøŒ≥ŒπŒ∫ŒÆœÇ œÑŒøœÖœÇ Œ±œÄœåœÉœÑŒ±œÉŒ∑œÇ, Œ±ŒªŒªŒ¨ Œ∫Œ±Œπ ŒªœåŒ≥œâ œÑœâŒΩ Œ¥ŒπŒ±ŒºŒµœÑœÅŒπŒ∫Œ¨ Œ±ŒΩœÑŒØŒ∏ŒµœÑœâŒΩ Œ∏ŒµŒºŒµŒªŒπœâŒ¥œéŒΩ ŒºŒ∑œáŒ±ŒΩŒπœÉŒºœéŒΩ œÄœÅŒøœÉŒ≠Œ≥Œ≥ŒπœÉŒ∑œÇ œÑŒ∑œÇ œÄœÅŒ±Œ≥ŒºŒ±œÑŒπŒ∫œåœÑŒ∑œÑŒ±œÇ œÄŒøœÖ œÜŒ±ŒØŒΩŒµœÑŒ±Œπ œåœÑŒπ œÄœÅŒøŒ¨Œ≥ŒøœÖŒΩ.

Les 12 lots concern√©s par le retrait sont, √† ce jour: ‚Ä¢ Lait Picot SL sans lactose 1er √¢ge 350g, les lots 17C0012344 (date limite d'utilisation 15/02/2019), 17C0012877 (DLUO 01/06/2019), 17C0013216 (DLUO 18/09/2019) et 17C0013549 (DLUO 29/09/2019).
"Il y eu des produits commercialis√©s sur les 12 lots et d'autres qui sont encore dans nos entrep√¥ts", a pr√©cis√© le directeur de la communication de Lactalis.
L'apparition de ces signes chez un nourrisson doit conduire les familles √† consulter un m√©decin, rappellent les autorit√©s.
Un num√©ro vert a d'ailleurs √©t√© mis √† disposition des parents pour r√©pondre √† leurs interrogations sur les lots et les questions commerciales (0800.120.120, ouvert de 09H00 √† 20H00).
Il est notamment possible de se voir conseiller ponctuellement un lait de remplacement, notamment pour les b√©b√©s allergiques aux prot√©ines de lait.
TEXT:
SANT√â - Les autorit√©s sanitaires ont proc√©d√© au retrait et au rappel de lots de laits infantiles commercialis√©s sous trois marques diff√©rentes apr√®s avoir √©t√© inform√©es de la "contamination par des salmonelles de 20 jeunes enfants √¢g√©s de moins de 6 mois dans 8 r√©gions diff√©rentes", a annonc√© samedi 2 d√©cembre la Direction g√©n√©rale de la Sant√©.

En raison de ces contaminations, sans mise en danger des b√©b√©s concern√©s, les autorit√©s sanitaires demandent aux parents de ne pas utiliser douze lots de laits infantiles commercialis√©s sous les marques Lait Picot SL sans lactose, 1er √¢ge 350g, Lait Pepti Junior sans lactose, 1er √¢ge 460g, et Lait Milumel, Bio 1er √¢ge 900g, sans huile de palme.

URGENT :retrait de laits infantiles 1er age en raison d'une contamination par Salmonella agona ( source DGS/DGCCRF) pic.twitter.com/Tv1tQtxsQr ‚Äî j.daniel Flaysakier (@jdflaysakier) 2 d√©cembre 2017

Un num√©ro vert a √©t√© mis √† disposition des parents pour r√©pondre √† leurs interrogations (0800 120 120, ouvert de 09h00 √† 20h00).

A la suite de ces contaminations par des salmonelles de type Salmonella agona, les familles de 13 des 20 enfants affect√©s ont √©t√© interrog√©es dans un premier temps, montrant qu'ils avaient tous consomm√© du lait infantile 1er √¢ge issu de productions √©labor√©es entre mi-juillet et fin novembre sur un m√™me site de production du groupe LNS (Lactalis).

Les 12 lots concern√©s par le retrait sont, √† ce jour: ‚Ä¢ Lait Picot SL sans lactose 1er √¢ge 350g, les lots 17C0012344 (date limite d'utilisation 15/02/2019), 17C0012877 (DLUO 01/06/2019), 17C0013216 (DLUO 18/09/2019) et 17C0013549 (DLUO 29/09/2019). ‚Ä¢ Lait Pepti Junior sans lactose 1er √¢ge 460g, les lots 17C0012512 (DLUO 14/09/2018), 17C0012856 (DLUO 01/12/2018), 17C0013179 (DLUO 01/02/2019) ‚Ä¢ ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãLait Milumel Bio 1er √¢ge 900g sans huile de palme, les lots 17C0012592 (Date de durabilit√© minimale 03/04/2018), 17C0012845 (22/05/2018), 17C0012848 (26/08/2018), 17C0012960 (12/09/2018) et 17C0013084 (13/10/2018).

Les bo√Ætes de lait de ces marques non concern√©es par le retrait-rappel (autres num√©ros de lots) peuvent √™tre consomm√©es, indique la DGS, qui indique avoir aussi transmis ces recommandations aux m√©decins g√©n√©ralistes, p√©diatres et pharmaciens.

"Il y eu des produits commercialis√©s sur les 12 lots et d'autres qui sont encore dans nos entrep√¥ts", a pr√©cis√© le directeur de la communication de Lactalis. "Ces produits-l√† ont √©t√© bloqu√©s", a-t-il ajout√©.

"Il y aura une analyse et un plan de contr√¥le encore plus pr√©cis pour analyser et voir si on retrouve cette salmonelle dans les produits stock√©s dans nos entrep√¥ts", a-t-il indiqu√©, pr√©cisant que cela √©tait fait "en relation tr√®s √©troite avec les services d√©partementaux et nationaux" de la Direction g√©n√©rale de la concurrence, de la consommation et de la r√©pression des fraudes (DGCCRF).

Un num√©ro vert mis en place

Les infections √† Salmonella agona surviennent dans les trois jours suivant l'ingestion, et provoquent un tableau de gastro-ent√©rite avec des vomissements, une diarrh√©e parfois sanglante, et f√©brile dans la majorit√© des cas. L'apparition de ces signes chez un nourrisson doit conduire les familles √† consulter un m√©decin, rappellent les autorit√©s.

Un num√©ro vert a d'ailleurs √©t√© mis √† disposition des parents pour r√©pondre √† leurs interrogations sur les lots et les questions commerciales (0800.120.120, ouvert de 09H00 √† 20H00). Les autorit√©s insistent sur l'importance de consulter un p√©diatre ou un m√©decin pour les questions m√©dicales. Il est notamment possible de se voir conseiller ponctuellement un lait de remplacement, notamment pour les b√©b√©s allergiques aux prot√©ines de lait.
TITLE: B√©b√©s contamin√©s par des salmonelles: la liste des lots de lait infantile retir√©s du commerce

Beim Roulette liegt die Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass die Kugel auf einem roten oder einem schwarzen Feld landet, bei 97,3 Prozent.
Dass die Bundesrepublik bald von einer schwarz-roten Koalition regiert wird, ist zwar noch ein wenig unwahrscheinlicher.
Schulz‚Äô Emp√∂rung bedeutet aber l√§ngst nicht, dass der Sozialdemokrat ein B√ºndnis mit der Union aufrichtig scheut.
Es zeugt wohl eher vor der berechtigten Sorge, die Schulz vor der Reaktion der eigenen Basis hat, sollte die SPD die Gespr√§che entgegen den urspr√ºnglichen Versicherungen aufnehmen.
Was die Forderungen der SPD bedeutenDas Wort ‚Äúergebnisoffen‚Äù h√∂rt man vor den wichtigen Gespr√§chen mit den Konservativen immer wieder aus der SPD.
TEXT:
Schulz' Regierungs-Roullete: Wie der SPD-Chef seine Partei in die Gro√üe Koalition zockt | Reuters

Zwischen Union und SPD hat es am Freitag wieder einmal gekracht

Dennoch zeichnet sich ab, dass SPD-Chef Schulz eine GroKo anstrebt

F√ºr Schulz ist das Poltern wichtiger Bestandteil seiner Strategie

√úber zwei Monate sind seit der Bundestagswahl bereits vergangen. Und so richtig hat er noch nicht begonnen: der oft beschworene Koalitionspoker.

Stattdessen scheint die Berliner Republik einem anderen Gl√ºcksspiel dieser Tage deutlich √§hnlicher zu sein. Dem Roulette.

Man kann den Eindruck gewinnen: Egal, was passiert, am Ende l√§uft es doch auf Schwarz-Rot hinaus. Beim Roulette liegt die Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass die Kugel auf einem roten oder einem schwarzen Feld landet, bei 97,3 Prozent.

Dass die Bundesrepublik bald von einer schwarz-roten Koalition regiert wird, ist zwar noch ein wenig unwahrscheinlicher. Dennoch scheinen die Alternativen dieser Tage fast bedeutungslos zu sein.

Die SPD hadert zwar noch. Doch das ist vor allem eins: Kalk√ºl.

Schulz' gut inszenierte Emp√∂rung

Als die ‚ÄúBild‚Äù am Freitagmorgen berichtete, dass Sondierungsgespr√§che zwischen Union und SPD bereits festst√ºnden, griff SPD-Chef Martin Schulz Berichten zufolge wutentbrannt zum H√∂rer.

Er habe Merkel angerufen und zurechtgewiesen, erkl√§rte Schulz sp√§ter. Immerhin sei die Meldung wohl aus Unionskreisen lanciert gewesen.

Schulz‚Äô Emp√∂rung bedeutet aber l√§ngst nicht, dass der Sozialdemokrat ein B√ºndnis mit der Union aufrichtig scheut. Es zeugt wohl eher vor der berechtigten Sorge, die Schulz vor der Reaktion der eigenen Basis hat, sollte die SPD die Gespr√§che entgegen den urspr√ºnglichen Versicherungen aufnehmen.

Schulz ist l√§ngst umgeschwenkt. Bereits am Montag wolle er mit dem SPD-Vorstand √ºber einen entsprechenden Antrag f√ºr den Kongress Ende kommender Woche beraten, sagte Schulz am Freitag in Berlin.

Im ‚ÄúSpiegel‚Äù argumentiert er bemerkenswert defensiv, es gebe ja auch ‚Äúvern√ºnftige Unionspolitiker‚Äù.

Was die Forderungen der SPD bedeuten

Das Wort ‚Äúergebnisoffen‚Äù h√∂rt man vor den wichtigen Gespr√§chen mit den Konservativen immer wieder aus der SPD. Und den Term ‚ÄúMinderheitsregierung‚Äù. Auch die sei eine M√∂glichkeit, hei√üt es dann. Doch auch in der Fraktion der Sozialdemokraten macht sich der Eindruck breit, dass die Option dieser Tage eher das gr√ºne Feld auf dem Roulette-Tisch ist.

Denn die SPD hat l√§ngst ausgelotet, was sie in der Gro√üen Koalition durchsetzen will.

Schulz spricht im ‚ÄúSpiegel‚Äù von ‚Äústolzen Punkten‚Äù. Dem Ende der ‚ÄúZwei-Klassen-Medizin‚Äù etwa. Mit der Union gibt es hier Reibungspotenzial. Der Bildungsrevolution: Auch hier zeigte sich schon in den Jamaika-Verhandlungen, dass CDU und CSU Zugest√§ndnisse beim Kooperationsverbot blockieren.

F√ºr den SPD-Chef sind diese Differenzen wichtig, vielleicht √ºberlebenswichtig. Eine Gro√üe Koalition ohne z√§he Raufereien am Verhandlungstisch k√∂nnte er den Parteilinken noch viel weniger verkaufen, als eine hart errungene. Beim Parteitag im Dezember geht es auch um Schulz‚Äô Zukunft.

Achse Macron-Merkel-Schulz?

Bei der letzten Veranstaltung dieser Art in Dortmund hatte der ehemalige Europapolitiker vor allem mit seiner Vision f√ºr die EU geworben. Auch die will er der CDU-Chefin Angela Merkel nun zumindest √∂ffentlichkeitswirksam aufzwingen.

Schulz erkl√§rte daher: ‚ÄùDie deutsche Europolitik muss sich √§ndern. Eine positive Antwort auf Emmanuel Macron zu geben, wird ein Kernelement bei jeder Verhandlung mit der SPD sein."

Das klingt nach einer gleichzeitig k√§mpferischen wie positiven Vision. Gleichzeitig wei√ü Schulz: Die Forderung ist weniger eine Drohung, als ein ausgestreckter Arm an die Kanzlerin.

Auch CDU-Chefin Merkel hat l√§ngst betont, an Macrons Europa-Projekt mitarbeiten zu wollen. √úber Einzelheiten bei der Durchf√ºhrung wird sich reden lassen.

Falls die Kugel nicht doch noch auf Gr√ºn f√§llt.

(jg)
TITLE: Schulz' Regierungs-Roulette: Wie der SPD-Chef seine Partei in die Gro√üe Koalition zockt

SUMMARY:
In our society, it's viewed as an honour and a symbol of trust to be appointed as an estate trustee.
Movies and the media portray the trustee process as simple, straightforward and immediate ‚Äî the character goes from the funeral straight to the lawyer's office, reads the will and is handed a cheque.
There are more than 70 different tasks an estate trustee is responsible for, and the estate administration process can take between one and two years.
If you're unable to find an appropriate trustee based on the considerations, a corporate trustee might be the best option.
Before this year is over, review or put together a will that includes a responsible estate trustee and rest assured that your financial legacy will be carried out according to your wishes.
TEXT:
As we come to the end of "Make a Will Month," I wanted to share one of the most important parts of the process ‚Äî appointing an estate trustee. The largest intergenerational wealth transfer in Canadian history is taking place over the next decade, but only 50 per cent of Canadians have wills. Creating a will and appointing a trustee is the key to ensuring your estate is carried out to your wishes.

When you're preparing your will, you must select a representative to administer your affairs. A trustee is the representative charged with the ongoing administration of the will. In simple terms, they are the business manager of your estate. They act as an extension of you, wrapping up your affairs when you die. This includes a variety of tasks, from completing final tax returns, cleaning out your home, cancelling credit cards, investing the assets and making funeral arrangements.

In our society, it's viewed as an honour and a symbol of trust to be appointed as an estate trustee. Movies and the media portray the trustee process as simple, straightforward and immediate ‚Äî the character goes from the funeral straight to the lawyer's office, reads the will and is handed a cheque.

But in reality, the process is complex and a trustee's work is demanding. There are more than 70 different tasks an estate trustee is responsible for, and the estate administration process can take between one and two years. Choosing the right representative is critical, so make an informed and educated decision.

Here are 10 things to consider when choosing a trustee:

1. Project management skills

The execution of an estate is complicated, and it helps if your trustee is naturally organized.

2. Decision-making skills

Before appointing a trustee, ask yourself if their decision-making skills will be hindered by emotion or prejudice in anyway.

Getty Images/iStockphoto

3. Ability to handle stress

A trustee should be able to maintain calm under pressure and not let the weight of the work wear on them.

4. Understanding of the role, responsibilities and liabilities

Make sure the trustee fully understands their role and the work involved so they know what they are getting into before accepting.

5. Health and longevity

Ideally, your trustee will live long enough to execute your will as required. It may be difficult to think about, but consider a potential trustee's lifespan before entrusting them with your estate.

6. Ability to work with beneficiaries

Often people choose one of their beneficiaries to be the trustee of the estate, but this can lead to conflict and tension within the family. It's better to choose a representative with a neutral relationship to the beneficiaries.

7. Impartiality

Choose someone that can be impartial ‚Äî a trustee will need to make decisions that can't be clouded by emotion or a sense of loyalty to individuals.

8. Conflict resolution skills

In an emotional time, your beneficiaries and other family and friends may become emotional and conflict may ensue. Much of the pressure of relieving this conflict will fall to your trustee.

9. Geographic proximity

Choose someone who lives in the same jurisdiction as you, if not the same province, and definitely within Canada. This will help avoid unnecessary complications in the process and ensure that the trustee won't need to post an administration bond, which is required for security if the trustee lives out of province.

10. Time and availability

Consider the trustee's career, family and home life demands. If they've already got a full plate, you make want to choose someone else.

As family structures become more complicated, Canadians are increasingly choosing to appoint a corporate trustee to efficiently manage the process and assets versus doing it themselves. Every person who acts in the role of executor is entitled to compensation. In Canada, the courts determine what an estate trustee is entitled to based on the "usual percentages," which are up to five per cent on the value of capital assets and up to five per cent on the value of income collected in the estate, varied by province and other factors. If you're unable to find an appropriate trustee based on the considerations, a corporate trustee might be the best option.

This massive wealth transfer occurring over the next decade is going to be an issue if half of these estates do not have documents determining where this money goes. Before this year is over, review or put together a will that includes a responsible estate trustee and rest assured that your financial legacy will be carried out according to your wishes.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: 10 Ways To Ensure You Pick The Right Trustee To Carry Out Your Will

SUMMARY:
Gandhi to his Twitter handle and said "more hugs were urgently needed" between PM Modi and Trump.
President Trump just delinked Pak military funding from LeT.
Earlier on November 24, Saeed was released from house arrest in Lahore.
Police guards were removed from his residence where a large number of supporters gathered to celebrate the end of his house arrest.
In his first address after being released, Saeed blames India and the U.S. for detention and raked up Kashmir.
TEXT:
Rahul Gandhi, Vice-President of India's main opposition Congress Party, waves to his supporters during a rally ahead of Gujarat state assembly elections, at a village on the outskirts of Ahmedabad, India November 11, 2017.

Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi on Saturday took a dig at Prime Minister Narendra Modi after Pakistan released 2008 Mumbai attacks mastermind and Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed from house arrest, saying that the former's 'Hugplomacy' with US President Donald Trump failed.

Gandhi to his Twitter handle and said "more hugs were urgently needed" between PM Modi and Trump.

"Narendrabhai, ??? ???? ???. Terror mastermind is free. President Trump just delinked Pak military funding from LeT. Hugplomacy fail. More hugs urgently needed (sic)," he tweeted.

Earlier on November 24, Saeed was released from house arrest in Lahore.

Police guards were removed from his residence where a large number of supporters gathered to celebrate the end of his house arrest.

In his first address after being released, Saeed blames India and the U.S. for detention and raked up Kashmir.

Saeed is said to be the head of the U.S.-designated terror outfit, Lashkar-e-Taiba and had been under house arrest since January 31 this year.

The decision to put Saeed under house arrest in January was seen as a response to actions by US President Donald Trump's White House against nations deemed linked to terrorism.

He has been declared a global terrorist by the United Nations and the US for his role in the Mumbai attack which claimed the lives of 166 people and maimed over 300 others.

He has a USD 10 million bounty on his head.

Also on HuffPost India:
TITLE: 'Hugplomacy': Rahul Gandhi Takes A Dig At PM Modi After Hafeez Saeed's Release

SUMMARY:
Los eurodiputados han recordado la existencia de estudios de 2012 y 2013 que demuestran la relaci√≥n de los fosfatos en alimentos con unos mayores riesgos cardiovasculares.
La Agencia Europea de Seguridad Alimentaria (EFSA), por el contrario, descarta que la posibilidad de atribuir este riesgo a la ingesta de fosfatos.
Los fosfatos se utilizan hoy en d√≠a para aumentar el peso de la carne, debido a sus propiedades para conservar el agua especialmente en la carne en vertical, como es el caso de los doner kebabs.
Se trata de una carne que no se consume en casa y por tanto no est√° etiquetada, y los consumidores no son informados.
La portavoz de los socialdem√≥cratas en el Parlamento Europeo, Christel Schaldemose, se mostr√≥ satisfecha por el voto en favor de una objeci√≥n al uso de fosfatos que, a su juicio, demuestra que la Euroc√°mara "se toma en serio la salud p√∫blica".
TEXT:
epicurean via Getty Images

La comisi√≥n de Salud del Parlamento Europeo ha rechazado este martes una propuesta de la Comisi√≥n Europea que autorizar√≠a la presencia como aditivos de fosfatos en la carne de kebab, ya sea de cordero, ternera o pollo, por sus posibles efectos sobre la salud de los seres humanos.

Esta objeci√≥n ha sido aprobada con 32 votos a favor y 22 en contra en la comisi√≥n europarlamentaria y la propuesta de Bruselas quedar√° bloqueada si tambi√©n recibe el respaldo de la Euroc√°mara durante la sesi√≥n plenaria de mediados de Diciembre.

Las normas europeas proh√≠ben en t√©rminos generales la presencia de fosfatos en preparaciones de carne, pero estos aditivos est√°n cada vez m√°s presentes debido a la aprobaci√≥n de excepciones para determinados productos. El objetivo es proteger su sabor y retener el agua.

Los eurodiputados han recordado la existencia de estudios de 2012 y 2013 que demuestran la relaci√≥n de los fosfatos en alimentos con unos mayores riesgos cardiovasculares. La Agencia Europea de Seguridad Alimentaria (EFSA), por el contrario, descarta que la posibilidad de atribuir este riesgo a la ingesta de fosfatos.

Esta agencia europea, en cualquier caso, ha garantizado que evaluar√° de nuevo los posibles efectos de la presencia de fosfatos en alimentos como aditivos antes del 31 de diciembre del pr√≥ximo a√±o.

Los fosfatos se utilizan hoy en d√≠a para aumentar el peso de la carne, debido a sus propiedades para conservar el agua especialmente en la carne en vertical, como es el caso de los doner kebabs.

Se trata de una carne que no se consume en casa y por tanto no est√° etiquetada, y los consumidores no son informados.

La portavoz de los socialdem√≥cratas en el Parlamento Europeo, Christel Schaldemose, se mostr√≥ satisfecha por el voto en favor de una objeci√≥n al uso de fosfatos que, a su juicio, demuestra que la Euroc√°mara "se toma en serio la salud p√∫blica".

"SENTENCIA DE MUERTE"

Sin embargo, los comerciantes de este tipo de productos alertan de que si se lleva a cabo esta prohibici√≥n ser√° la "sentencia de muerte" para el kebab en la Uni√≥n Europea, tal y como ha dicho el representante de la Asociaci√≥n Alemana de Productores de Doner Kebab al rotativo alem√°n Bild.

Hasta un miembro del partido de la canciller alemana Angela Merkel se ha pronunciado al respecto: "La prohibici√≥n del fosfato ser√° el fin para la producci√≥n de doner kebabs y supondr√° la p√©rdida de centenares de puestos de trabajo".
TITLE: La medida de la UE que puede poner en peligro a los kebabs

SUMMARY:
"El estudio descubri√≥ que los hombres y las mujeres experimentan distintos sentimientos de p√©rdida tras una ruptura.
Al parecer, sentir distintos tipos de p√©rdida tras una ruptura se traduce en los distintos modos en que los hombres y las mujeres sobrellevan su sufrimiento.
"Los estudios demuestran que las mujeres necesitan conexi√≥n (sentimientos) y los hombres necesitan hacer algo (actividad).
En la sociedad en la que vivimos, a los hombres no se les permite mostrarse vulnerables cuando est√°n heridos", explica la doctora Nikki Goldstein.
Las diferencias surgen seg√∫n el modo en que afrontan la tristeza, la p√©rdida y el sufrimiento.
TEXT:
Rupturas. Nunca son un buen trago. L√°grimas, rabia, noches turbias y atracones son algunos de los s√≠ntomas de un coraz√≥n hecho pedazos.

Si tanto los hombres como las mujeres sufren emocionalmente cuando pasan por una ruptura, ¬øpor qu√© es tan dif√≠cil de entender que √©l "quiera mantener la distancia" o que ella "a√∫n quiera que se√°is amigos"?

El motivo est√° relacionado con el papel social que desempe√±an las relaciones y c√≥mo afectan a nuestra percepci√≥n de la val√≠a personal, as√≠ como con el hecho de que hombres y mujeres lidien con el mismo sufrimiento de forma diferente.

El motivo est√° relacionado con el papel social que desempe√±an las relaciones y c√≥mo afectan a nuestra percepci√≥n de la val√≠a personal

"Los estudios demuestran que tanto hombres como mujeres obtienen parte de su autoestima a partir de las relaciones, de modo que ambos sexos sufren un sentimiento de p√©rdida y conflictos de identidad cuando salen de una relaci√≥n", explica la psic√≥loga Melanie Schilling a la edici√≥n estadounidense del HuffPost.

"El estudio descubri√≥ que los hombres y las mujeres experimentan distintos sentimientos de p√©rdida tras una ruptura. En t√©rminos generales, los hombres obtienen parte de su autoestima a partir del estatus social que les proporciona el hecho de tener pareja, mientras que las mujeres la obtienen a partir del sentimiento de conexi√≥n con su pareja. Estas diferencias probablemente influyen en el modo en que ambos sexos se comportan tras una ruptura", indica.

Tanto los hombres como las mujeres obtienen parte de su autoestima a partir de las relaciones.

Al parecer, sentir distintos tipos de p√©rdida tras una ruptura se traduce en los distintos modos en que los hombres y las mujeres sobrellevan su sufrimiento. As√≠ como las mujeres tienden a buscar consuelo en sus familiares y amigos, los hombres tienden a salir por ah√≠ y mantenerse activos.

"Los estudios demuestran que las mujeres necesitan conexi√≥n (sentimientos) y los hombres necesitan hacer algo (actividad). No resulta extra√±o que una mujer que acaba de romper se refugie en sus amigas y comparta los detalles de la ruptura. Es tan com√∫n como ver a un hombre que acaba de romper empezando a practicar un nuevo deporte, y√©ndose de vacaciones o buscando una nueva relaci√≥n por Internet", comenta la experta.

¬øQu√© m√©todo es m√°s efectivo, el de los hombres o el de las mujeres? Est√° claro que cuanto antes cicatrizas un coraz√≥n roto y antes te incorporas a la vida normal y recuperas la felicidad, mejor, ¬øno?

Es importante destacar que, aunque los dos sexos procesan de forma distinta una ruptura, el sentimiento de p√©rdida es equivalente.

Da la impresi√≥n de que est√° mejor visto socialmente que las mujeres se abran emocionalmente a las personas de su entorno, de forma que pueden afrontar los sentimientos de arrepentimiento y tristeza m√°s r√°pido que los hombres.

"A las mujeres se nos acepta que hablemos abiertamente del tema... Se nos permite tener estos momentos de '¬øqu√© me pasa?' y 'no era el adecuado para m√≠', podemos estar tristes y ausentes", opina la doctora en sexolog√≠a Nikki Goldstein.

Si un hombre hiciera las mismas cosas que hace una mujer cuando pasa por una ruptura, la sociedad lo considerar√≠a d√©bil, y eso es triste, porque as√≠ surge una generaci√≥n entera de hombres a quienes se les ha inculcado que tienen que tragarse su sufrimiento y seguir adelante as√≠"

"Si un hombre hiciera las mismas cosas que hace una mujer cuando pasa por una ruptura, probablemente la sociedad lo considerar√≠a d√©bil, y eso es algo verdaderamente triste, porque as√≠ surge una generaci√≥n entera de hombres a quienes se les ha inculcado que tienen que tragarse su sufrimiento y seguir adelante as√≠", a√±ade.

"Tras una ruptura, pueden surgir conductas secundarias como darse a la bebida o mantener muchas relaciones sexuales sin compromiso. En la sociedad en la que vivimos, a los hombres no se les permite mostrarse vulnerables cuando est√°n heridos", explica la doctora Nikki Goldstein.

Tras una ruptura, los hombres tienen la presi√≥n de mostrarse fuertes, aunque est√©n pasando por un momento terrible.

Melanie Schilling afirma que esa actitud por la que los hombres fingen poder suprimir sus emociones no hace m√°s que alargar el tiempo que les cuesta superar una ruptura. "Muchos hombres se encierran en su metaf√≥rica 'cueva masculina' tras una ruptura para escudarse del sufrimiento de p√©rdida. A menudo sienten la presi√≥n social de 'actuar como un hombre' y superarlo en lugar de poder centrarse en sus sentimientos. Esta actitud solo sirve para alargar el dolor de la ruptura y la p√©rdida".

La conclusi√≥n es que tanto hombres como mujeres experimentan unas emociones equivalentes cuando pasan por una ruptura. Las diferencias surgen seg√∫n el modo en que afrontan la tristeza, la p√©rdida y el sufrimiento. De modo que el mejor consejo para superar una ruptura es, por lo tanto, com√∫n para ambos sexos.

Tr√°tate bien y aprovecha la ocasi√≥n para dedicarte toda tu atenci√≥n"

Melanie Schilling ofrece el siguiente consejo: "Habla, escribe y medita sobre ello. Haz lo que necesites para digerir la ruptura y analizar por qu√© termin√≥ la relaci√≥n. Pasa tiempo con gente que te apoye y te anime a seguir cuid√°ndote, gente que te permita estar en consonancia con el momento por el que est√°s pasando. No te sientas en la obligaci√≥n de seguir adelante si a√∫n no lo has superado, mantente en contacto con tus sentimientos y perm√≠tete renunciar a la vida social durante el tiempo que necesites. Tr√°tate bien y aprovecha la ocasi√≥n para dedicarte toda tu atenci√≥n".

Este art√≠culo fue publicado originalmente en el 'HuffPost' Australia y ha sido traducido del ingl√©s por Daniel Templeman Sauco.
TITLE: El motivo por el que los hombres y las mujeres afrontan las rupturas de forma diferente

√âTATS-UNIS - Les menaces de la Cor√©e du Nord sont prises tr√®s au s√©rieux aux √âtats-Unis. Pour preuve: Hawa√Ø a r√©activ√© puis test√© sa sir√®ne d'alarme nucl√©aire vendredi 1er d√©cembre, pour la premi√®re fois depuis la fin de la guerre froide, explique l'√©dition am√©ricaine du HuffPost. Un essai qui intervient quelques jours seulement apr√®s que la Cor√©e du Nord s'est vant√© d'√™tre un √âtat nucl√©aire pouvant viser tout le territoire am√©ricain.

"La sir√®ne a retenti pendant une minute, √† partir de 11 heures 45" d√©taille le service d'intervention d'urgence d'Hawa√Ø qui pr√©cise que les op√©rations se sont bien d√©roul√©es.

Selon un rapport de l'Agence de s√©curit√© locale, relay√©e en France par Ouest-France "un seul missile de 150 kilotonnes tir√© sur Pearl Harbor, situ√© √† Oahu, l'√Æle principale d'Hawa√Ø, causerait 18 000 morts et entre 50 000 et 120 000 bless√©s selon ce document." Il ne faudrait d'ailleurs que 20 minutes au missile en question pour atteindre le sol am√©ricain.

Et l'importante pr√©sence militaire sur ses terres pourrait en faire une cible de choix. L'√Æle d'Oahu abrite en effet le quartier g√©n√©ral de l'US Army dans la r√©gion Asie-Pacifique. SUMMARY:
You might want to get out the heavy-duty thermals and stand outside to catch a glimpse of something pretty special.
That‚Äôs because Earth will have front row seats for the first and last supermoon of 2017 in the next few days, known as the ‚Äòfull cold moon‚Äô.
Appearing 14% larger and 30% brighter than the moon usually does, according to NASA, it will be well worth looking out for.
The moon is usually about 238,000 miles away from Earth but when in perigee it is about 222, 135 miles away - that‚Äôs a difference of 30,516 miles.
It won‚Äôt actually reach perigee ‚Äì or the point at which it‚Äôs closest to Earth ‚Äì until the next morning at 08.45 GMT.
TEXT:
Got any plans for this weekend? You might want to get out the heavy-duty thermals and stand outside to catch a glimpse of something pretty special. That‚Äôs because Earth will have front row seats for the first and last supermoon of 2017 in the next few days, known as the ‚Äòfull cold moon‚Äô. Appearing 14% larger and 30% brighter than the moon usually does, according to NASA, it will be well worth looking out for.

Getty Images

What Is A Supermoon? NASA says that a supermoon happens when a full moon coincides with the moon‚Äôs perigee - meaning the point in its orbit at which it is closest to Earth (the farthest point is known as apogee). The moon is usually about 238,000 miles away from Earth but when in perigee it is about 222, 135 miles away - that‚Äôs a difference of 30,516 miles. It is this combination of being physically closer to earth and being a full moon that makes it look so much larger and brighter. ‚ÄúGenerally speaking, full moons occur near perigee every 13 months and 18 days, so it‚Äôs not all that unusual,‚Äù Geoff Chester of the US Naval Observatory told NASA Science News. When Can I See The Supermoon? The moon will rise on Sunday 3 December and becomes totally full at 15.47 GMT, though of course it will be big and full all night. It won‚Äôt actually reach perigee ‚Äì or the point at which it‚Äôs closest to Earth ‚Äì until the next morning at 08.45 GMT.

vladimir zakharov via Getty Images
TITLE: Supermoon UK 2017: The Biggest And Brightest Supermoon Of The Year Is Happening This Weekend
