SUMMARY:
‚ÄúDuring a major incident it‚Äôs immensely useful that we can get messaging out directly to people that are in an incident quickly,‚Äù he says.
More info asap ‚Äî Metropolitan Police (@metpoliceuk) November 24, 2017Issue pertinent advice:If you are on Oxford Street go into a building.
More updates as soon as we have them ‚Äî Metropolitan Police (@metpoliceuk) November 24, 2017And declare the situation over:Our response on #OxfordStreet has now been stood down.
The failure was swiftly spotted internally and the story containing the inaccurate information was only live for exactly seven minutes.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve revamped our major incident communications over the last three years and at the heart of this has been making it part of the policing operation, not a bolt on.
TEXT:
A week ago today an ‚Äúaltercation‚Äù between two men at Oxford Circus Tube station sparked mass evacuations, a huge armed police response and lit up social media with panic, rumours and occasionally, some solid facts. One man who was desperately trying to be heard above all the noise was Ed Stearns, Head of Media at the Metropolitan Police, and the person ultimately responsible for what is, for many people, the first port of call for information during a potential terrorist incident in London - the force‚Äôs Twitter account.

Simon Dawson / Reuters Panic swept one of the country's busiest shopping streets in minutes on Friday night

‚ÄúWe are very aware that we have a responsibility to get out as much info as we can, as quickly as we can, but it‚Äôs got to be correct as well,‚Äù Stearns tells HuffPost UK. Less than a decade ago reporters would gather under the revolving sign of Scotland Yard awaiting word from a police spokesperson on major events, perhaps also periodically refreshing the Met Police website on an early smartphone. The public, ever-eager for information, would generally wait for word from the media.

Steve Parsons - PA Images via Getty Images Then-Deputy Commissioner Paul Stephenson giving a press briefing outside Scotland Yard in 2006

But a lot has changed in that time. The press conferences at Scotland Yard are still held, but social media has helped fill the gap between an incident happening and an official or verified version of events being presented - usually not with verified facts as aptly demonstrated last week when rumours of gun-fire swept Twitter. For Stearns and his team of around 30 people who provide 24-hour coverage of events in the capital, social media can be a double-edged sword. ‚ÄúDuring a major incident it‚Äôs immensely useful that we can get messaging out directly to people that are in an incident quickly,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúThe strategic intention of the communication is saving life, providing reassurance to the public and aiding the investigation as that goes forward.‚Äù

PA Archive/PA Images Old-school and low-tech - Scotland Yard's telegraph room in 1967

Stearns‚Äô team follows a relatively standard procedure during a major incident - acknowledge the event and reassure the public that police are on the ground:

Our officers are on the scene at #OxfordCircus tube station with @BTP Please avoid the Oxford Circus area whilst we deal with the incident. More info asap ‚Äî Metropolitan Police (@metpoliceuk) November 24, 2017

Issue pertinent advice:

If you are on Oxford Street go into a building. Officers are on scene and dealing. More info when we can ‚Äî Metropolitan Police (@metpoliceuk) November 24, 2017

Release information as it is confirmed:

Police called at 16:38 to a number of reports of shots fired on #OxfordStreet & underground at Oxford Circus tube station. Police have responded as if the incident is terrorist related. Armed and unarmed officers are on scene and dealing along with colleagues from @BTP ‚Äî Metropolitan Police (@metpoliceuk) November 24, 2017

We have not located any trace of suspects, evidence of shots fired or casualties. Officers still on scene. If you are in a building stay there, if you are on the street in #OxfordStreet leave the area. Officers continue to search the area. More updates as soon as we have them ‚Äî Metropolitan Police (@metpoliceuk) November 24, 2017

And declare the situation over:

Our response on #OxfordStreet has now been stood down. If you sought shelter in a building please now leave, and follow the direction of police officers on the ground if you need assistance ‚Äî Metropolitan Police (@metpoliceuk) November 24, 2017

This is good in theory but in the crowded virtual space of Twitter, the Met Police account, even with its 1.1 million followers, can find itself vying for attention with thousands of others, none of which are privy to the information Stearns and his team have.

Met Police Ed Stearns, Head of Media at the Metropolitan Police

‚ÄúUnverified rumours being out there are not helpful to a police operation, that‚Äôs for sure,‚Äù Stearns says. ‚ÄúRumours are difficult because you can‚Äôt possibly respond to every rumour, because often we don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs true, so it‚Äôs better for us to say please come to us for verified information.‚Äù Last Friday‚Äôs incident was notable for the input of celebrities such as Russell Brand and pop star Olly Murs, who found himself live-tweeting in an understandably panicked manner from Selfridges on Oxford Street.

Fuck everyone get out of @Selfridges now gun shots!! I‚Äôm inside ‚Äî Olly Murs (@ollyofficial) November 24, 2017

Live from Oxford St pic.twitter.com/WZaRBetplT ‚Äî Russell Brand (@rustyrockets) November 24, 2017

Both drew criticism for potentially stoking panic, with Piers Morgan even going so far as to say Murs ‚Äúcould have put people in more danger‚Äù. Stearns plays down the role Brand and Murs could have had with causing unnecessary panic saying it‚Äôs been ‚Äúoverblown‚Äù. ‚ÄúI think people were just reacting to what they were hearing on the streets as much as anything,‚Äù he adds.

Probably the most effective tweet they can put out is follow @MetPoliceUK for latest information and retweet what we‚Äôre putting out Ed Stearns, Head of Media at the Metropolitan Police

Regardless, he does still have some advice for anyone with a large social media following who finds themselves caught up in such a situation. ‚ÄúOne hundred percent anyone with a large following, if they‚Äôre in an incident, probably the most effective tweet they can put out is follow @MetPoliceUK for latest information and retweet what we‚Äôre putting out. ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre in Manchester say follow Manchester Police for information, if you‚Äôre in Liverpool, follow Merseyside Police. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the police that have that verified information and who will put out the messaging that could save lives.‚Äù And it‚Äôs not just celebrities and the public who can confuse matters, occasionally the media makes mistakes too. A tweet sent by the Daily Mail last Friday reported a lorry had ‚Äúploughed into pedestrians‚Äù mistakenly quoting another tweet that was sent weeks before the actual incident.

Daily Mail one of the UK‚Äôs biggest newspaper tweeted about a lorry ploughing into people at Oxford Circus, then deleted it when it turns out to be fake news. Well that‚Äôs one way to spread a rumor. pic.twitter.com/nULu0G4lbe ‚Äî Stephen Brian Lowe (@SBrianLowe) November 24, 2017

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to criticise a particular source,‚Äù Stearns says. ‚ÄúI used to work on newspapers and we would have to be pretty sure of our facts before we put something out now. I‚Äôm not sure the same rules are applying now to that extent. ‚ÄúBut I‚Äôm sure any news organisation that puts out something wrong will reflect on that. After Westminster there were early reports there were more gunman out there, all this speculation - it doesn‚Äôt help but I hope news organisations learn from what they put out there and what they do.‚Äù Mail Online did indeed reflect on it and issued an apology, which read: As in any major incident these days, social media was awash with confused reports from Oxford Circus tonight, many of which turned out to be inaccurate. It is the job of the mainstream media to strike a balance between reflecting what is being reported from the scene without spreading false facts. And, despite the fast-moving situation, reporting this particular information that was not in line with the mass of eye-witness reports was a grave error. The failure was swiftly spotted internally and the story containing the inaccurate information was only live for exactly seven minutes. Nevertheless MailOnline deeply regrets that it was ever published at all, however briefly, and has instituted an urgent inquiry to establish exactly how it happened. The lesson from all of this is of course that ultimately the police and security services are the only ones who know for sure what‚Äôs going on during a major event. ‚Ä≥[When an incident occurs] something called a Gold is appointed, a Gold Commander and a team set up to run that incident but obviously they‚Äôre not going to be there for, depending on what time of day it is, it can take between 20 minutes and an hour to set that system up,‚Äù Stearns says. ‚ÄúIn the meantime it‚Äôs run by the force control room - there‚Äôs a team inspector who‚Äôs running London really and we‚Äôre liaising with that control room to get information out as soon as we can. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve revamped our major incident communications over the last three years and at the heart of this has been making it part of the policing operation, not a bolt on. ‚ÄúCommunication can save life and so that‚Äôs a really important part of the operation.‚Äù

Social media gives us our own channel - it gives people a place to go Ed Stearns, Head of Media at the Metropolitan Police
TITLE: Meet The First Person You Should Listen To On Twitter During A Terror Attack On London

Selon le New York Post, le procureur local n'aurait retenu aucune charge.
Ses rencontres avec Levine, sous pr√©texte de parler de ses ambitions dans le monde de la musique classique, se seraient poursuivies jusqu'en 1993.
D'apr√®s le Post, en plus de divers cadeaux comme des baguettes de chef d'orchestre, Levine lui aurait donn√© 50.000 dollars en liquide au fil des ann√©es.
James Levine a commenc√© sa carri√®re au "Met" √† New York en 1971, dirigeant plus de 2.500 repr√©sentations de pr√®s de 85 op√©ras diff√©rents.
Apr√®s 40 ann√©es √† la direction musicale de l'op√©ra, il a pris sa retraite √† la fin de la saison 2015-16, pour raisons de sant√©, √©tant atteint de la maladie de Parkison.
TEXT:
James Levine, mythique chef d'orchestre et directeur musical honoraire du Metropolitan Opera de New York, est la derni√®re personnalit√© de premier plan √† √™tre impliqu√© dans un scandale d'accusations de harc√®lement et d'agressions sexuelles, accus√© avoir abus√© d'un adolescent dans les ann√©es 80.

La victime pr√©sum√©e, rest√©e anonyme, a d√©clar√© √† la police de l'Etat de l'Illinois (nord-est) que les faits auraient d√©but√© en 1985 quand il avait 15 ans et le chef d'orchestre 41, et se sont poursuivis jusqu'en 1993, selon les quotidiens New York Post et The New York Times.

"Nous sommes profond√©ment troubl√©s par les articles de presse (...) sur James Levine", a r√©agi le Metropolitan Opera de New York, qui affirme conduire "une enqu√™te pour d√©terminer si les accusations d'agressions sexuelles sont vraies" afin de prendre "les mesures appropri√©es".

Les accusations ne peuvent pas faire l'objet de poursuites judiciaires, car le d√©lai de prescription pour un crime sexuel sur mineur dans l'Etat est d√©pass√© de neuf ans.

En 2016, un rapport de police avait fait √©tat de ces accusations, mais "James Levine avait affirm√© qu'elles √©taient totalement fausses et nous nous en √©tions remis √† l'enqu√™te de la police", pr√©cise la direction du Met.

Selon le New York Post, le procureur local n'aurait retenu aucune charge.

"Il m'a embarrass√©, m'a fait me sentir coupable", a d√©clar√© la victime pr√©sum√©e, √¢g√©e d√©sormais de 48 ans, dans sa d√©claration √† la police, selon le journal. "J'ai √©t√© bless√© √©motionnellement, perdu, paralys√©".

Les attouchements sexuels auraient d√©but√© par des caresses sur la main du jeune homme "de fa√ßon prolong√©e et incroyablement sensuelle", ce qui l'aurait mis "tr√®s mal √† l'aise". L'homme accuse ensuite James Levine de lui avoir caress√© le sexe dans une chambre d'un h√¥tel de luxe √† Lake Forest, o√π la sc√®ne se serait reproduite "des centaines de fois" au cours des ann√©es.

D'apr√®s le New York Post, l'homme aurait affirm√© aux policiers de Lake Forest (Illinois) que James Levine avait pris l'habitude de se masturber devant lui et de lui embrasser le sexe.

Ses rencontres avec Levine, sous pr√©texte de parler de ses ambitions dans le monde de la musique classique, se seraient poursuivies jusqu'en 1993. D'apr√®s le Post, en plus de divers cadeaux comme des baguettes de chef d'orchestre, Levine lui aurait donn√© 50.000 dollars en liquide au fil des ann√©es.

La victime pr√©sum√©e affirme que ces agressions "l'ont men√© au bord du suicide." "Je me sentais seul, effray√©. Il essayait de me s√©duire. Je ne pouvais pas voir ce qu'il se passait. Maintenant je peux.", aurait-il d√©clar√© √† la police.

"James Levine n'√©tait pas quelqu'un √† qui on pouvait dire non", aurait-il ajout√©.

James Levine a commenc√© sa carri√®re au "Met" √† New York en 1971, dirigeant plus de 2.500 repr√©sentations de pr√®s de 85 op√©ras diff√©rents. Apr√®s 40 ann√©es √† la direction musicale de l'op√©ra, il a pris sa retraite √† la fin de la saison 2015-16, pour raisons de sant√©, √©tant atteint de la maladie de Parkison. Il a n√©anmoins conserv√© un poste de directeur musical honoraire.

Depuis l'√©clatement de l'affaire Harvey Weinstein en octobre, d'innombrables scandales autour d'accusations de harc√®lement, d'agressions voire de viols ont √©clat√©, touchant, outre le cin√©ma, d'autres secteurs (m√©dias, politique, etc.) dans de nombreux pays.
TITLE: Le chef d'orchestre am√©ricain James Levine accus√© d'agression sexuelle

SUMMARY:
After a video surfaced showing migrants apparently being sold at auction in Libya, people worldwide have been calling for action.
Last week, CNN published a report on modern slavery in Libya, featuring a video that reportedly was shot in August and appeared to show a man selling African migrants for farm work.
"Big strong boys," the man said in the video, according to a CNN narrator.
The U.N. Support Mission in Libya said Wednesday that it was "dismayed and sickened," and is "actively pursuing" the matter with Libyan authorities.

TEXT:
After a video surfaced showing migrants apparently being sold at auction in Libya, people worldwide have been calling for action.

Last week, CNN published a report on modern slavery in Libya, featuring a video that reportedly was shot in August and appeared to show a man selling African migrants for farm work.

"Big strong boys," the man said in the video, according to a CNN narrator. "400 ... 700 ... 800," he called out the mounting prices. The men were eventually sold for about $400 each, CNN reported. The Libyan government said it has launched an investigation into slave auctions in the country.

Following the CNN report, demonstrators took to the streets in Paris and other cities last week to express their outrage, and Libyans showed their solidarity on Twitter with the hashtag #LibyansAgainstSlavery.

Several world leaders spoke out as well. The chairman of the African Union, Guinean President Alpha Cond√©, called it a "despicable trade ... from another era" on Friday. The U.N. Support Mission in Libya said Wednesday that it was "dismayed and sickened," and is "actively pursuing" the matter with Libyan authorities.

"I am horrified at news reports and video footage showing African migrants in Libya reportedly being sold as slaves," U.N. Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres said to reporters on Monday. "Slavery has no place in our world, and these actions are among the most egregious abuses of human rights and may amount to crimes against humanity."
TITLE: Video Of Apparent Slave Auction In Libya Provokes Outrage Worldwide

TEXT:
POLITIQUE - Nouveau look pour une nouvelle vie. A l'image de l'√©mission de M6, Beno√Æt Hamon veut faire prendre un virage au mouvement qu'il a lanc√© le 1er juillet dernier. Lors du congr√®s qu'il organise ce samedi 2 d√©cembre au Mans, l'ancien candidat socialiste √† la pr√©sidentielle va d√©voiler le nouveau nom et le nouveau site internet du M1717.

Au-del√† de ces consid√©rations esth√©tiques, il lance surtout pour de bon son aventure politique hors du PS. Seulement, six mois apr√®s sa d√©route √©lectorale (6,4% des voix au premier tour), les bases sur lesquelles il inscrit son action ne sont pas des plus solides.

Officiellement, le M1717 revendique 40.000 sympathisants qui, pour la plupart, "n'ont eu aucun engagement militant avant". Mais comme √† la France insoumise ou √† la R√©publique en marche, il s'agit d'adh√©rents qui n'ont fait que quelques clics sur internet et ne r√®glent pas encore de cotisation. Cette question sera d'ailleurs tranch√©e ce samedi avec l'id√©e qu'il va falloir trouver des ressources financi√®res pour un mouvement qui ne peut pas compter sur un financement public. "On fait la tourn√©e des caf√©s pour travailler", illustre dans Paris Match l'eurod√©put√© Guillaume Balas, lieutenant de Beno√Æt Hamon.

La r√©gion Ile-de-France comme exemple

Sans le sou, Beno√Æt Hamon peut √©galement compter sur un nombre tr√®s limit√© d'√©lus √† ses c√¥t√©s. Comme lui, les d√©put√©s dont il √©tait proche ont √©t√© balay√©s par la vague macroniste, √† l'exception de R√©gis Juanico. Ce dernier est rest√© cependant au PS. Seulement deux eurod√©put√©s (Guillaume Balas et Isabelle Thomas) ont quitt√© le PS pour le rejoindre tandis qu'√† la r√©gion √éle-de-France o√π il est encore √©lu (son dernier mandat) le groupe qu'il a rejoint est constitu√© majoritairement d'√©cologistes.

C'est pourtant ce mod√®le de rassemblement qu'il r√™ve de construire √† plus grande √©chelle. Dans la continuit√© de ce qu'il a fait √† la pr√©sidentielle avec le ralliement de l'√©cologiste Yannick Jadot, l'√©ph√©m√®re ministre de l'Education nationale (c'√©tait en 2014) aimerait rassembler "tous les progressistes pro-europ√©ens" de gauche.

"Entre l'impasse du n√©olib√©ralisme et l'impasse d'une r√©plique nationaliste, l'espace politique est immense", veut croire l'int√©ress√©. "L'enjeu, ce sont les alliances, a-t-il poursuivi r√©cemment sur France Info. Avec des communistes, avec Europe Ecologie-Les Verts, avec des socialistes, avec de la gauche citoyenne et solidaire, cet espace-l√† pourra √™tre consid√©rable."

Voil√† toute la question pour Beno√Æt Hamon. L'espace situ√© entre Emmanuel Macron et Jean-Luc M√©lenchon dans lequel le PS veut aussi exister est-il aussi "immense" qu'il le laisse entendre? "Il n'a pas d'espace entre le PS et nous", estime un d√©put√© de la France insoumise qui confirme cependant des contacts r√©guliers entre les deux anciens candidats √† la pr√©sidentielle. Ils √©taient d'ailleurs c√¥te √† c√¥te en septembre contre la r√©forme de la loi travail.

"Pour le moment, il me fait penser √† Jean-Luc en 2008 apr√®s qu'il a claqu√© la porte du PS. Il faut lui laisser du temps, cheminer qu'il fasse son truc tranquillement", reprend ce parlementaire.

Pourquoi √ßa bloque encore avec M√©lenchon

Pour toutes les forces de gauche qui veulent s'opposer √† l'ex√©cutif, une premi√®re √©ch√©ance se dessine avec les europ√©ennes de 2019. Le nouveau mode de scrutin qui pr√©voit une liste nationale unique avec repr√©sentation de ceux qui ont fait plus de 5% des voix rend ces alliances indispensables.

Avec certains, cela semble en bonne voie. "Il y a des convergences sur plusieurs sujets: la n√©cessit√© de construire les ripostes les plus rassembleuses face √† la politique d'Emmanuel Macron, la transformation de la gauche, l'objectif d'une approche commune pour les europ√©ennes", salue le porte-parole du PCF Olivier Dartigolles. "Les lignes sont potentiellement convergentes", appuie Yannick Jadot, l'√©ph√©m√®re candidat EELV √† la pr√©sidentielle.

Reste l'incompatibilit√© avec Jean-Luc M√©lenchon. √Ä la pr√©sidentielle, des consid√©rations financi√®res avaient rendu un d√©sistement impossible. Six mois plus tard, les convergences th√©oriques sont encore l√†. Mais deux probl√®mes majeurs n'ont pas disparu. "Nous refusons toute alliance entre la France insoumise et n'importe quel autre mouvement, m√™me le M1717 car nous ne voulons pas retomber dans la tambouille", explique un m√©lenchoniste. Celui-ci √©voque aussi une divergence centrale sur le fond de la question europ√©enne: "Hamon est convaincu qu'on peut garder les trait√©s actuels; or m√™me son programme de la pr√©sidentielle n'√©tait pas possible dans ce cadre."

Si rien ne bouge sur ce front dans les 18 prochains mois, Beno√Æt Hamon pourrait alors se heurter aux m√™mes probl√®mes que pendant la pr√©sidentielle. "Il donne le sentiment d'avoir donn√© le meilleur de lui-m√™me √† la pr√©sidentielle. Est-ce qu'il peut donner plus? Certains en doutent", r√©sume un d√©put√© socialiste.

A voir √©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Sans √©lu ni argent, Beno√Æt Hamon peut-il survivre sans alliance?

TEXT:
‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã

It's rare to find a person that does not wish their hair would grow faster or that their nails were stronger.

Sure, there's all kinds of hair treatments and nail polishes that promise to do just that, but can you promote longer and stronger nails and hair through the foods to you? You bet.

"There is no doubt about it -- what you eat, and also what you don't eat, can really affect your appearance," Dr. Josh Axe, author of Eat Dirt, and co-founder of Ancient Nutrition told HuffPost Australia.

"For example, someone with an iron deficiency is at a greater risk for both hair loss and brittle nails so eating iron-rich foods can really help hair and nail health. Overall, eating a healthy diet filled with nutrient-dense whole foods can go a long way when it comes to boosting the growth and strength of both your hair and nails."

So, what kinds of foods should you look out for?

"Foods that are rich in the following nutrients are excellent at supporting healthy hair and nails," Axe said.

Omega-3 fatty acids: Foods like wild-caught fish, chia seeds, flaxseeds, and walnuts are rich in omega-3 fatty acids which are anti-inflammatory, hormone-balancing and decrease external dryness.

Iron: Great dietary sources of iron include foods like grass-fed beef, lentils, white beans, and dark leafy greens. An iron deficiency can be underlying cause of thinning hair and dry, brittle nails so getting enough of this nutrient regularly is key.

Biotin (B7): A B vitamin found in delicious foods like eggs, salmon, goat cheese, and almonds, biotin plays a crucial role in maintaining the health of our hair, nails and skin.

Zinc: Zinc is another vitamin essential to healthy skin and nails since it aids tissue growth and tissue repair. Similarly to iron, a zinc deficiency is linked to poor hair and nail growth. High-zinc foods include lamb, pumpkin seeds, chickpeas, and cashews.

In addition to diet, having less stress in your life can also promote a healthier looking appearance -- hair and nails included.

"Practising forms of relaxation, such as yoga, journalling, prayer, etc, on a regular basis and balancing hormones can really help to promote the healthy growth of nails and hair since thyroid issues and hormone imbalance as well as chronic stress can contribute to unhealthy hair and nails," Axe said.

As for things that could have a negative effect on growing your hair and nails long and lush?

"Food allergens, processed foods, trans fat and refined sugar should be avoided. Caffeine and alcohol should be chosen wisely and always in moderation."
TITLE: Can What You Eat Help Grow Longer And Stronger Hair And Nails?

So habe es seine Partei auch schon bei der Abstimmung √ºber die Verl√§ngerung der aktuellen Mandate f√ºr die Auslandseins√§tze der Bundeswehr gehandhabt.
"Das entsprach nicht der Weisungslage, die von der Bundesregierung ausgearbeitet war", sagte Merkel am Dienstag in Berlin.

TEXT:
Diese Woche k√∂nnte richtungsweisend in der Regierungskrise sein

Bundespr√§sident Steinmeier ist offensichtlich f√ºr eine Gro√üe Koalition

√úber die Entwicklungen in Berlin informieren wir euch in unserem News-Blog

Die zehnte Woche nach der Bundestagswahl d√ºrfte zumindest eine Vorentscheidung dar√ºber bringen, wohin das Land steuert. Und wer es steuert - zusammen mit Angela Merkel nat√ºrlich.

Immer noch liegen drei Optionen auf dem Tisch, ungeliebt sind sie alle: Gro√üe Koalition, Minderheitsregierung unter F√ºhrung der Union oder Neuwahl.

√úber die Entwicklungen in der Regierungskrise informieren wir euch in unserem News-Blog:

14:02 Uhr: SPD-Ministerpr√§sident Weil spricht sich f√ºr GroKo aus

Niedersachsens Ministerpr√§sident Stephan Weil (SPD) sieht eine Neuauflage der Gro√üen Koalition als einzige stabile Regierung f√ºr Deutschland. "Ohne die SPD wird es keine stabile Bundesregierung geben", sagte er der "Bild"-Zeitung.

"Durch das Platzen von Jamaika hat sich die Situation stark ge√§ndert, fundamental ge√§ndert", betonte Weil. Daher sei es richtig, "dass wir unsere Position an dieser Stelle √ºberpr√ºfen".

Die SPD k√∂nne sich nicht einfach aus der Verantwortung verabschieden, sagte er weiter. Das sei aber nat√ºrlich f√ºr die SPD auch ein Problem, gesteht Weil. Durch das wiederholte Nein zur GroKo sei kein Schaden entstanden. "Jetzt reden wir, √ºber das, was ist. Wir sind vielleicht in der Zwischenzeit auch alle schlauer geworden. Das geschieht tats√§chlich auch bei Politikern."

11:12 Uhr: Ex-SPD-Minister Eichel schl√§gt neue GroKo-Variante vor

Der fr√ºhere SPD-Finanzminister Hans Eichel hat seiner Partei zu einer gro√üen Koalition mit verk√ºrzter Laufzeit geraten. "Man muss ja keine Koalition auf ganze vier Jahre vereinbaren. Zwei vielleicht. Und dann wird neu gew√§hlt", sagte der 75-j√§hrige, der auch Ministerpr√§sident von Hessen war, der "S√ºddeutschen Zeitung".

Er sei kein Freund gro√üer Koalitionen, halte eine solche Regierungsbildung aber aus europ√§ischer Sicht f√ºr n√∂tig. Nur SPD und Union gemeinsam h√§tten die politische Kraft, mit Frankreich einen Weg zur Stabilisierung der Euro-Zone zu finden.

Von einer Minderheitsregierung h√§lt er dem Bericht zufolge nichts. Auch dem Argument, die SPD k√∂nne sich nur in der Opposition erneuern, kann er nichts abgewinnen: Schlie√ülich habe man auch zwischen 2009 und 2013 in der Opposition gesessen - die gro√üe Erneuerung sei aber ausgeblieben. "Es geht beides, erneuern und regieren", sagte Eichel.

11:05 Uhr: Jeder zwei¬≠te Deut¬≠sche f√ºr R√ºck¬≠tritt See¬≠ho¬≠fers als CSU-Chef

50 Pro¬≠zent der Deutschen sind der Mei¬≠nung, dass Horst See¬≠ho¬≠fer sei¬≠nen Pos¬≠ten als CSU-Vor¬≠sit¬≠zen¬≠der auf¬≠ge¬≠ben soll¬≠te. Das ergab eine Em¬≠nid-Um¬≠fra¬≠ge im Auf¬≠trag der "Bild am Sonntag". Nur 31 Pro¬≠zent den¬≠ken, er soll¬≠te wei¬≠ter¬≠hin Vor¬≠sit¬≠zen¬≠der der CSU blei¬≠ben.

Bei den An¬≠h√§n¬≠gern der Union sind sogar 58 Pro¬≠zent f√ºr sei¬≠nen R√ºck¬≠tritt und nur 35 Pro¬≠zent f√ºr sei¬≠nen Ver¬≠bleib im Amt.

Bei SPD-Chef Mar¬≠tin Schulz sind die Deut¬≠schen ge¬≠spal¬≠ten: 41 Pro¬≠zent sind daf√ºr, dass er bleibt, 42 Pro¬≠zent da¬≠ge¬≠gen. Al¬≠ler¬≠dings: Fragt man SPD-An¬≠h√§n¬≠ger, wol¬≠len wei¬≠ter¬≠hin 95 Pro¬≠zent Schulz als SPD-Chef und nur 5 Pro¬≠zent sei¬≠nen R√ºck¬≠tritt.

Den gr√∂√ü¬≠ten R√ºck¬≠halt in der Be¬≠v√∂l¬≠ke¬≠rung ge¬≠nie√üt beim Ver¬≠gleich der drei Par¬≠tei¬≠chefs von CDU, CSU und SPD nach wie vor An¬≠ge¬≠la Mer¬≠kel. Jeder zwei¬≠te Deut¬≠sche (51 Pro¬≠zent) fin¬≠det, dass sie CDU-Che¬≠fin blei¬≠ben soll. 40 Pro¬≠zent for¬≠dern ihren R√ºck¬≠tritt. Al¬≠ler¬≠dings: Ende Sep¬≠tem¬≠ber waren noch 70 Pro¬≠zent daf√ºr, dass Mer¬≠kel an der Spit¬≠ze der CDU bleibt.

Im Sonn¬≠tags¬≠trend ver¬≠liert die SPD einen Punkt zur Vor¬≠wo¬≠che und kommt auf 21 Pro¬≠zent. Zu¬≠le¬≠gen kann die AfD auf 12 Pro¬≠zent (plus 1). Un¬≠ver¬≠√§n¬≠dert lie¬≠gen CDU/CSU bei 33 Pro¬≠zent, die FDP bei 9 Pro¬≠zent, Linke und Gr√ºne bei 10 Pro¬≠zent.

Sonntag, 3. Dezember 08:15 Uhr: Wie Schulz am Telefon zur GroKo gedr√§ngt wird

Frankreichs Staatspr√§sident und Europas Sozialdemokraten dr√§ngen die SPD, gemeinsam in einer gro√üen Koalition Verantwortung f√ºr die Zukunft Europas zu √ºbernehmen. Der franz√∂sische Staatspr√§sident Emmanuel Macron habe in den vergangenen Tagen in mehreren Telefonaten mit Martin Schulz gesprochen, wie der SPD-Chef der "Frankfurter Allgemeinen Sonntagszeitung" (F.A.S.) best√§tigte.

Dabei habe Macron daf√ºr geworben, die europ√§ischen Reformen in einer Regierung zu unterst√ºtzen. Die Neugr√ºndung Europas, die Macron vorgeschlagen hat, sieht auch Schulz als Chance.

Schulz erhalte in diesen Tagen immer wieder ermunternde Anrufe und Mails von europ√§ischen Politikern, berichtet die "FAS" weiter.

So habe ihm der griechische Ministerpr√§sident Alexis Tsipras eine SMS geschrieben und darum gebeten, in "dieser entscheidenden Phase f√ºr Europa" nicht abseits zu stehen. Er respektiere die urspr√ºngliche Entscheidung der SPD, aber eine Regierungsbeteiligung sei "eine Voraussetzung daf√ºr, gemeinsam f√ºr notwendige progressive Reformen und die Demokratisierung Europas zu streiten, f√ºr soziale Rechte und einen substantiellen Kampf gegen Jugendarbeitslosigkeit".

Nun bestehe die Chance, "in Europa eine progressive Agenda auf den Tisch zu legen". Tsipras habe an Schulz den Appell gerichtet: "Vergiss nicht, dass eine wahrhaft linke und fortschrittliche Position nicht darin besteht, die eigene Identit√§t m√∂glichst sauber zu halten, sondern f√ºr wirkliche Ver√§nderungen und Reformen zu k√§mpfen, im Interesse der Vielen. Ich bin sicher, Du wirst die richtige Entscheidung treffen."

16:53 Uhr: SPD-Fraktionschefin lehnt Minderheitsregierung ab

SPD-Fraktionschefin Andrea Nahles hat erhebliche Zweifel am Modell einer Minderheitsregierung. Sie k√∂nne sich zwar durchaus vorstellen, dass die W√§hler f√ºr eine √úbergangszeit eine solche L√∂sung akzeptieren w√ºrden.

"Aber ob es unser Land wirklich voran bringt, bezweifle ich", sagte Nahles wenige Tage vor dem SPD-Bundesparteitag dem Berliner "Tagesspiegel" (Sonntag).

Nahles sieht durchaus Chancen f√ºr die SPD in einer Gro√üen Koalition ihr Profil zu wahren, allerdings "nur mit einer klaren Haltung". Es gehe jetzt darum, selbstbewusst alle M√∂glichkeiten f√ºr eine stabile Regierung zu pr√ºfen.

11.36 Uhr: CDU-Politiker Linnemann zur GroKo: "Nicht auf Gedeih und Verderb einander ausliefern"

Carsten Linnemann, Leiter der Mittelstandsvereinigung in der CDU, hat vorsichtig eine Alternative f√ºr die Gro√üe Koalition beworben. In der "Welt" brachte Linnemann eine Minderheitsregierung als Option ins Spiel, sollten die Verhandlungen mit der SPD scheitern.

"Die sollte man dann seri√∂s pr√ºfen", sagte Linnemann der Zeitung. "Ein Vorteil w√§re, dass dann das Parlament gest√§rkt w√ºrde und mehr Bedeutung bek√§me."

Linnemann schr√§nkte aber auch ein, dass eine Minderheitsregierung negative Seiten h√§tte. "Deutschland w√ºrde in den Augen der Partnerl√§nder an Verl√§sslichkeit einb√º√üen", sagte der CDU-Politiker. Daher sei es jetzt richtig, die Chancen einer gro√üen Koalition sorgf√§ltig auszuloten. "Das hei√üt aber im Umkehrschluss nicht, dass wir uns jetzt auf Gedeih und Verderb einander ausliefern m√ºssen."

Samstag, 2. Dezember - 8:49 Uhr: SPD-Politiker Pronold verlangt von CDU, parteitaktische Man√∂ver einzustellen

Wenn die CDU ihr Foul-Spiel nicht einstelle, werde es keine stabile Regierung geben, warnt Florian Pronold, Mitglied des SPD-Pr√§sidiums. "Die gestrige Falschmeldung, es gebe schon gr√ºnes Licht f√ºr GroKo-Koalitionsverhandlungen, geht auf ein weiteres Foul aus dem CDU-Pr√§sidium zur√ºck. Hier ist gezielt die Unwahrheit verbreitet worden‚Äú, sagte Pronold der "Passauer Neuen Presse‚Äú.

Das kenne man schon aus den Jamaika-Verhandlungen. Er warnte: "So wird es die CDU niemals schaffen, stabile Verh√§ltnisse zu erreichen. Kreise: Seehofer will CSU-Vorsitz, aber nicht Spitzenkandidatur | Joerg Koch via Getty Images

Einmal schlafen m√ºssen sie in der krisengesch√ºttelten CSU noch

Dann d√ºrfte offiziell werden, was Seehofer intern bereits angek√ºndigt hat: eine Doppelspitze mit Seehofer als Parteichef - und einem neuen Spitzenkandidaten f√ºr die Landtagswahl

CSU-Chef Horst Seehofer will auf dem Parteitag im Dezember wieder als Parteivorsitzender antreten - aber 2018 nicht erneut als Spitzenkandidat in die bayerische Landtagswahl ziehen.

Au√üerdem soll er grunds√§tzlich bereit sein, sein Amt als bayerischer Ministerpr√§sident bereits vor der Landtagswahl im Herbst 2018 an einen Nachfolger abzutreten. Als m√∂glichen Zeitpunkt soll er das erste Quartal 2018 genannt haben.

Das k√ºndigte er am Sonntag bei einem Treffen der engeren Parteif√ºhrung in M√ºnchen an, wie die Deutsche Presse-Agentur aus Teilnehmerkreisen erfuhr. Zuvor hatte dies auch die "Augsburger Allgemeine" gemeldet.

Seehofer und die CSU-Spitze berieten am Sonntag √ºber das weitere Vorgehen. Sp√§testens am Montag will sich der 68-J√§hrige offiziell √§u√üern - in Sondersitzungen von Landtagsfraktion und Parteivorstand.

Seehofer unter Druck

Seehofer steht seit dem CSU-Bundestagswahlfiasko unter Druck, mindestens eines seiner beiden Spitzen√§mter abzugeben.

Unklar war am Sonntag zun√§chst weiter, ob Finanzminister Markus S√∂der der einzige Nachfolgekandidat f√ºr das Ministerpr√§sidentenamt ist oder ob es in der Fraktion eine Kampfabstimmung mit Innenminister Joachim Herrmann geben wird.



Informationen der "Augsburger Allgemeinen", wonach Seehofer seine Posten an S√∂der abgeben wolle und es keine Kampfkandidatur geben werde, wurden in Parteikreisen zun√§chst nicht best√§tigt. Es sei dazu noch keine Entscheidung gefallen, hie√ü es.

Sollten am Montag die Landtagsfraktion und der Parteivorstand der Entscheidung einer k√ºnftigen Doppelspitze zustimmen, k√∂nnte damit der seit der Bundestagswahl herrschende Machtkampf in der CSU befriedet werden.

Die Fraktion d√ºrfte Seehofers gr√∂√üten Rivalen S√∂der als ihren Favoriten f√ºr die Spitzenkandidatur vorschlagen, am Montag will sie noch vor der Vorstandssitzung dar√ºber abstimmen.

"Eine riesige Aufgabe"

In den vergangenen Tagen hatte sich bereits angedeutet, dass Seehofer nicht wieder Spitzenkandidat f√ºr die Landtagswahl wird und somit sp√§testens im Herbst 2018 als Regierungschef aufh√∂rt.

"Der ganz √ºberragende Wunsch in der Partei ist, dass wir im Konsens, gemeinsam die riesigen Aufgaben anpacken, um die es geht", sagte Seehofer am Sonntag vor den Beratungen der engeren Parteif√ºhrung in M√ºnchen.

"Jetzt versuchen wir so schnell wie m√∂glich, wieder zu der legend√§ren Gemeinsamkeit und Geschlossenheit zu kommen, die die CSU √ºber Jahrzehnte ausgezeichnet hat", m√∂glichst ab Montag, betonte er.

Seehofer zeigte sich zuversichtlich, dass eine Konsensl√∂sung zu erreichen sei. "Das wollen praktisch alle unsere Anh√§nger und Mitglieder." Die CSU habe schlie√ülich auch eine zweifache Verantwortung: die f√ºr Deutschland, etwa wenn es zu Koalitionsgespr√§chen mit der SPD kommen sollte, und die f√ºr Bayern.

"Das Spiel ist noch nicht aus"

Der Vorstand von Seehofers CSU-Heimatverband Oberbayern hatte sich am Samstag daf√ºr ausgesprochen, dass er auf dem Parteitag Mitte Dezember noch einmal als Parteichef antritt.

Bezirkschefin Ilse Aigner sagte dazu am Sonntag, angesichts der ungekl√§rten Situation in Berlin w√§re dies "ein stabilisierender Faktor". Der CSU-Ehrenvorsitzende Edmund Stoiber rief Seehofer wegen der Lage in Berlin zu, er k√∂nne nicht zur Halbzeit das Spielfeld verlassen. "Das Spiel ist noch nicht aus."

Seehofer sagte in der Oberbayern-Sitzung nach Teilnehmerangaben, er klammere sich an keines seiner √Ñmter. Am Sonntag hatte er zun√§chst weiter f√ºr R√§tselraten gesorgt. "Ich hoffe, dass wir jetzt heute und morgen das abschlie√üen, was ich eigentlich schon am Donnerstag vor acht Tagen abschlie√üen wollte", sagte er.

Da hatte er die Bekanntgabe seiner Zukunftspl√§ne noch einmal vertagt - unter anderem auf Bitten seiner Stellvertreter. Auf die Frage, ob er seine Meinung seither noch einmal ge√§ndert habe, sagte Seehofer: "Nein."

SUMMARY:
Mikayla Holmgren made history Sunday night at the Miss Minnesota USA pageant, where she became the first woman with Down syndrome to compete in a state Miss USA pageant.
The 22-year-old Bethel University student from Stillwater, Minnesota, also won two awards: the Spirit of Miss USA Award and the Director's Award.
"You exude the spirit of Miss USA by always being true to yourself and putting others first," Heitkamp said, according to Pioneer Press.

"I went from a special needs pageant to the biggest pageant in the world.
TEXT:
Mikayla Holmgren made history Sunday night at the Miss Minnesota USA pageant, where she became the first woman with Down syndrome to compete in a state Miss USA pageant.

The 22-year-old Bethel University student from Stillwater, Minnesota, also won two awards: the Spirit of Miss USA Award and the Director's Award.

Denise Wallace Heitkamp, the executive state director of Miss Minnesota USA, presented Holmgren with the Spirit Award and told the contestant that she makes people cheer and smile every time she speaks.

"You exude the spirit of Miss USA by always being true to yourself and putting others first," Heitkamp said, according to Pioneer Press. "You have selflessness, humility and the ability to overcome obstacles with a smile on your face and excitement in your heart."

Holmgren, who competed in the special needs pageant Minnesota Miss Amazing in 2015, told BuzzFeed that she was overwhelmed to be participating in the Miss Minnesota USA pageant.

"I was super shocked, I was in tears," she said. "I went from a special needs pageant to the biggest pageant in the world. It's kind of crazy."
TITLE: Mikayla Holmgren Blazes Trail As First State Miss USA Contestant With Down Syndrome

SUMMARY:
Responding to improving demand, manufacturers cranked up output for the fourth month in a row, and hired new workers at the fastest pace in five years.
That suggests a drag on the economy caused by the shock removal of higher-value currency bills from circulation in November 2016 and the roll-out of a goods and services tax (GST) this July has faded.
"Growth in output and new orders picked up to the fastest since October 2016, reportedly supported by reductions in GST rates and stronger underlying demand conditions."
But cost pressures remained strong in November, and may push inflation to breach the Reserve Bank of India's medium-term target of 4 percent.
"Underlying data indicated that the central bank is less likely to adopt an accommodative stance as input cost inflation intensified to the fastest since April," said Dodhia.
TEXT:
India's factory activity quickened in November at the fastest pace since just before the government's surprise cash clampdown late last year, driven by a surge in new orders, a business survey found.

Responding to improving demand, manufacturers cranked up output for the fourth month in a row, and hired new workers at the fastest pace in five years.

That suggests a drag on the economy caused by the shock removal of higher-value currency bills from circulation in November 2016 and the roll-out of a goods and services tax (GST) this July has faded.

November's Nikkei/IHS Markit Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index rose to 52.6 from 50.3 in October, above all forecasts in a Reuters poll which had predicted a more modest rise to 51.0. Anything above 50 indicates growth.

The reading was the strongest in 13 months.

A new orders sub-index bounced back into expansionary territory to 54.2 in November from 49.9 the month before. Export orders improved slightly after contracting in the previous two months.

The findings add to evidence that a recovery in Asia's third-largest economy is on track.

Data on Thursday showed growth rebounded to 6.3 percent annually in the quarter to September, from a three-year low of 5.7 percent in the previous period.

"India's manufacturing economy advanced on its path to recovery as disruptions from the recent tax reform (GST) continues to diminish," said Aashna Dodhia, economist at IHS Markit.

"Growth in output and new orders picked up to the fastest since October 2016, reportedly supported by reductions in GST rates and stronger underlying demand conditions."

In order to help reduce the burden and confusion of the new nationwide tax on businesses, the government moved most goods which had attracted the highest rate to a band lower.

But cost pressures remained strong in November, and may push inflation to breach the Reserve Bank of India's medium-term target of 4 percent.

"Underlying data indicated that the central bank is less likely to adopt an accommodative stance as input cost inflation intensified to the fastest since April," said Dodhia.

The Reserve Bank of India is likely to keep interest rates steady at its policy meeting next week, with stronger inflation expectations leaving it little room to ease, a recent Reuters poll of economists showed.
TITLE: Indian Factories Show Fastest Growth Since Demonetisation In 2016

TEXT:
El 65% de los productos de lujo lo compran mujeres. Y de forma abrumadora, son a quienes se dirigen la publicidad y las acciones de las grandes campa√±as de las multinacionales del sector. Salvo autom√≥viles, un peque√±o porcentaje de cosm√©tica masculina, y moda y complementos destinados directamente al hombre, las empresas siguen pensando que el poder decisorio sobre un producto de lujo lo tienen ellas.

En este sentido, Vicente Nicol√°s, el fundador de la joyer√≠a Nicol's de Madrid, asegura que "hasta para comprar la sortija de pedida los hombres vienen con su madre o con su hermana".

Como las mujeres son las que compran lujo, las multinacionales del sector han encontrado en las campa√±as de RSC ‚ÄîResponsabilidad Social Corporativa‚Äî, dirigidas a mejorar la vida de las mujeres y a luchar por sus derechos, el nicho fundamental para transmitir los valores de compa√±√≠a y de producto. "Hay una relaci√≥n directa entre la campa√±a de RSC que se elija y nuestros productos de venta. Transmitimos valores, los de la empresa y los de nuestros productos, reflejados en las campa√±as. Es la mejor manera de actuar no solo sobre la decisi√≥n de compra, sino sobre la conciencia", asegura la directora de marketing social de una multinacional estadounidense.

Un ejemplo claro es el del Grupo Kering. Como cada mes de noviembre, su fundaci√≥n cumple su compromiso anual de lanzar una nueva campa√±a contra la violencia de g√©nero, White Ribbon ‚Äîlazo blanco‚Äî. Y este a√±o ha regresado con m√°s fuerza que nunca, con la colaboraci√≥n de los dise√±adores Stella McCartney, Alessandro Michele y Christopher Kane y el creador de zapatos Joseph Altuzarra.

La Fundaci√≥n de Kering, nacida en 2009, se nutre de las donaciones de las marcas que forman esta multinacional del lujo. Por ello, unir el mensaje al producto es fundamental. "Sin negocios recurrentes que ganen dinero, no hay capacidad de generar fundaciones solidarias", aseguraba hace unos d√≠as el director general de la Fundaci√≥n La Caixa, Jaume Gir√≥. Esta es la mayor fundaci√≥n bancaria de Europa con un presupuesto anual de 500 millones de euros. Y todo es evidente, si no vendes, si no generas recurso, no puedes ser solidario.

En Espa√±a, varias empresas han decidido ligarse a fundaciones con el objetivo √∫ltimo de apoyar iniciativas solidarias. La multinacional Iberdrola ha lanzado una campa√±a junto a la Fundaci√≥n Querer para concienciar sobre las enfermedades neurol√≥gicas infantiles y juveniles. La firma de moda de lujo, The Extreme Collection, sacar√° a la venta estas Navidades el Oso Solidario de las NeuronasSo√±adoras con el mismo objetivo, concienciar a los padres y familiares para que luchen por un mejor diagn√≥stico de los menores con problemas neurol√≥gicos y apuesten por m√©todos educativos que les permitan integrarse en una sociedad m√°s justa.
TITLE: Las marcas de lujo se comprometen con las mujeres

SUMMARY:
America‚Äôs had a rough go of it lately when it comes to Batman, but now filmmakers in Japan are giving the character makeover.
Ben Affleck‚Äôs portrayal has yielded unenthusiastic critical reviews, but, to be fair, he hasn‚Äôt really been given a decent film in which to be Batman.
In 2018, a feature length anime film, ‚ÄúBatman Ninja‚Äù will hit theaters in Japan, and from the looks of the trailer above, it‚Äôs going to be a take on Batman like we‚Äôve never seen before.
Directed by Junpei Mizusaki and with character design by Takashi Okazaki, ‚ÄúBatman Ninja‚Äù sees the caped crusader and his enemies sent back in time to Medieval Japan.
Mizusaki says ‚ÄúBatman Ninja‚Äù is ‚Äúhow Japan sees Batman and not one about how Batman (and Bruce Wayne) see Japan,‚Äù according to io9.
TEXT:
America‚Äôs had a rough go of it lately when it comes to Batman, but now filmmakers in Japan are giving the character makeover.

Ben Affleck‚Äôs portrayal has yielded unenthusiastic critical reviews, but, to be fair, he hasn‚Äôt really been given a decent film in which to be Batman.

In 2018, a feature length anime film, ‚ÄúBatman Ninja‚Äù will hit theaters in Japan, and from the looks of the trailer above, it‚Äôs going to be a take on Batman like we‚Äôve never seen before.

Directed by Junpei Mizusaki and with character design by Takashi Okazaki, ‚ÄúBatman Ninja‚Äù sees the caped crusader and his enemies sent back in time to Medieval Japan. It‚Äôs a genre-splicing iteration of Batman that, at the very least, will be refreshing to watch.

Mizusaki says ‚ÄúBatman Ninja‚Äù is ‚Äúhow Japan sees Batman and not one about how Batman (and Bruce Wayne) see Japan,‚Äù according to io9.

Here in America, we‚Äôll take it.
TITLE: Japan Just Made An Anime Batman Ninja And It‚Äôs Awesome

Teniendo en cuenta todos los cargos adicionales que Flynn podr√≠a haber enfrentado en relaci√≥n con sus negocios en el extranjero, el hecho de que se enfrente a una sola acusaci√≥n es una indicaci√≥n de que Flynn est√° ofreciendo cooperaci√≥n e informaci√≥n significativas que podr√≠an impulsar la investigaci√≥n de Mueller.

TEXT:
WASHINGTON - El exasesor de seguridad nacional del presidente Donald Trump se declar√≥ culpable el viernes por la ma√±ana de mentirle al FBI sobre sus contactos con el gobierno ruso, un acontecimiento extraordinario en la investigaci√≥n del abogado especial Robert Mueller sobre la interferencia rusa en las elecciones de 2016.

Michael Flynn fue acusado de hacer una declaraci√≥n falsa a agentes del FBI y compareci√≥ ante un tribunal federal en D.C.

JUST IN: Michael Flynn arrives at court for plea hearing pic.twitter.com/Igi6GuroG4

AL MOMENTO: Michael Flynn llega a la corte para la comparecencia.

En una presentaci√≥n de informaci√≥n criminal del equipo de Mueller, el gobierno alega que Flynn "voluntaria y deliberadamente hizo declaraciones materialmente falsas, ficticias y fraudulentas" en una entrevista con agentes del FBI el 24 de enero. Alega que le dijo falsamente al FBI que no le pidi√≥ al embajador ruso que se abstuviera de tomar represalias por las sanciones que el gobierno de Obama impuso a Rusia a fines de diciembre. Flynn tambi√©n supuestamente minti√≥ sobre pedirle al embajador ruso el 22 de diciembre que retrasara o anulara una resoluci√≥n pendiente del Consejo de Seguridad de las Naciones Unidas.

Teniendo en cuenta todos los cargos adicionales que Flynn podr√≠a haber enfrentado en relaci√≥n con sus negocios en el extranjero, el hecho de que se enfrente a una sola acusaci√≥n es una indicaci√≥n de que Flynn est√° ofreciendo cooperaci√≥n e informaci√≥n significativas que podr√≠an impulsar la investigaci√≥n de Mueller.

ABC informa que Flynn est√° listo para testificar que Trump lo incit√≥ a contactarse con los rusos.

En respuesta al cargo del viernes por la ma√±ana, el abogado de Trump, John Dowd, le dijo al periodista del Wall Street Journal, Rebecca Ballhaus: "No tengo ninguna reacci√≥n. No s√© lo suficiente. No estoy preocupado por eso".

The New York Times inform√≥ a fines de noviembre que el abogado de Flynn, Robert Kelner, ya no compart√≠a informaci√≥n con el equipo legal de Trump, lo que aumentaba a√∫n m√°s la posibilidad de que Flynn cooperara con la investigaci√≥n de Mueller. Kelner m√°s tarde se reuni√≥ con los investigadores, seg√∫n ABC News.

La acusaci√≥n de Flynn se da despu√©s de que el equipo de Mueller acus√≥ al expresidente de la campa√±a de Trump Paul Manafort y su exayudante Rick Gates con 12 cargos, incluidas acusaciones de conspiraci√≥n contra Estados Unidos y lavado de dinero. Manafort y Gates se declararon inocentes de los cargos y est√°n programados para enfrentar un juicio federal en mayo.

En octubre, los investigadores tambi√©n llegaron a un acuerdo de culpabilidad con el exasesor de campa√±a de Trump, George Papadopoulos, quien le minti√≥ al FBI acerca de que le ofrecieron "informaci√≥n negativa" sobre Hillary Clinton durante las elecciones de 2016. Seg√∫n informes, Papadopoulos tambi√©n sugiri√≥ una reuni√≥n entre el entonces candidato Trump y el presidente ruso Vladimir Putin el a√±o pasado.

Pero esas acusaciones involucraban solo a los oficiales de campa√±a de Trump. Flynn es el primer exfuncionario de la administraci√≥n acusado, lo que hace m√°s dif√≠cil para la Casa Blanca alejar al presidente de la investigaci√≥n de Mueller.

Despu√©s de que Trump despidi√≥ al entonces director del FBI, James Comey, en medio de su investigaci√≥n sobre la campa√±a, Comey testific√≥ que Trump hab√≠a pedido que terminara la investigaci√≥n del FBI sobre Flynn.

Flynn, quien renunci√≥ como asesor de seguridad nacional de Trump en febrero despu√©s de mentir a los funcionarios de la administraci√≥n sobre el alcance de sus comunicaciones con funcionarios rusos, se hab√≠a enfrentado durante mucho tiempo al escrutinio de las m√∫ltiples investigaciones sobre la campa√±a de Trump.

De particular inter√©s fue la historia de Flynn de negocios sospechosos y v√≠nculos financieros con Rusia, as√≠ como su ocultaci√≥n de que trabaj√≥ como cabildero extranjero para el gobierno turco mientras asesoraba a la campa√±a de Trump.

En el oto√±o de 2016, un empresario con lazos cercanos con el presidente autocr√°tico de Turqu√≠a, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, le pag√≥ a Flynn m√°s de $ 500,000 para realizar investigaciones destinadas a desacreditar al cl√©rigo exiliado Fethullah G√ºlen. Flynn no pudo revelar el trabajo hasta marzo, despu√©s de que ya hab√≠a renunciado como asesor de seguridad nacional.

Seg√∫n los informes, el equipo de Mueller investig√≥ la empresa de cabildeo de Flynn y sus relaciones con Turqu√≠a.

Flynn tambi√©n ocult√≥ contactos m√∫ltiples con Rusia durante la transici√≥n de Trump, incluso discutiendo sanciones con el embajador de entonces ruso Sergey Kislyak.

Tambi√©n asisti√≥ a una reuni√≥n con Kislyak para discutir la creaci√≥n de un canal secundario con Putin. Tambi√©n asistieron el asesor y yerno de Trump, Jared Kushner, quien ahora es asesor principal de la Casa Blanca y, seg√∫n los informes, un sujeto de la investigaci√≥n de Mueller.

Los funcionarios de la Casa Blanca han negado repetidamente cualquier colusi√≥n entre el equipo de Trump y Rusia, a menudo minimizando la participaci√≥n de presuntos funcionarios en la campa√±a o la administraci√≥n. En marzo, el entonces secretario de prensa Sean Spicer disminuy√≥ a Flynn solo como "un voluntario".

Alana Horowitz Satlin contribuy√≥ a este reportaje.

Este art√≠culo se public√≥ originalmente en The HuffPost.
TITLE: Exasesor de Trump, Michael Flynn, se declara culpable en la investigaci√≥n de Rusia

SUMMARY:
When Roo the rooster became involved in an altercation with another rooster, he came off a little worse for the wear.
Roo's owner, Darcy Smith took in another rooster recently and because of the animal's size Smith kept him in a separate cage.
With such serious injures, Smith decided that Roo needed some serious medical care so he ordered a custom-made chicken wheelchair from Melbourne to aid his rehabilitation.
Roo, a rescue rooster, has a new lease on life thanks to a special wheelchair that helps him walk.
It helps him walk, not only around his home but also slowly along his path of recovery and into the future.
TEXT:
When Roo the rooster became involved in an altercation with another rooster, he came off a little worse for the wear.

Roo's owner, Darcy Smith took in another rooster recently and because of the animal's size Smith kept him in a separate cage. Roo became a little unsettled about having company and so, determined to be the only rooster who could rule the roost, decided to deal with the newcomer himself.

Roo attempted to attack the new rooster through the cage and in doing this, broke his beak in two places and sustained head injuries which resulted in swelling on his brain.

With such serious injures, Smith decided that Roo needed some serious medical care so he ordered a custom-made chicken wheelchair from Melbourne to aid his rehabilitation.

Roo, a rescue rooster, has a new lease on life thanks to a special wheelchair that helps him walk. Go Roo! We're rooting for you! https://t.co/OWvyRM6UaD pic.twitter.com/rLJpNlzCPo ‚Äî ABC News (@ABC) November 25, 2017

"The change in behaviour was immediate -- his eyes brightened up and he was able to be himself again," Ms Smith told the ABC of the moment Roo was put into the wheelchair.

Miranda Boutlon is the lady who makes the chicken wheelchairs and she told the ABC that she has handmade about 100 of them so far.

"You might see wheelchairs for dogs and cats, so there's a lot for our four-legged friends but nothing out there for chickens -- I guess there was a gap in the market," Boulton told the ABC.

The chair, complete with food holders at the front, means that Roo can stand up and interact with other roosters has he recovers from his injures. It helps him walk, not only around his home but also slowly along his path of recovery and into the future.

Get well, Roo!
TITLE: Aussie-Made Wheelchair Helps Injured Chickens Walk Again

SUMMARY:
Dramatically reducing the corporate tax rate.
The centerpiece of the Republican tax bill is its slashing of the top corporate tax rate from 35 percent to 20 percent.
This means that in practice, the average effective corporate tax rate on profit from new investments in the U.S. is 24 percent ‚Äï just a shade higher than the G-7 average of 21 percent.
There are, of course, proponents of a lower corporate tax rate in both major political parties.
While the top statutory estate tax rate is 40 percent, the average effective rate paid by families subject to the tax is about 17 percent, according to the Tax Policy Center.
TEXT:
The nearly 500-page overhaul of the tax code that Republicans rammed through the Senate early Saturday morning gave lawmakers and experts little more than a moment‚Äôs notice to pore over the law‚Äôs myriad changes.

But one thing is clear: The bill is filled with perks for America‚Äôs wealthiest individuals and largest corporations, many of them paid for by closing loopholes that benefit middle-class people. By 2027, the top one-fifth of earners would receive 90 percent of the tax bill‚Äôs benefits, according to an analysis by the nonpartisan Tax Policy Center.

Here are some of the legislation‚Äôs most outrageous components ‚Äï from giveaways for the super-rich to carve-outs for private schools.

Dramatically reducing the corporate tax rate.

The centerpiece of the Republican tax bill is its slashing of the top corporate tax rate from 35 percent to 20 percent. Republicans claim this is necessary to restore American competitiveness, noting that, on paper at least, the United States has one of the highest corporate rates in the developed world.

However, many large corporations are able to take advantage of deductions and loopholes that allow them to register profits overseas. This means that in practice, the average effective corporate tax rate on profit from new investments in the U.S. is 24 percent ‚Äï just a shade higher than the G-7 average of 21 percent.

There are, of course, proponents of a lower corporate tax rate in both major political parties. Former President Barack Obama, for example, proposed lowering the top corporate rate to 28 percent as part of a revenue-neutral, comprehensive tax reform package.

But without major changes in the way corporations do business, a big corporate tax cut is not actually likely to result in more job creation and higher wages. Instead, it is just a windfall for the corporate executive suite that is bound to exacerbate income inequality.

That‚Äôs because corporate incentives are such that executives and their boards are rewarded for how much they maximize quarterly returns for big investors, not how much they invest in the long-term growth of their companies ‚Äï let alone how they treat their workers. As a result, Fortune 500 CEOs and their fellow decision-makers are just as likely to spend the extra cash they get from this massive tax cut on dividends and stock buybacks, rather than expanding their workforces. They have even said as much.

Creating a big new tax deduction for private school tuition.

Sen. Ted Cruz (R-Texas) succeeded in adding an amendment to the final bill that would expand tax-exempt 529 college savings plans to parents saving for K-12 private school tuition, as well as expenses associated with home schooling.

Technically the expanded savings accounts would allow parents to amass tax-free savings for public school education as well, but it is not at all clear what major costs are incurred from a public school education. And there are no exceptions to the types of schooling eligible for the tax break, meaning that the tax code is now almost certain to subsidize private religious education.

‚ÄúBy expanding choice for parents and opportunities for children, we have prioritized the education of the next generation of Americans, allowing families to save and prepare for their children‚Äôs future educational expenses,‚Äù Cruz said in a statement about the amendment‚Äôs passage.

Although the tax benefit is sure to save some families money, the ballooning cost of private elementary and secondary school makes it unlikely that it will increase access to private school for middle- and low-income kids.

Average annual tuition at non-sectarian private elementary schools rose from $4,120 in 1979 to $22,611 in 2011, according to a study by the National Bureau of Economic Research released in July. It‚Äôs no surprise then that in 2013, 26 percent of families in urban area with incomes in the 90th income percentile sent their kids to private school, compared to just 7 percent of families in the 50th percentile, according to NBER. In 1968, by contrast, the study said, there was a gap of just 5 percentage points in the two income groups‚Äô respective rates of private school enrollment.

Kevin Lamarque / Reuters Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-Ky.), left, and House Speaker Paul Ryan (R-Wis.), right, sit alongside President Donald Trump. Cutting taxes is a major triumph for the trio.

Encouraging corporations to automate ‚Äï without any help for displaced workers.

A provision of the tax bill would allow companies to deduct from their taxable income the entire cost of certain kinds of business investments that were previously only eligible for a 50 percent deduction. Traditionally, manufacturing firms and other infrastructure-heavy companies took advantage of the deduction to buy new factory equipment.

But the increase in the deduction comes at a time when corporations are investing in automation of their production facilities through the use of robots and artificial intelligence technology, noted Robert Kovacev, a corporate tax attorney for the Steptoe & Johnson law firm in Washington, D.C.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to accelerate spending, basically, on robots that could displace workers,‚Äù Kovacev told HuffPost.

Kovacev is supportive of the deduction, because automation is likely to increase productivity ‚Äï defined as the amount of economic output generated per work-hour. And many experts maintain that, over the long run, this type of technological disruption is a net job creator.

That is likely to serve as cold comfort, however, for the mostly blue-collar workers displaced by automation in the short term. And Congress chose to speed up the automation process without any companion measures to offset the fallout for affected workers.

‚ÄúIt would be a good idea to pair this with a tax incentive to encourage companies either to employ more human workers or retrain them for jobs in the new economy,‚Äù Kovacev said.

Some progressive lawmakers have other ideas about how to address the harm caused by automation. For example, San Francisco County Supervisor Jane Kim has explored the idea of implementing a ‚Äùrobot tax‚Äù on companies for every robot they employ to perform a job previously done by humans. The revenue raised by the tax would fund the retraining of displaced workers.

Setting the stage for cuts to Social Security, Medicare and Medicaid.

The Republican tax bill will add $1 trillion to the national debt over a 10-year period, according to the most recent estimate from the Joint Committee on Taxation, a nonpartisan congressional tax analysis body. The lack of measures to pay for the tax cuts is why Sen. Bob Corker (R-Tenn.) decided to vote against the final Senate bill, becoming the only Republican to do so.

Many progressive economists believe the national debt is not a major challenge at this juncture. Interest rates on Treasury bonds remain low by historical standards.

Still, once Republicans pass their budget-busting tax cuts, they frequently stoke debt fears to justify taking an ax to federal spending. They did it when Obama took office despite their overwhelming support for former President George W. Bush‚Äôs tax cuts, and they have already indicated they plan to do it again.

This time, though, they are coming for the three largest social insurance programs ‚Äï Social Security, Medicare and Medicaid.

Sen. Marco Rubio (R-Fla.) was one of several Republican lawmakers to explicitly say that following the changes to the tax code, the next priority would be scaling back so-called ‚Äúentitlement‚Äù spending.

‚ÄúYou also have to bring spending under control. And not discretionary spending. That isn‚Äôt the driver of our debt,‚Äù Rubio said last week. ‚ÄúThe driver of our debt is the structure of Social Security and Medicare for future beneficiaries.‚Äù

Rejecting a proposal to expand a tax credit for families with children in order to reduce the corporate tax rate even more.

Rubio and Sen. Mike Lee (R-Utah) wanted to add an amendment to the tax bill that would have modestly expanded the Child Tax Credit, which is effectively a cash benefit for low-income working families with children. The latest version of the change would have provided some 10 million families with about $75 more per year, according to the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities, a liberal think tank.

To pay for the roughly $87 billion price of expanding the tax credit, Rubio and Lee proposed reducing the top corporate tax rate to just under 21 percent, rather than the 20 percent threshold that President Donald Trump and GOP leaders were seeking.

The amendment collapsed in a 71-29 vote with just 20 Republicans and nine Democrats voting for it.

Most Republicans objected to the amendment on the grounds that the corporate rate needed to drop to 20 percent. Democrats declined to rally behind it, because they argued that the tax credit was far too small to provide meaningful help to vulnerable people and that GOP leaders would ultimately strip it out in conference committee regardless.

All but eliminating the estate tax for the country‚Äôs wealthiest households.

Under the Senate bill, an even tinier sliver of households in the country would be subject to the estate tax levied on the assets that ultra-rich individuals leave to their heirs when they die.

Currently, $11 million in assets are exempt from the estate tax, ensuring that it falls on just 0.2 percent of American households with taxable assets. While the top statutory estate tax rate is 40 percent, the average effective rate paid by families subject to the tax is about 17 percent, according to the Tax Policy Center. The tax nonetheless serves as a major source of revenue for the federal government and achieves the additional goal of modestly limiting intergenerational wealth transfers, which some experts believe undermine meritocracy and social mobility.

The Senate bill would double the estate tax exemption to $22 million for couples, eliminating the tax entirely for half the estates that currently pay it, according to the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities. Those households still subject to the tax would get a $4.4 million tax cut, which CBPP points out would be enough to provide Pell grants to fund college tuition for 1,100 low- and moderate-income students.
TITLE: Here Are 6 Of The Most Radical Aspects Of The GOP Tax Bill

SUMMARY:
OTTAWA ‚Äî Health Canada is advising consumers that it's received reports that some packages of the Alesse birth control pill that contain broken tablets or pills that are smaller than normal, potentially making the medication less effective.
The government says it's received complaints that in packages of both Alesse 21 and Alesse 28, there has been at least one pill that is roughly half the size of the others.
A package of Alesse brand birth control pills.
Health Canada says the complaints involved a package of Alesse 21, which contains 21 active birth control pills, that expires in August 2018, and a package of Alesse 28, which contains 21 active birth control pills and seven tablets that don't contain hormones, that expires in April 2019.
Health Canada is asking pharmacists to look at each blister pack of Alesse 21 and Alesse 28 before dispensing it to make sure the pills look normal.
TEXT:
OTTAWA ‚Äî Health Canada is advising consumers that it's received reports that some packages of the Alesse birth control pill that contain broken tablets or pills that are smaller than normal, potentially making the medication less effective.

The government says it's received complaints that in packages of both Alesse 21 and Alesse 28, there has been at least one pill that is roughly half the size of the others.

It says the reduced size may also reduce the medication's effectiveness at preventing pregnancy.

A package of Alesse brand birth control pills.

Health Canada says the complaints involved a package of Alesse 21, which contains 21 active birth control pills, that expires in August 2018, and a package of Alesse 28, which contains 21 active birth control pills and seven tablets that don't contain hormones, that expires in April 2019.

But the government says it's unsure whether the issue is isolated to those lots of pills, and it's working with Pfizer Canada to determine the scope of the issue.

Health Canada is advising consumers to check their pills before taking them, and not to take them if they look unusual, including a paler colour, jagged edges or a broken or smaller-than-normal tablet.

Pfizer sign at manufacturing facility.

It advises consumers who find an odd pill not to take it, but to go to their pharmacy and get a replacement pack so they don't miss a day of the pill, which can increase the chance of pregnancy.

Health Canada is asking pharmacists to look at each blister pack of Alesse 21 and Alesse 28 before dispensing it to make sure the pills look normal.

Pfizer said in a statement that it is continuing monitor the situation and assess the need for further action.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Alesse Birth Control Pills May Be Broken Or Too Small, Health Canada Warns

"Die Debatte ist im Stande viel vern√ºnftiges und liebgewordenes an Traditionen und Gewohnheiten in unserem Land zu beseitigen", sagt sie.
Nun will uns eine Minderheit von Frauen also auch noch diese deutschen Traditionen nehmen - das zumindest scheint uns Frauke Petry weismachen zu wollen.

TEXT:
In einem WDR-Interview wurde Frauke Petry zur #metoo-Debatte befragt

Die ehemalige AfD-Chefin bezeichnet die Aufregung √ºber sexuelle Bel√§stigung als "v√∂llig √ºbertrieben"

Die Debatte w√ºrde uns "vern√ºnftiges und liebgewordenes an Traditionen" nehmen, behauptet sie

Die #metoo-Debatte um sexuelle Bel√§stigung bricht nicht ab. Tausende Frauen auf der ganzen Welt, auch viele Prominente, haben mittlerweile berichtet, wie M√§nner sie bedr√§ngt, begrapscht oder vergewaltigt haben.

Jetzt schaltet sich die ehemalige AfD-Politikerin Frauke Petry in die Debatte ein. Ihre Meinung: Die Beschwerden √ºber sexuelle Bel√§stigung seien vollkommen √ºbertrieben, sagt sie. In einem Interview f√ºr das WDR-Format "Docupy" erkl√§rt Petry au√üerdem, dass die Debatte "√ºber den angeblichen Sexismus von einer Minderheit instrumentalisiert" werde.

Ok...

Allein auf Twitter wurde der Hashtag #metoo bis Ende Oktober 2017 √ºbrigens von 726.000 verschiedenen Nutzern gebraucht. Von einer Minderheit kann also nicht die Rede sein.

Aber Petrys Aussagen werden noch abstruser.



"Die Debatte ist im Stande viel vern√ºnftiges und liebgewordenes an Traditionen und Gewohnheiten in unserem Land zu beseitigen", sagt sie.

Ja, wer kennt sie nicht, die liebgewordenen, vern√ºnftigen Traditionen wie das ungefragte Anfassen von Br√ºsten oder den kleinen Klaps auf den Hintern von fremden M√§nnern.

Petry verschlie√üt die Augen vor den Fakten

Auch Vergewaltigungen gibt es in Deutschland immerhin schon seit Jahrzehnten, sie sind sozusagen ein Teil unserer Kultur. Nun will uns eine Minderheit von Frauen also auch noch diese deutschen Traditionen nehmen - das zumindest scheint uns Frauke Petry weismachen zu wollen.

Dass sie im Zusammenhang mit sexueller Bel√§stigung von "liebgewordenen Traditionen" spricht, zeigt nur, dass sie nicht verstanden hat, wie gro√ü dieses Problem in unserer Gesellschaft mittlerweile ist und wie viele Frauen darunter leiden.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: "Er dr√§ngte sich zwischen meine Beine": Stewardessen berichten √ºber sexuelle √úbergriffe in ihrem Job

Die Weltgesundheitsorganisation WHO bezeichnet Gewalt gegen Frauen als eines der gr√∂√üten Gesundheitsrisiken von Frauen weltweit. 40 Prozent der Frauen in Deutschland haben seit ihrem 16. Lebensjahr k√∂rperliche oder sexuelle Gewalt erlebt. Je nach Gewaltform haben 56 Prozent bis 80 Prozent der Betroffenen psychische Folgebeschwerden davongetragen.

Entweder kennt Petry diese Zahlen nicht - oder sie interessieren sie einfach nicht.

Petry: "Frauen sollten das schwache Geschlecht bleiben"

Sie selbst habe nichts dagegen, dass Frauen weiterhin "das schwache Geschlecht" seien, f√ºgt sie hinzu. "Weil wir objektiv anders sind als M√§nner", sagt sie.

Stimmt, zweifellos sind wir Frauen anders als M√§nner. Unsere biologischen Unterschiede machen uns aber nicht automatisch "schwach".

Die Kommentare unter dem Video sind eindeutig.

"Was stimmt denn mit ihr nicht?!?", fragt sich eine Nutzerin irritiert.

"Mir fehlen die Worte.. was hat sie denn lieb gewonnen, das durch das aufmerksam machen auf Sexismus und sexistische √úbergriffe verloren geht?!", fragt sich eine andere.

Eine weitere Nutzerin bringt das wirre Petry-Interview mit den folgenden S√§tzen vielleicht am besten auf den Punkt: "Ich glaube nicht, dass sie eine Frau ist. Sie ist ein emotionsfreier Politroboter, von ewiggestrigen, machtgeilen M√§nnern programmiert."

(ben)
TITLE: Frauke Petry bezeichnet sexuelle Bel√§stigung in Deutschland als "liebgewordene Tradition"

SUMMARY:
Andre Pratte looks up while waiting in the entrance of the Senate chamber before being sworn-in as a senator on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on April 12, 2016.
In a copy of the internal email obtained by HuffPost Canada, Pratte wrote: "I would suggest that the honourable senator himself ask the Senate ethics officer to investigate the matter, in order to clear his name of any wrongdoing."
"I hold a great degree of faith in Senator Oh's high ethical standards.
He invited Conservative senators Leo Housakos and Don Plett to join him on a trip in April, and failed to report it to the Senate ethics officer, according to The Globe.
Interim Senate Ethics Officer Pierre Legault could not confirm if Oh had approached the office for advice on whether or not he should disclose the trip.
TEXT:
Andre Pratte looks up while waiting in the entrance of the Senate chamber before being sworn-in as a senator on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on April 12, 2016.

OTTAWA ‚Äî Independent Sen. Andr√© Pratte sent a message to all his colleagues Friday suggesting there needs to be an investigation into Conservative Sen. Victor Oh's undisclosed private trips to China earlier this year, paid for by the Chinese government.

In a copy of the internal email obtained by HuffPost Canada, Pratte wrote: "I would suggest that the honourable senator himself ask the Senate ethics officer to investigate the matter, in order to clear his name of any wrongdoing."

Sen. Victor Oh speaks at an event commemorating the repeal of the Chinese Exclusion Act in May 2017.

He argued that swift action and a positive conclusion would "avoid the institution's reputation from being further tarnished" and show that potential ethics code breaches are treated seriously.

"I hold a great degree of faith in Senator Oh's high ethical standards. However, I also believe that for the institution's good standing in the hearts and minds of the population, this issue needs to be clarified as soon as possible," wrote Pratte.

Earlier, The Globe and Mail reported since Oh's appointment to the Senate in 2013, he's accepted sponsored trips to China paid by Chinese airlines, three provincial governments, and business groups.

He invited Conservative senators Leo Housakos and Don Plett to join him on a trip in April, and failed to report it to the Senate ethics officer, according to The Globe.

The story also detailed how Liberal MP Geng Tan originally denied travelling to his hometown in China before an official tour in July, but admitted to taking the trip when the newspaper said there were photos published of him by local Chinese media.

Tan was part of a parliamentary delegation that included Liberal MPs Rob Oliphant, Pam Damoff and Tory MP Michael Cooper, according to a certificate issued Aug. 24 by the Chinese People's Institute of Foreign Affairs.

Copy of a certificate from the Chinese People's Institute Of Foreign Affairs breaking down the cost for a sponsored eight-day trip for a parliamentary delegation in July 2017.

The document shows the domestic cost for the eight-day trip was $5,136.85 for each MP. Their flights ranged from $4,726.50 to $6,466.16 each.

Both Tan and Oh met with Chinese government officials during their trips, despite telling the Globe they were private trips to visit family.

Oh declined HuffPost Canada's request for comment.

Interim Senate Ethics Officer Pierre Legault could not confirm if Oh had approached the office for advice on whether or not he should disclose the trip. Legault's office cited confidentiality as reason to not answer the question.

"We do not comment on whether or not we have received a statement prior to a statement being posted on our website as we cannot otherwise publicly comment on the particular circumstances of individual senators since the office of the ethics officer is bound by confidentiality under the Ethics and Conflict of Interest Code for Senators."

The revelation comes right before Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's four-day visit to China. Officials say kicking off free trade talks between the two countries is not on the prime minister's trip agenda.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Senator Suggests New Investigation To Avoid Senate From Being 'Further Tarnished'
