SUMMARY:
Hay m√°s listas mentales que barajar, m√°s compromisos en el calendario que administrar, m√°s tareas que delegar.
Hay m√°s presi√≥n para que generar la magia para los que te rodean.
Aunque el perfeccionismo no es lo m√≠o, durante las fiestas navide√±as es muy f√°cil enfocarme en los aspectos en los que es m√°s probable que yo pueda hacer m√°s.
"Las redes sociales te hacen sentir que la vida de todos dem√°s es perfecta y encantadora... menos la tuya", dijo Wilding.
Ser√≠a mejor reevaluar lo que ya haces, eliminar algunos compromisos y elegir solamente aquellos en los que la labor emocional es verdaderamente valiosa para ti.
TEXT:
Planear la cena de Navidad y fin de a√±o. Convocar para que toda la familia est√© unida en esta √©poca del a√±o. ¬øQui√©n har√° la limpieza despu√©s del recalentado? Pero antes est√°n las posadas, ponerse de acuerdo con los vecinos de la calle para organizarlas y asignar tareas.

En las mujeres recae la mayor parte de la labor emocional; es decir, el fen√≥meno psicol√≥gico de realizar un trabajo no pagado y que casi no se toma en cuenta que implica mantener a todos los que te rodean c√≥modos y contentos. Y durante las fiestas de fin de a√±o, ese trabajo se multiplica. Hay m√°s listas mentales que barajar, m√°s compromisos en el calendario que administrar, m√°s tareas que delegar. Hay m√°s presi√≥n para que generar la magia para los que te rodean. Se necesita mucho esfuerzo invisible y no valorado para conseguir que todo salga bien y bonito.

Melody Wilding, una terapeuta y couch certificada que ayuda a sus clientes a superar retos como la labor emocional, dice que la tendencia de querer abarcar mucho y olvidar cuidarse a s√≠ misma aumenta siempre en funci√≥n de las fiestas de fin de a√±o.

"Sentirte m√°s presionada por tener que crear 'las fiestas perfectas' puede detonar tu estr√©s hasta el cielo, y los compromisos excesivos pueden dejarte exhausta y con agotamiento", dijo Wilding a HuffPost.

C√≥mo manejar el estr√©s que la labor emocional te deja esta √©poca del a√±o

Yo siempre trato de incluir cuidados a m√≠ misma durante las fiestas, lo cual generalmente implica una rutina de yoga y beber mucho t√© verde descafeinado para combatir el estr√©s. Sin embargo, la carga de todo lo que me rodea me sigue pesando. Si bien mi esposo es quien se encarga de poner las luces y adornar el √°rbol, la mayor parte de la planeaci√≥n navide√±a recae en m√≠.

Soy yo la que tiene que calendarizar las fiestas y las cenas, afinar las donaciones de abrigos para quien los necesita, planear las reuniones con los dos lados de la familia, agotar la energ√≠a mental para ver qu√© le vamos a regalar a cada quien... Es agotador y parece un trabajo infinito (al menos hasta que pasa el A√±o Nuevo). Normalmente, este nivel de productividad podr√≠a hacerme sentir como una rockstar... pero en realidad, en esta √©poca del a√±o siempre siento que no hago todo lo que deber√≠a de hacer.

Los expertos dicen que este tipo de presi√≥n intensa tiene trazas de perfeccionismo, en su forma m√°s radical, o sea, el perfeccionismo que se asocia con problemas de salud mental. Hay investigaciones que relacionan el perfeccionismo con la ansiedad, la depresi√≥n e inclusive pensamientos de lastimarse a uno mismo.

Aunque el perfeccionismo no es lo m√≠o, durante las fiestas navide√±as es muy f√°cil enfocarme en los aspectos en los que es m√°s probable que yo pueda hacer m√°s. Podr√≠amos, por ejemplo, ir a cortar nuestro propio √°rbol de Navidad, pero en realidad nunca se me ha ocurrido planear un viaje para eso. Podr√≠a aprender a utilizar mi m√°quina de coser para hacer un camino de mesa y unas servilletas alegres y festivas. Podr√≠a construir una hermosa casa de jengibre desde cero si realmente me esforzara. Siempre me pongo a pensar que probablemente ya estoy haciendo suficiente, pero siento que podr√≠a hacer m√°s.

Wilding dice que una forma para solucionar ese sentimiento irracional podr√≠a arrancar con salirte de Instagram. Ese consejo tiene sentido: hay estudios que demuestran que el uso excesivo de las redes sociales est√° relacionado con una mayor sensaci√≥n de soledad, ansiedad y s√≠ntomas de depresi√≥n.

"Las redes sociales te hacen sentir que la vida de todos dem√°s es perfecta y encantadora... menos la tuya", dijo Wilding.

Ella recomienda aprovechar el tiempo que te pasas en Facebook y dedicarlo a actividades que te relajen m√°s (pero no te pongas a hornear para hacer casas de jengibre, a menos que realmente sea algo que te prende). Hay mucha labor emocional por hacer y no necesitas m√°s. Ser√≠a mejor reevaluar lo que ya haces, eliminar algunos compromisos y elegir solamente aquellos en los que la labor emocional es verdaderamente valiosa para ti.

"Cuestiona la voz de tu cr√≠tica interna que te dice que no est√°s haciendo lo suficiente", dijo Wilding.

Esa voz generalmente se equivoca, asegura. As√≠ que cuando brote, haz lo contrario.

"No temas dejar cosas de lado", dijo Wilding. "El mundo no se va a caer por eso y, de hecho, va a alentar a que los dem√°s recojan su propia rebanada de responsabilidad".
TITLE: La magia de la Navidad es obra de las mujeres (y eso nos est√° lastimando)

SUMMARY:
One of the best Thanksgiving invite mixups has become a holiday tradition.
A grandmother who last year became an online sensation after mistakenly texting the wrong teenager about Thanksgiving dinner plans extended the invite again.
‚ÄúFor him to continue with the relationship, I‚Äôm just really pleasantly surprised,‚Äù Dench told the Phoenix-based paper.
Dench replied: ‚ÄúYour grandma‚Äù with a tiny grandma emoji.
‚ÄúYou not my grandma,‚Äù Hinton texted back, along with a photo of his own face.
TEXT:
One of the best Thanksgiving invite mixups has become a holiday tradition.

A grandmother who last year became an online sensation after mistakenly texting the wrong teenager about Thanksgiving dinner plans extended the invite again. And once again, he came through.

Jamal Hinton returned to Wanda Dench‚Äôs home in Mesa, Arizona, for the meal on Thursday, this time bringing along his girlfriend, as well as a pumpkin pie, The Arizona Republic reported.

‚ÄúFor him to continue with the relationship, I‚Äôm just really pleasantly surprised,‚Äù Dench told the Phoenix-based paper. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre more of [an] extended family and, best of all, friends.‚Äù

Over the year since that fateful text between strangers, Dench said they now talk about once a week. Hinton said he looks upon her as an adopted grandmother.

‚ÄúThe world is becoming a better place than it used to be,‚Äù Hinton said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm loving it. I love that you don‚Äôt have to know someone or know their background to be nice to them.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe always has an open invite to our house for Thanksgiving,‚Äù Dench told local station KPNX. ‚ÄúI do believe there are no accidents in life.‚Äù

For those who missed last year‚Äôs heartwarming hilarity, the mixup occurred when Dench attempted to text a dinner invite to her grandson without realizing he had recently changed numbers.

Somebody grandma is coming in clutch this year!! Ayee!!! pic.twitter.com/QGrx83nHLl ‚Äî Jamal Hinton (@kingjamal08) November 15, 2016

Hinton, then 17 years old, was bewildered by the message from an unknown number, so he asked who was extending the invite. Dench replied: ‚ÄúYour grandma‚Äù with a tiny grandma emoji.

‚ÄúGrandma? Can I have a picture,‚Äù Hinton replied. He got back a photo of Dench smiling.

‚ÄúYou not my grandma,‚Äù Hinton texted back, along with a photo of his own face. ‚ÄúCan I still get a plate tho?‚Äù

That‚Äôs when Dench offered an endearing reply: ‚ÄúOf course you can. That‚Äôs what grandma‚Äôs do...feed everyone‚Äù
TITLE: Grandma Who Texted Wrong Teen Last Thanksgiving Invites Him Again

SUMMARY:
Students of a girls' school in Arunachal Pradesh were allegedly forced to undress by three teachers as a punishment for writing vulgar words against the head teacher.
According to the complaint, two assistant teachers and a junior teacher forced 88 students to undress before other students following the recovery of a piece of paper containing vulgar words about the head teacher and a girl student.
The teachers demanded an explanation from all the 88 students of classes VI and VII, who were later made to undress before the other students as punishment, it said.
"The school authorities did not speak to the parents of the students before punishing them," APPDSU president Nabam Tado said.
The Arunachal Pradesh Congress Committee (APCC) has condemned the incident and said such "heinous act" by the teachers might affect the students.
TEXT:
Students of a girls' school in Arunachal Pradesh were allegedly forced to undress by three teachers as a punishment for writing vulgar words against the head teacher.

Eighty-eight students of class VI and VII of Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya, Tani Happa (New Sagalee) in Papum Pare district were subjected to the humiliating treatment on November 23, police said.

The matter, however, came to light on November 27 after the victims approached the All Sagalee Students Union (ASSU), who then filed an FIR with the local police.

According to the complaint, two assistant teachers and a junior teacher forced 88 students to undress before other students following the recovery of a piece of paper containing vulgar words about the head teacher and a girl student.

Papum Pare Superintendent of Police Tumme Amo on Wednesday confirmed the filing of the FIR by ASSU. He said the case has been forwarded to the women police station here.

"The officer in-charge of the (women) police station said the victims and their parents along with the teachers will be interrogated before registering a case," Amo said.

A team of All Papum Pare District Students Union (APPDSU) had met the students and teachers on Tuesday, and found that an unidentified student had used vulgar words in a piece of paper mentioning the name of the head teacher and a girl student, a release by APPDSU said.

The teachers demanded an explanation from all the 88 students of classes VI and VII, who were later made to undress before the other students as punishment, it said.

"The school authorities did not speak to the parents of the students before punishing them," APPDSU president Nabam Tado said.

The Arunachal Pradesh Congress Committee (APCC) has condemned the incident and said such "heinous act" by the teachers might affect the students.

"Tempering with a child's dignity is against the law as well as the constitution," it said in a statement.

"To discipline a student is an attitude, character, responsibility and commitment of a teacher. Undressing a student is definitely not a corrective measure...Imposing such punishment is total violation of child rights, and more likely it may accelerate the risk of child abuse," the party added.
TITLE: 88 Girl Students Forced To Undress As Punishment By Teachers In Arunachal School

SUMMARY:
These ricotta pancakes are light, fluffy, gluten free and easy to make.
Serve with caramelised figs (or banana), extra ricotta and raw honey.
Ricotta pancakes with caramelised honey figsRecipe by Helen Tzouganatos, celiac food blogger of Hungry and Fussy.
"In this recipe, I have prepared them with caramelised figs, but they are just as delicious served with a sprinkling of sugar and lemon juice as per my lemon ricotta variation.
Variation: For lemon ricotta pancakes, add two teaspoons of lemon zest to batter.
TEXT:
Pancakes are the best way to start the day and, as long as you have a spare 20 minutes in the morning, there's no reason you can't make them on weekdays.

These ricotta pancakes are light, fluffy, gluten free and easy to make. Serve with caramelised figs (or banana), extra ricotta and raw honey.

Ricotta pancakes with caramelised honey figs

Recipe by Helen Tzouganatos, celiac food blogger of Hungry and Fussy.

"I love the fluffy lightness of these pancakes. They remind me of a light and airy Italian ricotta cheesecake but even better because they can be whipped up in five minutes," Tzouganatos said.

"In this recipe, I have prepared them with caramelised figs, but they are just as delicious served with a sprinkling of sugar and lemon juice as per my lemon ricotta variation. You can even spoon small drops of the batter into the frying pan and make delicious pikelets."

Preparation time: 5 minutes. Cooking time: 15 minutes.

Serves six.

INGREDIENTS

Pancakes:

3 eggs, separated

1 cup or 130g plain gluten free flour, sifted

¬º cup 55g caster sugar

2 teaspoons gluten free baking powder

Pinch of salt

¬æ cup buttermilk

300g ricotta, plus extra to serve

Caramelised honey figs:

6 fresh figs, halved

1 tablespoon raw honey

1 tablespoon butter

METHOD

Whisk egg whites in a small bowl until stiff peaks form. Place all other ingredients into a bowl and whisk to combine. Add stiff egg whites to batter. Fold to combine. Melt a little butter in a frying pan over low to medium heat. Spoon batter into pan and cook pancakes for 2-3 minutes until bubbles pop on the surface. Flip over and cook for a further minute until golden. Repeat until all the batter is cooked. For caramelised figs, melt butter and honey in a frying pan over medium heat. Add figs and cook for one minute on each side until caramelised. To serve, smear pancakes with ricotta and place figs on top. Drizzle with honey.

Tips: the figs will caramelise quickly so keep your eye on them to avoid burning.

Variation: For lemon ricotta pancakes, add two teaspoons of lemon zest to batter. To serve, sprinkle pancakes with sugar and lemon juice.

For more from Helen Tzouganatos, head to Hungry and Fussy blog or purchase Hungry and Fussy for $39.95.
TITLE: Delicious Gluten Free Ricotta Pancakes Recipe

SUMMARY:
The incident in question happened in Perth a few weeks ago when West Australian players met up by chance with England players at a bar in Perth.
The room was losing it now, and Steve Smith was the first to crack up.
Bancroft wasn't done.
Steve Smith couldn't seem to believe it either.
"As you saw out there today, there is no animosity between myself or Cameron any of the other Australian players," he said.
TEXT:
Oh, this is pure comedy gold.

After news broke on Sunday night that Australian opening batsman Cameron Bancroft had allegedly been headbutted by England player Jonny Bairstow, you thought uh oh, here we go. Is this another incident on the Ben Stokes scale of seriousness?

Relax, it was not.

In fact, the incident has provided Australian captain Steve Smith with the great big belly laugh he clearly needed after an epic man-of-the-match performance in the first Ashes Test at the Gabba-- and the rest of us can laugh along with him.

The incident in question happened in Perth a few weeks ago when West Australian players met up by chance with England players at a bar in Perth. Bancroft was then playing for WA and had never previously met Bairstow.

At Monday's post-match press conference at the Gabba, Bancroft was even more impressive with his comic timing and delivery than he had been with his timing at the batting crease, where he made 82 not out in Australia's second innings.

"He greeted me with, uh, yeah, a headbutt kind of thing," he said of the incident, as the room started to chortle.

"I was expecting a handshake. It wasn't the greeting of choice that I was expecting."

The room was losing it now, and Steve Smith was the first to crack up.

"It was certainly no malice in his action and we continued on having a very good conversation for the rest of the evening," the young opener continued.

"At the time he said sorry. For me personally it was just really weird, you know obviously it was just so random and I certainly didn't expect it coming."

Smith briefly looked down to compose himself at this point, like a naughty schoolboy trying to suppress a smirk. He was going OK too. The sensible captain's face was about to return. And then...

"As I said, a handshake or a hug would have been something that I probably would have expected more than a headbutt," Bancroft said.

And Smith just lost it all over again.

Bancroft wasn't done. The charm of his explanation was how he played it as straight as the bat he'd played in the middle of the Gabba.

"I don't know Jonny Bairstow, but he says hello to people very differently to most others," Bancroft deadpanned.

Gold.

"He didn't knock me over. I have the heaviest head in the West Australian squad... there's an actual measurement.

There's an actual WHAT? Steve Smith couldn't seem to believe it either.

"It was a good hit," Bancroft continued. "Play on."

Thus did Australian cricket unearth not just a promising batsman but a fine comic talent. And a great Australian sporting victory found its ideal final act.

Meanwhile, England captain Joe Root brushed aside the controversy over the incident in slightly more traditional fashion at the post-match press conference, describing it as a "mountain out of a molehill".

Bairstow himself said it had been "blown out of all proportion".

"As you saw out there today, there is no animosity between myself or Cameron any of the other Australian players," he said.

However England coach Trevor Bayliss did say his players would get a "stern talking-to" about their drinking culture.
TITLE: The Ashes: Watch Steve Smith Totally Lose It As Cameron Bancroft Spins Hilarious Headbutt Yarn

SUMMARY:
(Reuters) - A man has been arrested and charged in North Carolina in connection with the disappearance of three-year-old Mariah Woods who went missing from her bedroom five days ago, the Federal Bureau of Investigation and local sheriff said on Saturday.
Earl Kimrey, 32, was taken into custody on Friday in Onslow County, North Carolina, and charged with several crimes including concealing a death and obstruction of justice, the FBI and Onslow County Sheriff‚Äôs Office said in a statement.
The girl is believed to be dead due to evidence gathered during the investigation, the statement said.
The couple contacted the Onslow County sheriff‚Äôs office early the next morning to say the girl had disappeared, officials said.
A days-long search ensued with hundreds of police officers, military troops and volunteers searching the rural area around the family‚Äôs mobile home in Jacksonville.
TEXT:
(Reuters) - A man has been arrested and charged in North Carolina in connection with the disappearance of three-year-old Mariah Woods who went missing from her bedroom five days ago, the Federal Bureau of Investigation and local sheriff said on Saturday.

Earl Kimrey, 32, was taken into custody on Friday in Onslow County, North Carolina, and charged with several crimes including concealing a death and obstruction of justice, the FBI and Onslow County Sheriff‚Äôs Office said in a statement.

Handout . / Reuters Earl Kimrey in a police handout photo.

Kimrey also faces burglary, felony larceny and possession of stolen property charges, the statement said.

The girl is believed to be dead due to evidence gathered during the investigation, the statement said.

‚ÄúAt this time, the location of Mariah is unknown,‚Äù the statement said. ‚ÄúThe searches will now shift to a recovery process.‚Äù

Kimrey, who is being held on a $1 million bond, is the live-in boyfriend of the girl‚Äôs mother Kristy Woods, local media reported.

.@FBICharlotte is asking for the public's assistance to locate 3-year-old Mariah Woods, missing since November 27, 2017: https://t.co/MuJOfZH2rR #FBI pic.twitter.com/UVcz2P6gQj ‚Äî FBI Most Wanted (@FBIMostWanted) November 28, 2017

Woods said she put her daughter to bed about 11 p.m. on Sunday, and said her boyfriend saw the girl about an hour later when the child got up and he had told her to go back to bed, WRAL, an NBC affiliate in Raleigh, North Carolina, reported.

The couple contacted the Onslow County sheriff‚Äôs office early the next morning to say the girl had disappeared, officials said.

A days-long search ensued with hundreds of police officers, military troops and volunteers searching the rural area around the family‚Äôs mobile home in Jacksonville.
TITLE: Man Charged In Disappearance Of North Carolina Toddler

SUMMARY:
Elle Mills came out in an emotional YouTube video.
Ottawa YouTuber Elle Mills doesn't seem to do anything without throwing herself into it completely and in truly spectacular fashion.
With the help of her friends, Mills covers her house with rainbow-coloured wrapping paper and waits for her family.
"Hi, I'm Elle Mills, and I'm bisexual," she concludes the adorable video.
thank you and you're welcome pic.twitter.com/EisRR3fjyn ‚Äî Elle Mills (@millselle) November 28, 2017Also on HuffPost:
TEXT:
Elle Mills came out in an emotional YouTube video.

Ottawa YouTuber Elle Mills doesn't seem to do anything without throwing herself into it completely and in truly spectacular fashion. This is, after all, the girl who let her friends give her a random tattoo without first seeing the design.

So why would her coming out video be any different?

Mills is following in the footsteps of many other vloggers, internet personalities and celebrities who have taken to the platform to share a multitude of emotional, funny and sometimes just plain quirky coming out stories.

British Olympian Tom Daley and Australian singer Troye Sivan are just two of the big names who have used the platform for this purpose.

But 19-year-old Mills' video is a particularly emotional ride.

She begins by explaining that she gets a lot of questions about her sexuality on her channel, and that she's always repressed the fact that she likes girls along with boys.

Mills, who has nearly 700,000 subscribers, also shares that the first person she ever came out to was fellow YouTuber Dion York, who she met in Toronto and came out to after knowing him for under an hour.

She goes on to tell some of her friends, but not before making them draw who they think she has a crush on based on some simple characteristics including hazel eyes, tattoos and a good taste in music.

Mills asked her friends to draw her crush.

Though they all draw boys, they're excited when she shows them a photo of the girl she actually likes.

"You can't be gay, I'm gay," one of her friends jokes.

The video takes a deeply emotional turn, though, when Mills talks through tears about coming out to her family and how nervous she is about their reactions.

"I'm scared that my relationships with the people in my life right now are going to be different, people are going to look at me differently."

Mills became emotional when she spoke about coming out to her family.

With the help of her friends, Mills covers her house with rainbow-coloured wrapping paper and waits for her family.

When her mother and brother pull up to the house, they immediately hug Mills and tell her that they accept her.

"Hi, I'm Elle Mills, and I'm bisexual," she concludes the adorable video.

Reactions to the video have been overwhelmingly positive.

The was the cutest and the most amazing thing I've ever seen ‚ù§Ô∏è I'm so proud of you ‚Äî Natalia Soto (@_nataliasoto1) November 27, 2017

As someone who had a very traumatic coming out and tons of challenges because of my sexual orientation, it made me cry so hard to watch this. I am so happy for you. Welcome to the community love! üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà ‚Äî Christina Crockett (@StinaWeeze) November 28, 2017

Mills acknowledged the positive comments on Twitter, and thanked her followers for their support.

Angeh√∂rige der Breitscheidplatz-Opfer haben einen w√ºtenden Brief an Merkel geschrieben | Hannibal Hanschke / ReutersDie Hinterbliebenen des Weihnachtsmarkt-Anschlages von Berlin haben sich in einem Brief an die Kanzlerin gewandtSie kritisieren das Verhalten Merkels in der Folge des AttentatsHinterbliebene des Terroranschlags auf einen Berliner Weihnachtsmarkt haben Bundeskanzlerin Angela Merkel (CDU) laut "Spiegel" Versagen vorgeworfen.
"Der Anschlag am Breitscheidplatz ist auch eine tragische Folge der politischen Unt√§tigkeit Ihrer Bundesregierung", zitiert das Nachrichtenmagazin aus dem Offenen Brief von Angeh√∂rigen der zw√∂lf Todesopfer.
In einer Zeit, in der die Bedrohung durch Islamisten zugenommen habe, sei vers√§umt worden, "die Reformierung der wirren beh√∂rdlichen Strukturen" voranzutreiben.
Es sei der gesamten Bundesregierung wichtig, dass die Opfer und deren Familien "in ihrer oftmals verzweifelten menschlichen Lage m√∂glichst gut begleitet und beraten werden", sagte der Sprecher.
Sie will au√üerdem an der Einweihung eines Berliner Mahnmals f√ºr die Opfer am ersten Jahrestag des Anschlags teilnehmen und den Weihnachtsmarkt am Breitscheidplatz besuchen.
TEXT:
Angeh√∂rige der Breitscheidplatz-Opfer haben einen w√ºtenden Brief an Merkel geschrieben | Hannibal Hanschke / Reuters

Die Hinterbliebenen des Weihnachtsmarkt-Anschlages von Berlin haben sich in einem Brief an die Kanzlerin gewandt

Sie kritisieren das Verhalten Merkels in der Folge des Attentats

Hinterbliebene des Terroranschlags auf einen Berliner Weihnachtsmarkt haben Bundeskanzlerin Angela Merkel (CDU) laut "Spiegel" Versagen vorgeworfen.

"Der Anschlag am Breitscheidplatz ist auch eine tragische Folge der politischen Unt√§tigkeit Ihrer Bundesregierung", zitiert das Nachrichtenmagazin aus dem Offenen Brief von Angeh√∂rigen der zw√∂lf Todesopfer. Die Rede ist von "mangelhafter Anti-Terror-Arbeit", die alarmierend sei.

In einer Zeit, in der die Bedrohung durch Islamisten zugenommen habe, sei vers√§umt worden, "die Reformierung der wirren beh√∂rdlichen Strukturen" voranzutreiben. Die Angeh√∂rigen monierten auch, dass sie nach dem Anschlag am 19. Dezember 2016 nicht gen√ºgend vom Staat unterst√ºtzt worden seien.

"Es ist unsere konkrete Erwartung an Sie, Frau Bundeskanzlerin, dass die Bundesrepublik unseren Familien unb√ºrokratisch und umfassend hilft", hie√ü es. Der Umfang der staatlichen Unterst√ºtzung bleibe weit hinter den Erwartungen zur√ºck.

"Es ist eine Frage des Respekts..."

Die Angeh√∂rigen werfen Merkel auch vor, sie habe auch fast ein Jahr nach dem Anschlag weder pers√∂nlich noch schriftlich kondoliert. "Es ist eine Frage des Respekts, des Anstands und eigentlich eine Selbstverst√§ndlichkeit, dass Sie als Regierungschefin im Namen der Bundesregierung unseren Familien gegen√ºber den Verlust eines Familienangeh√∂rigen durch einen terroristischen Akt anerkennen."

Ein Regierungssprecher verwies am Freitagabend darauf, dass Merkel bereits am Tag nach dem Anschlag den Tatort besucht und sich "umfassend √ºber den Tathergang" informiert habe. Zudem habe sie vor gut einem Jahr an einem √∂kumenischen Gedenkgottesdienst teilgenommen.

Es sei der gesamten Bundesregierung wichtig, dass die Opfer und deren Familien "in ihrer oftmals verzweifelten menschlichen Lage m√∂glichst gut begleitet und beraten werden", sagte der Sprecher.

Nach seinen Angaben will sich Merkel am 18. Dezember mit Angeh√∂rigen der Todesopfer sowie Verletzten im Kanzleramt treffen. Das ist ein Tag vor dem Gedenken, das der Berliner Senat plant. Sie will au√üerdem an der Einweihung eines Berliner Mahnmals f√ºr die Opfer am ersten Jahrestag des Anschlags teilnehmen und den Weihnachtsmarkt am Breitscheidplatz besuchen.

(jg)
TITLE: Angeh√∂rige der Breitscheidplatz-Opfer haben einen w√ºtenden Brief an Merkel geschrieben

SUMMARY:
The White House on Saturday urged Pakistan to arrest Saeed, calling for him to be prosecuted over the Mumbai attack that killed 166 people, including Americans.
The United States had offered a $10 million bounty for information leading to the arrest and conviction of Saeed, who heads the Jamaat-ud-Dawa (JuD).
Members say the JuD is a charity but the United States says it is a front for the Pakistan-based Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) militant group.
The White House said Pakistan's failure to charge Saeed sent a "a deeply troubling message about Pakistan's commitment to (combating) international terrorism."
Pakistan argues that it has done a great deal to help the United States in tracking down terrorists.
TEXT:
The White House has said there would be repercussions for U.S.-Pakistan relations unless Islamabad took action to detain and charge a newly freed Islamist accused of masterminding a 2008 assault in Mumbai, India.

A Pakistani court ordered the release on Wednesday of Hafiz Saeed, who was put under house arrest in January after years of living freely in Pakistan, one of the sore points in its fraying relationship with the United States. His freedom had also infuriated its arch-foe India.

The White House on Saturday urged Pakistan to arrest Saeed, calling for him to be prosecuted over the Mumbai attack that killed 166 people, including Americans.

"If Pakistan does not take action to lawfully detain Saeed and charge him for his crimes, its inaction will have repercussions for bilateral relations and for Pakistan's global reputation," the White House said in a statement.

This is the first time the United States has acknowledged that the recent decision could have an impact on relations between the two countries, who are allies but view each other with suspicion.

Saeed has repeatedly denied involvement in the Mumbai attacks in which 10 gunmen attacked targets in India's largest city, including two luxury hotels, a Jewish centre and a train station in a rampage that lasted several days.

The violence brought nuclear-armed neighbours Pakistan and India to the brink of war.

The United States had offered a $10 million bounty for information leading to the arrest and conviction of Saeed, who heads the Jamaat-ud-Dawa (JuD). Members say the JuD is a charity but the United States says it is a front for the Pakistan-based Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) militant group.

The White House said Pakistan's failure to charge Saeed sent a "a deeply troubling message about Pakistan's commitment to (combating) international terrorism." It added that it also was counter to Pakistan's claim that it did not provide sanctuary to militants.

President Donald Trump has accused Pakistan of harbouring "agents of chaos" and providing safe havens to militant groups waging an insurgency against a U.S.-backed government in Kabul.

Pakistan argues that it has done a great deal to help the United States in tracking down terrorists.

U.S. official expressed hope that relations between the two countries could improve after a kidnapped U.S.-Canadian couple and their three children were freed in Pakistan in October, after the couple was abducted in neighbouring Afghanistan.

Michael Kugelman, of the Woodrow Wilson Center think tank in Washington, said he did not expect an imminent change in relations between the two countries, but Saeed's release would be a critical point for Washington as it considers it options.

"This could move the U.S. closer to adapting a largely symbolic but nonetheless major punitive step - the revocation of Pakistan's non-NATO ally status, which would be a big reputational blow for Pakistan," Kugelman said.

Pakistan won major non-NATO ally status in 2004 from the George Bush administration, in what was at the time seen in part as recognition of its importance in the U.S. battle against al Qaeda and Taliban insurgents.

Non-NATO ally status is a designation given by the U.S. government to close allies who have a strategic working relationship with U.S. Armed Forces but are not members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.
TITLE: US Warns Of Repercussions After Pakistan Frees Militant Hafiz Saeed

Eisregen im S√ºden und im MittelgebirgeDies kann gerade in der Nacht f√ºr erhebliche Gl√§tte sorgen.
Besondere Vorsicht ist im Mittelgebirge geboten: Hier kann es zu Eisregen kommen, der zu gef√§hrlicher Gl√§tte f√ºhrt.
Autofahrer sollten mit eisglatten Fahrbahnen rechnen und auch der Zugverkehr kann von dem Eisregen beeintr√§chtigt werden.

TEXT:
P√ºnktlich zum meteorologischen Winteranfang bleiben die Temperaturen auch am ersten Advent im Keller

Mehr √ºber die kommende Wetterlage erfahrt ihr oben im Video

Die Weihnachtsm√§rkte haben ge√∂ffnet und kalt genug f√ºr einen Gl√ºhwein ist es auch schon. P√ºnktlich zum meteorologischen Winteranfang am 1. Dezember bleiben die Temperaturen auch am ersten Advent niedrig. Am Sonntag kann es im Osten zun√§chst leichte Schneef√§lle geben, aus denen sp√§ter allerdings Regen wird.

Vorsicht! Eisregen im S√ºden und im Mittelgebirge

Dies kann gerade in der Nacht f√ºr erhebliche Gl√§tte sorgen. Im S√ºden geht der Schneefall etwas sp√§ter in Regen √ºber. Besondere Vorsicht ist im Mittelgebirge geboten: Hier kann es zu Eisregen kommen, der zu gef√§hrlicher Gl√§tte f√ºhrt. Autofahrer sollten mit eisglatten Fahrbahnen rechnen und auch der Zugverkehr kann von dem Eisregen beeintr√§chtigt werden.

Im Tagesverlauf wird es deutliche Temperaturunterschiede zwischen Norden und S√ºden geben. An der Nordsee kann es am Nachmittag vereinzelt sonnig mit Temperaturen bis zu acht Grad geben.

Bis zu zehn Zentimeter Neuschnee

Doch im Verlauf der n√§chsten Woche wird es auch im S√ºden wieder etwas freundlicher. Die Temperaturen k√∂nnen sogar wieder in den zweistelligen Bereich steigen. An der K√ºste muss aber mit teils kr√§ftigen B√∂en gerechnet werden. Nach der milden Phase kommt auch wieder die kalte Polarluft nach Deutschland und es wird wieder k√§lter.

SUMMARY:
Nietzsche diceva che non bisogna mai prestare ascolto a un pensiero che viene in mente quando non si √® in cammino.
Le idee sono delle visioni, non sono concetti che si pensano e che si elaborano: sono qualcosa che si impone alla vista, anche se li si guarda con gli occhi interiori.
Ma non √® contro la corrente vitale del mondo, l'energia che si dispiega nella storia e chiede senso, giustizia, bellezza.
Dio √® la forza che guida la corrente e la meta verso cui la corrente si dirige.
C'√® il rischio che il treno della Chiesa si spezzi.
TEXT:
A Carate Brianza, si sentiva in esilio: "Mio padre e mia madre erano emigrati dalla Sicilia poco prima che nascessi. Andavo a scuola in provincia di Monza e gi√† quando i professori facevano l'appello in classe sentivo che c'era qualcosa che non andava. Io mi chiamo Vito Mancuso. Il mio nome e cognome evocano prepotentemente il sud. Invece, crescevo nella Brianza bianchissima degli anni sessanta. Mi sentivo fuori posto e diverso. Avvertivo su di me il razzismo, la diffidenza di certa gente. Credo che dalla lacerazione tra ci√≤ a cui appartenevo e il luogo in cui mi trovavo sia nato in me il bisogno di pensare".

Per rifondare la fede cristiana su una base laica e universale, Vito Mancuso ha affrontato duemila anni di dottrina della Chiesa, armato di Tommaso d'Aquino e Albert Einstein, di filosofia e di scienza, del suo corpo e della sua mente: tutti uniti nella lotta. Teologo, ha scritto che il peccato originale √® "un'offesa alla creazione, un insulto alla vita, uno sfregio all'innocenza e alla bont√† della natura". Ha definito l'inferno "un concetto teologicamente indegno, logicamente inconsistente, moralmente deprecabile". Ha incuriosito il mondo secolare e procurato allarme in quello religioso. "Svuota di significato circa una dozzina di dogmi della Chiesa"(La Civilt√† Cattolica). "Ha suscitato in me un senso di profondo disagio"(Osservatore Romano) .

Leggendo il suo ultimo libro ‚Äì "Il bisogno di pensare" (Garzanti) ‚Äì si ha l'impressione che il margine sia per Mancuso il luogo da cui pu√≤ sentire pi√π forte l'appartenenza, come lo sradicamento √® all'origine del suo bisogno di radicarsi: "Non ho mai tenuto a essere iscritto a una scuola, fosse quella hegeliana, kantiana, martiniana. Preferisco coltivare l'indipendenza, anche nei confronti dei maestri".

Lei si occupa di Dio, ma richiama sempre la carne. Perch√©?

Nietzsche diceva che non bisogna mai prestare ascolto a un pensiero che viene in mente quando non si √® in cammino. E che avere il "sedere di pietra" ‚Äì cio√®, stare sempre seduti ‚Äì √® un peccato contro lo spirito santo. La parte del corpo con cui penso di pi√π sono i piedi. Essi mi fanno sentire la concretezza delle cose. Giacch√© il pensiero √® sempre immerso nel materiale.

Anche le idee lo sono?

Le idee sono delle visioni, non sono concetti che si pensano e che si elaborano: sono qualcosa che si impone alla vista, anche se li si guarda con gli occhi interiori. √à questo ci√≤ che connota le grandi intuizioni dei musicisti, dei poeti, degli artisti, degli scienziati.

Gli scienziati non lo fanno con gli esperimenti?

Quando nel 1964 Peter Higgs teorizz√≤ l'esistenza di un bosone oltre le particelle elementari, non aveva nessun dato per sostenerlo. Lo vide. Quarant'anni dopo, al Cern di Ginevra, verificarono che c'era davvero. Fu cos√¨ anche per la teoria della relativit√†. Einstein aveva da una parte la meccanica quantistica, dall'altra le leggi dell'elettromagnetismo: due teorie che prese singolarmente erano vere, ma insieme erano inconciliabili. La sua visione della relativit√† le univa. Finch√© non fu verificata, anch'essa era pura immaginazione.

La sua fantasia di cosa si √® nutrita?

Mio padre era un muratore, mia madre cominci√≤ facendo la sartina. A casa mia c'erano solo due libri: un vangelo con la copertina bianca e le pagine sottilissime, e un libro di preghiere. Quando mio padre ebbe un piccolo successo economico, cominci√≤ a comprare a rate delle enciclopedie. I volumi arrivavano una volta al mese. Io sfogliavo Le Scienze, Universi, perdendomi nelle parole e nelle illustrazioni. E poi c'erano i romanzi d'avventura di Emilio Salgari.

Fece il liceo negli anni settanta. Com'era?

Studiavo a Desio, a dieci chilometri da Milano. Era una zona operaia, vicino agli stabilimenti dell'Autobianchi. Democrazia proletaria era fortissima, come gli altri gruppi dell'estrema sinistra. Desio, per√≤, aveva anche una grande tradizione cattolica. √à la citt√† di Don Luigi Giussani, il fondatore di Comunione e Liberazione. E ogni manifestazione finiva nella piazza che ospita la statua di Pio XI ‚Äì anch'egli nato l√¨ ‚Äì con una bandiera rossa inforcata tra le tre dita benedicenti.

Lei da che parte stava?

In mezzo agli extraparlamentari di sinistra e ai ragazzi di Cielle. Ero vicino al cattolicesimo democratico, ma sopratutto ero lontano, anzi provavo allergia nei confronti di quei miei coetanei che sapevano gi√† tutto della vita, che avevano in tasca una verit√† rossa, bianca oppure nera. Sentivo in loro una falsit√†. Avevo l'impressione che rimuovessero le contraddizioni dell'esistenza, nascondendosi dietro una citazione ritagliata dai loro testi di riferimento. Io, invece, cercavo la verit√† che c'era dentro ogni posizione: la verit√† della tesi, e quella dell'antitesi. Quando scoprii Hegel, sentii una grande affinit√† con la sua dialettica.

Cos√¨ giovane lesse Hegel?

No, a diciassette anni lessi Dio esiste? di Hans K√ºng, un libro di pi√π di mille pagine che si interroga sul rapporto tra il pensiero moderno e l'idea di Dio, dove c'era una parte dedicata ad Hegel. Quando lo finii, mi dissi: "A questo voglio dedicarmi: a pensare Dio filosoficamente". Fu una lettura decisiva. Mi cambi√≤ la vita.

Come?

Ne parlai al prete del mio oratorio, che mi consigli√≤ di fare dei colloqui in seminario: "Pu√≤ essere un segno di vocazione sacerdotale", mi disse. Andai. Incontrai il direttore spirituale in una stanza piena di libri, a cui si accedeva percorrendo dei corridoi pieni di luci. Mi sentii nel posto giusto. Mi convinsi ed entrai in seminario.

Divenne prete?

A ventitr√© anni e mezzo, in anticipo di quasi due anni sui tempi canonici, il cardinal Martini mi ordin√≤ sacerdote. Avevo fatto cinque anni di studi teologici meravigliosi, con professori eccezionali, tra i quali il cardinal Tettamanzi, e poi il cardinal Ravasi, e il cardinal Coccopalmerio, e tanti altri ancora.

Perch√© non continu√≤ a fare il prete?

Perch√© dopo un anno mi resi conto che la mia vocazione era s√¨ teologica, ma non sacerdotale. Due cose non mi appartenevano: una era l'obbedienza alla dottrina, l'altra era la rinuncia a esercitare la mia affettivit√† anche a livello sessuale. Alla prima avrei potuto ovviare diventando uno di quei preti ribelli come Don Gallo. Per la seconda, invece, non c'era soluzione.

Prefer√¨ se stesso a Dio?

C'√® un grande filone del pensiero teologico che crede ci sia un'infinita differenza qualitativa tra Dio e l'uomo, per cui seguire Dio significa fare un salto nel grande mistero, vivere la fede come cecit√†, fino a negare se stessi e opporsi alla ragione, scandalizzando il mondo. Ma questa non √® la mia visione della fede. Dio, per me, √® contro il consumismo, il potere, il desiderio di possesso: le manifestazioni superficiali della cultura contemporanea. Ma non √® contro la corrente vitale del mondo, l'energia che si dispiega nella storia e chiede senso, giustizia, bellezza. Dio non √® contro corrente. Dio √® la forza che guida la corrente e la meta verso cui la corrente si dirige. √à sorgente e porto, alfa e omega. E non c'√® opposizione tra dimensione umana e teologica, tra corpo e spirito: √® nell'armonia tra di esse che Dio si manifesta.

Papa Francesco in che direzione si muove?

La forza profetica di Francesco √® cos√¨ evidente che anche il mondo laico lo ascolta e lo considera un punto di riferimento. Nella Chiesa, per√≤, una parte lo segue, un'altra lo avversa. Le tensioni sono diventate fortissime. C'√® il rischio che il treno della Chiesa si spezzi.

La politica, invece?

Nel novecento, la politica √® stata invasa dal pensiero. Schiere di ideologi hanno elaborato teorie che pretendevano di imporsi sulla storia, gli uomini e la loro libert√†. E forse, oggi, paghiamo quell'eccesso. Senza una visione, la politica si riduce a pura amministrazione, a tecnica fredda del governo. E, per l'Italia, questo √® pi√π rischioso che per altri paesi.

Perch√©?

Perch√© senza senza delle idee capaci di organizzare la dimensione pubblica, entrano in gioco gli interessi, le lobby, le clientele, la corruzione: un campo in cui il nostro paese √® sempre molto in alto nelle classifiche internazionali. Pi√π le visioni del bene comune si estinguono, pi√π emerge il particulare.

Cita Guicciardini. Non significa che l'Italia √® sempre stata cos√¨?

Quando ero ragazzo, non mi perdevo nemmeno una tribuna politica. Ascoltare Berlinguer, Zaccagnini, Fanfani o Almirante mi metteva di fronte a una visione del mondo. Non si trattava semplicemente di altri politici: si trattava di statisti, cio√® di politici in grado di dare unit√† ai bisogni e agli interessi di un paese intero. Oggi, di statisti, non mi pare di vederne.

La Chiesa potrebbe fare qualcosa?

La Chiesa deve fare politica, fornendo un orientamento, parlando di economia, etica, giustizia sociale. Quello che non deve fare √® scegliere un partito, anzich√© un altro.

Papa Francesco piace molto a sinistra, per√≤.

√à innegabile che tra i due grandi principi che orientano la politica ‚Äì la libert√† (destra) e l'uguaglianza (sinistra) ‚Äì insista di pi√π pi√π sulla seconda.

Significa che possiamo definirlo "un papa di sinistra"?

√à una definizione che il papa rifiuterebbe. Ma se applichiamo ‚Äì un po' impropriamente ‚Äì le categorie politiche alla teologia √® chiaro che a destra c'√® la tradizione, a sinistra l'innovazione. Dunque: Ratzinger era una papa di destra, Francesco √® un papa di sinistra.

Perch√© ci invita a pensare?

Per trovare pace e non diventare cattivi.

I cattivi non pensano?

Intendo cattivi nel senso latino del termine: captivi, cio√® prigionieri. Prigionieri della paura che immobilizza la mente e il cuore, generando chiusura e aggressivit√†. Le bestie aggredite, aggrediscono. Quando non esercitiamo il pensiero, noi uomini non siamo diversi.
TITLE: Intervista a Vito Mancuso: "Con Francesco tensioni fortissime, c'√® il rischio che la Chiesa si spezzi"

SUMMARY:
The New York Times is under fire for publishing a profile of an Ohio native and Nazi sympathizer that many saw as an attempt to normalize white nationalism.
Many took to Twitter to remind the Times that being a self-described Nazi sympathizer isn‚Äôt as harmless as the profile made it seem.
White journalists at the New York Times: "Ok, but please tell us more about your favorite food and show."
When identifying as a Nazi was so toxic you didn't get a puff-piece write up in the New York Times.
‚Äî Matthew Chapman (@fawfulfan) November 26, 2017image 1: nyt profile of neo-naziimage 2: nyt profile of unarmed man executed by police pic.twitter.com/8RWOTtmuTo ‚Äî shon.
TEXT:
The New York Times is under fire for publishing a profile of an Ohio native and Nazi sympathizer that many saw as an attempt to normalize white nationalism.

The profile, written by Times reporter Richard Fausset and published Saturday, follows Tony Hovater, a 29-year-old welder from a Dayton suburb, and his path from a ‚Äúvaguely leftist rock musician‚Äù to a Nazi sympathizer and ‚Äúavowed white nationalist.‚Äù

Some readers thought Fausset‚Äôs profile wasn‚Äôt critical enough of Hovater‚Äôs views on race (Hovater believes races should be separated), his admiration for Adolf Hitler (Hovater described Hitler as ‚Äúkind of chill‚Äù and thinks the Holocaust‚Äôs death total estimates are ‚Äúoverblown‚Äù) and his role in starting the extreme right-wing Traditionalist Worker Party, a group that marched at the white supremacy rally this summer in Charlottesville, Virginia.

For all of the alt-right's disdain for "normies," many in the movement want their extremist views to be normalized https://t.co/Uyw0z05bts ‚Äî NYT National News (@NYTNational) November 25, 2017

‚ÄúAnd the New York Times is here to help!‚Äù https://t.co/Wi6MyZzr2g ‚Äî Patrick Monahan (@pattymo) November 25, 2017

Fausset appears to use the newlywed‚Äôs seemingly normal life to show just how easy it is for an average American such as Hovater to adopt such radical and hateful views.

Instead, many saw the profile as an attempt to normalize Hovater‚Äôs white nationalist views, fascism and the neo-Nazi movement.

I don't mean to sound intolerant or coarse, but fuck this Nazi and fuck the gentle, inquisitive tone of this Nazi normalizing barf journalism, and fuck the photographer for not just throwing the camera at this Nazi's head and laughing. https://t.co/Pxfx2KU9AN ‚Äî Bess Kalb (@bessbell) November 25, 2017

Get ready to read a fucking sentence. It's a sentence about a Nazi. Are you ready? Lay the fuck down.



Here goes.



Quick reminder: It's about a fucking Nazi. A Nazi. Nazi. It's a sentence about a Nazi.



"In person, his Midwestern manners would please anyone‚Äôs mother." ‚Äî Bess Kalb (@bessbell) November 25, 2017

Bess Kalb, a writer for ‚ÄúJimmy Kimmel Live,‚Äù especially took issue with Fausset‚Äôs insistence that Hovater is polite. For example, in the same sentence that Fausset describes Hovater as a Nazi sympathizer, he immediately calls him ‚Äúpolite and low-key.‚Äù When writing of Hovater as a self-described ‚Äúsocial media villain‚Äù who occasionally appears on alt-right podcasts, Fausset adds that ‚Äúhis Midwestern manners would please anyone‚Äôs mother.‚Äù

Even the profile‚Äôs title suggests that Hovater is a charming character, despite his views on race and white supremacy: ‚ÄúIn America‚Äôs Heartland, the Nazi Sympathizer Next Door.‚Äù

There is a problem with making a man who believes that races should be separated seem likable. It suggests that Hovater‚Äôs politeness and all-American love for ‚ÄúSeinfeld‚Äù can make his hateful views more tolerable.

Many took to Twitter to remind the Times that being a self-described Nazi sympathizer isn‚Äôt as harmless as the profile made it seem.

We eat Wheaties, watch Seinfeld, have hipster beards and at night we march with torches hoping to eradicate the world of Jews and the colored. Other than that, really we're normal and harmless: "In America‚Äôs Heartland, the Nazi Sympathizer Next Door" https://t.co/UA3UDk7W5I ‚Äî Wajahat Ali (@WajahatAli) November 25, 2017

Dear New York Times,



As an Asian-American doctor in the Deep South, a low-key Nazi attacked me in the parking garage. Please don't normalize white supremacy.



Sincerely,

Eugene Gu, MD ‚Äî Eugene Gu, MD (@eugenegu) November 25, 2017

Nazis: "We want to kill all minorities!"



White journalists at the New York Times: "Ok, but please tell us more about your favorite food and show." ‚Äî Denizcan James (@MrFilmkritik) November 25, 2017

Next up from the New York Times: "The child pornographer next door -- he's a football fan, and a surprisingly good cook." ‚Äî CC (@canadiancynic) November 26, 2017

You know what I remember before 2017? When identifying as a Nazi was so toxic you didn't get a puff-piece write up in the New York Times. pic.twitter.com/ncpKNErRUB ‚Äî Julius Goat ü¶Ü (@JuliusGoat) November 25, 2017

I‚Äôm all for profiling Nazis if it helps show how this shit happens and shines a light on an important & terrible phenomenon, but I don‚Äôt think that means you have to profile the ‚Äúmodel Nazis‚Äù the Nazis want profiled. ‚Äî Ben Dreyfuss (@bendreyfuss) November 25, 2017

For his part, Fausset said he believes his profile on Hovater was fundamentally flawed and tried to address that in a column following the story.

Fausset acknowledged that his profile didn‚Äôt answer the question he originally set out to answer: How did an ‚Äúintelligent, socially adroit and raised middle class‚Äù 29-year-old man become a white nationalist?

I beat myself up about all of this for a while, until I decided that the unfilled hole would have to serve as both feature and defect. What I had were quotidian details, though to be honest, I‚Äôm not even sure what these add up to. Like other committed extremists I have known, Mr. Hovater had little time for a life beyond his full-time job and his line of activism. When he is not doing those things, he likes to be at home with his girlfriend (now his wife) and their cats.

The follow-up column, however, still failed to address the inherently problematic nature of Hovater‚Äôs political views.

Many saw the profile as following a wider pattern in the Times‚Äô coverage of race ‚Äî another reason why, they argued, the paper needs to hire more minorities in high-ranking editorial positions.

HuffPost has reached out to the Times and Fausset for comment on the profile‚Äôs backlash.

After today, I‚Äôm convinced more than ever that the New York Times needs more women and more minorities on their editorial board and senior management.



A human interest piece on a literal, actual Nazi would never have made it off the drawing board in a diverse, mixed newsroom. ‚Äî Matthew Chapman (@fawfulfan) November 26, 2017

image 1: nyt profile of neo-nazi

image 2: nyt profile of unarmed man executed by police pic.twitter.com/8RWOTtmuTo ‚Äî shon. (@SeanMcElwee) November 25, 2017

Maybe @nytimes is waiting for the Hitler-praiser to die before they take a more critical look at him. https://t.co/MsLJmLcOpT ‚Äî Paul F. Tompkins (@PFTompkins) November 25, 2017

Did the Times even ASK the Normal Guy Who Loves Seinfeld And Hates All Non-White Races if he‚Äôd ever stolen a box of cigars, a crime punishable by execution? ‚Äî Paul F. Tompkins (@PFTompkins) November 25, 2017

The New York Times has long had a deep masochistic desire to normalize Nazis. pic.twitter.com/NTkIwv3yXN ‚Äî David Menschel (@davidminpdx) November 25, 2017

They should change the New York Times‚Äôs nickname from ‚ÄúThe Grey Lady‚Äù to ‚ÄúThe White Dude‚Äù ‚Äî Chase Mitchell (@ChaseMit) November 26, 2017

UPDATE: Nov. 28. ‚Äï In a follow-up column published Sunday, Times national editor Marc Lacey said the publication regrets that some readers found the profile offensive, but maintained that the paper did not intend to ‚Äúnormalize anything.‚Äù

The profile was an attempt ‚Äúto describe the degree to which hate and extremism have become far more normal in American life than many of us want to think,‚Äù Lacey wrote.

He also acknowledged that readers wanted Richard Fausset, the author of the piece, to challenge and provide more context to the hateful views of profile subject Tony Hovater and members of the far right.

‚ÄúWe understand that some readers wanted more pushback, and we hear that loud and clear,‚Äù Lacey wrote.

However, the Times editor defended the paper‚Äôs decision to profile Hovater, whom Lacey said was of a similar age and background as the white nationalist suspected of running over protesters and killing Heather Heyer at the white supremacist rally in Charlottesville, Virginia, in August.

Lacey concluded:
TITLE: NYT Accused Of Normalizing White Nationalism In 'Nazi Sympathizer' Profile

SUMMARY:
Zuletzt hatte sich die Krise um das Atomprogramm des kommunistischen Regimes wieder zugespitzt, als Nordkorea erneut eine Rakete in Richtung Japan abfeuerte.
Im Vorfeld des Man√∂vers steigen deswegen die Spannungen zwischen den USA und Nordkorea.
Bei einer Konferenz im US-Bundesstaat in Kalifornien sagte der Trump-Berater, die Wahrscheinlichkeit eines Krieges zwischen den USA und Nordkorea erh√∂he sich jeden Tag.
Zwar gebe es nicht-milit√§rische Wege, um die Krise mit Nordkorea zu l√∂sen.
Auch Deutschland hatte daraufhin seine diplomatischen Beziehungen zu Nordkorea eingeschr√§nkt.
TEXT:
Am Montag beginnt ein gemeinsames Milit√§rman√∂ver von S√ºdkorea und den USA

Zuvor nehmen die Spannungen zwischen Washington und Pj√∂ngjang wieder zu

Es soll das gr√∂√üte gemeinsame Luftwaffen-Man√∂ver der USA und S√ºdkorea auf der koreanischen Halbinsel werden.

Am Montag wollen die beiden B√ºndnispartner zusammen eine Milit√§r√ºbung abhalten. F√ºnf Tage lang.

Zuletzt hatte sich die Krise um das Atomprogramm des kommunistischen Regimes wieder zugespitzt, als Nordkorea erneut eine Rakete in Richtung Japan abfeuerte. Laut Angaben des s√ºdkoreanischen Verteidigungsministeriums h√§tte die Hwasong-15-Rakete sogar Washington treffen k√∂nnen.

Nun stehen also 12.000 US-Soldaten bereit, in den n√§chsten Tagen den Ernstfall zu √ºben. F√ºr Pj√∂ngjang und Diktator Kim Jong-un ist das selbstverst√§ndlich eine Provokation.

Im Vorfeld des Man√∂vers steigen deswegen die Spannungen zwischen den USA und Nordkorea. Und die Eskalation der Worte in diesem Konflikt beginnt einmal mehr von Neuem.

Nordkorea: "Trump bettelt um einen Atomkrieg"

Am Samstag wetterte das nordkoreanische Au√üenministerium, Donald Trump "bettelt um einen Atomkrieg".

Der US-Pr√§sident veranstalte ein "extrem gef√§hrliches Gl√ºcksspiel auf der koreanischen Halbinsel", hie√ü es in einer schriftlichen Mitteilung des Ministeriums, aus der unter anderem der US-Sender CNN zitierte. Darin wird Trump auch als "nuklearer D√§mon" und "St√∂rer des Weltfriedens" bezeichnet.

Am Sonntag kritisierte die Zeitung "Rodong Sinmun", die von der in Nordkorea herrschenden Partei herausgegeben wird, in einem Kommentar: Das Milit√§rman√∂ver der USA und S√ºdkorea sei eine "gef√§hrliche Provokation" und bringe die Region an den Rand eines Krieges.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Journalisten haben mit dem Koch der Kim-Familie gesprochen: So war der Diktator als Kind

"Die Wahrscheinlichkeit eines Krieges steigt t√§glich"

Bereits am Samstag wetzte auch der Nationale Sicherheitsberater, HR McMaster, rhetorisch das Messer. Bei einer Konferenz im US-Bundesstaat in Kalifornien sagte der Trump-Berater, die Wahrscheinlichkeit eines Krieges zwischen den USA und Nordkorea erh√∂he sich jeden Tag.

"Das bedeutet, dass wir uns in einem Wettrennen befinden. In einem Wettrennen, dieses Problem zu l√∂sen", sagte McMaster laut dem US-Sender CNN.

Zwar gebe es nicht-milit√§rische Wege, um die Krise mit Nordkorea zu l√∂sen. Aber der nordkoreanische Machthaber Kim Jong-un "kommt n√§her und n√§her" an Atomwaffen heran, sagte McMaster: "Es bleibt nicht viel Zeit."

Auch Deutschland zieht Konsequenzen

Der neuerliche nordkoreanische Raketentest am Mittwoch war international scharf kritisiert worden. Das diplomatisch isolierte Land hatte damit zum wiederholten Mal gegen UN-Resolutionen versto√üen.

Die F√ºhrung in Pj√∂ngjang erkl√§rte danach, das Land sei jetzt in der Lage, das gesamte Festland der USA mit Atomsprengk√∂pfen angreifen zu k√∂nnen.

Auch Deutschland hatte daraufhin seine diplomatischen Beziehungen zu Nordkorea eingeschr√§nkt. Au√üenminister Sigmar Gabriel k√ºndigte am Donnerstag bei einem Besuch in Washington den Abzug eines deutschen Diplomaten - aber nicht des Botschafters - aus der nordkoreanischen Hauptstadt Pj√∂ngjang an.

Mit Material der dpa.
TITLE: "Wahrscheinlichkeit eines Krieges steigt t√§glich": Nordkorea-Krise versch√§rft sich vor US-Milit√§rman√∂ver

SUMMARY:
The Interagency Coalition on AIDS and Development (ICAD) is a registered Canadian charity based in Ottawa, Ontario representing a large coalition of over 100 Canadian HIV and AIDS organizations, international development non-governmental organizations, academic institutions, labour unions, and individuals.
ICAD helps Canadians contribute to international HIV work and encourages Canadian organizations to use the lessons learned from the global response that ICAD makes available, to improve prevention, care, treatment, and support services across diverse settings in Canada.
ICAD provides leadership in reducing the global and domestic impact of the HIV and AIDS epidemic through improving public policy, providing information and analysis, and sharing lessons learned.
TEXT: The Interagency Coalition on AIDS and Development (ICAD) is a registered Canadian charity based in Ottawa, Ontario representing a large coalition of over 100 Canadian HIV and AIDS organizations, international development non-governmental organizations, academic institutions, labour unions, and individuals. ICAD helps Canadians contribute to international HIV work and encourages Canadian organizations to use the lessons learned from the global response that ICAD makes available, to improve prevention, care, treatment, and support services across diverse settings in Canada. ICAD provides leadership in reducing the global and domestic impact of the HIV and AIDS epidemic through improving public policy, providing information and analysis, and sharing lessons learned.
TITLE: Interagency Coalition on AIDS and Development

SUMMARY:
The allegations lodged against Louis C.K.
Not even the comedian‚Äôs publicist knew Louis C.K.
In response to the Times‚Äô investigation, Louis C.K.‚Äôs publicist, Lewis Kay, said, ‚ÄúLouis is not going to answer any questions.‚ÄùWhen HuffPost reached out for comment on Thursday, Kay said, by email, ‚ÄúIn the coming days, Louis will issue a written statement.‚Äù (Kay announced Friday that Louis C.K.
Was Louis C.K.
‚ÄúWe are thrilled to start this journey with Louis and bring his film to audiences worldwide.‚ÄùOh, OK, sure, that works, if ‚Äúmulti-layered comedy‚Äù is code for ‚Äúmovie in which Louis C.K.
TEXT:
Louis C.K. knew this moment was coming. He must have.

Any Hollywood luminary with years of sexual predation rumors to his name, who then makes a movie about a Hollywood luminary with years of sexual predation rumors to his name, would have known this moment was coming.

What is ‚ÄúI Love You, Daddy,‚Äù the project Louis C.K. filmed quickly and cheaply this summer? Is it his confession? His farewell? A misguided attempt at a public self-reckoning? A two-hour-long Freudian slip?

The allegations lodged against Louis C.K. ‚Äï first suggested in a blind item published by Gawker in 2012, and more recently investigated by The New York Times and published in a report on Thursday ‚Äï assume an even ickier subtext when held up against ‚ÄúDaddy.‚Äù (Just putting the words ‚ÄúLouis C.K.‚Äù and ‚Äúdaddy‚Äù in the same sentence feels vile.)

Not even the comedian‚Äôs publicist knew Louis C.K. was making ‚ÄúI Love You, Daddy,‚Äù until the Toronto International Film Festival added the movie to its lineup in August. Louis C.K. wrote and financed ‚ÄúDaddy,‚Äù and shot it in June on a modest budget, casting himself as a successful television writer who idolizes an esteemed director (played by John Malkovich) long accused of pedophilia and child molestation. Who cares, Louis C.K.‚Äôs character, Glen, says in regard to this sordid backstage behavior; it‚Äôs ‚Äújust a story‚Äù ‚Äï until the director pursues Glen‚Äôs 17-year-old daughter (Chlo√´ Grace Moretz). Only then does Glen think twice about his hero. We often see this dynamic with men who invoke their female relatives to express concern about systemic harassment; it only matters when it‚Äôs personal.

The Orchard Louis C.K. and Chlo√´ Grace Moretz star in "I Love You, Daddy."

Yep, Louis C.K., whose stand-up sets regularly include jokes about rape, child molestation and masturbation, created a fictional manifesto about processing a public figure‚Äôs sexual deviancy, years after he was first accused of jerking off in front of female colleagues and mere months before five women went on the record to confirm such accusations. (The incidents occurred between 2002 and 2005.) Furthermore, the film‚Äôs lush black-and-white cinematography resembles that of ‚ÄúManhattan,‚Äù the 1979 comedy in which now-alleged sexual abuser Woody Allen cast himself as a television writer romancing a bright 17-year-old (Mariel Hemingway). The allusion is no accident.

As Louis C.K.‚Äôs career blossomed ‚Äï his FX series, ‚ÄúLouie,‚Äù racked up a bevy of Emmy nominations, and he landed supporting roles in movies like ‚ÄúBlue Jasmine,‚Äù ‚ÄúAmerican Hustle‚Äù and ‚ÄúTrumbo‚Äù ‚Äï he evaded the allegations in defiant tones.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt care about that,‚Äù he told New York magazine in 2016.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to answer to that stuff, because they‚Äôre rumors. If you actually participate in a rumor, you make it bigger and you make it real,‚Äù he told The New York Times in September, when ‚ÄúI Love You, Daddy‚Äù premiered in Toronto.

In response to the Times‚Äô investigation, Louis C.K.‚Äôs publicist, Lewis Kay, said, ‚ÄúLouis is not going to answer any questions.‚Äù

When HuffPost reached out for comment on Thursday, Kay said, by email, ‚ÄúIn the coming days, Louis will issue a written statement.‚Äù (Kay announced Friday that Louis C.K. was no longer his client.)

That statement was disseminated Friday afternoon. Louis C.K. finally acknowledged the accusations‚Äô veracity. ‚ÄúAt the time, I said to myself that what I did was okay because I never showed a woman my dick without asking first, which is also true,‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúBut what I learned later in life, too late, is that when you have power over another person, asking them to look at your dick isn‚Äôt a question. It‚Äôs a predicament for them. The power I had over these women is that they admired me. And I wielded that power irresponsibly.‚Äù

As many critics have noted in their reviews, it‚Äôs hard to parse the self-awareness of something like ‚ÄúDaddy.‚Äù Glen eventually attempts to impart upon his daughter why her relationship with the director shouldn‚Äôt continue, in turn evoking cultural conversations surrounding industry fixtures like Roman Polanski and Woody Allen, the latter of whom directed Louis C.K. in ‚ÄúBlue Jasmine.‚Äù (As recently as September, during an interview with Uproxx, he said he still ‚Äúkeep[s] in touch‚Äù with Allen.)

What cause would someone accused of unseemly behavior toward woman have to make such a movie, if not to induce queries about his own sleazy reputation? Knowing that Louis C.K. had, for years, hatched plots and punchlines about sexual misconduct ‚Äï in 2014, a hot-button episode of ‚ÄúLouie‚Äù depicted an attempted rape ‚Äï erases the already vague line that separates this artist‚Äôs personal life from his art, as his ‚ÄúDaddy‚Äù character attempted to do for the auteur he worshipped. Louis C.K.‚Äôs work was informed by his own wrongdoings. He‚Äôd handed us all the clues.

Was Louis C.K. baiting us with ‚ÄúI Love You, Daddy‚Äù? Was he coaxing us to probe his past? Was it a dare?

After all, it‚Äôs not as if he were merely adding another title to his illustrious big-screen catalog. He hadn‚Äôt helmed a movie since 2001‚Ä≤s dumb ‚ÄúPootie Tang.‚Äù

Whatever his motive, the whole endeavor reads like a macho ego trip. Either he was telling the world, simply, ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt stop me now.‚Äù Or, knowing the truth would emerge soon enough, he persuaded indie distributor The Orchard to shell out a sizable $5 million for the rights to a personal therapy session. Plenty of qualified filmmakers who know how to keep their genitals covered when appropriate will never land a deal like that.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a multi-layered comedy that tackles provocative issues head-on, combining a style that shows a clear passion for cinema with Louis‚Äô singular voice,‚Äù Danielle DiGiacomo, The Orchard‚Äôs vice president of acquisitions, said in a statement in September. ‚ÄúWe are thrilled to start this journey with Louis and bring his film to audiences worldwide.‚Äù

Oh, OK, sure, that works, if ‚Äúmulti-layered comedy‚Äù is code for ‚Äúmovie in which Louis C.K. has Charlie Day‚Äôs character pantomime jerking off in front of colleagues and Rose Byrne‚Äôs character explain why adults fornicating with teenagers maybe isn‚Äôt so bad, before ultimately arriving at a moral posture best summed up as, ‚ÄòWell, it‚Äôs complicated.‚Äô‚Äù
TITLE: Louis C.K. Has Been Baiting Us

Prononc√©e par Roger Gicquel en ouverture du journal t√©l√©vis√© apr√®s l'arrestation du tueur en s√©rie Patrick Henry, mort le 3 d√©cembre 2017, l'expression est depuis devenue culte, reprise en parodie et en chanson.
En t√©moignent les paroles sans ambigu√Øt√© du refrain du premier single du groupe Mickey 3D (2000), intitul√©...La France a peur.
La peur, ressort m√©diatique √† la base de la construction de "l'ennemi public" pour le dessinateur de BD Manu Larcenet.
La France a peur.
(...) Oui, la France a peur et nous avons peur, et c'est un sentiment qu'il faut d√©j√† que nous combattions je crois.
TEXT:
M√âDIAS - "La France a peur": il n'√©tait pas n√©cessaire de se trouver devant TF1, √† 20 heures le 18 f√©vrier 1976, pour avoir entendu ces quelques mots aux accents inqui√©tants.

Prononc√©e par Roger Gicquel en ouverture du journal t√©l√©vis√© apr√®s l'arrestation du tueur en s√©rie Patrick Henry, mort le 3 d√©cembre 2017, l'expression est depuis devenue culte, reprise en parodie et en chanson.

Avec ses accents anxiog√®nes, c'est le plus souvent pour l'associer √† l'impact de la t√©l√©vision sur la conscience collective que la c√©l√®bre phrase a √©t√© r√©utilis√©e: pour intituler, par exemple l'ouvrage du chercheur Laurent Bonelli, qui analyse la mont√©e du th√®me de l'ins√©curit√© dans les m√©dias.

Une d√©nonciation que l'on retrouve dans la chanson engag√©e. En t√©moignent les paroles sans ambigu√Øt√© du refrain du premier single du groupe Mickey 3D (2000), intitul√©...La France a peur.

La peur, ressort m√©diatique √† la base de la construction de "l'ennemi public" pour le dessinateur de BD Manu Larcenet.

Dans le deuxi√®me volet de ses aventures, Nic Oumouk, un jeune beur de banlieue, vit ses m√©saventures dans un hexagone qui ne l'accepte pas: dans La France a peur de Nic Oumouk le voit donc prendre la place de Patrick Henry comme √©tant l'homme √† abattre.

M√™me utilisation √† des fins parodiques, illustrant le clich√© journalistique et le son pour les phrases anxiog√®nes, quand l'humoriste Guillaume Meurice, sur France Inter, l'utilise pour illustrer sa chronique sur Fran√ßois Fillon et sa "mort" politique.

Mais ces multiples d√©tournements n'emp√™chent pas cette phrase de vivre une vie parall√®le, un clin d'≈ìil journalistique d'o√π le second degr√© est exclu.

Les journalistes et √©ditorialistes ne se privent pas, pour illustrer un sujet de soci√©t√©, de citer la brutale entr√©e en mati√®re de Roger Gicquel, d√©c√©d√© en mars 2010. En 2014, la journaliste Natacha Polony synth√©tisait une soudaine avalanche de mauvaises nouvelles par ces quelques mots.

La post√©rit√© de cette phrase, au d√©part simple illustration d'un fait divers gla√ßant dont le coupable, Patrick Henry, √©tait alors inconnu, va pourtant √† l'encontre de la volont√© de son auteur.

Comme le rappelait ainsi le site Arr√™t sur image, la suite de l'ouverture du journal t√©l√©vis√©, bien loin d'inciter √† la peur, mettait les t√©l√©spectateurs en garde: il ne faut pas c√©der √† la panique, et lutter contre sa peur instinctive.

Bonsoir. La France a peur. Je crois qu'on peut le dire aussi nettement. (...) Oui, la France a peur et nous avons peur, et c'est un sentiment qu'il faut d√©j√† que nous combattions je crois. Parce qu'on voit bien qu'il d√©bouche sur des envies folles de justice exp√©ditive, de vengeance imm√©diate et directe.
TITLE: L'affaire Patrick Henry, c'est aussi le c√©l√®bre "La France a peur" de Roger Gicquel

SUMMARY:
You‚Äôre more likely to remember something if you read it out loud, a study from the University of Waterloo has found.
Researchers discovered that speaking and reading aloud helps words stick in a person‚Äôs long-term memory.
Dubbed the ‚Äúproduction effect‚Äù, it is the dual action of speaking and hearing oneself that has the most beneficial impact on memory.
‚ÄúThis study confirms that learning and memory benefit from active involvement,‚Äù said the study‚Äôs co-author Colin MacLeod, a professor and chair of the Department of Psychology at University of Waterloo in Canada.
‚ÄúWhen we add an active measure or a production element to a word, that word becomes more distinct in long-term memory, and hence more memorable.‚Äù
TEXT:
You‚Äôre more likely to remember something if you read it out loud, a study from the University of Waterloo has found.

Researchers discovered that speaking and reading aloud helps words stick in a person‚Äôs long-term memory. Dubbed the ‚Äúproduction effect‚Äù, it is the dual action of speaking and hearing oneself that has the most beneficial impact on memory.

‚ÄúThis study confirms that learning and memory benefit from active involvement,‚Äù said the study‚Äôs co-author Colin MacLeod, a professor and chair of the Department of Psychology at University of Waterloo in Canada.

‚ÄúWhen we add an active measure or a production element to a word, that word becomes more distinct in long-term memory, and hence more memorable.‚Äù
TITLE: If You Need To Memorise Something, This Trick Might Help

El debate de la Ley de Seguridad Interior surgi√≥ a ra√≠z de dos iniciativas presentadas en el Congreso desde septiembre de 2016.
La segunda, presentada en la C√°mara de Diputados, presentada por los diputados del PRI, C√©sar Camacho Quiroz y Martha Sof√≠a Tamayo.
Y aunque hubo un intento de aprobar la Ley de Seguridad Interior en agosto de 2017 √©ste no prosper√≥.
Casi al mismo tiempo que 2017 se convirti√≥ en el a√±o m√°s violento de la historia reciente de M√©xico, situaci√≥n que evidenci√≥ la poca efectividad de la estrategia de seguridad p√∫blica basada en la militarizaci√≥n.
La presencia de la prensa provoc√≥ que se cambiara la sede de la discusi√≥n y en pocos minutos fue aprobado el dictamen.
TEXT:
Un a√±o despu√©s de que el PRI y PAN promovieran una Ley de Seguridad Interior para militarizar la seguridad p√∫blica, los diputados que aprobaron dicha iniciativa simplemente decidieron ignorar toda la evidencia y recomendaciones de acad√©micos y organizaciones nacionales como internacionales de derechos humanos.

El debate de la Ley de Seguridad Interior surgi√≥ a ra√≠z de dos iniciativas presentadas en el Congreso desde septiembre de 2016. La primera, a cargo del senador del PAN, Roberto Gil Zuarth. La segunda, presentada en la C√°mara de Diputados, presentada por los diputados del PRI, C√©sar Camacho Quiroz y Martha Sof√≠a Tamayo.

Ambas iniciativas confer√≠an facultades extraordinarias al Ej√©rcito y la Marina para realizar las labores de seguridad p√∫blica que han venido realizando desde que en 2006, el presidente Felipe Calder√≥n decret√≥ la llamada "guerra contra el narcotr√°fico" sin que existiera un marco legal que regulara la actuaci√≥n de las fuerzas armadas. Entre las medidas m√°s pol√©micas, estas iniciativas planteaban que los militares realizaran labores de investigaci√≥n sustituyendo al Ministerio P√∫blico, pudieran intervenir comunicaciones privadas sin una orden judicial, utilizaran la fuerza letal para contener protestas pac√≠ficas o quedar exentos de la Ley Federal de Procedimiento Administrativo.

Esto, a√∫n cuando la ONU recomend√≥ a M√©xico poner m√°s controles sobre los militares en lugar de conferirles poderes extraordinarios.

A partir de ah√≠, diversos acad√©micos advirtieron los muchos riesgos que tendr√≠a aprobar una ley que otorgar√≠a facultades extraordinarias a las fuerzas armadas por encima de los poderes civiles. Una situaci√≥n que implica el cambio de un r√©gimen civil a un r√©gimen militar, sin controles ciudadanos ni contrapesos. Es decir, condiciones para instaurar un r√©gimen autoritario.

"Lo que est√°n haciendo es flexibilizar absolutamente todo y, me atrevo a ponerlo en estos t√©rminos, dar una llave para abrir y cerrar un r√©gimen totalitario a discrecionalidad de quien opera esta legislaci√≥n", dijo Ximena Medell√≠n, acad√©mica del CIDE y maestra en Derecho por la Universidad de Notre Dame.

En diciembre de 2016, el titular de la Secretar√≠a de la Defensa Nacional, Salvador Cienfuegos, levant√≥ la voz y exigi√≥ regularizar el marco normativo de las fuerzas armadas

"No pedimos estar aqu√≠, no nos sentimos a gusto. Los que estamos con ustedes aqu√≠ no estudiamos para perseguir delincuentes", dijo Cienfuegos en una at√≠pica rueda de prensa.

El tema cobr√≥ a√∫n mayor vuelo a partir de las protestas por el incremento a los precios de la gasolina en enero de 2017, donde las fuerzas armadas tuvieron que contener algunos saqueos registrados en lugares como el Estado de M√©xico.

El debate gener√≥ que acad√©micos de diversas instituciones como la UNAM y CIDE, expusieran ante el Senado de la Rep√∫blica una serie de argumentos sobre los peligros de aprobar dicha ley ante el alto √≠ndice de abusos de fuerzas armadas en tareas de seguridad p√∫blica, incluidas masacres como las de Tlatlaya y Tanhuato, as√≠ como el caso Ostula. Esto, luego de que los acad√©micos documentaran indicios de ejecuciones sumarias, luego de que el 86% de los civiles abatidos por el Ej√©rcito y la Marina, entre 2007 y 2011, fueron asesinados con un √≠ndice de "letalidad perfecta".

Mientras tanto, la presi√≥n de los mandos militares lleg√≥ a tal punto, que reunieron en las instalaciones de la Secretar√≠a de la Defensa a legisladores federales para definir los t√©rminos en los que los militares requer√≠an un nuevo marco normativo. Un suceso que ocasion√≥ que integrantes de la sociedad civil acusaran un chantaje de las fuerzas armadas y de disputar el poder pol√≠tico ante a debilidad de las instituciones civiles.

"M√°s que llenar un vac√≠o, est√°n disputando un poder que no les est√° acotando. Y eso llama la atenci√≥n porque uno de los principios de la democracia respecto a las fuerzas armadas es obviamente la sujeci√≥n al poder civil. Y cuando no existe esa sujeci√≥n o lo cuestionan, estamos ante un riesgo muy grande de regresi√≥n democr√°tica", dijo Erubiel Tirado, investigador de la Universidad Iberoamericana, en entrevista con el HuffPost.

Para ese entonces, la Secretar√≠a de Marina present√≥ ante legisladores su propio concepto de Seguridad Interior, el cual inclu√≠a aspectos como perseguir pol√≠ticos corruptos y atender la desigualdad en el pa√≠s. Una concepci√≥n que de manera impl√≠cita ya inclu√≠a una visi√≥n de pa√≠s (¬øy de gobierno?) por parte de la Armada.

En plena contienda electoral en el Estado de M√©xico, Coahuila y Nayarit, el gobierno de Enrique Pe√±a Nieto hizo un nuevo llamado para "dejar la discusi√≥n y pasar a la acci√≥n" a la hora de aprobar la Ley de Seguridad Interior. "Es momento de darles el respaldo con decisi√≥n y dejar c√°lculos pol√≠ticos electorales para despu√©s", resalt√≥ el titular de la Segob, Miguel Osorio Chong.

Ya en pleno proceso electoral, el PRD y el Partido Verde presentar√≠an sus respectivas iniciativas de Seguridad Interior.

Sin embargo, la coyuntura pol√≠tica mand√≥ el tema a la congeladora durante varios meses. Y aunque hubo un intento de aprobar la Ley de Seguridad Interior en agosto de 2017 √©ste no prosper√≥.

Pero todo cambi√≥ a partir del 20 de noviembre pasado, cuando en pleno acto de condecoraci√≥n de militares en presencia del presidente Pe√±a Nieto, Cienfuegos hizo un nuevo llamado a aprobar la Ley de Seguridad Interior a tan s√≥lo ocho meses de las elecciones presidenciales de 2018. Casi al mismo tiempo que 2017 se convirti√≥ en el a√±o m√°s violento de la historia reciente de M√©xico, situaci√≥n que evidenci√≥ la poca efectividad de la estrategia de seguridad p√∫blica basada en la militarizaci√≥n.

El PRI comenz√≥ a operar y de inmediato mand√≥ las primeras se√±ales de que buscar√≠a aprobar la pol√©mica ley a pesar de las cr√≠ticas realizadas por m√°s de 140 organizaciones de la sociedad civil o el m√°s reciente informe de WOLA sobre los abusos militares que hasta la fecha permanecen impunes. El colectivo #SeguridadSinGuerra advirti√≥ la posibilidad de un albazo legislativo cuyas consecuencias ser√≠an desastrosas para los derechos humanos en M√©xico.

Pero quiz√° el llamado m√°s notorio fue el realizado por la Comisi√≥n Nacional de Derechos Humanos, organismo que un d√≠a previo a la aprobaci√≥n de la iniciativa, advirti√≥ que el dictamen preparado para aprobar la ley era violatorio de los derechos humanos, la Constituci√≥n y promov√≠a la discrecionalidad de las fuerzas armadas, lo cual facilitar√≠a que los abusos militares quedaran impunes.

Todo lo anterior no fue impedimento para que el PRI y sus aliados aprobaran en la Comisi√≥n de Gobernaci√≥n el dictamen de Ley de Seguridad Interior durante una sesi√≥n que en un primer momento intent√≥ realizarse a espaldas de la ciudadan√≠a, en una reuni√≥n a puerta cerrada que no ser√≠a transmitida por el Canal del Congreso con el argumento de que hab√≠a "problemas con el cableado", seg√∫n refiri√≥ la diputada priista Mercedes Guill√©n. La presencia de la prensa provoc√≥ que se cambiara la sede de la discusi√≥n y en pocos minutos fue aprobado el dictamen.

No pasaron m√°s de dos horas cuando dicho dictamen ya estaba siendo procesado de manera apresurada en el pleno de la C√°mara de Diputados sin que muchos de los legisladores conocieran si quiera el contenido de la ley que estaban aprobando.

Al final, las protestas de Movimiento Ciudadano y Morena no rindieron frutos y el bloque PRI-PVEM-NA termin√≥ imponi√©ndose en la votaci√≥n de la Ley de Seguridad Interior, con voto dividido del PAN, PRD y PES.

Fue as√≠ que tras desechar las 101 reservas que formularon diputados de oposici√≥n, la C√°mara de Diputados aval√≥ y determin√≥ enviar al Senado la minuta de la Ley de Seguridad Interior para ser revisada y procesada.

::.
TITLE: Cronolog√≠a de la militarizaci√≥n: c√≥mo fue que se aprob√≥ la Ley de Seguridad Interior
