SUMMARY:
Si bien puedes estar al tanto de que tu ex sigue adelante con su vida, es diferente cuando la evidencia est√° justo frente a ti.
Luego, un espantoso d√≠a, t√∫ decides (o, lo que es peor, deciden por ti) que la relaci√≥n ha llegado a su fin.
Todav√≠a tienes a tu ex en Facebook... y a sus amigos.
Otra cosa a tomar en cuenta es que solo porque elimines a tu ex y a sus amigos de una plataforma de redes sociales no significa que esto sea una decisi√≥n inamovible.
No te enga√±es pensando en que est√°s de acuerdo con ver a tu ex en las redes sociales si realmente no lo est√°s.
TEXT:
Si bien puedes estar al tanto de que tu ex sigue adelante con su vida, es diferente cuando la evidencia est√° justo frente a ti.

Cualquiera que haya salido con una persona despu√©s de 2004 muy probablemente haya tenido acceso a redes sociales. Estas han mejorado nuestra conexi√≥n con las personas, pero la conexi√≥n constante tambi√©n tiene sus peligros, especialmente cuando te separas de tu novi@ o pareja.

As√≠ que presentemos un escenario com√∫n: comienzas a salir con un chavo o chava, conoces a sus amigos y se lleva muy bien. Los agregas a Facebook.

Luego comienza la cadena de conexiones cuando todos los dem√°s amigos siguen el ejemplo y te agregan. Te tomas muchas fotos con ellos, salen juntos a restaurantes y bares; te empiezan a caer bien los amigos de tu pareja.

Todo va bien... O eso parece. Luego, un espantoso d√≠a, t√∫ decides (o, lo que es peor, deciden por ti) que la relaci√≥n ha llegado a su fin. Est√°s devastad@. O si fuiste t√∫ quien tron√≥, es posible que tengas dudas sobre tu decisi√≥n.

¬øCu√°l es el dilema entonces? Todav√≠a tienes a tu ex en Facebook... y a sus amigos. Y ahora contemplas la posibilidad de borrarlos a todos.

¬øEs algo muy severo?

¬øParecer√≠a que me importan mucho si los borro a todos?

¬øMe porto s√∫per cool y pretendo que no pasa nada?

Estas son las preguntas que probablemente te har√°s a ti mism@. Sin embargo, la √∫nica pregunta v√°lida que deber√≠a hacerte es la siguiente:

¬øQu√© funcionar√° para mi salud emocional en este momento y me ayudar√° a salir adelante?

Si eres una persona curiosa, o tu peor enemigo, descubrir√°s que, por aburrimiento, inevitablemente verificas la p√°gina de tu ex, solo para ver sus fotos con amigos, ad√≥nde salen...

Esto arde, ¬øno?

Si bien puedes estar al tanto de que tu ex sigue adelante con su vida, es diferente cuando la evidencia est√° justo frente a ti. En lugar de ser feliz inconscientemente y seguir adelante, al ver esa foto retrocedes dos pasos.

Lo m√°s probable es que en respuesta decidas publicar una foto estilo 'checa, estoy guap√≠sim@/mira de lo que te est√°s perdiendo'. Nuevamente, algo nada √∫til. Presumir ante tu ex en Facebook con la esperanza de que √©l o ella pueda verlo puede ser algo satisfactorio a corto plazo, particularmente si le dan "Me gusta".

Pero es m√°s probable que haya una raz√≥n por la que tronaron y ninguna cantidad de fotos sexys realmente har√°n que vuelvan, esto solo da falsas esperanzas. Si te sientes profundamente afectad@ por la ruptura, probablemente pases el resto del d√≠a analizando el "Me gusta" que dio o el comentario que hizo, algo que tampoco es √∫til.

Sin embargo, si la separaci√≥n fue una decisi√≥n mutua y ninguno de los dos estaba emocionalmente involucrado en la relaci√≥n, mantener a tu ex en Facebook puede no ser un problema (simplemente un poco inc√≥modo).

Bueno, y respecto a los amigos..

Es posible que no tengas un problema con ellos personalmente, pero en la mayor√≠a de los casos siempre ser√°n leales a tu ex, ya que fueron sus amigos primero. Tambi√©n existe el riesgo de que publiquen fotos con tu ex. El tipo de im√°genes que no quieres ver

Si te preocupa que se ofendan porque los elimines, siempre puedes explicarles que los est√°s eliminando como amigos, pero no es nada personal. Es solo para darte un poco de espacio y que t√∫ salgas adelante. Deber√≠an ser capaces de entender esto.

Otra cosa a tomar en cuenta es que solo porque elimines a tu ex y a sus amigos de una plataforma de redes sociales no significa que esto sea una decisi√≥n inamovible. Siempre puedes volver a agregarlos en otro momento cuando hayas superado la situaci√≥n al 100% y est√©s listo para que sean tus amigos.

El punto es que debes ser sincer@ contigo mism@. No te enga√±es pensando en que est√°s de acuerdo con ver a tu ex en las redes sociales si realmente no lo est√°s. Es perjudicial a la larga. Es como abrir una herida cada dos d√≠as y esperar a que se cure. Los meses pueden convertirse en a√±os y todav√≠a no lo superar√°s.

Una separaci√≥n completa es lo que realmente necesitas para dejar atr√°s una relaci√≥n.

Este art√≠culo fue publicado originalmente en 'HuffPost' Australia y luego fue traducido.

*Este contenido representa la opini√≥n del autor y no necesariamente la de HuffPost M√©xico.
TITLE: ¬øDeber√≠as borrar a tu ex de las redes sociales?

SUMMARY:
At Groote Schuur Hospital celebrating Worlds First heart transplant performed by Dr Chris Barnard 50 years ago!
The historic human heart transplant demonstrates the power of mass media to transform a scientist into a global icon.
Political undercurrentsThe apartheid politics in 1960s South Africa shaped the first human heart transplant in a number of ways.
Despite the risk that Washkansky could die before the heart transplant could proceed or that another surgeon could win this race, they decided to wait for a "white heart".
Celebrity surgeonTo this day, Dr Chris Barnard remains the only South African scientist who ever achieved global celebrity status.
TEXT:
South Africa's Chris Barnard stands out in medical history as the heart surgeon who became a global household name after transplanting the first human heart on 3 December 1967.

The historic surgery captured the world's imagination and was hailed by 20th-century historians as socially and scientifically of equal significance compared to the moon-landing in 1969.

I examined aspects of this landmark surgery in two papers. The one looks at how Barnard fits into the mould of celebrity scientists across the world. The other zooms in on Barnard himself and how the media shaped perceptions of his landmark surgery.

The dramatic events that unfolded 50 years ago in Cape Town on December 2 and 3, 1967 had all the makings of media gold. It was a daring world-first in medicine, performed by a largely unknown surgeon in a hospital far away from leading medical centres around the world where other surgeons were working towards the same goal. Embedded in the drama were real people set to become instantly famous and whose lives would change forever.

At Groote Schuur Hospital celebrating Worlds First heart transplant performed by Dr Chris Barnard 50 years ago! This Video is in the Room where the Donor surgery took place. Her name Denise Darvall-she died in an accident at 25. Her heart became the most famous ‚ù§Ô∏è in the world! pic.twitter.com/OJLn5mvl37 December 1, 2017

Underlying it all, were moral apprehensions about whether doctors were playing God which resulted in fierce criticism of Barnard. The criticism was tempered by public fascination with the idea that one person's heart could beat in someone else's chest, as well as by Barnard's explanations that the heart was nothing more than a pump.

On top of all this, Barnard's charisma and the increasing competition between news companies fuelled the unprecedented media interest. No other medical milestone has had such a defining effect on the relationship between medicine, media and society.

The historic human heart transplant demonstrates the power of mass media to transform a scientist into a global icon. It highlights how public visibility offers some scientists a path to influence and power, but also illustrates that scientific celebrity comes with considerable reputational and personal risk.

It reminds us that science, morals and politics have always been, and will always be, inextricably interlinked.

Political undercurrents

The apartheid politics in 1960s South Africa shaped the first human heart transplant in a number of ways.

Once Barnard managed to convince his superiors at Groote Schuur hospital that he was ready to transplant a human heart, Louis Washkansky, already in the final stages of heart failure, was identified as a potential recipient. It was a race against time to find a heart donor. A suitable donor was identified, but the medical team made up of white doctors at Groote Schuur decided against using the heart of a man who under apartheid law fell into one of the categories of black people called "coloured". They were afraid of being accused of experimenting on black people.

Despite the risk that Washkansky could die before the heart transplant could proceed or that another surgeon could win this race, they decided to wait for a "white heart". Ten days later, Chris Barnard transplanted the heart of 25-year old Denise Darvall, who was left brain-dead after being hit by a speeding car.

Following this medical triumph, the South African government called on Barnard to help promote South Africa's image around the world. A patriot at heart, he mostly obliged. But, back in South Africa, he was fiercely opposed to apartheid and later refused to allow ongoing segregation of black and white patients in his intensive care wards at Groote Schuur hospital. His anti-apartheid views led to ongoing clashes with hospital authorities and politicians.

A media frenzy like never before

There were no journalists or photographers around when Chris Barnard walked out of Groote Schuur hospital on Sunday morning 3 December 1967, hours after making history. Before driving home, he called the medical superintendent of the hospital to inform him that they had performed a human-to-human heart transplant the night before. He told Dr Jacobus Burger:

No, it wasn't dogs. It was human beings... two human beings.

Within an hour, South African Prime Minister John Vorster knew about the historic operation. The news spread like wildfire and hordes of journalists and photographers descended on Cape Town over the next few days. Chris Barnard himself famously said:

On Saturday, I was a surgeon in South Africa, very little known. On Monday, I was world-renowned.

Barnard admitted that he found it flattering to be at the centre of so much attention and he went out of his way to accommodate the media. Given his limited exposure to the media before, he had a remarkable ability to control the media agenda and steer live television interviews in his own favour. In later years, he reflected more critically on the intense media attention and its effects on medicine and society.

New rules

The unprecedented media interest in the first human heart transplant, transformed many of the rules that governed the relationships between medicine and the media at the time.

With the names and faces of recipient Washkansky and donor Darvall on front pages around the world, it shattered rules about the anonymity of organ donors and recipients, how medical procedures were reported in the media and the extent of patients' details that were disclosed.

It also fundamentally changed the way leading surgeons would be identified in and pursued by the mass media in future.

One of the ways in which Barnard changed the way medicine was communicated was to appoint his own PR man and official photographer ‚Äì something that was unheard of at the time. He allowed Don MacKenzie to take exclusive photographs of him which he could sell, after giving Barnard a fee.

Celebrity surgeon

To this day, Dr Chris Barnard remains the only South African scientist who ever achieved global celebrity status.

His celebrity status was boosted by his unique blend of charisma, media flair and boyish good looks. Barnard sustained it in years to come by his high-profile private life, public engagements with royalty and world leaders, as well as a series of flirtations with models and movie stars.

He remained an iconic public figure for the rest of his life, but also continued to do pioneering work as a cardiac surgeon, including many successful surgeries on children with congenital heart disease around the world.

This piece originally appeared in The Conversation and can be viewed here.
TITLE: Chris Barnard: How A Historic Heart Transplant Created A Celebrity Scientist 50 Years Ago

SUMMARY:
Shot this footage 2day of the INCREDIBLE Pilliga forest, Australia's largest dryland forest.
"We encourage the New South Wales government to approve the development of the Narrabri Gas Project," the PM said.
The Narrabri Gas Project is an ambitious plan to drill 850 wells tapping underground natural gas reserves, which resources giant Santos said would be tapped for the domestic market.
A spokesman for the Minister told us:"The NSW Government is assessing the Narrabri Gas Project proposal under clear planning legislation and policies.
Paull called Environmental Impact Statement for the Narrabri Gas Project "appalling".
TEXT:
What, as a society, do we value more? Forests or fuel? Agriculture or energy? Fresh water or fracking? Beauty or balance sheets? And are these things mutually exclusive, or can we maybe have it all?

These questions are all about to play out in Australia's largest inland native forest, the Pilliga, in northern New South Wales.

The Pilliga is not what you'd call a pretty forest. It has neither the lushness of the Daintree, nor the towering grandeur of West Australia's Karri forests or Victoria's mountain ash. In truth it's more like scrub -- a patchwork of scraggly ironbark, thin-stemmed eucalypts and a plain native pine called cypress pine.

The Pilliga's creekbeds are sandy and its roads throw up a powdery dust that turns everything Donald Trump orange. Its emus, koalas and glossy black cockatoos are elusive. There are few lookouts or landmarks of note. The rest areas beside the Newell Highway -- the main road from Brisbane to Melbourne which barrels right through the heart of it -- are devoid of picnickers.

SUBSCRIBE AND FOLLOW Get top stories and blog posts emailed to me each day. Newsletters may offer personalized content or advertisements. Learn more Newsletter Please enter a valid email address Thank you for signing up! You should receive an email to confirm your subscription shortly. There was a problem processing your signup; please try again later Facebook

Twitter

YouTube

Pinterest

Snapchat

Instagram

CLOSE

It takes about two hours to drive from Sydney to Newcastle. That gives you a good indication of the vast scale of The Pilliga -- which is the large area of forest to the south of Narrabri.

The Pilliga is a place few people go to see, and which most people are in a hurry to get through. But the Pilliga is vast and quiet. And when you spend two days driving its rutted tracks, you come to understand that its unrelenting, undulating featurelessness is its very charm.

But for how long?

Shot this footage 2day of the INCREDIBLE Pilliga forest, Australia's largest dryland forest. It's threatened by a huge coal seam gas project pic.twitter.com/gP4bZxltTC ‚Äî Anthony Sharwood (@antsharwood) 6 de julho de 2017

The 'Pilliga Gas Project'

Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull shifted the national focus to The Pilliga in the last week of September, when he announced that Australia's gas supply crisis was "three times worse than thought". "We encourage the New South Wales government to approve the development of the Narrabri Gas Project," the PM said. "The sooner that is brought online, the better."

The Narrabri Gas Project is an ambitious plan to drill 850 wells tapping underground natural gas reserves, which resources giant Santos said would be tapped for the domestic market.

But in a sense, the project's name is a misnomer. The "Narrabri Gas Project" brings to mind the town of 7,600 people on the Namoi River, which as the project's administrative base, would likely enjoy a temporary economic upswing. Indeed, Santos already employs 20-30 people at shopfronts in the area.

The Narrabri gas Project should arguably be called The Pilliga Gas Project, because the vast bulk of the 850 wells would be sunk in the Pilliga forest just south of Narrabri -- which consists of a mix of state forest, nature reserve, state conservation area, national park and freehold land.

Whatever you call it, this project -- which is currently in the planning approval phase -- would change the face of the Pilliga. And as the NSW government makes its decision, a fight is bubbling away not just over the forest itself, but over the forest's water resources, which some claim would be degraded.

The Pilliga is a recharge zone for the Great Artesian Basin -- Australia's vast, inland underground water resource without which so much of our agriculture would be unviable. Being a recharge zone means it's one of the few areas which provide significant new water to replenish the basin.

Farmers in areas bordering the Pilliga rely on bore water from the Great Artesian Basin. Their soils are rich but their rainfall is scant. They fear that a project of this scale will destroy the subterranean water pressure and dry up their bores. They also fear groundwater in the forest itself could be tainted.

Santos says there are numerous studies conducted by eminent scientists which have found that coal seam gas can be safely produced without harmful effects on ground or surface water. It cites Ex-CSIRO water expert Dr Richard Creswell, who said farmers' water would "not be impacted by any of the drilling that goes through the Great Artesian Basin to get to the gas".

But RMIT's Dr Matthew Currell -- who has been called up as part of the approval process to help assess the submissions -- told HuffPost Australia that "I think there's genuine concern about the protection of surface water systems and also groundwater-dependent ecosystems in the area".

The Pilliga is situated at the area of shaded blue that dips down into NSW.

The water wars are also being fought over the groundwater in the forest itself. The disputed point is whether the mix of chemicals involved in unconventional gas drilling will leave a toxic mess.

Santos directed HuffPost Australia to the 2014 study by the NSW Chief Scientist and Engineer, which concluded that with appropriate safeguards and controls, natural gas can be safely extracted from coal seams. Richard Creswell said there are "at least three levels of protection" in the gas drilling process.

But RMIT's Matthew Currell said "there's no reason why any land holder that lives in vicinity of coal seam gas wells or waste water storage ponds could not have their water quality affected".

For now, we have a stand-off. Water versus gas. The Pilliga versus what many people see as the pillagers.

With the NSW Department of Planning approval process underway, it's highly unusual that the Prime Minister would overstep the boundaries of his authority, and urge the NSW state government to get cracking with the project.

HuffPost Australia contacted the office of NSW Planning Minister Anthony Roberts to ask whether the PM's urging could potentially help fast-track the approval process. A spokesman for the Minister told us:

"The NSW Government is assessing the Narrabri Gas Project proposal under clear planning legislation and policies. We have also established a panel of four independent scientific experts to advise on the potential water-related impacts. In addition, other government agencies such as the NSW Environment Protection Authority and NSW Crown Lands and Water are also providing advice. We consider all applications under the same rules to carefully assess any potential environmental, social, or economic impacts or benefits. We also closely consider community feedback... There is no set timeframe for determination."

There is much for the Department to assess. As HuffPost Australia reported in June when submissions closed, a record number of 23,000 submissions were received in response to resources giant Santos's proposal. Of these, just 300 were in favour. While many of the submissions opposed to the project are form letters, it's our understanding that at least 5,000 are carefully researched, informed statements of genuine concern.

No person has articulated her concerns with more passion than Anne Kennedy, a farmer from Coonamble, west of the Pilliga, who relies on Great Artesian Basin bore water.

"What you are doing is pitting fuel versus food. Which industry will still be necessary in 20 years? If you want to drink clean water and eat clean food, then this is your problem," Kennedy told HuffPost Australia.

Santos pointed us to a study which showed that "the collective impacts of coal mining and coal seam gas extraction can be effectively managed without negatively impacting agricultural water use across the region".

Pilliga-based ecologist David Paull, who has worked as an environment officer for both state and local governments, is unconvinced.

"I think the fact that there's a record-breaking number of submissions for this project than is a fairly good sign that it's not well received by the community. Certainly in the local region outside Narrabri area itself there's no support for it," he said.

Paull called Environmental Impact Statement for the Narrabri Gas Project "appalling". Santos said the environmental assessment process was "rigorous".

"Santos has the track record and expertise required to safely and sustainably develop the Narrabri Project and deliver reliable, affordable, clean natural gas to NSW for many years to come," a spokesman said.

It's likely that the decision on this project will be made in the first half of 2018. Expect passions to run high whichever way the dice rolls. The Pilliga does not have the emotional tug of some better-known iconic Australian landscapes like the Reef or the Tasmanian wilderness, but to locals, this great, largely uncelebrated Australian forest is everything.

"I'm just an old chook, a broken down farmer," Anne Kennedy said with unconvincing self-deprecation. Then her feisty self returned.

"There will be massive civil disobedience if they approve it. We're not going to give up without a fight."
TITLE: What Lies Beneath: The Battle Over Water, Gas And The Pilliga, Our Vast, Pristine Inland Wonderland

SUMMARY:
The initial hiatus has since being extended by an additional two weeks to 8 December, when production is expected to resume.
Work on the Netflix series was suspended on 31 October, after various allegations of sexual harassment were made against its lead star.
Production on the sixth season of ‚ÄòHouse Of Cards‚Äô is set to resume next month, following the departure of Kevin Spacey .
Following the allegations made against Spacey, it was also announced the next series of ‚ÄòHouse Of Cards‚Äô would be the last.
It came after the Old Vic said that 20 people were allegedly victims of ‚Äúinappropriate behaviour‚Äù by Spacey and that a ‚Äúcult of personality‚Äù may have stopped them from coming forward.
TEXT:
However, there is no official word yet on how the show will deal with writing out Spacey‚Äôs character, Frank Underwood.

The initial hiatus has since being extended by an additional two weeks to 8 December, when production is expected to resume.

Work on the Netflix series was suspended on 31 October, after various allegations of sexual harassment were made against its lead star.

Production on the sixth season of ‚ÄòHouse Of Cards‚Äô is set to resume next month, following the departure of Kevin Spacey .

In a letter sent to the cast and crew by producers Media Rights Capital, senior vice president Pauline Micelli said (via Hollywood Reporter): ‚ÄúThese last two months have tested and tried all of us in ways none of us could have foreseen.

‚ÄúThe one thing we have learned throughout this process is that this production is bigger than just one person and we could not be more proud to be associated with one of the most loyal and talented production cast and crews in this business.‚Äù

She added: ‚ÄúOur hope is that the entire crew will be able to reconvene when production resumes, but we want you to know that we will certainly understand if crew members need to find other work in the interim, which will prevent them from re-joining us. We sincerely appreciate all you have done‚Äù.

Following the allegations made against Spacey, it was also announced the next series of ‚ÄòHouse Of Cards‚Äô would be the last.

Accusations against Spacey surfaced in October when actor Anthony Rapp described an incident which allegedly happened when he was just 14 years old.

Spacey responded to Rapp‚Äôs allegations in a statement on Twitter, in which he said he didn‚Äôt recall the events described, but offered his ‚Äúsincerest apologies‚Äù for ‚Äúwhat would have been deeply inappropriate drunken behaviour‚Äù.

He is also being investigated by the Metropolitan Police over two alleged sexual assaults - one that took place when was artistic director of the Old Vic theatre in 2008, and the second that is claimed to have taken place in Lambeth in 2005.

It came after the Old Vic said that 20 people were allegedly victims of ‚Äúinappropriate behaviour‚Äù by Spacey and that a ‚Äúcult of personality‚Äù may have stopped them from coming forward.
TITLE: 'House Of Cards' Season 6 Production Set To Resume, Following Kevin Spacey Departure

TEXT:
Neil Young a mis en ligne ses riches archives, accumul√©es pendant son demi-si√®cle de carri√®re par le rockeur canadien de l√©gende, un geste sans pr√©c√©dent pour un musicien de son calibre.

Et il a aussi publi√© un nouvel album aux forts accents militants et anti-Trump.

Neil Young, 72 ans, a mis en ligne vendredi tous ses albums, qui peuvent √™tre √©cout√©s en streaming accompagn√©s des paroles, de vid√©os, d'informations sur ses tourn√©es mais aussi des r√©f√©rences bibliographiques, et bien d'autre choses √† d√©couvrir sur un site qui a dessein est un peu un capharna√ºm.

Le fan y trouvera son bonheur et pour aider √† la t√¢che, le rockeur a mis en ligne une vid√©o de 10 minutes o√π il explique comment naviguer dans ses archives.

Cela vaut la peine d'√™tre patient. Le musicien, si prolifique, a mis en ligne une dizaine d'albums in√©dits, mais la plupart n'√©taient pas encore totalement charg√©s sur le site.

Pour marquer l'occasion, Neil Young a donn√© un concert solo vendredi, diffus√© en direct depuis une salle de 225 places √† Omemee, la petite ville rurale de l'Ontario o√π il a pass√© une partie de son enfance.

Perfection technique

Le canadien voit son site comme un v√©ritable fonds Neil Young, une version high-tech des archives donn√©es par ses pairs musiciens ou d'autres artistes √† une universit√© ou un mus√©e.

Il a promis de constamment mettre le site --neilyoungarchives.com-- √† jour, apr√®s avoir mis des ann√©es √† l'√©laborer.

L'acc√®s sera libre jusqu'au 30 juin. Ensuite, le rockeur a promis qu'il fera payer une "tr√®s modique somme" pour consulter le tr√©sor accumul√© tout au long d'une carri√®re longue et riche.

Neil Young, qui est obs√©d√© par la perfection technique --√† l'instar d'un autre immense interpr√®te canadien, le pianiste Glenn Gould-- a travaill√© en collaboration avec la soci√©t√© de Singapour OraStream pour d√©velopper la meilleure qualit√© sonore possible, avec des fichiers 20 fois plus lourds que le format standard MP3.

Il a quand m√™me fait une concession pour ses fans qui auraient de vieux ordinateurs ou une une connexion internet √† faible d√©bit, en mettant √† disposition des fichiers moins gourmands.

AntiTrump

Les archives remontent jusqu'au premier enregistrement de Young, "The Sultan", un single sorti en 1963 et elle se terminent (provisoirement) par le nouvel album publi√© vendredi, "The Visitor". C'est le deuxi√®me opus enregistr√© avec le groupe de rock Promise of the Real.

Neil Young d√©bute sur l'album avec une attaque en r√®gle contre Donald Trump dans "Already Great".

Dans "Stand Tall", il fait allusion au pr√©sident qui ne croit pas dans la science parce que "elle fait mentir l'argent". Et dans "Change of Heart", il s'en prend √† la grande promesse du milliardaire de b√¢tir un mur anti-immigrants tout le long de la fronti√®re avec le Mexique. "Cela ne vaut pas la peine d'user de la haine, m√™me comme ciment pour construire tes murs derri√®re lesquels tu te caches", chante Neil Young, qui vit en Californie.

Il laisse encore mieux transpara√Ætre son m√©pris pour ce pr√©sident dans "When Bad Got Good" en lan√ßant avec force: "Enfermez le !".

√Ä voir aussi:
TITLE: Neil Young ouvre ses archives au monde entier

SUMMARY:
Former President Barack Obama appeared to throw subtle shade at President Donald Trump for having fewer Twitter followers than himself during a forum in India on Friday.
In a conversation with journalist Karan Thapar at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit in New Delhi, Obama boasted on stage about having ‚Äú100 million Twitter followers‚Äù.
(For the record, Obama actually has 97.4 million followers.
Trump has 43.8 million).
The full interview is below, with Obama‚Äôs Twitter comments at the 34:30 mark.
TEXT:
Former President Barack Obama appeared to throw subtle shade at President Donald Trump for having fewer Twitter followers than himself during a forum in India on Friday.

In a conversation with journalist Karan Thapar at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit in New Delhi, Obama boasted on stage about having ‚Äú100 million Twitter followers‚Äù.

‚ÄúI actually have more than other people who use it more often,‚Äù he added, prompting laughter from the audience who interpreted it as a ding against Trump. (For the record, Obama actually has 97.4 million followers. Trump has 43.8 million).

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs important to be mindful about both the power of these tools and also its limits and to understand it can be used for both good or for ill,‚Äù Obama added, during a more general discussion on technology.

Obama later issued this advice for people using social media:

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt say the first thing that pops into your head, just have a little bit of an edit function, that‚Äôs wise for life generally. You see people getting in all kinds of trouble because they sent out some tweet and then they‚Äôre trying to erase it afterwards but somebody‚Äôs screenshot it and they‚Äôre getting embarrassed.‚Äù

‚ÄúThink before you speak, think before you tweet, same principle,‚Äù he added.

The full interview is below, with Obama‚Äôs Twitter comments at the 34:30 mark.
TITLE: Barack Obama Appears To Zing Donald Trump With Twitter Followers Boast

TEXT:
Le but exceptionnel de Malcom contre Dijon.

FOOTBALL - GOLA√áOOOO! √Ä la 36e minute du match de Ligue 1 qui opposait vendredi 1er d√©cembre Dijon √† Bordeaux, les supporters du stade Gaston-G√©rard ont eu droit √† un but dont il se souviendront longtemps. Une merveille de frappe de 30 m√®tres sur laquelle le gardien de but dijonnais Baptiste Reynet n'a absolument rien pu faire.

Son auteur: l'excellent Br√©silien Malcom, p√©pite couv√©e par les Girondins et que nombre de grands clubs europ√©ens aimeraient attirer lors des prochains march√©s des transferts. Et √† voir sa formidable r√©alisation, on comprend pourquoi.

Toutefois, ce but n'a pas permis aux Bordelais de se sortir du ventre-mou du championnat dans lequel ils se sont englu√©s depuis quelques semaines. Alors que Malcom leur avait permis de reprendre l'avantage (2-1), ils ont fini par s'incliner en encaissant deux buts en seconde p√©riode. S'il y en a bien qui ont gagn√© leur soir√©e, c'√©tait donc forc√©ment les supporters dijonnais.

SUMMARY:
In Dubai, however, you can get the full desert experience by driving a mere 45 minutes out of the city.
Here you'll find Bab Al Shams Desert Resort and Spa, a sprawling 5-star oasis with two pools, several restaurants and even on-site camels should you fancy a ride.
Bab Al Shams Desert Resort - rooftop.
Bab Al Shams Desert Resort & Spa.
If beach-side vacations are more your thing, look no further than Nikki Beach Resort and Spa.
TEXT:
It's difficult to know what to expect from a city like Dubai. Of course, there's the excessiveness: an unapologetic appreciation of all that's bigger, better, faster, flashier.

You can see it in the skyline, where the world's tallest building, the, Burj Khalifa, shoots from the cityscape like a silver arrow.

You can see it at The Dubai Mall (once again, the world's largest -- Dubai has a thing for world records), where brands like Cartier and Chanel exist alongside attractions that could rival Disneyland's.

You can even see it in peak hour traffic, where Maseratis and Ferraris join the regular vans and taxis in the long commute home.

The Burj Khalifa is the tallest building in the world.

But Dubai isn't just the 'Vegas of the Middle East', as it's becoming increasingly known. Underneath the glitz and glamour is a vibrant city of a different kind: a city that is as much ocean as it is desert, a place where you can hear the call to prayer sung live over the loudspeakers while you browse through the heady aromas of the spice souk, or wander through the 'old town' of the Al Fahidi District.

Scratch the surface of Dubai and you'll find it's more than a playground for the rich (though, of course, there's that too) and deserving more than a stopover on your way to Europe, too.

Is there anything better than fresh spices?

Where to stay

Given our geography, it's unsurprising Australians equate deserts with being very far away. In Dubai, however, you can get the full desert experience by driving a mere 45 minutes out of the city.

Here you'll find Bab Al Shams Desert Resort and Spa, a sprawling 5-star oasis with two pools, several restaurants and even on-site camels should you fancy a ride.

When it's 35 degrees and over, this pool becomes your best friend. Bab Al Shams Desert Resort - rooftop. Bab Al Shams Desert Resort & Spa.

The hotel offers a number of activities including falconry (a must in Dubai), archery, desert fat biking (they're not being rude -- it's the bike tyres that are fat), not to mention their award winning spa.

Surrounded by sand dunes and decked out in authentic Arabic design, Bab Al Shams Desert Resort is an Aladdin-esque fantasy land ideal for unwinding away from the hustle of the city.

Hot tip: organise an open 4x4 desert ride to see the dunes up close and personal and to get a feel for the surrounding area. Warning: not for the faint of heart.

If beach-side vacations are more your thing, look no further than Nikki Beach Resort and Spa. Decorated almost entirely in white, you'd be forgiven for thinking you'd fallen out of Dubai and somehow ended up in The Hamptons, but make no mistake, this is Arab hospitality at is finest.

Located on the waterfront of Pearl Jumeira, this 5-star resort is only a 14-minute drive from the airport and 7km from the city centre, making it a great base from which to explore.

The warmest, saltiest water you will ever swim in.

Nikki Beach Resort & Spa.

Not that you'd ever want to leave. With the beach at your doorstep (the water is so warm it's unbelievable) as well as a lap pool, a bubble pool and a beach club; five restaurants and lounges plus a spa and gym, you may choose to stay where you are, and we don't blame you.

Hot tip: Get up early and enjoy an ocean swim with the beach all to yourself.

What to do

For adventure

Easily the best thing you can do in Dubai to get the heart racing is a 4x4 ride through the desert. Your driver will show no fear as he races throughout the dunes, climbing and falling at an alarming rate while you hang onto your life in the back.

Get him to turn the radio to a local station, put it on as loud as you can bear and before you know it, you'll feel like you're in the next instalment of Mad Max.

Have the dunes to yourself on a 4x4 tour.

Taking a break by an oasis as sun falls.

This is what a desert oasis looks like at sunset.

In the quieter moments, when you're not feeling like your heart is about to exit your body, you'll notice gazelles bounding through the brush, or perhaps an oryx will come to drink from one of the many hidden oases.

And at dusk, as you head home, the sunset bounces off the sand, turning the dunes all kinds of wonderful pinks and oranges and purples -- meaning not only do you get your adventure fix, but about 8,000 photos to put on Instagram, as well.

For art

The new Louvre may have opened in neighbouring Abu Dhabi but that doesn't mean Dubai is without an art scene of its very own.

Art lovers should head to Alserkal Avenue in the city's industrial quarter, where they will find a flourishing creative community just begging to be explored.

An exhibition takes up an entire gallery room in Alserkal Avenue.

Good question.

Mirzam chocolate makers.

Here you'll find several private galleries, each with their own distinctive style, as well as other creative pursuits such as a classic car warehouse, a private museum and even a small chocolate factory.

And if all this creativity makes you hungry, you can always pop around to Tom&Serg, a large warehouse-style cafe that wouldn't look out of place in Melbourne's trendiest suburbs. You can even get smashed avo on toast. (Fun fact: co-owner Tom is actually a Melbourne native, so obviously all of this makes sense.)

For history

Dubai isn't an old city, so you're not going to experience the same kind of history here as you would, say, in Europe.

But to get an understanding of the pillars on which Dubai is built, it's worthwhile checking out the Al Fahidi Historial neighbourhood.

Here you can wander through twisting alleyways of paved stone, past mud houses and ornate doors, all the way to the community mosque where men gather five times a day to pray.

You can also observe men and women working at various wares, whether it be carving intricate designs on a buffalo horn or fluffing cotton using a traditional cotton carder.

A man poses with his falcon in the historical Al Fahidi District.

While in the neighbourhood, an absolute must is a visit to The Sheikh Mohammad Centre for Cultural Understanding.

Established in 1988, the SMCCU aims to help visitors better understand the culture and customs of the United Arab Emirates, and will happily answer any of your questions, no matter how ignorant they may seem.

The organisation hosts many activities, including heritage tours and guided mosque visits, but you won't find a better opportunity to embrace Emirati culture than with one of their hosted breakfasts or lunches, where you can enjoy traditional fare in a relaxed and informative setting.

For food and drink

Whether it's fine dining at Sean Connolly at Dubai Opera or hoeing into a takeaway falafel on the side of the road, food is a central part of enjoying Dubai culture, and it's nearly impossible to visit the city without expecting to put on a kilo or two.

For those who want to experience the cuisine like a local, you can't go past a food tour with Frying Pan Adventures. Explore the hustle of Maraqabat Road with your host taking you to the kinds of places not found in the travel guides.

Hands down the best falafel you will ever eat.

Enjoy a falafel sandwich coupled with hummus, pickled vegetables, fried cauliflower and eggplant, slow cooked fava beans and a lathering of toum (garlic ailoi), tatbeela (a green sauce with green chilli peppers, green bell peppers, lemon juice and garlic) and shatta (a spicy red chilli paste) and then you will know the true flavour of the middle east. (You will also wonder what Australia is doing to butcher our falafels, but that's another story for another time).

Head into the back kitchens of local eateries to eat dessert straight from the pan, or sit kerb-side while you enjoy your fatir, which is essentially an Egyptian street pizza, and watch the world go by.

To top of the night, indulge in a bastani; a saffron ice cream coupled with lemon juice and rosewater, before taking a baklava for the road at one of the local specialist bakeries.

Keen for a drink? It's illegal to actually buy alcohol in Dubai, but you can have as many cocktails as you like as long as it's in a resort or hotel. Our pick? Head to Pearl Bar for a view of the Burj Khalifa, and mull over why the hell you haven't visited this place earlier.

Emily Blatchford travelled to Dubai as a guest of Dubai Tourism.
TITLE: Dubai With A Difference: It's Not All Shopping And Theme Parks

TEXT:
CULTURE

iPhone X √® davvero "il pi√π resistente di sempre"? Non provate a rifare questi test di caduta

Apple ha definito i nuovi iPhone 8 e iPhone X "gli smartphone con il vetro pi√π resistente di sempre". La spesa pu√≤ arrivare fino a 1359 euro e naturalmente ci si augura in effetti che il Gorilla Glass 5 che li avvolge non vada in frantumi dopo una caduta accidentale. Per questo i cosiddetti "drop test" vanno alla grande sul web: gli YouTuber pi√π coraggiosi, e con grande seguito, sacrificano uno dei nuovi esemplari riprendendo la sua caduta da almeno due altezze: 1 metro, corrispondente pi√π o meno a una fuoriuscita dalla tasca dei pantaloni, e 1,5 metri, l'altezza a cui si tiene normalmente il dispositivo quando si usa per telefonare. Quello che state vedendo √® uno dei test pi√π cliccati su YouTube dalla data di uscita dell'iPhone X, lo scorso 3 novembre. L'autore del video mette a confronto la caduta dell'iPhone pi√π costoso sul mercato con quella dell'iPhone 8. I risultati ottenuti in questo test, ovviamente, non sanciscono ufficialmente n√© definitivamente la resistenza del nuovo smartphone. Altre prove, sul web, hanno registrato esiti diversi
TITLE: iPhone X √® davvero "il pi√π resistente di sempre"? Non provate a rifare questi test di caduta

TEXT:
POLITIQUE - "√Ä ces ch√¢teaux dans les nuages, il convient de donner des fondations". Jouant de sa caricature de r√™veur utopiste, Beno√Æt Hamon a tent√© de r√©instiller de l'optimisme lors du congr√®s de refondation de son mouvement, le M1717, rebaptis√© "G√©n√©ration.s".

Convaincu que ses id√©es sur le revenu universel, la taxe sur les robots ou encore la lutte contre les perturbateurs endocriniens ont essaim√© en d√©pit de son petit score √† l'√©lection pr√©sidentielle, l'ancien chef de file de l'aile gauche du PS s'est d'ores et d√©j√† positionn√© en vue des √©lections europ√©ennes de 2019, premier scrutin d'ampleur nationale en vue.

"Il faut d√©signer nos adversaires. Qui sont-ils? Le n√©olib√©ralisme et -l'adversaire qui arrange bien le n√©olib√©ralisme- les nationalistes", a plaid√© Beno√Æt Hamon devant ses quelques 2000 sympathisants r√©unis au Mans. S'il n'a pas cit√© de noms, le chef de file de G√©n√©ration.s a n√©anmoins d√©sign√© "le pr√©sident de la R√©publique" comme "le leader n√©olib√©ral fran√ßais et peut-√™tre m√™me europ√©en".

Face √† lui, l'extr√™me droite. "Les n√©olib√©raux adorent n'avoir qu'un adversaire, celui qu'ils ont cr√©√© eux-m√™mes par la soci√©t√© injuste et in√©galitaire qu'ils ont laiss√© se d√©ployer, les nationalistes, les x√©nophobes, les racistes, les antis√©mites, les islamophobes..."

Pour "un bloc europ√©en, transnational et progressiste"

"Le seul combat v√©ritable est de savoir si ce seront eux, les nationalistes, ou nous, qui remplaceront les n√©olib√©raux. La seule bataille pour nous, elle est l√†. C'est le combat le plus essentiel. Et il se nouera tout particuli√®rement l'ann√©e prochaine au moment des √©lections europ√©ennes", a estim√© Beno√Æt Hamon qui propose de "construire une strat√©gie d'un bloc" qui serait √† la fois "europ√©en, transnational, socialiste, √©cologiste, progressiste, f√©ministe".

Choisissant avec pr√©caution ses mots tandis que des cadres de la France insoumise avaient fait le d√©placement en tant qu'observateurs, Beno√Æt Hamon a sembl√© vouloir se d√©marquer de la ligne souverainiste d√©velopp√©e par Jean-Luc M√©lenchon, l√† encore sans jamais le citer.

"Ils nous disent parce que l'Europe est n√©olib√©rale, jetons le n√©olib√©ralisme et de facto jetons l'Europe avec, parce que par nature elle est n√©olib√©rale", a d√©taill√© l'ancien ministre de Fran√ßois Hollande. Avant d'affirmer vouloir apporter la preuve que "on peut vaincre le n√©olib√©ralisme en restant europ√©en et internationaliste".

TITLE: Avec "G√©n√©ration.s", Hamon se cherche en vue des √©lections europ√©ennes de 2019

"Die AfD baut sich ihre eigene Wirklichkeit"Insbesondere in der Fl√ºchtlingspolitik sei das der Fall: "Diese Partei baut sich ihre eigene Wirklichkeit.
CDU-Politiker Kauder sprach sich im Interview mit der "Welt am Sonntag" gegen eine Abschiebung von syrischen Migranten aus.
Im Falle des Familiennachzugs sind etwa die Union, die FDP und die AfD f√ºr die Aussetzung, die Gr√ºnen und die Linke dagegen, die SPD hadert.
Kauder schloss im Interview mit der "Welt am Sonntag" eine Zusammenarbeit von Union und AfD allerdings kategorisch aus: "So wie es bislang keine inhaltliche Zusammenarbeit mit der Linken gegeben hat, wird es nun keine mit der AfD geben."
TEXT:
CDU-Politiker Volker Kauder hat in einem Interview die AfD f√ºr ihren Umgang mit Fakten kritisiert

Angesichts des AfD-Einzugs in den Bundestag appellierte er auch an die eigene Partei

Etwas hat sich ver√§ndert im Bundestag. Das berichten Politiker und Journalisten derzeit √ºbereinstimmend: Der Ton im Parlament sei mit dem Einzug der AfD nach der Bundestagswahl rauer geworden.

Auch der CDU-Fraktionsvorsitzende Volker Kauder spricht im Interview mit der "Welt am Sonntag" dar√ºber, wie sich die Arbeit im Bundestag durch die neue Partei am rechten Rand der Sitzungsordnung gewandelt habe. Schon in den ersten Debatten sei deutlich geworden: "Die AfD nimmt es mit den Fakten nicht immer so genau."

Kein neuer Vorwurf an die AfD-Politiker. Dennoch bekr√§ftigte Kauder: "Wenn das so weitergeht, muss man das noch st√§rker thematisieren."

"Die AfD baut sich ihre eigene Wirklichkeit"

Insbesondere in der Fl√ºchtlingspolitik sei das der Fall: "Diese Partei baut sich ihre eigene Wirklichkeit. Sie fokussiert sich einzig und allein auf das Fl√ºchtlingsthema und sieht fast in jedem, der eine andere Hautfarbe hat, eine Bedrohung", sagte Kauder.

Gerade der Antrag der AfD, syrische Fl√ºchtlinge wieder in ihr Heimatland zu schicken, hatte im Bundestag zuletzt f√ºr Streit gesorgt. Die Rechtspopulisten forderten, dass die Bundesregierung daf√ºr ein Abkommen mit dem syrischen Machthaber Baschar al-Assad eingehen solle. Syrien sei nun sicher, so die Argumentation.

Besonders die Gr√ºnen-Politikerin Luise Amtsberg kritisierte den Antrag mit scharfen Worten. "Mit diesem Antrag geriert die AfD sich als Pressesprecher von Assad", wetterte sie.

Wie sicher ist Syrien?

CDU-Politiker Kauder sprach sich im Interview mit der "Welt am Sonntag" gegen eine Abschiebung von syrischen Migranten aus. "Zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt ist das f√ºr mich angesichts der Sicherheitslage kein Thema", sagte er. Schob allerdings nach: "Nat√ºrlich muss man die Situation immer wieder neu bewerten."

Tats√§chlich berichtete das Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland (RND) diese Woche √ºber einen Antrag des Bundeslandes Sachsen f√ºr die bevorstehende Innenministerkonferenz.

Demnach plane die Union, den eigentlich Ende September 2017 ausgelaufenen Abschiebestopp f√ºr Syrer lediglich bis zum 30. Juni 2018 zu verl√§ngern. Gerade die unionsgef√ºhrten Bundesl√§nder seien daf√ºr, das Land wieder als sicher einzustufen.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Volle Stra√üen, flei√üiger Wiederaufbau: Das steckt hinter den Berichten, dass Syrien wieder sicher ist

Appell an die eigene Partei

Angesichts der AfD im Bundestag richtete Kauder auch einen Appell an die eigenen Reihen: "Die anderen Fraktionen und auch wir m√ºssen die Pr√§senz im Parlament erh√∂hen. Die B√ºrger achten schon darauf, ob rechts au√üen die Reihen gut gef√ºllt sind, aber nicht bei den anderen Fraktionen."

Er fordert also, dass die Bundestagsabgeordneten sich rege - und sichtbar - an den Debatten im Parlament beteiligen. Die AfD hatte in der ersten Sitzungswoche behauptet, die etablierten Parteien seien der Debatte um Bundeswehrs√§tze ferngeblieben. Ein AfD-Abgeordneter twitterte als Beleg ein Foto aus dem Bundestag - das allerdings die Wirklichkeit verzerrte.

Eine weitere Beobachtung der ersten Sitzungswoche in Berlin lautet auch: Die AfD setzt nicht nur auf Fundamentalopposition - sondern stimmt differenzierter ab, als erwartet.

Bei manchen Themen, wie etwa dem Familiennachzug f√ºr subsidi√§r Gesch√ºtzte, ist denkbar, dass es dazu kommt, dass die etablierten Parteien gemeinsam mit der AfD abstimmen. Im Falle des Familiennachzugs sind etwa die Union, die FDP und die AfD f√ºr die Aussetzung, die Gr√ºnen und die Linke dagegen, die SPD hadert. Sollten die Sozialdemokraten dagegen stimmen, k√§me es auf die Stimmen der AfD an.

Kauder schloss im Interview mit der "Welt am Sonntag" eine Zusammenarbeit von Union und AfD allerdings kategorisch aus: "So wie es bislang keine inhaltliche Zusammenarbeit mit der Linken gegeben hat, wird es nun keine mit der AfD geben."

(best)
TITLE: "AfD baut sich ihre eigene Wirklichkeit": CDU-Politiker Kauder erkl√§rt, was sich im Bundestag ver√§ndert hat

SUMMARY:
Let's be honest with each other for a second, there are too many damn shows to watch nowadays.
From intense, thrilling dramas to cooking shows where nothing bad ever really happens, here are 11 shows with one season you can easily binge over the next few weeks.
This series is a real easy binge, you'll be surprised just how quickly you'll burn through the eight episodes trying to get some answers.
It's harrowing, relentless and brutal but it's also one of the year's best, so it's worth the emotional strife you'll probably go through watching it.
It's a ridiculous set-up but after an episode or two you begin to realise you really, really want to know... who drew the dicks?
TEXT:
Let's be honest with each other for a second, there are too many damn shows to watch nowadays. Honestly, it's almost impossible to say up-to-date with all the major hits of the year.

Luckily, with the holiday season almost upon us, there's some time to sit down, tune out the world and catch up on some of those awesome shows you may have missed.

From intense, thrilling dramas to cooking shows where nothing bad ever really happens, here are 11 shows with one season you can easily binge over the next few weeks. Trust us, there's something for everyone here.

'The Sinner'

A young mum, her husband and son are all enjoying a day at the beach. She's stressed and over-tired, she goes for a swim, comes back and stabs a stranger seven times in broad daylight. The authorities know she did it, but they have no idea why. The chilling thing is... neither does she.

This series is a real easy binge, you'll be surprised just how quickly you'll burn through the eight episodes trying to get some answers. Jessica Biel produced and stars in the series as a woman who is just trying to understand the gravity of losing control, and having no idea why she committed such a horrible crime. The show is full of twists, you never know if you can trust what you're seeing, and the end is truly a wild ride.

See it on: Netflix.

'The Big Family Cooking Showdown'

Okay this one is a little different to the slew of dramas out there, but stick with us. If you ever waded into the brilliant territory of 'The Great British Bake Off' and fell in love with the low-stakes non-competitive environment of the tent, you'll love 'The Big Family Cooking Showdown'.

With the same quaint, totally pleasant vibe, 'The Big Family Cooking Showdown' is like a refreshing slice of pie, roast dinner and all that comfort food. Each episode sees two families of three face off in three rounds, the winner moving on to semi finals. Sometimes you just want something completely adorable to take your mind off the waking nightmare of 2017, and the 'Showdown' might be exactly that.

See it on: Netflix.

'Big Little Lies'

By now you've probably heard a bit about HBO's 'Big Little Lies'. With executive producers Reese Witherspoon and Nicole Kidman also co-starring alongside the likes of Laura Dern, Zoe Kravitz, Shailene Woodley and Alexander Skarsgard, the cast lit up the Emmy Awards this year.

The series is based on Liane Moriarty's novel of the same name which was set in Sydney's northern beaches. The series transplants the story to the city of Monterey, California. The series opens with the information that someone is dead, but you don't know who or under what circumstances they died until the very end. It's an incredibly well-crafted drama that puts the lives of several families under the microscope and explores small-town gossip and schoolyard dynamics of over-involved parents.

See it on: Foxtel Now.

'The Handmaid's Tale'

OK to be honest this is a tough one to do a traditional binge-watch with. The utterly sensational series stars Elisabeth Moss in a dystopian future. It's harrowing, relentless and brutal but it's also one of the year's best, so it's worth the emotional strife you'll probably go through watching it.

Set in the near future (sometimes it feels almost TOO near) 'The Handmaid's Tale' depicts a world where fertility rates have plummeted, leaving a handful of the population able to successfully give birth. The United States falls to a totalitarian theocratic regime which forces fertile women to become Handmaids, for "elite" couples. Alongside Moss the cast includes Joseph Fiennes, Yvonne Strahovski, Alexis Bledel, O.T. Fagbenle and Ann Dowd who all, especially Dowd, give fearless performances you won't forget any time soon.

See it on: SBS OnDemand.

'Dear White People'

Based on the film of the same name, this Netflix comedy-drama follows a group of black students at a predominantly white university who each grapple with varied social injustices. The ten-episode series is incredibly binge-worthy, with each episode usually focusing on one student in particular.

The series kicks off with an outspoken student, Samantha White, and her regular radio show 'Dear White People'. The series rubs the wealthy white members of the university's satirical magazine who hold a blackface party to protest Sam's show. The party illuminates the glaring racial prejudices bubbling under the surface of the University and from there things begin to truly unravel.

See it on: Netflix.

'American Gods'

The first season of 'American Gods' may not be quite what you'd expect from the show. Based on the Neil Gaiman novel of the same name, the series imagines a world where the old gods -- brought to America over the years with the many migrants making it their home -- have been forgotten. Replaced by new gods like Media, Roads and Technology, the old gods must fight to survive.

The series follows a man named Shadow Moon who is released early from prison after hearing of his wife's death in a car accident. Travelling home for her funeral he meets a mysterious man who simply goes by the name Mr. Wednesday. Shadow agrees to accompany Wednesday on a journey across the country in an attempt to recruit as many of the old gods who'll join Wednesday's path to war.

See it on: Amazon Prime Video.

'The Other Guy'

One of Stan's recent additions to original comedy, 'The Other Guy' was co-written by and stars Matt Okine. The series follows Okine's character AJ who, after finding out his long-term girlfriend slept with his best friend, has to deal with a breakup and losing a best mate all in one.

The series is funny, but still manages to tug at the heartstrings as AJ flails through the muck of dating, breakups and all the awkwardness in between as well as trying to be a "functional adult" whatever that means.

See it on: Stan.

'Big Mouth'

It's not every day you expect to see an animated series tackle puberty with such, how do we put this, grotesque abandon? 'Big Mouth' comes from the deranged minds of Nick Kroll, Andrew Goldberg, Mark Levin and Jennifer Flackett. An extremely filthy look at growing up and the terrible teenage years of adolescence, 'Big Mouth' features the voice talents of Kroll and his many hilarious friends like John Mulaney, Jenny Slate, Maya Rudolph, Jason Mantzoukas and Jordan Peele.

It won't be for everybody, but if your humour falls more to the filthy side of things, you'll probably find yourself cackling in revolution as the series takes you to places you definitely never wanted to go.

See it on: Netflix.

'Glow'

Named after the "Gorgeous Ladies Of Wrestling" from the '80s, Netflix's comedy-drama 'GLOW' features all the spandex and piledrivers you could ask for. Based on the actual women's wrestling circuit that started in the '80s, 'GLOW' follows a group of fictitious women who happen to fall into the world of women's wrestling.

The series centers around Ruth, a struggling actress played by Alison Brie, who is attempting a career move when all of a sudden who should show up in the ring but her ex-best friend Debbie. It's not only a blast for anyone looking for a bingeable show, but wrestling fans need to keep their eyes peeled for a bunch of cameos.

See it on: Netflix.

'American Vandal'

You've probably heard of those incredible true crime stories that take the world by storm. First there was 'Serial', then 'Making a Murderer' and now get ready for the pitch-perfect parody of all that: 'American Vandal'.

The series is genius, working both as an incredible parody of a genre Netflix really perfected but takes it one step further. A high school is rocked with a shock act of vandalism when 27 faculty cars are spray-painted with giant dicks. Despite all signs pointing to student Dylan Maxwell, two other students launch their own investigation docuseries. It's a ridiculous set-up but after an episode or two you begin to realise you really, really want to know... who drew the dicks?

See it on: Netflix.

'Star Trek: Discovery'

You might have seen the news that a totally new 'Star Trek' series was coming out and shrugged so hard you almost went into orbit, and we're not here to judge you for that. But, if you're looking for a new series to dive into, 'Discovery' isn't a bad place to look.

Firstly it's a prequel series, set about a decade before the events of the original series and has nothing to do story-wise with the movies that have come out so you can go in knowing absolutely nothing about the whole 'Star Trek' universe. The series is surprising, there are several great twists we're not going to spoil but it's also just a completely gorgeous show to watch, the cinematography and design is out of this world, pun intended. Seriously, space has never looked this good.

See it on: Netflix.

One
TITLE: 11 Shows With Just One Season You Can Easily Binge Over The Holidays

Nous avons choisi 3 livres qui se compl√®tent: un sur l'ambiance de No√´l, le second sur le p√®re No√´l et le dernier, que nous avions d√©j√†, sous forme d'imagerie.
On lui explique qu'elle peut faire sa lettre au p√®re No√´l et qu'il am√®ne des cadeaux aux enfants sages.
Voil√† un petit avant-go√ªt de notre programme pour faire d√©couvrir √† Tess la magie de No√´l.

TEXT:
On y est! On entre dans cette douce p√©riode avant No√´l o√π la magie prend place, les c≈ìurs se r√©chauffent √† coup de chocolat et marrons chauds, les d√©corations illuminent notre quotidien, le p√¥le nord n'aura jamais re√ßu autant de courrier.

Ce n'est pas le premier No√´l de Tess (ma fille, NDLR), elle avait alors 10 mois et demi, a eu beaucoup de cadeaux et a m√™me pris plaisir √† les d√©baller. Mais cette ann√©e, c'est diff√©rent. C'est son premier No√´l "conscient". C'est le premier No√´l o√π la magie doit l'emporter et o√π le P√®re-No√´l apportera les cadeaux pendant la nuit (hors de question donc de d√©poser quoique ce soit le 24 au soir au pied du sapin).

Mais alors, comment expliquer √† nos enfants ce qu'est No√´l? Quelles valeurs et traditions leur transmettre? Quand sont-ils capables de comprendre?

Tess aura 22 mois et demi au moment de No√´l. Cela fait maintenant plusieurs mois que nous remarquons qu'elle nous comprend tr√®s bien m√™me sur des donn√©es abstraites. Nous pensons donc qu'elle est tout √† fait en √¢ge et apte √† comprendre ce qu'est No√´l. Cette ann√©e est quand m√™me particuli√®re car elle n'a pas de souvenir sur lesquels s'appuyer. Nous allons donc y aller tout doucement et √† son rythme. Elle n'int√®grera s√ªrement pas tout mais d√®s l'ann√©e prochaine, je suis certaine que ce sera plus facile.

Nous avons fait le choix de parler du P√®re-No√´l et de faire croire en lui en cr√©ant toute la magie qu'il y a autour. Ce sont de tr√®s bons souvenirs d'enfance pour moi et je ne me voyais donc pas priver Tess de cette croyance.

S'appuyer sur les livres de No√´l

Pour la petite histoire, nous sommes all√©s choisir les livres sur No√´l avec Tess. J'ai demand√© √† Monsieur Bob d'en trouver sur la th√©matique et finalement, c'est Tess qui a trouv√© le rayon et nous a amen√© les premiers livres en nous disant "No√´l". On a vraiment √©t√© surpris sur le coup! Elle connaissait d√©j√† No√´l? Apr√®s enqu√™te, elle a vu un P√®re-No√´l 10 minutes un soir chez nounou et √ßa a suffi pour qu'elle s'en souvienne. Elle est donc d√©finitivement capable de comprendre et reconna√Ætre la magie de No√´l.

Nous avons choisi 3 livres qui se compl√®tent: un sur l'ambiance de No√´l, le second sur le p√®re No√´l et le dernier, que nous avions d√©j√†, sous forme d'imagerie.

Le calendrier de l'avent

Qui n'a jamais eu son calendrier de l'Avent? Je dois vous avouer quelque chose... Monsieur Bob continue √† m'en offrir un chaque ann√©e et j'adore! Alors hors de question que Tess n'en ait pas cette ann√©e. Elle ne mange pas encore de chocolat alors nous avons choisi le calendrier de l'Avent Playmobil. Elle adore jouer avec ces petites figurines (pour la grande joie de maman) et nous sommes persuad√©s que cela lui plaira et lui permettra d'attendre sagement No√´l.

Les catalogues de jouets

Quelle ne fut pas notre surprise quand nous nous sommes rendus compte que Tess, √† tout juste 21 mois, √©tait passionn√©e par les catalogues de jouets... Si nous ne l'avons pas lu 10 fois √† la place de l'histoire du soir, nous ne l'avons jamais ouvert! Elle adore reconna√Ætre les jouets qu'elle a d√©j√† ou qu'elle a rep√©r√© en magasin. On lui explique qu'elle peut faire sa lettre au p√®re No√´l et qu'il am√®ne des cadeaux aux enfants sages. On ne fera pas de lettre cette ann√©e, je la trouve encore trop jeune pour y prendre part mais on n'y manquera pas √† No√´l prochain!

La d√©coration

Je suis d√©j√† impatiente de mettre toute la d√©coration de No√´l en place avec Tess. Comme tous les ans, nous allons d√©corer notre joli sapin mais cette ann√©e, je voudrais √©galement investir dans une cr√®che, une couronne de houx et d'autres d√©corations. Et pourquoi pas faire participer Tess dans la fabrication de petits objets? J'aurais bien tent√© la p√¢te √† sel mais pour le moment, elle en a peur... En tous cas, elle va en d√©corer des maisons: sa marraine a d√©j√† pr√©vu de la kidnapper pour avoir 2 petites mains suppl√©mentaires.

Les gourmandises de No√´l

Les papilles de Tess ont d√©j√† eu un avant go√ªt des gourmandises de No√´l et elle adore!! Nous sommes devenus des inconditionnels des petits sabl√©s, une premi√®re pour moi √©galement (et merci Lftrouck pour la recette!). La semaine derni√®re, nous avons √©galement pris nos premiers marrons chauds en centre ville de Lille. C'est mon p√™ch√© mignon de l'hiver et je crois bien que Tess est partie pour suivre les bons go√ªts de sa maman... Nous allons profiter des f√™tes pour lui faire d√©couvrir plein de nouvelles saveurs et textures, j'esp√®re que √ßa lui plaira.

Voil√† un petit avant-go√ªt de notre programme pour faire d√©couvrir √† Tess la magie de No√´l. On improvisera au fur et √† mesure et j'esp√®re qu'elle en gardera quelques petits souvenirs. Je reviens prochainement te parler de notre wish-list pour No√´l et te raconter comment nous f√™terons les f√™tes de fin d'ann√©es chez nous cette ann√©e. Et toi, comment pr√©pares-tu No√´l avec tes petits-bouts?

Ce billet est √©galement publi√© sur le blog de Madame Bobette.

(Le nom de l'auteur a √©t√© modifi√© √† sa demande)

TITLE: Mes 5 conseils pour expliquer No√´l √† ma fille

TEXT:
El presidente estadounidense Donald Trump neg√≥ el domingo que haya pedido al anterior director del FBI, James Comey, que cerrara una investigaci√≥n sobre su exasesor de seguridad nacional Michael Flynn, como el New York Times public√≥ en mayo.

Flynn se declar√≥ culpable el viernes de haberle mentido al FBI sobre sus conversaciones con el embajador de Rusia, un acontecimiento extraordinario en la investigaci√≥n del abogado especial Robert Mueller sobre la interferencia rusa en las elecciones de 2016.

"Yo nunca ped√≠ a Comey que parara de investigar a Flynn. S√≥lo (es) otra Noticia Falsa cubriendo otra mentira de Comey".



Trump hab√≠a insistido el s√°bado en que su equipo de campa√±a no se coludi√≥ con Mosc√∫ en las elecciones estadounidenses del a√±o pasado, y culp√≥ al Departamento de Justicia y a su rival Hillary Clinton.

TEXT:
Polemiche sui social networks per un cartellone pubblicitario di Pandora apparso alla fermata della metropolitana Duomo a Milano. Questa la scritta che sta facendo infuriare moltissimi utenti, soprattutto donne ma non solo. "Un ferro da stiro, un pigiama, un grembiule, un bracciale Pandora. Secondo te cosa la farebbe felice?"

Il manifesto ‚Äì che riesce a mettere in fila alcuni dei pi√π gretti stereotipi sul genere femminile ‚Äì non √® passato inosservato a Lefanfarlo, organizzazione no-profit che si occupa di "burlesque, vita e donne" e su Facebook si presenta cos√¨: "Abbiamo un cervello e un reggicalze. E non abbiamo paura di usarli. Entrambi".

"Non potevamo crederci, ma purtroppo √® tutto vero", scrivono Lefanfarlo su Fb. "La nostra Laki Hancock ha scattato questa foto a Milano, MM1 Duomo uscita via Torino. Cara PANDORA, Lefanfarlo per Natale vorrebbero soprattutto rispetto, piuttosto che un bel bracciale. E voi amiche cosa vi aspettate di trovare sotto l'albero? Un ferro da stiro oppure un grembiule?". Con tanto di hashtag: #pandora #tristezza #pandoraepicfail #epicfail

Sono in molti a condividere la foto su Twitter puntando il dito contro un "Copywriter da arresto".

Copywriter da arresto.



(Ma anche volendo, chi osa regalare un grembiule da cucina?)#Pandora pic.twitter.com/E1Sxrb7PTb ‚Äî Irene Bo (@Eneriry) 2 dicembre 2017

Pi√π tardi, sulla pagina Facebook ufficiale di Pandora, arriva il chiarimento: "Abbiamo notato che il messaggio a volte √® stato frainteso, per questo vogliamo raccontarvelo meglio". Dunque la spiegazione: "Quante di noi a Natale hanno ricevuto qualcosa di non gradito? Questa iniziativa nasce proprio da una ricerca che ha evidenziato come la maggior parte delle donne a Natale riceva sempre il regalo sbagliato. Tutte insieme, quindi, diciamo NO a pigiami, ciabatte e frullatori ma S√å ai gioielli che amiamo. Auguriamo a tutte voi di ricevere proprio ci√≤ che pi√π desiderate".
TITLE: Pandora √® riuscita a mettere in un unico manifesto i pi√π gretti stereotipi femminili. La rete sentenzia: #EpicFail

", s'est d√©fendu Donald Trump au petit matin, dans le premier d'une salve de tweets critiquant la police f√©d√©rale avec une virulence in√©dite pour un pr√©sident am√©ricain.

Il avait alors bien tent√© de maintenir l'attention sur la r√©forme fiscale adopt√©e la veille au S√©nat, premi√®re grande victoire l√©gislative r√©publicaine depuis son arriv√©e √† la Maison Blanche, √† m√™me de faire oublier l'√©chec cuisant de la r√©forme de la sant√©.
TEXT:
Donald Trump a lanc√© dimanche une violente contre-attaque contre le FBI, apr√®s son faux pas de la veille laissant entendre qu'il savait de longue date que son ancien conseiller √† la s√©curit√© nationale, inculp√© dans l'affaire russe, avait menti √† la police f√©d√©rale.

"Je n'ai jamais demand√© √† Comey d'abandonner l'enqu√™te sur Flynn. Encore de fausses informations couvrant un autre mensonge de Comey!", s'est d√©fendu Donald Trump au petit matin, dans le premier d'une salve de tweets critiquant la police f√©d√©rale avec une virulence in√©dite pour un pr√©sident am√©ricain.

I never asked Comey to stop investigating Flynn. Just more Fake News covering another Comey lie! ‚Äî Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) December 3, 2017

Lors d'une audition sous serment d√©but juin devant le S√©nat, l'ancien directeur du FBI James Comey --brutalement limog√© par le pr√©sident-- avait affirm√© que Donald Trump lui avait personnellement demand√© d'enterrer l'enqu√™te visant Michael Flynn.

Ce dernier a plaid√© coupable vendredi d'avoir notamment menti aux enqu√™teurs, plongeant le premier cercle de l'entourage de Donald Trump au coeur de l'enqu√™te du procureur sp√©cial Robert Mueller sur l'ing√©rence de Moscou dans la pr√©sidentielle am√©ricaine de 2016 et une possible entente entre l'√©quipe de l'homme d'affaires et le Kremlin.

Or dans un tweet qui a fait sensation, le pr√©sident a √©crit samedi: "J'ai d√ª limoger le g√©n√©ral Flynn parce qu'il a menti au vice-pr√©sident et au FBI", laissant entendre par cette formulation qu'il √©tait au courant des mensonges quand il avait demand√©, selon James Comey, au patron du FBI d'abandonner l'enqu√™te.

I had to fire General Flynn because he lied to the Vice President and the FBI. He has pled guilty to those lies. It is a shame because his actions during the transition were lawful. There was nothing to hide! ‚Äî Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) December 2, 2017

L'avocat personnel de Donald Trump, John Dowd, a ensuite affirm√© aux m√©dias que c'est lui qui avait r√©dig√© ce message pour d√©douaner le pr√©sident. La Maison Blanche a par le pass√© soulign√© que les tweets de Donald Trump avaient valeur de communiqu√©s officiels.

La s√©natrice d√©mocrate Dianne Feinstein, membre de la puissante commission du Renseignement au coeur de l'enqu√™te russe, n'a pas √©t√© convaincue par ces arguments: "Je pense que ce qui est en train de se dessiner est un cas d'entrave √† la justice", a-t-elle affirm√© sur la cha√Æne NBC.

'R√©putation en lambeaux'

S'appuyant ensuite sur la nouvelle, tomb√©e samedi, qu'un des principaux enqu√™teurs du FBI charg√©s du dossier russe --et pr√©c√©demment de l'enqu√™te sur les courriels de Hillary Clinton, class√©e sans suite-- avait √©t√© √©cart√© du dossier apr√®s des messages le critiquant, Donald Trump a lanc√© plusieurs violents coups de boutoir contre la police f√©d√©rale.

"Apr√®s des ann√©es de Comey, avec l'enqu√™te bidon et malhonn√™te sur Clinton (et plus), √† la t√™te du FBI, sa r√©putation est en lambeaux - la pire de l'Histoire! Mais n'ayez crainte, nous lui rendrons sa grandeur", a poursuivi le pr√©sident am√©ricain.

After years of Comey, with the phony and dishonest Clinton investigation (and more), running the FBI, its reputation is in Tatters - worst in History! But fear not, we will bring it back to greatness. ‚Äî Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) December 3, 2017

L'enqu√™te sur les courriels de Hillary Clinton avait secou√© la campagne pr√©sidentielle de 2016, motivant Donald Trump et ses supporteurs, dont Michael Flynn, √† demander, aux cris de "Enfermez-la", qu'elle soit condamn√©e et emprisonn√©e. En vain.

"+UN AGENT DU FBI ANTI-TRUMP A MENE L'ENQUETE CLINTON+ Maintenant tout commence √† s'expliquer", a encore ass√©n√© le pr√©sident, √† propos de cet enqu√™teur, Peter Strzok, l'un des plus exp√©riment√©s dans les services de contre-espionnage du FBI et qui a √©t√©, cet √©t√©, r√©assign√© aux ressources humaines, selon le New York Times.

Report: "ANTI-TRUMP FBI AGENT LED CLINTON EMAIL PROBE" Now it all starts to make sense! ‚Äî Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) December 3, 2017

'Tr√®s haut responsable'

Washington avait √©t√© secou√© vendredi matin par la nouvelle que Michael Flynn avait plaid√© coupable notamment d'avoir menti sur ses conversations avec l'ambassadeur de Russie aux Etats-Unis puis accept√© de coop√©rer avec la justice.

M. Flynn a surtout confirm√© √† l'accusation avoir ponctuellement agi sur les instructions d'un "tr√®s haut responsable" de l'√©quipe de transition pr√©sidentielle qui n'est autre, selon plusieurs m√©dias am√©ricain, que Jared Kushner, gendre et proche conseiller de Donald Trump.

Puisqu'ils sont intervenus apr√®s la victoire de l'homme d'affaires en novembre 2016, ces contacts avec l'ambassadeur de Russie ne confortent pas la th√®se d'une concertation entre Moscou et l'entourage du candidat pour influencer le scrutin.

Mais Michael Flynn pourrait fournir de nouvelles informations aux enqu√™teurs. Et si Robert Mueller parvenait √† prouver une collusion avec la Russie ou une entrave √† la justice --comme le laisse entendre le t√©moignage de James Comey-- une proc√©dure de destitution ne pourrait √™tre exclue pour le 45e pr√©sident des Etats-Unis.

R√©forme fiscale √©clips√©e

Samedi, Donald Trump avait toutefois assur√© n'√™tre pas inquiet de ce que pourrait r√©v√©ler Michael Flynn et r√©affirm√© qu'il n'y avait eu "aucune collusion" de son √©quipe de campagne avec la Russie lorsqu'il briguait la Maison Blanche.

Il avait alors bien tent√© de maintenir l'attention sur la r√©forme fiscale adopt√©e la veille au S√©nat, premi√®re grande victoire l√©gislative r√©publicaine depuis son arriv√©e √† la Maison Blanche, √† m√™me de faire oublier l'√©chec cuisant de la r√©forme de la sant√©.

Mais ses d√©clarations et l'avalanche de tweets √©clipsaient largement dimanche cette refonte historique du code des imp√¥ts.

SUMMARY:
WINNIPEG ‚Äî Sandra Houston was looking for Christmas gifts for her grandchildren when she heard yelling coming from the checkout aisle at a Winnipeg Toys "R" Us store.
She spotted a security guard tussling with a suspected shoplifter near the exit door.
Toys 'R' Us apologizedToys "R" Us has apologized and the guard has been fired.

TEXT:
WINNIPEG ‚Äî Sandra Houston was looking for Christmas gifts for her grandchildren when she heard yelling coming from the checkout aisle at a Winnipeg Toys "R" Us store.

She spotted a security guard tussling with a suspected shoplifter near the exit door. The pair ‚Äî both women ‚Äî were punching, pulling hair and slapping each other, she said.

After a few minutes, she said the guard pulled a knife from her back pocket.

"You could see the knife plain as day," Houston recalled Friday.

She said many shoppers, some with children in tow, put down the toys they were carrying and walked away. Houston grabbed her husband's cellphone and started filming.

Employee intervened

"You can't use that knife!" she screamed.

An employee at the store soon intervened, she said.

"He grabbed that (knife) from her and ... he put it in a bin right beside the door."

Houston said the shoplifter got away but the woman had already dropped most of the items she had with her. Police officers later arrived and are investigating.

Houston said it was a scary experience.

"I'm glad my grandchildren weren't with me."

Toys 'R' Us apologized

Toys "R" Us has apologized and the guard has been fired.

Company spokesman Clint Gaudry said in an emailed statement that guards, provided by a separate security firm, are stationed in some of its store locations across Canada to provide a visual presence to "deter delinquent behaviour."

"Unfortunately, in this instance, the security guard did not follow proper protocols and attempted to intervene during an attempted theft," he said. "We apologize to our customers who witnessed the altercation."

ESM personnel are not permitted to carry any form of weapon or anything that can be perceived as a weapon.

ESM Security Solutions, the company that employed the guard, said she was immediately suspended and fired after an internal review.

"ESM personnel are not permitted to carry any form of weapon or anything that can be perceived as a weapon," spokesman Bikram Daulay said in a statement.

"We are reviewing internal practices and taking immediate measures to reinforce our protocols and ensure a similar incident does not occur."

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Security Guard Fired After Pulling Out Knife In Winnipeg Toys 'R' Us
