TEXT:
Der geb√ºrtige Pf√§lzer Ramazan Demir ist muslimischer Gef√§ngnis-Seelsorger in √ñsterreich. Der Umgang mit Extremisten geh√∂rt f√ºr ihn zum Alltag. Viele von ihnen sind √ºberzeugt, dass ihnen die Religion es gebiete, sogenannte Ungl√§ubige zu t√∂ten. Und viele von ihnen hat Demir umstimmen k√∂nnen, wie er sagt. Mit der simplen Frage: "Wo genau im Koran steht denn diese Vorschrift?"

Adam (Namen aller Beteiligten ge√§ndert) war mein erster Schwerverbrecher. 19 Jahre alt, drahtig, blass. M√∂rder seiner Schwester Esra. √úberzeugt, dass seine t√∂dlichen Messerstiche vom Islam gedeckt waren - schlie√ülich hat Esra mit einem Mann geschlafen, mit dem sie nicht verheiratet war.

Ich bin der Leiter aller Gef√§ngnis-Imame f√ºr √ñsterreich und zusammen mit weiteren ehrenamtlichen Kollegen zust√§ndig f√ºr die Seelsorge an den 2044 Muslimen unter den 9500 Gefangenen im Land.

Ich wollte nie Gef√§ngnis-Imam werden

Eigentlich wollte ich diesen Beruf nie aus√ºben. Ich hatte wie wohl die meisten Menschen Scheu vor dem Gef√§ngnis, vor den Menschen, die ich dort treffen w√ºrde. Vor sieben Jahren - ich war in meinem letzten Semester Islam-Studium an der Islamischen Akademie in Wien -

habe ich mich dann von einem Kollegen breitschlagen lassen, mir √ñsterreichs gr√∂√ütes Gef√§ngnis, Wien Josefstadt, wenigstens einmal zu besuchen. Und habe gesehen, wie sehr die Arbeit dort n√∂tig ist.

Adam war √ºberzeugt davon, dass die t√∂dlichen Messerstiche richtig waren. Warum? "Weil es der Islam verlangt." Sicher? "Mein Opa hat gesagt, ich muss sie umbringen. Er betet immer, also muss er sich mit dem Islam ja auskennen."

Adam, der Schwesterm√∂rder

Nachdem Adam beschlossen hatte, sich mir zu √∂ffnen, hat es 20 Minuten gedauert, ihm zu erkl√§ren, dass das, was er beschrieb, die Interpretation einer √ºberkommenen Tradition war, nicht der Religion. Dass das, was er getan hatte, definitiv nicht islamisch war.

Adam war v√∂llig zerst√∂rt. Er hat nur noch geweint. Er hat erst dann wirklich verstanden, dass seine zwei Jahre √§ltere Schwester nicht mehr da war. "Und ich bin der Schuldige. Ich habe sie umgebracht."

Es ist f√ºrchterlich, wozu Unwissenheit f√ºhren kann. Deshalb habe ich mich entschieden, das, was ich in der Betreuung Hunderter Muslime im Knast erlebt habe, nicht f√ºr mich zu behalten, sondern anonymisiert zu ver√∂ffentlichen.

Mansur, der IS-Sympathisant

Mansur ist einer von den vielen Radikalen, mit denen ich zu tun habe. Er war mir aufgefallen bei den gemeinsamen Gebeten, weil er sich gar so abkapselte. Ich habe gefragt, ob er allein mit mir reden will. Er wollte.

Wie immer musste ich erst einmal Vertrauen aufbauen. Wir redeten √ºber seinen Prozess, den Knast, das √úbliche. Pl√∂tzlich beugte er sich √ºber den Tisch in diesem kleinen Zimmer, in dem wir allein waren. Und sagte:

Sobald er wieder drau√üen ist, wird er runterfahren nach Syrien, um mit dem IS zu k√§mpfen. Wie er es schon einmal getan hatte. Denn nur der IS sei wirklich islamisch. Warum er das glaube? Sein Cousin habe ihm das gesagt. Der kenne den Koran. Da stehe, man m√ºsse Ungl√§ubige t√∂ten.

Ich habe ihn gebeten, mir die Stelle zu zeigen. Er konnte es nicht. Also habe ich ihm, die von ihm falsch √ºbersetzte und interpretierte Stelle, gezeigt. Und ich habe ihn auf die Stelle hingewiesen, in der steht, dass derjenige, der einen anderen t√∂tet, so handelt, als t√∂te er alle Menschen. Er kannte sie nicht.

Letztlich habe ich erreicht, dass er nicht in den Krieg gezogen ist. Er hat gelernt, den Islam, so wie er ist, als Friedensbotschaft zu verinnerlichen.

Die Mitl√§ufer haben keine Ahnung von ihrer Religion

In den Tausenden Stunden, die ich nun Muslime im Gef√§ngnis betreut habe, ist mir wieder und wieder aufgefallen, dass die meisten, die sich auff√ºhren, als h√§tten sie die Heilige Schrift selbst verfasst, keinen blassen Schimmer davon haben.

Der Koran ist das pure, unkommentierte Wort Gottes. Was nicht hei√üt, dass er deswegen immer w√∂rtlich zu nehmen w√§re. Man muss die historischen Bez√ºge verstehen, um ihn zeitgem√§√ü deuten zu k√∂nnen.

Dazu muss man die Sunna kennen - das, was Prophet Mohammed wirklich getan und gesagt hat. Nat√ºrlich ist es gut 1400 Jahre sp√§ter eine Herausforderung die Authentizit√§t zu √ºberpr√ºfen. Muslime haben daf√ºr Abertausende Hadithe, √úberlieferungen √ºber Mohammeds Wirken. Manche von Mohammeds Taten sind durch eine Vielzahl historischer Quellen gut belegt, zu anderen gibt es schwache und l√ºckenhafte √úberlieferungen, die mit allergr√∂√üter Vorsicht zu genie√üen sind.

Wer sich damit nicht auskennt, f√§llt leicht auf Hassprediger herein. Die missbrauchen die Terminologie und picken einzelne S√§tze aus dem Koran heraus und geben sie in anderem Kontext wider. Adam und Mansur haben diese Art von Giftk√∂der geschluckt. Wie viele andere auch.

Freie Bahn f√ºr Hassprediger

Wenn zum religi√∂sen Unwissen dann noch soziale Probleme kommen, haben Hassprediger ganz leichtes Spiel:

Das k√∂nnen Traumata aus Kriegen sein, wie bei Mansur aus Tschetschenien. Oder Identit√§tsprobleme und die Suche nach Anerkennung, weil sie ohne Vater aufwachsen und sich Ersatz-V√§ter suchen. Oder Anti-Islam-Kampagnen wie die von der AfD in Deutschland oder der FP√ñ in √ñsterreich. Sie sehen, dass sie hier gehasst werden und fragen sich, wo sie denn zuhause sind, wo sie nicht mehr als Nichtsnutze gemobbt werden.

Und dann kommen die Extremisten, die sie verblenden. Und das Schlaraffenland im IS-Gebiet versprechen. Sie erz√§hlen den jungen M√§nnern vom Schlaraffenland dort, denn die verlassenen Villen der Reichen in Syrien, die d√ºrften jetzt sie bewohnen.

Deswegen w√§re es so wichtig, dass Muslime guten Religionsunterricht bekommen. Damit sie lernen zwischen Religi√∂sen und Radikalen zu unterscheiden, zwischen Kultur, Tradition und Religion.

Deswegen w√§re es so wichtig, dass Politik und Medien nicht alle Muslime in einen Topf werfen und mit Paranoia auf sie reagieren und sie aus der Gesellschaft ausschlie√üen.

Amr hasst mich, weil ich f√ºr den Staat arbeite

Viele Experten warnen, dass sich viele Muslime erst im Gef√§ngnis so richtig radikalisieren. Aus meiner Erfahrung kann ich sagen: Das stimmt.

Im Gef√§ngnis sind alle Insassen in einer besonders heiklen sozialen Situation, also besonders anf√§llig f√ºr radikale Leader-Typen - von ihnen gibt es einige im Knast.

Als Imam versuche ich, diese Leader von ihrem radikalen Kurs abzubringen. So weit das eben geht, wenn man als Imam in der gr√∂√üten Justizanstalt √ñsterreichs √ºber 300 muslimische H√§ftlinge betreuen soll. Und das noch ehrenamtlich. Unfassbar.

Aber wenn die Leader schon Anerkennung von einer Gruppe deswegen bekommen haben und nun das Gesicht wahren wollen, wird es extrem schwierig.

Amr aus Tschetschenien war so einer. Er sagte mir, ich sei "die Pest", weil ich als Gef√§ngnis-Imam f√ºr den Staat arbeite. Leute wie ich st√ºnden beim IS auf der Todesliste. Ich habe wieder und wieder mit ihm gesprochen und fragte irgendwann, ob er mich besch√ºtzen w√ºrde, wenn jemand k√§me, um mich zu t√∂ten. "Warum sollte ich wenn er doch recht hat?", sagte er.

Damals lief es mir kalt den R√ºcken herunter. Heute wei√ü ich, wie bitter ernst es IS-Sympathisanten ist, mich loszuwerden.

Warnung, dass ich kaltgemacht werden soll

Musa, ein anderer tschetschenischer H√§ftling und Ex-IS-K√§mpfer, dessen Vertrauen ich gewonnen hatte, lie√ü mir eine Warnung zukommen: Seine Landsleute w√ºrden mich kaltmachen, wenn sie freik√§men.

Musa war dabei, wenn IS-Schergen ihre Gegner an das Heck eines Gel√§ndewagens gebunden und durch eine Stadt geschleift haben. Er war bei vielen Gr√§ueltaten in Syrien dabei. Er wei√ü also, wovon er spricht.

Erst k√ºrzlich hat der √∂sterreichische Verfassungsschutz die Islamische Glaubensgemeinschaft in √ñsterreich dar√ºber informiert, dass die offizielle Zeitschrift des IS dazu aufgerufen hat, alle Imame der Unislamischen Glaubensgemeinschaft in √ñsterreich zu ermorden. Freunde teilten mir mit, ich solle "aus der Schusslinie" verschwinden.

Aber ich will meine Arbeit weitermachen. Ich muss es tun, um der Insassen willen, bei denen ich noch etwas ausrichten kann, und um der Gesellschaft willen.

Die Sache mit der Schweigepflicht

Leute wie Amr kann ich schwer umstimmen. Aber ich kann verhindern, dass er andere radikalisiert.

Ich unterliege als Gef√§ngnis-Imam der Schweigepflicht. Ohne das Vertrauen, das ich dadurch genie√üe, w√§re meine Arbeit wertlos. Deswegen spreche ich sowohl gegen√ºber den Justizbeamten als auch √∂ffentlich nur anonymisiert √ºber das, was ich in den Vier-Augen-Gespr√§chen erfahre.

Was ich in F√§llen wie von Amr aber machen kann: Ich kann der Anstaltsleitung sagen, dass sie so jemanden wie Amr nicht mit anderen Muslimen eine Zelle setzen d√ºrfen.

Der Typ, der auf Amerikaner schie√üen wollte

Ein Insasse sagte, sobald er drau√üen ist, w√ºrde er einen Amerikaner erschie√üen. Es war einer der F√§lle, in denen ich es mit meinen Gewissen nicht vereinbaren konnte zu schweigen, solche Angst hatte ich um die Menschen da drau√üen.

Ich musste und konnte jedoch erreichen, seine Augen zu √∂ffnen. Vertrauen aufbauen und die eigene Einsicht des Gegen√ºber f√∂rdern, Verschw√∂rungstheorien und Vorurteile beseitigen, Aufkl√§rung √ºber die falsche Sichtweise des Islam, all das ist f√ºr die Deradikalisierung von gro√üer Bedeutung.

Ich m√∂chte mit meiner Geschichte keine Panik sch√ºren. Aber ich m√∂chte klar machen: Die Bedeutung von Religion nimmt in Haft zu und wenn die Imame nicht vor Ort sind, um die religi√∂sen Bed√ºrfnisse der Muslime zu stillen, dann √ºbernehmen Mith√§ftlinge diese Aufgabe und sorgen daf√ºr, dass die Gef√§ngnisse eine Brutst√§tte f√ºr Radikalisierung sind.

Der Text wurde von Susanne Klaiber aufgezeichnet.

Ramazan Demir ist Autor des Buchs: "Unter Extremisten. Ein Gef√§ngnisseelsorger blickt in die Seelen radikaler Muslime."
TITLE: Als Gef√§ngnis-Imam habe ich schon viele Extremisten gestoppt. Mit einer simplen Frage

TEXT:
Ein 70-j√§hriger Patient hat amerikanische √Ñrzte verwirrt - diese wollten den Mann wiederbeleben

Doch der trug ein Tattoo auf der Brust, das seine Wiederbelebung verhinderte

Im Video oben: Eigentlich ist es nur ein Satzzeichen, aber dieses winzige Tattoo rettet Leben

Es klingt zun√§chst fast zu absurd, um wahr zu sein: Im US-Bundesstaat Florida hat das Tattoo eines Patienten daf√ºr gesorgt, dass √Ñrzte ihn haben sterben lassen. Dar√ºber berichtet das Fachmagazin "The New England Journal of Medicine".

Ein 70-j√§hriger Mann sei demnach bewusstlos in ein Krankenhaus in Miami eingeliefert worden. Er habe an einer Infektion gelitten, die einen septischen Schock und letztlich Organversagen zur Folge haben kann, berichtet das Magazin.

Die √Ñrzte der Jackson Memorial Klinik h√§tten sofort damit begonnen, den Unbekannten wiederzubeleben.

Doch dann sei ihnen das gro√ü Tattoo auf seiner Brust aufgefallen. Die Botschaft dort: "Do Not Resuscitate". Auf deutsch: "Nicht wiederbeleben".

Der Autor des "The New England Journal of Medicine" berichtet:

"Der t√§towierte Wunsch dieses Patienten f√ºhrte zu mehr Verwirrung als Klarheit." Das Krankenhauspersonal h√§tte Bedenken gehabt: War der Wunsch rechtlich bindend? Oder ging das Tattoo auf eine betrunkene Nacht zur√ºck?

Der Patient durfte schlie√ülich sterben

Die √Ñrzte h√§tten den t√§towierten Wunsch des Mannes schlie√ülich nicht einfach so ignorieren wollen und nach seinen Angeh√∂rige gesucht. Ohne Erfolg.

Schlie√ülich sei eine offizielle Patientenverf√ºgung aufgetaucht, die der Mann beim Gesundheitsamt hinterlegt hatte. Somit sei der Fall klar gewesen: Der 70 Jahre alte Mann durfte sterben und wurde nicht wiederbelebt.

SUMMARY:
Nietzsche diceva che non bisogna mai prestare ascolto a un pensiero che viene in mente quando non si √® in cammino.
Le idee sono delle visioni, non sono concetti che si pensano e che si elaborano: sono qualcosa che si impone alla vista, anche se li si guarda con gli occhi interiori.
Ma non √® contro la corrente vitale del mondo, l'energia che si dispiega nella storia e chiede senso, giustizia, bellezza.
Dio √® la forza che guida la corrente e la meta verso cui la corrente si dirige.
C'√® il rischio che il treno della Chiesa si spezzi.
TEXT:
A Carate Brianza, si sentiva in esilio: "Mio padre e mia madre erano emigrati dalla Sicilia poco prima che nascessi. Andavo a scuola in provincia di Monza e gi√† quando i professori facevano l'appello in classe sentivo che c'era qualcosa che non andava. Io mi chiamo Vito Mancuso. Il mio nome e cognome evocano prepotentemente il sud. Invece, crescevo nella Brianza bianchissima degli anni sessanta. Mi sentivo fuori posto e diverso. Avvertivo su di me il razzismo, la diffidenza di certa gente. Credo che dalla lacerazione tra ci√≤ a cui appartenevo e il luogo in cui mi trovavo sia nato in me il bisogno di pensare".

Per rifondare la fede cristiana su una base laica e universale, Vito Mancuso ha affrontato duemila anni di dottrina della Chiesa, armato di Tommaso d'Aquino e Albert Einstein, di filosofia e di scienza, del suo corpo e della sua mente: tutti uniti nella lotta. Teologo, ha scritto che il peccato originale √® "un'offesa alla creazione, un insulto alla vita, uno sfregio all'innocenza e alla bont√† della natura". Ha definito l'inferno "un concetto teologicamente indegno, logicamente inconsistente, moralmente deprecabile". Ha incuriosito il mondo secolare e procurato allarme in quello religioso. "Svuota di significato circa una dozzina di dogmi della Chiesa"(La Civilt√† Cattolica). "Ha suscitato in me un senso di profondo disagio"(Osservatore Romano) .

Leggendo il suo ultimo libro ‚Äì "Il bisogno di pensare" (Garzanti) ‚Äì si ha l'impressione che il margine sia per Mancuso il luogo da cui pu√≤ sentire pi√π forte l'appartenenza, come lo sradicamento √® all'origine del suo bisogno di radicarsi: "Non ho mai tenuto a essere iscritto a una scuola, fosse quella hegeliana, kantiana, martiniana. Preferisco coltivare l'indipendenza, anche nei confronti dei maestri".

Lei si occupa di Dio, ma richiama sempre la carne. Perch√©?

Nietzsche diceva che non bisogna mai prestare ascolto a un pensiero che viene in mente quando non si √® in cammino. E che avere il "sedere di pietra" ‚Äì cio√®, stare sempre seduti ‚Äì √® un peccato contro lo spirito santo. La parte del corpo con cui penso di pi√π sono i piedi. Essi mi fanno sentire la concretezza delle cose. Giacch√© il pensiero √® sempre immerso nel materiale.

Anche le idee lo sono?

Le idee sono delle visioni, non sono concetti che si pensano e che si elaborano: sono qualcosa che si impone alla vista, anche se li si guarda con gli occhi interiori. √à questo ci√≤ che connota le grandi intuizioni dei musicisti, dei poeti, degli artisti, degli scienziati.

Gli scienziati non lo fanno con gli esperimenti?

Quando nel 1964 Peter Higgs teorizz√≤ l'esistenza di un bosone oltre le particelle elementari, non aveva nessun dato per sostenerlo. Lo vide. Quarant'anni dopo, al Cern di Ginevra, verificarono che c'era davvero. Fu cos√¨ anche per la teoria della relativit√†. Einstein aveva da una parte la meccanica quantistica, dall'altra le leggi dell'elettromagnetismo: due teorie che prese singolarmente erano vere, ma insieme erano inconciliabili. La sua visione della relativit√† le univa. Finch√© non fu verificata, anch'essa era pura immaginazione.

La sua fantasia di cosa si √® nutrita?

Mio padre era un muratore, mia madre cominci√≤ facendo la sartina. A casa mia c'erano solo due libri: un vangelo con la copertina bianca e le pagine sottilissime, e un libro di preghiere. Quando mio padre ebbe un piccolo successo economico, cominci√≤ a comprare a rate delle enciclopedie. I volumi arrivavano una volta al mese. Io sfogliavo Le Scienze, Universi, perdendomi nelle parole e nelle illustrazioni. E poi c'erano i romanzi d'avventura di Emilio Salgari.

Fece il liceo negli anni settanta. Com'era?

Studiavo a Desio, a dieci chilometri da Milano. Era una zona operaia, vicino agli stabilimenti dell'Autobianchi. Democrazia proletaria era fortissima, come gli altri gruppi dell'estrema sinistra. Desio, per√≤, aveva anche una grande tradizione cattolica. √à la citt√† di Don Luigi Giussani, il fondatore di Comunione e Liberazione. E ogni manifestazione finiva nella piazza che ospita la statua di Pio XI ‚Äì anch'egli nato l√¨ ‚Äì con una bandiera rossa inforcata tra le tre dita benedicenti.

Lei da che parte stava?

In mezzo agli extraparlamentari di sinistra e ai ragazzi di Cielle. Ero vicino al cattolicesimo democratico, ma sopratutto ero lontano, anzi provavo allergia nei confronti di quei miei coetanei che sapevano gi√† tutto della vita, che avevano in tasca una verit√† rossa, bianca oppure nera. Sentivo in loro una falsit√†. Avevo l'impressione che rimuovessero le contraddizioni dell'esistenza, nascondendosi dietro una citazione ritagliata dai loro testi di riferimento. Io, invece, cercavo la verit√† che c'era dentro ogni posizione: la verit√† della tesi, e quella dell'antitesi. Quando scoprii Hegel, sentii una grande affinit√† con la sua dialettica.

Cos√¨ giovane lesse Hegel?

No, a diciassette anni lessi Dio esiste? di Hans K√ºng, un libro di pi√π di mille pagine che si interroga sul rapporto tra il pensiero moderno e l'idea di Dio, dove c'era una parte dedicata ad Hegel. Quando lo finii, mi dissi: "A questo voglio dedicarmi: a pensare Dio filosoficamente". Fu una lettura decisiva. Mi cambi√≤ la vita.

Come?

Ne parlai al prete del mio oratorio, che mi consigli√≤ di fare dei colloqui in seminario: "Pu√≤ essere un segno di vocazione sacerdotale", mi disse. Andai. Incontrai il direttore spirituale in una stanza piena di libri, a cui si accedeva percorrendo dei corridoi pieni di luci. Mi sentii nel posto giusto. Mi convinsi ed entrai in seminario.

Divenne prete?

A ventitr√© anni e mezzo, in anticipo di quasi due anni sui tempi canonici, il cardinal Martini mi ordin√≤ sacerdote. Avevo fatto cinque anni di studi teologici meravigliosi, con professori eccezionali, tra i quali il cardinal Tettamanzi, e poi il cardinal Ravasi, e il cardinal Coccopalmerio, e tanti altri ancora.

Perch√© non continu√≤ a fare il prete?

Perch√© dopo un anno mi resi conto che la mia vocazione era s√¨ teologica, ma non sacerdotale. Due cose non mi appartenevano: una era l'obbedienza alla dottrina, l'altra era la rinuncia a esercitare la mia affettivit√† anche a livello sessuale. Alla prima avrei potuto ovviare diventando uno di quei preti ribelli come Don Gallo. Per la seconda, invece, non c'era soluzione.

Prefer√¨ se stesso a Dio?

C'√® un grande filone del pensiero teologico che crede ci sia un'infinita differenza qualitativa tra Dio e l'uomo, per cui seguire Dio significa fare un salto nel grande mistero, vivere la fede come cecit√†, fino a negare se stessi e opporsi alla ragione, scandalizzando il mondo. Ma questa non √® la mia visione della fede. Dio, per me, √® contro il consumismo, il potere, il desiderio di possesso: le manifestazioni superficiali della cultura contemporanea. Ma non √® contro la corrente vitale del mondo, l'energia che si dispiega nella storia e chiede senso, giustizia, bellezza. Dio non √® contro corrente. Dio √® la forza che guida la corrente e la meta verso cui la corrente si dirige. √à sorgente e porto, alfa e omega. E non c'√® opposizione tra dimensione umana e teologica, tra corpo e spirito: √® nell'armonia tra di esse che Dio si manifesta.

Papa Francesco in che direzione si muove?

La forza profetica di Francesco √® cos√¨ evidente che anche il mondo laico lo ascolta e lo considera un punto di riferimento. Nella Chiesa, per√≤, una parte lo segue, un'altra lo avversa. Le tensioni sono diventate fortissime. C'√® il rischio che il treno della Chiesa si spezzi.

La politica, invece?

Nel novecento, la politica √® stata invasa dal pensiero. Schiere di ideologi hanno elaborato teorie che pretendevano di imporsi sulla storia, gli uomini e la loro libert√†. E forse, oggi, paghiamo quell'eccesso. Senza una visione, la politica si riduce a pura amministrazione, a tecnica fredda del governo. E, per l'Italia, questo √® pi√π rischioso che per altri paesi.

Perch√©?

Perch√© senza senza delle idee capaci di organizzare la dimensione pubblica, entrano in gioco gli interessi, le lobby, le clientele, la corruzione: un campo in cui il nostro paese √® sempre molto in alto nelle classifiche internazionali. Pi√π le visioni del bene comune si estinguono, pi√π emerge il particulare.

Cita Guicciardini. Non significa che l'Italia √® sempre stata cos√¨?

Quando ero ragazzo, non mi perdevo nemmeno una tribuna politica. Ascoltare Berlinguer, Zaccagnini, Fanfani o Almirante mi metteva di fronte a una visione del mondo. Non si trattava semplicemente di altri politici: si trattava di statisti, cio√® di politici in grado di dare unit√† ai bisogni e agli interessi di un paese intero. Oggi, di statisti, non mi pare di vederne.

La Chiesa potrebbe fare qualcosa?

La Chiesa deve fare politica, fornendo un orientamento, parlando di economia, etica, giustizia sociale. Quello che non deve fare √® scegliere un partito, anzich√© un altro.

Papa Francesco piace molto a sinistra, per√≤.

√à innegabile che tra i due grandi principi che orientano la politica ‚Äì la libert√† (destra) e l'uguaglianza (sinistra) ‚Äì insista di pi√π pi√π sulla seconda.

Significa che possiamo definirlo "un papa di sinistra"?

√à una definizione che il papa rifiuterebbe. Ma se applichiamo ‚Äì un po' impropriamente ‚Äì le categorie politiche alla teologia √® chiaro che a destra c'√® la tradizione, a sinistra l'innovazione. Dunque: Ratzinger era una papa di destra, Francesco √® un papa di sinistra.

Perch√© ci invita a pensare?

Per trovare pace e non diventare cattivi.

I cattivi non pensano?

Intendo cattivi nel senso latino del termine: captivi, cio√® prigionieri. Prigionieri della paura che immobilizza la mente e il cuore, generando chiusura e aggressivit√†. Le bestie aggredite, aggrediscono. Quando non esercitiamo il pensiero, noi uomini non siamo diversi.
TITLE: Intervista a Vito Mancuso: "Con Francesco tensioni fortissime, c'√® il rischio che la Chiesa si spezzi"

SUMMARY:

Your harasser‚Äôs current employer most likely won‚Äôt take any action if the incident occurred while you both worked elsewhere, according to Ring.

TEXT:
It seems as if high-profile claims of workplace sexual harassment are cropping up daily. From Hollywood to Washington, D.C., to newsrooms across the nation, harassers ‚Äï all male, in these cases ‚Äï have been fired or publicly shamed for a range of sexual misconduct, with some instances having occurred decades ago.

While sexual harassment can include physical incidents, such as rape and groping, it can also include unwanted advances, sexual requests and ‚Äúcreating a hostile environment, pervasive jokes/comments, looks and body language that makes an individual feel harassed,‚Äù explained Emily Austin, a director at the California Coalition Against Sexual Assault, to Self magazine last month.

When they do come forward, it‚Äôs sometimes years after the fact, and that can make a difference in how a case is handled by both law enforcement and human resources departments.

Employees are often told how to report current episodes of harassment. But what about old ones? What if you were harassed at a previous job or the perpetrator no longer works at the same company you do? What if both of you have moved on to new jobs? It‚Äôs fair ‚Äï and responsible ‚Äï to want to warn the women or men who now work with your harasser. Unfortunately, the system doesn‚Äôt favor someone who brings forward an older case. Legal experts shared some advice about what you need to know.

In most cases, you can‚Äôt file a legal complaint or a lawsuit.

‚ÄúSome states extend the statute of limitations under certain circumstances, usually dealing with minors,‚Äù Ballman told HuffPost. But if your case ‚Äúis older than [10 months], you‚Äôre probably out of luck for a lawsuit.‚Äù

Image Source via Getty Images

Even though you likely won‚Äôt get legal or financial recompense for being harassed in this case, it‚Äôs still worth alerting your harasser‚Äôs current employer in order to protect the women he works with now, said Sunu Chandy, legal director at the National Women‚Äôs Law Center.

‚ÄúThe question is, what‚Äôs the purpose of coming forward? If the reason is to alert other individuals to this problem, then it doesn‚Äôt matter how long has gone by,‚Äù she told HuffPost.

‚ÄúYou may or may not get [justice]. But if you don‚Äôt come forward, you definitely won‚Äôt get it,‚Äù Chandy added.

Gather any evidence you can...

Before you alert your harasser‚Äôs current employer, gather evidence such as emails, voicemails or text message screenshots that can prove you were harassed, said David Ring, a personal injury attorney based in Los Angeles.

‚ÄúEveryone‚Äôs always looking for corroboration ‚Äï like [text messages], witnesses or a paper trail ‚Äï and if there isn‚Äôt, then employers are probably going to say there‚Äôs not much they can do, because [the harassment] didn‚Äôt happen on their turf,‚Äù he told HuffPost.

Of course, gathering evidence is difficult if you were harassed years ago or the harassment occurred in passing, like brief touching or groping. If you were harassed along with other women, see if they‚Äôll speak out with you, Ballman said.

‚ÄúIf a group of you came forward and said, ‚ÄòWe want to put [the harasser] on notice,‚Äô that‚Äôs stronger,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIf I‚Äôm his lawyer, I‚Äôd be looking at, ‚ÄòCan I discredit two, three or 10 people?‚Äô The more that come forward, the better.‚Äù

...and tell his current employer.

Ring suggests simply picking up the phone and calling the human resources director at your harasser‚Äôs current workplace. It‚Äôs unlikely they have any legal obligation to punish the harasser, he said, but your report could at least put them on the lookout for fishy behavior.

‚ÄúGet HR on the phone, and tell your story,‚Äù Ring said. ‚ÄúTell them, ‚ÄòIf you ever need me in the future, I‚Äôm telling you he did this to me.‚Äô Then the employer can either do nothing or look into it.‚Äù

Ballman recommends speaking with an employment lawyer beforehand to ensure you deliver your message in a way that won‚Äôt invite a lawsuit.

Yes, your harasser can sue you for speaking up.

While victims usually can‚Äôt collect legal damages for harassment that occurred more than 10 months ago, harassers can indeed sue victims for speaking up after the fact, Ballman said. Your harasser could file suit for defamation (harming his reputation via false information) or tortious interference (hurting his relationship with his employer).

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an unfair system,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs why we have such a culture of sexual harassment in this country. We have a system where the women are disbelieved, where the victims are punished.‚Äù

Fuse via Getty Images

However, you can usually rest easy if your story is true, Chandy pointed out. Defamation lawsuits argue that false information was provided against your harasser, which means that unless a jury is convinced that your true story is in fact false, you will prevail.

‚Ä≥[Your harasser] can bring whatever suit they want, but if the information you‚Äôre providing is true, then that person won‚Äôt be successful,‚Äù Chandy said. ‚ÄúYour word is evidence, and it often comes down to credibility assessments.‚Äù

Ring has a similar assessment.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs risky at all for a person who was harassed to make a complaint,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIf what they‚Äôre reporting is true, then I don‚Äôt think they have much to worry about.‚Äù

Just don‚Äôt be surprised if nothing happens at all.

Your harasser‚Äôs current employer most likely won‚Äôt take any action if the incident occurred while you both worked elsewhere, according to Ring.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre getting a complaint from someone they don‚Äôt know and who wasn‚Äôt under their rules, so they have no obligation to investigate,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd there could be monumental backlash if they discipline an employee for something that happened years ago under different employer. [The company] might not ignore [your report], but they‚Äôd be very cautious in how they looked into it.‚Äù

Ballman agrees.

‚ÄúIf [the current employer] has had no complaints internally, they may look at [your report] as odd,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThe first person who reports harassment is frequently met with skepticism.‚Äù

As an alternative, Ballman recommends anonymously posting your story on job review sites, such as Glassdoor, to warn future colleagues of your harasser‚Äôs behavior. There are also harassment reporting apps that let you anonymously submit your story for a manager at your harasser‚Äôs company to review.

Ultimately, Ring says, there‚Äôs no substitute for reporting right away.
TITLE: How To Report Sexual Harassment At A Previous Job

TEXT:
Le premier ministre Justin Trudeau et plusieurs de ses ministres ont quitt√© le pays en direction de P√©kin pour une visite officielle de quatre jours qui doit s'amorcer lundi dans les bureaux du r√©seau social Weibo.

L'objectif de cette visite d'entreprise est de vanter les attraits du Canada en tant que destination touristique.

La d√©l√©gation canadienne doit arriver en Chine en fin de journ√©e dimanche et la visite du si√®ge social de Sino Corporation, propri√©taire de Weibo, est pr√©vue lundi matin.

Cette plateforme qui se targue d'√™tre le r√©seau social le plus populaire en Chine combine des √©l√©ments que l'on retrouve sur Twitter, YouTube et Instagram. En septembre dernier, l'outil de micromessages de Weinbo a surpass√© Twitter sur le plan du nombre d'utilisateurs actifs chaque mois √† 376 000.

Selon les autorit√©s gouvernementales, le mandat derri√®re ce voyage en Chine est de resserrer les liens √©conomiques et d'attirer plus d'investisseurs au Canada. On souhaite aussi promouvoir l'¬´Ann√©e du tourisme Canada-Chine¬ª qui aura lieu en 2018.

Entre 2010 et 2016, le nombre de touristes chinois qui ont visit√© le Canada a tripl√© pour atteindre 625 000 visiteurs. Une croissance qui s'explique par le d√©cret de la Chine de faire du Canada une ¬´destination approuv√©e¬ª.

Plus tard lundi, Justin Trudeau devrait rencontrer le premier ministre Li Keqiang au somptueux palais de l'Assembl√©e du Peuple √† P√©kin. Une rencontre qui s'inscrit dans l'engagement de rencontrer son homologue chinois au moins une fois par ann√©e. La derni√®re visite de Justin Trudeau en Chine remonte √† l'√©t√© 2016.

Mardi, le premier ministre canadien devrait rencontrer le pr√©sident Xi Jinping. D'autres r√©unions sont aussi pr√©vues avec des chefs d'entreprises canadiens et chinois durant ce s√©jour √† P√©kin.

Malgr√© l'empressement de la Chine de discuter de libre-√©change, les autorit√©s canadiennes soutiennent vouloir plus de temps pour d√©terminer leur position.

Le gouvernement a r√©cemment rendu public le fruit de consultations men√©es aupr√®s de plus de 600 entreprises, chercheurs et organismes sociaux o√π certains ont dit craindre des pertes d'emplois et la difficult√© de rivaliser avec la main-d'oeuvre chinoise √† faible co√ªt ainsi que les faibles normes environnementales et les g√©n√©reuses subventions d'√âtat.

Le bureau du premier ministre n'a d'ailleurs fait aucune mention de discussions sur le libre-√©change.

Avant de s'envoler vers la Chine, Justin Trudeau a pris part √† un rassemblement √©lectoral √† Surrey, en Colombie-Britannique, pour soutenir le candidat lib√©ral Gordon Hogg, en vue de l'√©lection partielle du 11 d√©cembre.

The Narrabri Gas Project is an ambitious plan to drill 850 wells tapping underground natural gas reserves, which resources giant Santos said would be tapped for the domestic market.
A spokesman for the Minister told us:"The NSW Government is assessing the Narrabri Gas Project proposal under clear planning legislation and policies.
Paull called Environmental Impact Statement for the Narrabri Gas Project "appalling".
TEXT:
What, as a society, do we value more? Forests or fuel? Agriculture or energy? Fresh water or fracking? Beauty or balance sheets? And are these things mutually exclusive, or can we maybe have it all?

These questions are all about to play out in Australia's largest inland native forest, the Pilliga, in northern New South Wales.

The Pilliga is not what you'd call a pretty forest. It has neither the lushness of the Daintree, nor the towering grandeur of West Australia's Karri forests or Victoria's mountain ash. In truth it's more like scrub -- a patchwork of scraggly ironbark, thin-stemmed eucalypts and a plain native pine called cypress pine.

The Pilliga's creekbeds are sandy and its roads throw up a powdery dust that turns everything Donald Trump orange. Its emus, koalas and glossy black cockatoos are elusive. There are few lookouts or landmarks of note. The rest areas beside the Newell Highway -- the main road from Brisbane to Melbourne which barrels right through the heart of it -- are devoid of picnickers.

It takes about two hours to drive from Sydney to Newcastle. That gives you a good indication of the vast scale of The Pilliga -- which is the large area of forest to the south of Narrabri.

The Pilliga is a place few people go to see, and which most people are in a hurry to get through. But the Pilliga is vast and quiet. And when you spend two days driving its rutted tracks, you come to understand that its unrelenting, undulating featurelessness is its very charm.

But for how long?

Shot this footage 2day of the INCREDIBLE Pilliga forest, Australia's largest dryland forest. It's threatened by a huge coal seam gas project pic.twitter.com/gP4bZxltTC ‚Äî Anthony Sharwood (@antsharwood) 6 de julho de 2017

The 'Pilliga Gas Project'

Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull shifted the national focus to The Pilliga in the last week of September, when he announced that Australia's gas supply crisis was "three times worse than thought". "We encourage the New South Wales government to approve the development of the Narrabri Gas Project," the PM said. "The sooner that is brought online, the better."

The Narrabri Gas Project is an ambitious plan to drill 850 wells tapping underground natural gas reserves, which resources giant Santos said would be tapped for the domestic market.

But in a sense, the project's name is a misnomer. The "Narrabri Gas Project" brings to mind the town of 7,600 people on the Namoi River, which as the project's administrative base, would likely enjoy a temporary economic upswing. Indeed, Santos already employs 20-30 people at shopfronts in the area.

The Narrabri gas Project should arguably be called The Pilliga Gas Project, because the vast bulk of the 850 wells would be sunk in the Pilliga forest just south of Narrabri -- which consists of a mix of state forest, nature reserve, state conservation area, national park and freehold land.

Whatever you call it, this project -- which is currently in the planning approval phase -- would change the face of the Pilliga. And as the NSW government makes its decision, a fight is bubbling away not just over the forest itself, but over the forest's water resources, which some claim would be degraded.

The Pilliga is a recharge zone for the Great Artesian Basin -- Australia's vast, inland underground water resource without which so much of our agriculture would be unviable. Being a recharge zone means it's one of the few areas which provide significant new water to replenish the basin.

Farmers in areas bordering the Pilliga rely on bore water from the Great Artesian Basin. Their soils are rich but their rainfall is scant. They fear that a project of this scale will destroy the subterranean water pressure and dry up their bores. They also fear groundwater in the forest itself could be tainted.

Santos says there are numerous studies conducted by eminent scientists which have found that coal seam gas can be safely produced without harmful effects on ground or surface water. It cites Ex-CSIRO water expert Dr Richard Creswell, who said farmers' water would "not be impacted by any of the drilling that goes through the Great Artesian Basin to get to the gas".

But RMIT's Dr Matthew Currell -- who has been called up as part of the approval process to help assess the submissions -- told HuffPost Australia that "I think there's genuine concern about the protection of surface water systems and also groundwater-dependent ecosystems in the area".

The Pilliga is situated at the area of shaded blue that dips down into NSW.

The water wars are also being fought over the groundwater in the forest itself. The disputed point is whether the mix of chemicals involved in unconventional gas drilling will leave a toxic mess.

Santos directed HuffPost Australia to the 2014 study by the NSW Chief Scientist and Engineer, which concluded that with appropriate safeguards and controls, natural gas can be safely extracted from coal seams. Richard Creswell said there are "at least three levels of protection" in the gas drilling process.

But RMIT's Matthew Currell said "there's no reason why any land holder that lives in vicinity of coal seam gas wells or waste water storage ponds could not have their water quality affected".

For now, we have a stand-off. Water versus gas. The Pilliga versus what many people see as the pillagers.

With the NSW Department of Planning approval process underway, it's highly unusual that the Prime Minister would overstep the boundaries of his authority, and urge the NSW state government to get cracking with the project.

HuffPost Australia contacted the office of NSW Planning Minister Anthony Roberts to ask whether the PM's urging could potentially help fast-track the approval process. A spokesman for the Minister told us:

"The NSW Government is assessing the Narrabri Gas Project proposal under clear planning legislation and policies. We have also established a panel of four independent scientific experts to advise on the potential water-related impacts. In addition, other government agencies such as the NSW Environment Protection Authority and NSW Crown Lands and Water are also providing advice. We consider all applications under the same rules to carefully assess any potential environmental, social, or economic impacts or benefits. We also closely consider community feedback... There is no set timeframe for determination."

There is much for the Department to assess. As HuffPost Australia reported in June when submissions closed, a record number of 23,000 submissions were received in response to resources giant Santos's proposal. Of these, just 300 were in favour. While many of the submissions opposed to the project are form letters, it's our understanding that at least 5,000 are carefully researched, informed statements of genuine concern.

No person has articulated her concerns with more passion than Anne Kennedy, a farmer from Coonamble, west of the Pilliga, who relies on Great Artesian Basin bore water.

"What you are doing is pitting fuel versus food. Which industry will still be necessary in 20 years? If you want to drink clean water and eat clean food, then this is your problem," Kennedy told HuffPost Australia.

Santos pointed us to a study which showed that "the collective impacts of coal mining and coal seam gas extraction can be effectively managed without negatively impacting agricultural water use across the region".

Pilliga-based ecologist David Paull, who has worked as an environment officer for both state and local governments, is unconvinced.

"I think the fact that there's a record-breaking number of submissions for this project than is a fairly good sign that it's not well received by the community. Certainly in the local region outside Narrabri area itself there's no support for it," he said.

Paull called Environmental Impact Statement for the Narrabri Gas Project "appalling". Santos said the environmental assessment process was "rigorous".

"Santos has the track record and expertise required to safely and sustainably develop the Narrabri Project and deliver reliable, affordable, clean natural gas to NSW for many years to come," a spokesman said.

It's likely that the decision on this project will be made in the first half of 2018. Expect passions to run high whichever way the dice rolls. The Pilliga does not have the emotional tug of some better-known iconic Australian landscapes like the Reef or the Tasmanian wilderness, but to locals, this great, largely uncelebrated Australian forest is everything.

"I'm just an old chook, a broken down farmer," Anne Kennedy said with unconvincing self-deprecation. Then her feisty self returned.

"There will be massive civil disobedience if they approve it. We're not going to give up without a fight."
TITLE: What Lies Beneath: The Battle Over Water, Gas And The Pilliga, Our Vast, Pristine Inland Wonderland

TEXT:
When a ‚ÄòRick and Morty‚Äô fan asked the show‚Äôs co-creator for advice on coping with depression, the internet was overwhelmed by the response she received.

The fan, known only by her Twitter handle @chojuroh, tweeted co-creator Dan Harmon simply asking: ‚ÄúDo you have advice for dealing with depression.‚Äù

In response, Dan wrote a series of supportive messages, advising the woman to ‚Äúadmit and accept that it‚Äôs happening‚Äù.

He also advised her to remember that ‚Äúfeelings are real, but they aren‚Äôt reality‚Äù and that she doesn‚Äôt have to ‚Äúdeal with it alone‚Äù.
TITLE: 'Rick And Morty' Co-Creator Dan Harmon Gives Fan Heartfelt Advice For Coping With Depression

SUMMARY:
The cosmetic industry has come a long way in the past few years, both from a technical and social standpoint.
We asked facial plastic surgeon Doctor William Mooney to give us a glimpse as to what we might expect in the world of cosmetic surgery in 2018.
Now, people are asking for that procedure just to get a slimmer face," Mooney said.
"A lot of my cosmetic colleagues are missing the wrapping paper, the skin, and the skin is the first thing you see.
So what I've got to tell you the most important thing -- "skin care, skin care, skin care" is the rallying call for 2018 for cosmetics."
TEXT:
The cosmetic industry has come a long way in the past few years, both from a technical and social standpoint. The science behind anti-ageing and cosmetics procedures is better than ever, with less down time and more subtle results becoming the norm.

People are becoming more accepting of the industry, too. Women were often hesitant to admit they had botox just a few years ago, whereas now it's becoming more mainstream and there's less stigma around undergoing procedures.

We asked facial plastic surgeon Doctor William Mooney to give us a glimpse as to what we might expect in the world of cosmetic surgery in 2018.

"We have fantastic, exciting new developments in facial cosmetics, it really is the most amazing field. Techniques we used five or 10 years ago have been discontinued, and techniques we used even 12 months ago have been modified and improved," Mooney told HuffPost Australia.

A post shared by Dr William Mooney FRACS (@drwilliammooney) on Nov 17, 2017 at 12:58am PST

"It's exciting because it results in a better outcome for patients. The end goal is an age-appropriate, more natural look which is affordable, quick and easy -- and this is becoming ever closer to us."

Here, Mooney's five predictions for 2018.

'Auto-selection'

"In the old days, people used to come in with pictures of Kardashians or Brad Pitt's nose or chin and expect us to replicate that on their face. It was always a problem because the best nose is your nose -- just a better version of it. So trying to replicate a Kardashian face on someone else's face was going to be a bad idea," Mooney said.

"What's happened now, because of software apps such as Snapchat and Facetune, is that patients are now morphing their own faces. So rather than coming in with pictures of celebrities, they come in with a reference to a morphed version of their own face. It's useful because it is far easier to make a better version of that person's face, rather than a whole new face. However, I do caution against it creating unrealistic expectations for patients."

Medical to cosmetic change of treatments

A lot of treatments that were for originally medical reasons, have had a cosmetic shift and Mooney explains that patients have begun to like that.

"For example, teeth grinding -- something that is almost omni-present amongst busy 30-40 year old women results in a masculine jaw line. We used to inject the chewing muscles to decrease this swelling and decrease the teeth grinding at nighttime and the result was a slimmer, more feminine face. Now, people are asking for that procedure just to get a slimmer face," Mooney said.

"The other one is Platelet Rich Plasma aka The Vampire Facial. It was originally pioneered by orthopedic and sports doctors, where they spun the blood, took the platelets and plasma out, and injected it into the injured tendon in sporting injuries. Now, we use that in faces and skin and even in hair for baldness," Mooney said.

A patient's own latelet-rich blood plasma, shown in yellow above the remaining red blood, is used during skin procedures to promote faster healing and better results.

"So once again this is a treatment that began as a medical procedure that has morphed into a cosmetic procedure, which is exciting. Remember that botox started as a medical treatment for Myokymia -- flickering of the eye -- and it still has a myriad of medical uses, but of course it is most commonly known as a cosmetic anti-wrinkle treatment."

The ageing population

"The retirement age has been 65 in Australia for years and years, because life expectancy was around 70. Now, life expectancy is 80, 90 or beyond -- my own mother is 78 and that used to be an old person, but she plays A grade tennis, tap dances, breeds dogs, has a PhD and has a more active social life than me. She still wants to look good -- so we need to create a whole new gamut of cosmetic treatments for this generation," Mooney said.

Mooney explains that using a smattering of botox and a facial which works on a 20 or 30-something year-old isn't going to cut it on a 78 year-old-face.

"Especially given this cohort of people had no sun care when they were younger, didn't have good diets and didn't know about all the things that we know now are preventative. What we've done for this group of patients is a more significant, multi-faceted approach to anti-ageing."

Australia's ageing population means cosmetic procedures must be tailored for each demographic.

"Like anyone else, they don't want to jump straight under a knife for a face lift, and so we have developed a lot of deep space fillers, which are essential in loss of volume. Because the loss of volume in this age group isn't just skin thinning, but also re-absorption of bone, so there is a really significant loss of volume in this group, and counteracting that is very difficult, but effective if you've got a good injector," Mooney said.

"Also combined with this is more diligent skincare regimes, and I find this 70+ age group need a complicated and quite intense (but eventually rewarding) skin care regime of multiple lasers and facial techniques."

'Wrapping paper'

"I look at my kids at birthday parties or Christmas, and when we give them a present they tear off the wrapping paper, eager to get to the present within. And that was the technique for cosmetics for a long time -- where we ignored the wrapping paper, the skin, to jump to needles, injectables and muscle relaxants straight away," Mooney said.

A quality skincare regime full of actives and sunscreen can go a long way. Don't forget the 'wrapping paper'.

"A lot of my cosmetic colleagues are missing the wrapping paper, the skin, and the skin is the first thing you see. So what I've got to tell you the most important thing -- "skin care, skin care, skin care" is the rallying call for 2018 for cosmetics."

"New skin care regimes of super gentle lasers, combined with intelligent non-damaging facials and other techniques such as PRP and skin tightening techniques are the new cutting edge of good cosmetic facial technology."

'Faster, faster, faster'

Mooney observes that less and less patients want to have formal surgery and more and more want to have a minimal down time procedure.

"The reality is that we never want to compromise outcome to appease an impatient patient. However increasingly there is a phalanx of different techniques that we can perform as a lunchtime procedure, such as injectable liquid face lifts, injectable rhinoplasty, and new threading techniques that have maybe less than 24 hours downtime," Mooney said.

"All of these things we offer in our rooms and they are fantastic for patients on a limited budget, who want a fast outcome. I always counsel patients that formal assessment is necessary, and that formal surgery usually results in a better outcome. But in many cases, patients have a minor deformity in their nose (for example from a minor trauma), and this can be repaired and fixed with injectable rhinoplasty with zero downtime at a fraction of the cost of formal rhinoplasty."

A post shared by Dr William Mooney FRACS (@drwilliammooney) on Oct 24, 2017 at 1:52am PDT

"Liquid facelifts (the use of muscle relaxants and fillers) are something we have been talking about for a little while, but certainly the new group of micro-thread lifts are amazing in terms of giving a lovely mid-face and lower-third face-lift with less than 24 hours downtime. Imagine having a mid and lower third face-lift and going back to work confidently and comfortably the second day," Mooney said.

"That is where we are headed with facial cosmetics in 2018. But as always, watch this space, because in 12 months' time, I will be giving you a totally new and modified report from today's!"
TITLE: These Procedures Will Be Big In The Cosmetic Industry In 2018

SUMMARY:
Ein 70-j√§hriger Mann sei demnach bewusstlos in ein Krankenhaus in Miami eingeliefert worden.
Die √Ñrzte der Jackson Memorial Klinik h√§tten sofort damit begonnen, den Unbekannten wiederzubeleben.
Doch dann sei ihnen das gro√ü Tattoo auf seiner Brust aufgefallen.
Oder ging das Tattoo auf eine betrunkene Nacht zur√ºck?
Somit sei der Fall klar gewesen: Der 70 Jahre alte Mann durfte sterben und wurde nicht wiederbelebt.
TEXT:
Ein 70-j√§hriger Patient hat amerikanische √Ñrzte verwirrt - diese wollten den Mann wiederbeleben

Doch der trug ein Tattoo auf der Brust, das seine Wiederbelebung verhinderte

Im Video oben: Eigentlich ist es nur ein Satzzeichen, aber dieses winzige Tattoo rettet Leben

Es klingt zun√§chst fast zu absurd, um wahr zu sein: Im US-Bundesstaat Florida hat das Tattoo eines Patienten daf√ºr gesorgt, dass √Ñrzte ihn haben sterben lassen. Dar√ºber berichtet das Fachmagazin "The New England Journal of Medicine".

Ein 70-j√§hriger Mann sei demnach bewusstlos in ein Krankenhaus in Miami eingeliefert worden. Er habe an einer Infektion gelitten, die einen septischen Schock und letztlich Organversagen zur Folge haben kann, berichtet das Magazin.

Die √Ñrzte der Jackson Memorial Klinik h√§tten sofort damit begonnen, den Unbekannten wiederzubeleben.

Doch dann sei ihnen das gro√ü Tattoo auf seiner Brust aufgefallen. Die Botschaft dort: "Do Not Resuscitate". Auf deutsch: "Nicht wiederbeleben".

Der Autor des "The New England Journal of Medicine" berichtet:

"Der t√§towierte Wunsch dieses Patienten f√ºhrte zu mehr Verwirrung als Klarheit." Das Krankenhauspersonal h√§tte Bedenken gehabt: War der Wunsch rechtlich bindend? Oder ging das Tattoo auf eine betrunkene Nacht zur√ºck?

Der Patient durfte schlie√ülich sterben

Die √Ñrzte h√§tten den t√§towierten Wunsch des Mannes schlie√ülich nicht einfach so ignorieren wollen und nach seinen Angeh√∂rige gesucht. Ohne Erfolg.

Schlie√ülich sei eine offizielle Patientenverf√ºgung aufgetaucht, die der Mann beim Gesundheitsamt hinterlegt hatte. Somit sei der Fall klar gewesen: Der 70 Jahre alte Mann durfte sterben und wurde nicht wiederbelebt.

(ll)
TITLE: √Ñrzte wollen Mann wiederbeleben - als sie das Tattoo auf seiner Brust sehen, lassen sie ihn sterben

SUMMARY:
Imagen contenida en el informe de la OIM en la que se ve a un grupo de subsaharianos retenidos en Sabha, en el sur de Libia.
Los que est√°n fuera de esos muros, muchos miles, son los que se exponen a la esclavitud y la violencia.
Los que venden suelen ser ghaneses y nigerianos y los que compran, libios.
Y es que la prioridad de la la Uni√≥n en Libia ha sido m√°s la de poner barreras, la de impedir que salga m√°s flujo de migrantes, que la de garantizar que se les trata dignamente.
"Lo que ya era una situaci√≥n nefasta ahora se ha vuelto catastr√≥fica", reproch√≥ el d√≠a que se conoci√≥ el v√≠deo de la subasta humana.
TEXT:
Lo sab√≠an hasta en las m√°s altas esferas, de la UE a la ONU, desde hace meses, muchos, pero ha tenido que ser la CNN la que ponga en la agenda urgente del mundo la verg√ºenza de lo que pasa en Libia: la subasta de inmigrantes y refugiados como esclavos.

Un v√≠deo difundido el pasado 14 de noviembre -de escasa luz, mal encuadre y contenido clar√≠simo- mostraba a un grupo de j√≥venes africanos en fila mientras una voz en alto lanzaba cifras. No era la sala Christie's de Nueva York buscando comprador para el Salvator Mundi de Leonardo Da Vinci. Era un lugar sin identificar del pa√≠s norteafricano, donde en pleno siglo XXI se pone a√∫n en la picota a seres humanos, mercanc√≠a para trabajar sin descanso o para convertirse en juguetes sexuales de sus amos.

La Organizaci√≥n Internacional para las Migraciones (OIM) denunci√≥ por primera vez en abril la existencia de "mercados de esclavos" donde se "venden" inmigrantes en Libia, pero s√≥lo se movieron e indignaron las ONG. Luego lanz√≥ un informe, en verano, que tambi√©n pas√≥ con m√°s pena que gloria, y eso que ya inclu√≠a testimonios estremecedores de algunas de las v√≠ctimas localizadas. Palabras perdidas en el eco de los despachos. Pero ahora ha llegado una investigaci√≥n period√≠stica de primer nivel y su ruido no se puede amortiguar. La comunidad internacional ha tenido que pararse a escuchar c√≥mo se pide entre 400 y 800 euros por persona. ¬ø"D√≥nde est√° el mundo?", se preguntaba la cadena de noticias norteamericana. Ahora, al fin, tratando de buscar soluciones.

QU√â EST√Å PASANDO

Lo que ha documentado la OIM y la CNN es que en la √∫ltima etapa en el continente africano de quienes tratan de llegar a Europa cruzando el Mediterr√°neo -esa fosa en la que este a√±o ya han muerto m√°s de 3.000 personas, denuncia CEAR- los hombres y mujeres, inmigrantes y refugiados, son expuestos, comprados y explotados.

Los migrantes, sobre todo los m√°s j√≥venes, son vendidos para trabajar en casas, naves y talleres clandestinos o abandonados en apariencia, como cebo para exigir un rescate a sus familias y tambi√©n, en el caso de las mujeres y ni√±as, como esclavas sexuales o prostitutas. Seg√∫n el informe de la OIM -una organizaci√≥n asociada a las Naciones Unidas- estas personas son llevadas a plazas p√∫blicas o garajes en distintos puntos de Libia, donde se muestran a los posibles compradores.

Su precio oscila entre los 200 y los 500 d√≥lares (entre 171 y 429 euros, aproximadamente) y se paga m√°s por los sanos, por las mujeres guapas y por quien tuviera una formaci√≥n u oficio previos, de alba√±iles a pintores, pasando por azulejeros, granjeros, recolectores, carpinteros...

No todos los esclavos cobran por la labor que desarrollan a la fuerza. Algunos no pasan de tener un mal techo y peor comida con sus due√±os-captores. Algunos logran escapar, otros est√°n entre dos y tres meses con sus compradores y otros, malviven encerrados en √°reas donde son forzados a trabajar sin descanso, indica el estudio, hecho con investigadores a pie de campo, como el reporte de la CNN. Los supervivientes de esta experiencia sufren malnutrici√≥n severa y traumas por los abusos y maltratos de todo tipo, incluyendo los sexuales. Se desconoce cu√°ntos de ellos mueren durante su cautiverio. Desde principios de a√±o, casi mil solicitantes de asilo y refugio han sido liberados.

(Puedes seguir leyendo tras la foto...).

Imagen contenida en el informe de la OIM en la que se ve a un grupo de subsaharianos retenidos en Sabha, en el sur de Libia.

¬øD√ìNDE EST√Å EL GOBIERNO LIBIO?

William Lacy Swing, el director general de la OIM, se√±al√≥ este martes desde Ginebra, en una videoconferencia con el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, que cerca de 400.000 personas est√°n atrapadas en Libia, tratando de hacerse a la mar. De ellas, apenas 15.000 est√°n en unos 30 centros pseudo-oficiales, que en muchos casos no cumplen ni con las condiciones b√°sicas de higiene. Los que est√°n fuera de esos muros, muchos miles, son los que se exponen a la esclavitud y la violencia.

¬øPor qu√© el Gobierno libio no ataja esta bestialidad? Pues porque realmente no hay una administraci√≥n estable y seria. El pa√≠s est√° sumido en un formidable caos desde la llamada primavera y la intervenci√≥n de la OTAN que acab√≥ con la salida del poder en 2011 de Muammar el Gadafi; pr√°cticamente hay con dos gobiernos de facto: el oficial, el de unidad nacional del presidente Fayez al-Sarraj, y el llamado Congreso Nacional General del Tr√≠poli, islamista, dominado por los Hermanos Musulmanes y que act√∫a como contrapoder, controlando la capital y la mitad occidental del estado. A eso se a√±ade el poder local de grupos rebeldes, tribales y otras derivadas yihadistas.

Esa confusi√≥n es la que aprovechan los contrabandistas y los traficantes de personas para mover a los migrantes -en su inmensa mayor√≠a subsaharianos-. A unos los llevan finalmente hasta la costa, en busca de precarias embarcaciones con las que tratar de cruzar a Europa, y a otros los secuestran y subastan. Los que venden suelen ser ghaneses y nigerianos y los que compran, libios.

El gobierno oficial ha anunciado, presionado por las informaciones de la prensa, que va a emprender una investigaci√≥n sobre estas ventas, para dar con las mafias, identificar el lugar donde retienen a los rehenes y tratar de devolverlos a sus pa√≠ses.

Las principales ONG y organismos internacionales se lamentan de lo complicado que es trabajar en este contexto. "Los avances son modestos, la seguridad sigue siendo vol√°til, el acceso a los lugares clave no es posible a diario y las operaciones de la ONU contin√∫an siendo realizados a distancia desde Tunez", lamenta Swing.

¬øY QU√â HA HECHO LA UE?

Lamentarse. Su alta representante para la Pol√≠tica Exterior, Federica Mogherini, ha condenado el trato "inhumano" y la "esclavizaci√≥n" de inmigrantes en Libia a trav√©s de un comunicado del Servicio Europeo de Acci√≥n Exterior. Ha hablado de la necesidad de "garantizar el respeto de los derechos humanos y mejorar las condiciones de vida" de estas personas. Poco m√°s por ahora. Y es que la prioridad de la la Uni√≥n en Libia ha sido m√°s la de poner barreras, la de impedir que salga m√°s flujo de migrantes, que la de garantizar que se les trata dignamente.

Est√° llegando dinero para que la Armada impida la salida de las pateras y ese mayor control es que, por ejemplo, ha reducido a la mitad la llegada de desplazados a Italia, que adem√°s est√° limitando la labor de las ONG en la zona. Eso est√° haciendo que la ruta vire a Marruecos y Argelia y, de ah√≠, a Espa√±a, donde se est√°n alcanzando a cifras de hace casi 10 a√±os.

De hecho, el alto comisionado de la ONU para los Derechos Humanos, Zeid Ra'ad al Hussein, ha llegado a denunciar la "inhumana" la cooperaci√≥n de la Uni√≥n Europea con la Guardia Costera de Libia. "El sufrimiento de los inmigrantes detenidos en Libia es una atrocidad para la conciencia humana", afirm√≥ en un comunicado. "Lo que ya era una situaci√≥n nefasta ahora se ha vuelto catastr√≥fica", reproch√≥ el d√≠a que se conoci√≥ el v√≠deo de la subasta humana.

Espa√±a inst√≥ la pasada semana Libia a cumplir la Convenci√≥n de la ONU contra el Crimen Transnacional organizado y su protocolo sobre trata de seres humanos.

(Puedes seguir leyendo tras la foto...).

Varios n√°ufragos tratan de mantenerse a flote mientras los rescatan las autoridades de Malta, a 15 millas n√°uticas de Zawiya (Libya), el pasado 14 de abril.

¬øY QU√â SE PUEDE HACER AHORA?

Por primera vez, el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU ha tratado esta semana el tema de Libia. Tanto el OIM como el Alto Comisionado para los Refugiados, pidieron en esa reuni√≥n "medidas concretas" para acabar con "estos graves abusos que no pueden ser ignorados", en palabras de Filippo Grandi, m√°ximo responsable del Acnur.

La soluci√≥n debe ser global, desde la pol√≠tica, la seguridad, los derechos humanos... Por eso no les vale que s√≥lo se mire al control de fronteras, taponar las salidas, vigilar las embarcaciones. "Demasiado a menudo -denuncian- se centran las medidas en controlar, disuadir y excluir". Hay que "humanizar" las pol√≠ticas. Tres decisiones de hacen urgentes: crear un sistema de recepci√≥n de migrantes adecuado, crear m√°s plazas para su reasentamiento y trabajar acciones conjuntas contra los traficantes de personas.

Todo ello debe concretarse, proponen, en nuevas sanciones como la congelaci√≥n de activos y la prohibici√≥n de viajes a personas relacionadas con las mafias, incautaci√≥n de fondos y materiales de las redes de contrabandistas y m√°s dureza por v√≠a judicial -para lo que har√≠a falta un estado s√≥lido y no las milicias islamistas que justo ahora controlan el sistema judicial local-. William Lacy Swing lo resume en dos apuestas: actuar contra las redes y proteger a los migrantes. "La comunidad internacional dispone de todos los elementos necesarios para atajar el problema", dice, y "lo √∫nico que se necesita es un acuerdo claro" entre las partes implicadas. "Esta es una enorme tragedia humana y podemos detenerla", sostiene sin dudas.

Habr√≠a que implicar a la Uni√≥n Africana, a Libia y los pa√≠ses de origen para registrar a los desplazados, darles documentos de viaje y que algunos terceros pa√≠ses los acojan. Ruanda se ha ofrecido a atender a 30.000 migrantes.

Trilateral meeting #EU - #AU - #UN with @MoussaFaki_M @antonioguterres @JunckerEU to reinforce joint action to help migrants in #Libya #AUEU pic.twitter.com/lzcHrfKq2D
TITLE: Libia, el infierno donde se venden esclavos a 400 euros

Per Di Maio, "la nascita di questa nuova lista a sinistra con Grasso determina che il centrosinistra, sempre pi√π spaccato, √® ormai del tutto fuori dalla partita del prossimo governo.
√à chiaro che ognuno far√† il suo percorso ma altrettanto lo √® che l'unica forza politica che pu√≤ superare il centrodestra e andare al governo √® M5S".

"E sarebbe folle ‚Äì prosegue Di Maio - che una forza politica vada contro il suo stesso elettorato.
TEXT:
"Il centrosinistra √® spaccato almeno in due. Questo pone il centrosinistra fuori dalla partita delle prossime elezioni per andare al governo". Cos√¨ Luigi Di Maio, candidato premier del M5S, commenta la nascita del movimento Liberi e uguali in un'intervista a Rainews24.

Per Di Maio, "la nascita di questa nuova lista a sinistra con Grasso determina che il centrosinistra, sempre pi√π spaccato, √® ormai del tutto fuori dalla partita del prossimo governo. Con questa mossa centrosinstra e sinistra si tirano fuori dalla campagna per il governo. √à chiaro che ognuno far√† il suo percorso ma altrettanto lo √® che l'unica forza politica che pu√≤ superare il centrodestra e andare al governo √® M5S".

Su Berlusconi Di Maio dice: "Mio padre √® un imprenditore e lo vot√≤ nel 1994. Rimase deluso per la mancata rivoluzione liberale. Berlusconi mi ricorda il film 'Goodbye Lenin' di un uomo che si √® appena risvegliato dal 1994".

Sempre di Berlusconi Di Maio scrive sul blog di Grillo:

"Berlusconi √® un simpatico signore, fa ridere con le sue battute, ma non ha fatto praticamente nulla di ci√≤ che promise agli italiani nonostante abbia il record di longevit√† al governo. Continua a ripetere che il MoVimento 5 Stelle √® contro la classe media. O √® una battuta e allora fa ridere oppure mi ricorda tanto il film Good Bye Lenin dove la protagonista si sveglia nella Germania post muro di Berlino dopo essere caduta in coma nella Germania Est sovietica. Berlusconi √® come se si fosse svegliato oggi dopo essersi addormentato nel 1994, quando Forza Italia aveva dalla sua buona parte della classe media del Paese. Oggi non √® cos√¨, da almeno 5 anni peraltro. Good Bye Berlusconi. Il MoVimento 5 Stelle √® al 30%, quindi basta fare i calcoli, in cui Berlusconi √® bravissimo, per capire che la classe media sta con noi", scrive il candidato M5S.

"E sarebbe folle ‚Äì prosegue Di Maio - che una forza politica vada contro il suo stesso elettorato. Il MoVimento nasce proprio dal disgusto della classe media per i politici che hanno governato per 20 anni. Le nostre istanze sono le loro istanze, non ci interessa che siano di destra o di sinistra, ci interessa che siano di buon senso: piccole e medie imprese, diritti dei lavoratori, meno tasse, meno burocrazia, sicurezza sociale, aiuti alle famiglie, attenzione all'ambiente, sostegno al reddito strutturale, no alla tassa sulla prima casa e impignorabilit√† di essa, no redditometro, istruzione di qualit√†, investimenti in innovazione, aiuto ai giovani. Queste sono le proposte ed √® per questo che siamo sostenuti dalla classe media: dal 30% degli italiani. Sono impegnato in un #Rally a tutta velocit√† per il Paese per convincere anche altri italiani della bont√† della nostra proposta politica e ogni giorno persone che si erano rifugiate nell'astensione mi dicono che hanno cambiato, tra queste anche tante che nel '94 votarono Berlusconi. Non riconoscere questo √® una mossa politicamente suicida. Non siamo pi√π nel 1994. Good Bye Berlusconi".
TITLE: "Con la lista Grasso centrosinistra fuori dai giochi per il governo". Di Maio sul nuovo soggetto politico

SUMMARY:
Well, King did just that, and the match (nicknamed 'the battle of the sexes') paved the way for women's professional sport to be taken more seriously.
TV CoverageIn 2017 more women's sport has been shown on TV than ever before, but the coverage still pales in comparison to the men's.
If you want to see broadcasters airing women's sport, Dale says there's one way you can actively campaign: tune in.
According to Women In Sport, women's sport sponsorship accounted for only 0.4% of total sports sponsorship between 2011 and 2013.
"It would have a huge impact if more companies invested in women's sport ‚Äì more investment means better resources, training and support.
TEXT:
But we still have a long way to go before equality is achieved in the field. If you're feeling inspired by the film, here are five causes to shout about.

Well, King did just that, and the match (nicknamed 'the battle of the sexes') paved the way for women's professional sport to be taken more seriously.

In response, former tennis player Bobby Riggs, 55, - who famously won all three Wimbledon events (singles, doubles, mixed doubles) in 1939 - challenged her to a televised match, in an attempt to prove that no woman could beat him.

For those uninitiated, in 1973 King co-founded the Women's Tennis Association after becoming sick and tired of the disparity between prize money for men and women. At the age of 29, she'd recently won her fifth of her six Wimbledon singles titles.

This season Emma Stone will transform into legendary tennis player Billie Jean King for her latest film 'Battle Of The Sexes' - and it's guaranteed to give you a feminist sporting awakening.

TV Coverage

In 2017 more women's sport has been shown on TV than ever before, but the coverage still pales in comparison to the men's.

While in 2016 you could catch every single match in the men's UEFA Euro 2016 tournament on terrestrial TV, this year you could only catch the England and Scotland games of the UEFA Women's Euro on telly. If you wanted to watch any extra fixtures, searching for obscure links online was the only option.

Kate Dale, who heads up Sport England's This Girl Can campaign, says equal sports coverage "matters for many reasons".

"We want girls to grow up knowing their hard work and talents will receive the same rewards and recognition as their male counterparts," she tells HuffPost UK.

"What message are we sending out by valuing male endeavours so much more?"

She adds that women's sport coverage also shows "a more diverse range of women than we typically see portrayed on TV ‚Äì strong, fearless, confident".

"The more images and footage we see of women playing sport or getting active at every level ‚Äì from grassroots to elite ‚Äì the more we will feel like it is relevant to us, that parks, playing fields, pitches and pools are spaces for us to enjoy too," she says.

If you want to see broadcasters airing women's sport, Dale says there's one way you can actively campaign: tune in.

"We can't complain about a lack of coverage if we don't watch it," she says.

"So watch the coverage and demand more. Use social media, praise what you see, clamour for more, and let them see the potential audience."

Equal Pay

The gender pay gap is rife within sport. The most recent Forbes roundup of the world's highest paid athletes shows that Cristiano Ronaldo (the world's highest paid male athlete) is paid an estimated $93 million (¬£69 million) per year. In comparison, Serena Williams (the highest paid woman) is thought to earn $27 million (¬£20 million) per year.

The disparity is also seen here in the UK. According to the 2016 Women on Boards 'Gender Balance in Global Sport Report', on average male footballers more than three times in a week the amount female players get paid in a year.

Sue Anstiss, CEO of promote PR and founding trustee of the Women's Sport Trust charity, says the pay gap means women can not "fulfil their potential in sport".

"Many women in elite sport still have to work either full or part time ‚Äì which makes training and competing a real challenge," she tells HuffPost UK.

"It's a vicious circle ‚Äì women aren't paid equally, so they can't train full time and fulfil their potential, which means the quality of women's sport is criticised, less people watch, therefore there's less media coverage, so fewer sponsors are attracted, which means less funding for women's sport."

To champion equal pay for women in sport, Anstiss says one of the best things you can do is turn up and watch a game.

"Talk about it more ‚Äì call it out when you see it. On social media or in person," she adds.

"Directly ask the question of the sports and teams you follow ‚Äì why do Man United (a hugely wealthy club) not support a women's team? Why did Sky invest in a men's cycling team, but not a women's team?"

The Boardroom

Women form less than 30% of the board in more than half our National Governing Bodies and only 24% of those directing elite sport programmes are women.

Ruth Holdaway, chief executive of Women in Sport, says this shows there is still "a significant way for the sector to go to demonstrate its commitment to gender equality".

"In any business environment, we know that increased gender diversity leads to improved performance ‚Äì so it is in the best interest of sport to ensure there are more female leaders at every level," she tells HuffPost UK.

"But sport is more than just a business, it has a social purpose and receives public funding. The leadership of sport must, therefore, reflect society."

In order to truly have influence in the world of sport, we need more women at top positions, which is what Women in Sport proactively campaigns for through its 'Beyond 30%' initiative.

The charity is working proactively with governing bodies of sport to improve the gender balance of their boards.

But if you want to help get more women in the boardroom, tweet about it, pile on the pressure and make sure governing bodies know it's on our radar.

Prize Money And Sponsorship

Billie Jean King may have helped women in tennis receive equal prize money, but research conducted by BBC Sport earlier this year found that while the gap is narrowing across all sports, it still very much exists.

A total of 83% of sports now reward men and women equal prize money, but the disparities in some areas are still shocking, with cricket, golf and football among the worst offenders.

The study highlighted that in football, the prize money for the next men's World Cup will be ¬£35 million, compared to the last women's total of ¬£2 million.

In addition, male golfers competing in The Open have the chance to win ¬£1.17 million, while the women's prize money is ¬£487,500.

As Holdaway says: "The money athletes are paid reflects the value placed on them by the sport they represent. We want to see women's sport valued and supported to grow."

Of course, prize money is largely tied up with sponsorship, as organisers will use money from sponsorship towards the pot of funds. According to Women In Sport, women's sport sponsorship accounted for only 0.4% of total sports sponsorship between 2011 and 2013.

Things may be set to improve though with big companies - like SSE now sponsoring the Women's FA Cup - leading the way.

"It would have a huge impact if more companies invested in women's sport ‚Äì more investment means better resources, training and support. It will raise standards even higher," Dale says.

"The companies will benefit too by showing that they take women's sport seriously."

Again, Dale and Holdaway say the best way to campaign for higher prize money and better sponsorship for women's sport is to attend games.

Participation

There's still a gender gap in participation when it comes to sport, with the latest statistics from Sport England showing 40.5% of men take part in sport each year compared to 31.9% of women.

The gap also exists among children, especially in certain sports such as football. Research from the Football Association suggests 2.9 million girls and women play in football teams in the UK, compared to 8.9 million boys and men.

Getting more women and girls playing sport isn't just essential for the nation's health and fitness, it's important for nurturing new talent and raising standards within women's sport.

You can champion participation in sport by helping foster an environment that's inclusive to women, whatever their size or ability.

One way to do that is by supporting Sport England's initiative #ThisGirlCan, using the hashtag on empowering posts on social media.

"This Girl Can has become a movement - I don't think we could switch it off even if wanted to...and we don't," Dale says.

"Our online community of 800,000 women regularly support, encourage and motivate each other to get active, take part and kick the fear of judgement into touch."

The campaign is even expanding overseas with a version in Victoria, Australia, launching on 4 February 2018.

"We're looking at new ways of developing the campaign and reaching more women," Dale adds.

"This is just the beginning ‚Äì This Girl Can's work won't be complete until every woman and girl, whatever their age, ability or background, feels that that they can too."
TITLE: The 'Battle Of The Sexes' Is Not Over, Here Are 5 Areas Of Gender Inequality In Sport

TEXT:
When a ‚ÄòRick and Morty‚Äô fan asked the show‚Äôs co-creator for advice on coping with depression, the internet was overwhelmed by the response she received.

The fan, known only by her Twitter handle @chojuroh, tweeted co-creator Dan Harmon simply asking: ‚ÄúDo you have advice for dealing with depression.‚Äù

In response, Dan wrote a series of supportive messages, advising the woman to ‚Äúadmit and accept that it‚Äôs happening‚Äù.

He also advised her to remember that ‚Äúfeelings are real, but they aren‚Äôt reality‚Äù and that she doesn‚Äôt have to ‚Äúdeal with it alone‚Äù.
TITLE: 'Rick And Morty' Co-Creator Dan Harmon Gives Fan Heartfelt Advice For Coping With Depression

James Levine, el afamado director musical de la Metropolitan Opera de Nueva York, es el nuevo personaje de primer plano implicado en el esc√°ndalo de denuncias de acoso y agresiones sexuales, acusado de haber abusado de un adolescente en la d√©cada de 1980.
